description:
Me = medigan who married into wops. I've had a lot of good Italian food, both in Italy and northeastern US.

That said, the entrees were great! The cacio e pepe was perfect. Husband's ravioli had a really fresh and homemade-tasting red gravy.  My extremely picky father-in-law (nothing is like Mama made it) would have loved it.

The negatives: the garlic app was just okay. The bread was very generic, not up to the level of the food. And wine aficionados shouldn't have high expectations here. The rose was acceptable. The pinot noir was extremely bland. Neither was poured tableside, so could have been box wines. Both were "cooked" (not kept around 56 degrees), which is pretty common. Possibly the wines by the bottle are better quality/better storage.

Service was decent. Decor was great, which is really why we ended up there though it wasn't necessarily on my 'list'. And the quality of the entrees really made it worth it.
author: Haltone H.

description:
Right on the main drag I've passed this place before and wondered if they catered to the tourist crowd.  Heck, even if they do (and I was a tourist by the way), they kicked ass!  

Had a great waiter, thick Italian accent, wonderful pastas and calamari.  And wine.  And did I mention the pasta?  I had gnocci in an amazing blue cheese cream sauce.  

I seriously plan to return next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: LD W.

description:
Food: Amazing
Service: Not great...

I have been a couple of times, the last time i went was not the best experience. Made a reservation at 7 and was seated at 7:50.. 

Food was flavorful, and each course did take time to be made, but once they were made they came quick, portions were good, and wine tasted amazing. The food was very filing so I was glad to take some home to enjoy later. 

The staff isn't the friendliest any of the times I've gone, and the restaurant does get busy so they don't get much of a chance to be attentive. 

Expect to be at this restaurant for at least an hour, mostly based off of how long it takes to get served.
author: Mark F.

description: Came here for dinner by accident. The insane lines at the other 2 places I planned to eat at drove me away.  It looks like I just beat the crowd as the line grew here as well. Ordered the gnocchi with prawns. The tomatoes based sauce had bold flavors and the shrimps were fresh. But I would have the gnocchi to have a little more time in the boiling water as they tasted doughy to me...  A light fry in some butter would have added some nice texture and flavor.  Some parsley as a garnish would have been nice.
author: William L.

description: Excellent lunch!  Best we've had since getting here!  This is genuine Italian food.  The greeter barely knows English she was such a sweet hostess!  I had a Chicken Alfredo and she had Chicken Marsala.  The meal came out quick and perfect and service was the same!  This was the perfect place for a birthday lunch!  Luca and Olympia were the best!  I can't give them six stars but I would if I could!!
author: Alan W.

description:
As you drive around Chinatown, you end up seeing small Italian Flags painted on street lights.  The smell of Chinatown waffs away and replaced by pizza and bakeries.

As things go, Little Italy is predominantly eateries and cafe's.  Living the Dolce Vita!

Where to go for dinner.  Choppino is pretty San Fran iconic - like their sourdough clam chowder.  There are plenty of places that make Choppino and prices vary but expect to spend around $50.  The seafood varies too.

Mona Lisa is pretty lively.  Plenty of people dining and enjoying their meals.  Might as well go in and see what it's like.  The place is a little dark for my liking but ambience chirps up as you look around at all the celeb pix and memorabilia.

Ordered the Choppino and the Diavolo Pizza.  Pizza was good.  The crust was delicious - I'm not a crust guy...just a crusty guy!  :)

The Choppino could have been better.  Many other places use crabs or lobster to enrich the flavour.  Not here.  Up to you if you want to spend the $50 for it.

Service was great, food was good, wine was fine.  

Cheers!
author: Peter M.

description:
They feed you plenty family style. They rip you off with the wine so careful when going with a group they open bottle after bottle. In the end they charged us $435 for 3 bottles of wine ( we asked for 2 and they pushed a third on our group no one had asked for.... So when we asked to take the last bottle home with us after discussions back and forth the waiter emptied  the bottle in the back and then put it in a paper bag and gave it back to us with a straight face insisting it had been empty when we opened the bag and found the empty bottle.
The  food was fair Italian the ambiance quirky enough the staff are thieves.
I do not recommend going here in groups at all.
In fact I regret having eaten here at all.
author: Daniella S.

description: A small piece of Italy and exquisite meals, lunch or dinner, you won't be disappointed! From the appetizers  to the pizzas with rustic crust to the entrees you will be left with having to make choices, excellent list of wines as well. Amazing food, well worth the visit!
author: Dallas S.

description:
One of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city. The owner is so delightful and a true service man. 

This was my second visit and I brought my friends who where visiting for the first time. Our server took amazing care of us and even gave us a a complimentary Tiramisu to make our night.

Long story short, Mona Lisa will always have my heart when it comes to Italian food and service.
author: Gardenia H.

description:
1st visit - Ordered Carbonara minus meat plus onions n peas- really liked it. Enjoyed the atmosphere and interiors. Would like to explore more.

2nd visit - Ordered spaghetti with pink sauce (with onions n peas). Loved it !!! Also found a cute little car outside as a table. 

Only disappointment is the bread is not fresh and tasty. Had better ones in other places. I feel the bread definitely defines the quality of food and the restaurant itself. That's where it lost a star
author: Prateek R.

description:
I am not sure where to start with this review. I have walked by this place for years. At the moment I'm thinking, what took you so long to go on chef?  

We came through the door on a night that I was sure we might not even get in. We were greeted by Maurizio Flores. After I was seated I found out he was the owner. This gentleman understands the true art of greeting each guest with a warm sincere welcome. That alone starts your food journey for the evening on the right foot. 

The restaurant itself is cozy and warm. All of the pictures on the wall remind me of Satdi's restaurants in New York City. I am told all the famous pictures are at the owner's friends and people who have eaten here. The picture over our table is one of the late and great Prince. I had the opportunity to cook for him for 2 weeks.  The lights hanging in the middle of the restaurant reminds me of our flat we had for a week in Positano

We were seated in the section of Joseph B
Luca M. Wow!!!  The genuine care and comfort of their guests is their highest mission. I feel like we could be one of the few tables of English speakers.  Watching these charming waiters crossing over from Italian to English to give perfect service to each and every table. 

We started our first course with the calamari and it was fried to perfection. This is not one of these overly breaded bowl of rubber bands. How could we not have bruschetta as well. Beautiful, tasty and not a treat to be missed. 

We had the meat lasagna and the house pizza. Unfortunately, they took away the menu for me to describe perfectly how they prepare the dough. 

Thank you! Thank you!! Thank You Joseph B
Luca m and Maurizio Flores. It was a true honor to get to eat with you tonight!!!  This is why they have been here since 1979!!!
author: Tony C.

description:
What a great place to stop by for an afternoon lunch or a lovely dinner. I love it here. REALLY LOVE IT!  Every time I have visited, everyone has been super friendly and the wait staff is amazing. We have walked in with no reservation and some how we always get seated at the same table! It's not a very big restaurant but the ambience is absolutely beautiful... kind of dark, with a bar on one side and open kitchen on the other. Tables are down the middle of the restaurant. It is truly one of my favorite places to visit when I am visiting the North Beach area. The food is AMAZING! Get the bruschetta, you won't be disappointed. Perfectly grilled toast with just the right amount of tomato and garlic. In past visits, I have had the Margarita Pizza, Pasta with olive oil and garlic (amazing), Chicken marsala and Pasta Pomodoro. My son absolutely loves the seafood pasta. I have never been disappointed  here. Also,  they have a GREAT desert menu...Tiramisu, White Chocolate Profiteroles, Raspberry panna cotta, Mango panna gotta, Cannoli,  Lemon ripieno,  Tartufo chocolate, and LIMONCELLO!
You will not be disappointed. A must visit. 
Bon appetit!
author: Debbie K.

description:
This place is awful. As someone else noted below, their deliveries take way longer than estimated, and the food is not even worth the wait. We ordered a Don Mario pizza, which notes sauce as the first ingredient in its description, and it literally arrived as in the photo - no sauce, entirely tossed, cold and hard. We also ordered ravioli, which was undercooked. All of it was inedible.

When we called the restaurant, they hung up on us. When GrubHub tried contacting them about our order, they didn't even pick up.

GrubHub delivery guy said they only started preparing our order after I called about it being 30 mins late.

Everything about my experience with this restaurant was totally awful.

Update -- 2 weeks after not receiving an update about my refund request, I followed up with the restaurant and the man on the other end basically yelled at me and hung up on me. Customer service does not seem to be valued at this restaurant.
author: Niyati D.

description: Best Italian Ever!  What an Amazing family  and the food was Like Momma!  Marinara was Perfect  My first to San Francisco now with love from this family! You will fall in love the Italian way  Thank you  Mauricio ! Stefan and I appreciate you !
author: Karen T.

description:
This is a pretty decent Italian restaurant located in the North Beach area of San Fran.  

We called ahead and asked about reservations.  The lady who answered said "yes you'll need rev's".  Then when we said it was for 2 people she said "just come in soon and we will seat you".  

We then arrive and get seated immediately. All seams well and no reason to gripe ...until the bread comes.  Maybe it was bad timing or maybe that's the way it is but our bread basket was full of stain, hard to eat bread slices.  We had oil but no peppers or vinegar to dip in.  So we helped ourselves to the empty table next to us. 

So far we aren't to impressed.   Then the meals come.  I got the gluten free Kale ravioli $29 and my wife got the rigatoni alla borrelli $26.  The food was very good but the price doesn't quite add up.  Our server was very good but I can't put her name in this review since nobody where's name- tags. 


Over all-  good atmosphere, good food, good service and ok art
author: Jesse L.

description:
Best place to go eat Italian food in the Heart of North Beach neighbourhood of San Francisco. 

The ambiance is relaxing and the food is very good! If you go eat, make sure you're very hungry due to very generous portions! 

Price is reasonable for food and location. The menu offers a wide variety of food, pastas, seafood, poultry, meats and desserts!
author: Albie E.

description:
I wasn't even that hungry and I can't believe the 3 of us cleaned our plates! 

We were seated all the way to back of restaurant which I thought was nice because I could see the entire beauty of the place. Very Italian,however , with sunglasses and military hats on all the busts - which I didn't understand.
author: Denise H.

description:
This restaurant was super cute on the inside and out. The people that worked there all seemed pretty busy but everyone was friendly. 

The food is a little expensive and you don't get a ton. The drink prices are also a little overpriced. We usually get a bottle of wine with dinner but their cheapest option was $45 which is pretty steep.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Very disappointing now. This was my families go to Italian restaurant in North Beach for 25 years. The inside was cozy and felt very authentically Italian. Now the owner has installed TV screens everywhere which makes you feel like you're in a sports bar, they've put military and law enforcement hats on the busts of all his sculptures and the place is full of pictures of movie stars headshots which is unclear as to why.... So confusing what image they're going for in there now.

In the past the servers offered to grate Parmesan cheese over your dish. Yesterday a bowl of pre-grated Parmesan cheese was just placed on the table like it came out of the jar.

The chocolate profiteroles used to be amazing and now they're just OK. We won't be back. Disappointing.
author: Lisa E.

description:
Yesterday a few of us friends felt like enjoying a lovely Italian meal. I recommended Mona Lisa Restaurant, as I have had several yummy experiences at this restaurant before. Before entering my friends and I were scanning the menu located outside of the restaurant. The owner of the restaurant asked how many in our party, then proceeded to offer an appetizer on the house. 

We were seated, ordered beverages, our appetizer (which was "on the house") and lastly ordered our entrees. Our waiter was friendly and fast, which was perfect since we were starving! 

ALL of our food was perfect and delicious. No complaints there at all. On the contrary, the ingredients were fresh and rich. 

My issue here was the lack of communication in regard to our appetizer on the house. It was a good 20 min seated, when we ordered our drinks and appetizer. Once our ordered appetizer came out, our server brought an ADDITIONAL plate of bruschetta and said the owner "also sent you this". When we got the bill, the bruschetta was complimentary only. We were never asked if that's what we wanted as our complimentary appetizer. To me this smelled like tourist bait and I was extremely disappointed, especially when I was the one to bring my three friends to this restaurant. 

I asked our server and he repeated to me that the bruschetta was the complimentary dish only. Management, please make sure that if an offer will be made to a customer, that the Terms are crystal clear. I took responsibility for paying our non-complimentary appetizer as I didn't want to have a petty argument over an appetizer.
author: Jackie Z.

description:
As the saying goes third times the charm, well in Mona Lisa's case we'd say the second time it the charm! 

After our last visit (Winter 2017) and my previous review, I will say service has gotten better. Our server Roberto was friendly and attentive and this was a big difference from the last time (which we all still vividly remember)​ to be very different and not for the better; good job Roberto!

The food still extraordinary and flavorful. From the menu we ordered the Carprese Salad, Chicken Marsala, Involtini Mona Lisa, with a bottle of Donna Laura Chianti and split the Raspberry Panna Cota for dessert! The meal totaled $123.53 and while some would consider steep, just remember​ you are in San Francisco, and to eat well, you're gonna pay.

If your looking for for an Italian restaurant​ in Little Italy/ San Francisco that has great atmosphere, good food and good service, give Mona Lisa a try, but we do recommend making a reservation and doing that on Yelp made that a snap!
author: Joe R.

description: Came here for lunch because it was walking distance from my office. The restaurant was pretty much empty except for us during a weekday at around noon but we came in anyway after looking at the menu displayed outside. We were seated at a little table by the window as soon as we walked inside. We decided to order the cacio e Pepe and the carbonara. They brought us a basket of bread after taking out orders and there was olive oil and vinegar on the table for us already. The pasta came out pretty fast and the flavors tasted pretty good. My only complaint would be that the spaghetti was cooked for a little too long; I would've preferred a harder, chewier texture but other than that, I really liked it. The carbonara had a good Smokey bacon flavor and the cacio has a nice peppery flavor to it. They also have fresh Parmesan cheese to sprinkle over the top as well.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Great place for yummy Italian food and wine in our favorite San Fransisco neighborhood. The antipasto for two is incredible; the service and ambiance are warm and homey.
author: Angela S.

description: So delicious! Authentic Italian family and environment. Our waiter was wonderful and we Loved our dinner. We will be back again soon!
author: Annalee H.

description: Everything we ate was amazing! We had margarita pizza, spaghetti with meatballs, lasagna,  rigatoni aldon smith. We can't say one was better than the other, they were all uniquely delish!
author: Beth S.

description: Can't give a review on the food, server was beyond rude, walked out and he threw a temper tantrum yelling at us! This was after sitting at the table for an hour with no water or service. Server was busy talking with other employees. He told us too get out! We were visiting for a week, this incident was traumatizing! I'm still upset, and the response from the manager didn't seem genuine! Very upsetting on our vacation!
author: patti b.

description: Another beautiful night at Our favorite restaurant in San Francisco  Moriceo and the staff is excellent s the food is always amazing!!!!!!
author: Paul D.

description:
Prons: very cozy restaurant with cool interior. 
Cons: However food did not meet my and my wife's expectation. 

Insalata di Spinaci was great, big portion and yummy but a bit too lemony. 

Chicken Marsala was a bit too bitter. Chicken itself was good but could be a bit softer. 

Risotto was ok but rice slightly undercooked. 
Seems like both dishes lacked salt (maybe good, because salt can always be added) but there was no twist or kick or something exciting about them. 

The red Cabernet Sauvignon ordered by glass was not enjoyable, tasted cheap. 

My wife liked Tiramisu, I thought it was OK.

Verdict: maybe we ordered wrong dishes at the place. It was ok but certainly not the experience that would want me to come back and have more.
author: Alex B.

description: Absolutely loved the lasagna and bruschetta! We also had excellent service. It's tough choosing a place in this area with so many options, but you will not go wrong with Mona Lisa.
author: Cami F.

description:
This is my favorite Italian restaurant of all time.

Maurizio is fantastic, he makes you feel always welcome and he is always ready to make you smile with his jokes.

The food is really good quality (please give a try to Penne al Forno alla Calabrese), fresh and it always comes in huge portions. The pinsa is amazing, very light and delicious. The Tiramisu is spectacular at the end of the meal, really creamy but not heavy.

The wine is always abundant, as the Italian tradition wants and good quality for the price.

The ambiance is really cozy and warm and the staff is amazingly kind and available to accommodate any request.

That's the perfect Italian spot in San Francisco to me.
author: Giulia D.

description:
Unfortunately, this is definitely one of the worst restaurant I've ever been in SF. 
Atmosphere is old, menu is boring, and dishes are too salty. And from my experience, I can tell you that this place, doesn't serve an authentic Italian food. If you are in SF, you can definetely find a better restaurant.
author: T O M.

description:
When they tell you 15 minutes they mean an hour and a half...
If you are Italian you will wait less
Go to stinky rose
Way better
author: Adam L.

description:
Really great ambience, good location, nice dining area and European style patio for sitting outside.  
I ordered the eggplant parmesan, and it was way too rich.  Mostly mozzarella and tomato sauce, there was a pool of oil at the top of the dish.  Would not order again.  My friend had the funghi risotto which was better, I guess some dishes are hit or miss.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Delicious vegetarian pasta!

Stopped in here after going to the famous Franciscan Shrine across the street on Easter. 

There were many vegetarian options, FAR more  veg options than the larger touristy Italian spot across the street...... 

Servers were REALLY friendly and welcoming, maybe because it was pretty early /slow and a holiday...... 

Anyways, I got the Penna Rosa pasta which was way more delicious than it looked!!!! 

Served piping hot, super flavorful, fantastic lunch. 

Fantastico!! I'll be back.....
author: Stylishshopper ..

description:
Delicious Italian food, recommended for lunch and dinner,
We got the pasta with eggplant and it was one of the best i tried
author: Sarmad R.

description: Delicious authentic Italian food!! And awesome service! Today I tried Diavola Pizza, Pasta Pomodoro and Tiramisu... a must in the North Beach!
author: Lety L.

description: We visited this place with our daughter and her husband on our last day in San Francisco. I felt in love with the food! I had the Ravioli Di Porcini, finger licking. My husband and son in law had risotto. One had Risotto Di Porcini and the other chicken Risotto. I am looking forward to my next visit to the
author: Judith B.

description: Today I had lunch at the Mona Lisa restaurant with friends from Daughters of the Nile prior to seeing Beach Blanket Babylon. The food was delicious. And our waiter was friendly. I was happy that it was recommended to our group, and hope to go back again soon.  Thank you for a wonderful meal.
author: Cindy S.

description: My husband and I came for our One year anniversary to this wonderful place, Im seriously so glad we came to experience yummy food and wine in this restaurant, im so sad i didnt get to take any more pictures of the food; i was too excited enjoying the moment (: .Our waitter lucca was also very attentive and nice. I will defenetely recomment this place to my friends and family . Thank u so much for giving us such a great experience!
author: Karla M.

description: First time eating here. Calamari was outstanding! Our meals were very good and the place has a great old Italian vibe. Definitely recommend if you are looking for good Italian food in North Beach!
author: Steward D.

description: Very ,very delicious Italian food ! Authentic and flavorful! Loved the atmosphere and service was the best! Especially the owner, Mauriizio , an absolute gem!! I can't wait to dine there again !
author: Danielle A.

description: loved the interior of the restaurant very italian! the food was really good and the service was good the staff all seems very italian
author: Sabrina O.

description: First - we live here is SF, and originally from NJ - we know and love Italian. Mona Lisa is our favorite in North Beach - it's our weekly Sunday dinner spot. Across the entire menu the food is excellent - Cacai de Pepe, meatballs, arancini, manicotti, fettuccini Pescatore, and penne San Francisco are our favorites - but honestly everything we try becomes a favorite.  Service is great - they'll always find you a table and treat you like a VIP.  The Italian wine list is fairly priced as restaurants go, but the House wines are fine.
author: Lance A.

description: This is a wonderful restaurant where they make thrown pasta.  Service was great. It is a small restaurant and crowded thus a little noisy. They have a children's menu. The food is delicious. Salad prices are high as are appetizers. I was too full to eat dessert.  We were there on a Saturday at 630pm and although we had a reservation they still had tables available. They were very accommodating rearranging tables very quickly to suit party sizes.  I highly recommend.
author: Kathleen P.

description: This location is easy to find and make reservations at too. The space is relatively small and cramped but so are most places in San Francisco. The menu is great and full of options for vegetarians. I wish there were a few more options with pasta and veggies. It was mostly just pasta and sauce on the veggie menu. The staff was all great and the prices are really reasonable. I tried both the house salad and the spinach salad and the house salad is the way to go. I will definitely be back to Mona Lisa next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Walking around North Beach, looking for a nice place to eat and we found this amazing restaurant with such a warm atmosphere. Mario and Giovanni made our evening. They were super friendly yet very professional, delicious wine and conscious eats. If you are red wine lover do not pass by THE Brunello. Absolutely Delicious! The pasta is definitely the star of the show. Every dish was outstanding and cooked al dente to perfection! Also arrived on our table at the right temperature. The icing on the cake was that, while waiting for our bill to arrive, a server brought little surprise dessert wino. 
Will definitely come back and I'm not just saying that because the music was fire, mostly because the servers were so cute and friendly. Thank you Giovanni, Thank you Mario.               *5 STAR*


Nana Sarkisian
author: GS S.

description: It was amazing!!!!  The food was great, especially the bruschetta.  Dessert was delicious; the limoncello gelato was FABULOUS.  Everyone was so friendly.   Great spot for a date night!
author: Sofi V.

description: Awful experience. Waited 30 minutes to be seated even though we had reservations. After being seated for 15 minutes we finally got a server. Who brought us ravioli that was over cooked and hard. Followed by forgetting a dish we ordered. The owners excuse was "oh we are too busy". Definitely not coming back to pay 100 dollars for bad service and mediocre food.
author: Nikhil A.

description: Very rude maitre d accused us of being late and had already given our table away only 5 mins after our reservation time. Worked out pretty well as the Italian across the street was superb!
author: Nick S.

description:
Surprisingly good restaraunt. 

It's hard to choose a place when you're stuck between Chinatown and Italian-town in San Francisco. Luckily my wife chose the spot and we  were glad we stopped here.

The owner was very welcoming and their staff were great.

The food was delicious and the restaurant had cool decor. 

This place has been here a long time and will be for many years to come. 

I'd visit again when in the area.

It is a busy place and tables are very close to each other so don't plan on having an intimate dinner.
author: Arnel D.

description: If you really want to know the true Italian cuisine, with the best ingredients, in a romantic and cozy atmosphere, you must certainly go to Mona Lisa. There you will be greeted by a friendly and eclectic team, they are Italians... people from every corner that make Mona Lisa a place of the world with the best Italian food in the United States in my opinion
author: Taher R.

description: The ambiance and history make it a great place for tourists. Its menu options  are  overwhelming... but its recipes are spotty. Party of five, we ordered a lot and shared.  The antipasto, IMO was the best we had.  The other plates were okay... but nothing to write home about.  The ravioli was way too salty. The minestrone soup was real thick and bland. The pizza and calzone were bland.  Would I go back-- sure with tourists. And I would order some of the less known dishes such as the pasta con tonno. Would I suggest this place? Probably not.
author: Ken J.

description:
This place is so romantic and cozy!
I ordered the spinach salad. Walnuts' oily flavor is perfect with sweet and fresh spinach. Cheese is not too heavy and sour.
For the appetizer, definitely try bruschetta! Tomatoes with crispy bread, full of juice!
You can't miss the pasta, too! Just choose whatever you want! They have the best sauces and soft, chewy pasta! 
When the lights were turned on, it looked like an old Italian movie during Renaissance. Yellow, warm lights shined on the old pictures and paintings. You were surrounded by the shades of vintage and smiled, just like Mona Lisa.
author: Gigi G.

description:
I gotta say that I love this place.  For the last eight years - when I visit San Francisco - I love to stop here and get some dinner.  

Is the pasta fresh?  No, of course not.  You don't make HUGE bowls of tortellini and have them be hand made.  

But it's damn good.  The service is quick and the food is some of the tastiest I've ever had.

My recommendation for an appetizer is the "Sicilian Candy" - roasted garlic cloves.  SO sweet and delicious.  I could just eat those.
author: Gino M.

description: Had a beautiful dinner in their outdoors section as the sun was setting. Superb Italian hospitality + excellent food!
author: B A.

description: This restaurant was the best Italian restaurant I've been too and that's saying a lot. It had this vibe you know, it was crowded but in a good way. It was covered wall to wall with paintings. There were really 2 main points about this restaurant that really stood out to me. First off the food was to die for. We got the tower off appetizers plus we had the bread they gave us to start off with. We were so full by the time it got to our main course! All of this shocked me cause usually I can eat ALOT. But this is all in a good way, we wanted to eat all the food. When it did get to our main course we ate maybe 3-5 bites plus bite from others people to try theirs. The food was excellent and tasted very good the next day! Lastly but certainly not least, THE SERVICE! The service was tremendous here they were so kind. So first when we walked in there was this kind man greeting everyone and talking to everybody. Then this amazing lady got you situated and talked to you as well. She made sure you were ready to eat and hoped you were having a good day. They good came out relatively quick and did not disappoint. They did a good job checking on us making sure everything was just right. Once we are our main course they do something I've never seen, ever. They asked how our food was and then we asked for to go boxes. Then they got them for us and then he proceeded to put our food in the boxes for all of us and put them in a bag for us to take to our hotel. I've never seen that before but it just seemed so nice. Then we got our check payed and got up and left. The same person that greeted us said goodbye. Really I would recommend and would go here again!
author: Molly A.

description: I ate here a few years back. There was a broken-off metal corkscrew in my pasta. They took it away & asked if I wanted something else. I declined. When the bill came, they had charged me for it. I had to point out it was lucky we didn't call the health department. I will never go back.
author: Scott F.

description: Atmosphere was great, the service attentive, huge menu.  We ordered two pizzas for two people and that was way too much food.  I found the pizza to be a bit "soupy" and the sauce too salty.  I'll probably try something different on the menu next time.
author: Jim C.

description: Best service I've had in SF. Order the chicken Parmesan and pasta with Alfredo sauce! Best I've had. Thank you to all that made my birthday dinner special
author: Natasha S.

description: This place is so amazing!! I can still taste the pasta I had. It's soooo good. I've been to Italy before and it brought back memories of the food I had. I would definitely recommend it. They're even open late hours. We happen to run across it because we got into San Fransisco late and stopped here for dinner. Highly recommend! My family and I loved it. I honestly don't think anything on the menu is bad. We all ordered different things and all of us loved it. Which we had a place like this closer to home.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Came here because a former coworker of mine said this restaurant is really romantic. We were seated right away, and we thought we were off to a good start.

Well, long-story short, the ambiance was probably the only great thing about this place. They weren't busy when we went here at 8PM, but our waiter paid more attention to their other guests than us, so we felt very neglected. Maybe we just came on a bad day. 

For all these reviews about amazing food and a long wait for the food, we expected the food to be incredible. We did wait a while for our food, but that's not problematic for us. We were just really disappointed by how the food tasted. I am a huge advocate of chicken parmigiana, and it lacked flavor. This was my boyfriend's first time trying it, and now he's not convinced he should try other chicken parmigiana for comparison. 

The ravioli we got was ok tasting, and so was their bruschetta and tiramisu. For the price we paid for the food, though, it doesn't connect with us.
author: Rachel M.

description:
This place is no joke!

Wow. The fettuccine Leonardo is to die for. 

Extremely authentic Italian- as in, everyone who works here speaks fluent Italian. It's awesome.
author: Alysha M.

description: Last stop on our walking food tour (staycation). We had the Margherita pizza and it is one of the best I've had. Very basic/simple, perfectly salted dough, thin crust, light texture from the cornmeal. I enjoyed this pizza and would come back again.
author: Jesica I.

description:
My parents / brother were visiting me in the city, which happens rarely, and I wanted to take them to a nice restaurant in North Beach. However, I am so extremely disappointed with staff, service, and food that it ruined the whole night. Let me address each piece...

1. Service- we were seated quickly, but once seated we waited for forever before someone even came to our table.  It took so long that we almost left, but finally our server came after more than 20 minutes and brought us water. Which brings me to point 2....

2. Staff- HORRIBLE. We were greeted by Luca, and by the time were ready to order since they took so long to arrive in the first place. Let me start off by saying he was not at all pleasant. We weren't all that hungry, so we ordered 3 dishes to share: Chicken Piccata, Rigatoni Aldon Smith, and Risotto. Luca immediately arrogantly stated that since there are four of us dining, we would have to order four dishes.

What?! This was nowhere stated on the menu, and I saw other diners at the restaurant clearly sharing dishes. I thought he was joking at first and tried to laugh it off, but he retorted that he was being serious and demanded us to order another dish. I asked for some time to think about what we wanted to order. I was shocked that there was an obligation to order one dish per person for our table, when clearly it wasn't a requirement for others. I realized a few minutes later that he was probably taking advantage of us, thinking that we are tourists, since we were there as a family? I flagged him down and asked him to cancel our order and we will take our business elsewhere, and suddenly he seemed okay with serving us. This was absolutely not the ambiance I wanted to bring my family to, and was so upset at the upfront rude behavior of Luca that it ruined the rest of my night. 

3. The food itself was hit or miss. Rigatoni was excellent, Risotto was average, and the Chicken tasted like it was just boiled and doused in sauce. 

The food and service could have been pardoned, but I am so turned off by the arrogant behavior of the staff that I am never returning here again.
author: Sonia D.

description:
Amazing food! Great service! A real italian experience. Yummy!
Not much to say the carpaccio was amazing! The tiramisu was one of the best ive had.
author: Efrat K.

description:
My daughter was visiting San Francisco with her boyfriend, so I wanted to send them a gift card for her favorite restaurant, Mona Lisa. Unfortunately as they went to use it, their waiter/waitress informed them it had to be printed. It does not state this on the site when you go to purchase. They're supposed to have a Merchant App, but they do not. This seemed like an easy way to buy them dinner, but that was a fail. I looked at the site who sells the cards and it says the retailer just scans it. Very disappointing, especially since we don't even live there anymore. Am I out the money? Beware-DO NOT buy online Gift Cards for this restaurant! Waiting on my refund from Egiftify. Will update my review once this has been resolved.

UPDATE:

I contacted Egiftify land after they communicated with Mona Lisa and myself, I have been refunded. I personally received a phone call from the manager at Mona Lisa and they apologized. I'm sure after educating their wait staff, there will no longer be issues with redeeming E-gifts.
author: Lori M.

description: Excellent service! Professional, courteous, and respectful staff. Food was delicious! We had to come back for our dinner dates. Perfect atmosphere
author: Oscar A.

description: Great authentic Italian restaurant. Came here for a friend's birthday party. We sampled a bunch of appetizers, the pasta trio, and I had a salmon entree. It was fantastic. Wish I could have kept eating but I was stuffed. Def would come back again.
author: Jessica S.

description: Not a fan! Cute place very intimate but the service was not great! Bread was cold, was not offered drinks until my 9 year old asked and we had to flag down the waiter for everything. The pasta was okay not was I expected
author: Jeanette M.

description: Food was good, I have had more flavorful Italian food. The waiter had a bad attitude, he was rude. The food was brought out quick, they are open late.
author: Shanette F.

description: Make sure your waiter speaks English. They don't listen when you say easy ice on your soda and instead I got a drink with more ice without realizing it. Then the waiter tried to charge me for a refill because my soda was finished before food arrived. When I asked to remove it the waiter asked me why I only have 10% tip and that he is new and all that other bs so I gave 20% to shut him up. He also forgot to give me my to go food because he was busy ringing up his tip. If you don't do your job right then you don't deserve a tip at all. Moral of this is make sure you get a waiter that speaks good english.
author: Moe D.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite.  Pizza was excellent - crust was perfection.  Service was even better - fast and friendly.  They seemed genuinely glad we came in. Will definitely be back.
author: Michelle D.

description: This place is a not just a restaurant, it's like a museum, and the service is super fast and people care a lot about customer service, plus the owner is super funny and likes to interact with everyone
author: Bayrem D.

description:
I was walking down the street with my friends trying to find an Italian Restaurant with a lot of options and this place did not disappoint. 
The owner quickly came up to us and was super sweet so we decided to give this place a try! The decor was homey and very inviting with picture frames and busts everywhere. We decided to try the penne salsa rosa and lasagna vegetale. Overall the food was just okay. The penne pasta barely had any sauce and lacked taste. The lasagna lacked taste as well except for the spinach taste. I just wish it had more of a ricotta flavor I was looking for.
Other than that, the service was amazing as the server was attentive and very nice. The owner gave us a free appetizer of bruschetta which wasn't bad at all. 

I don't know if I would come back but the only reason I would come back would be for the decor and the amazing people who run the place!
author: Jasmine H.

description: A little pricey, but excellent ambiance, and tasty food. Our service was good as well, and good wine.
author: Vincent H.

description: Great location and the atmosphere was nice! We sat outside and got to enjoy the the evening! The only thing I did not like was their bread!
author: Patricia G.

description:
The food looked good.  But I didn't stay long enough to try it.  The service was really, really rude.  To the point that after we put in our order, I cancelled it and left.  

After getting conned into entering by a nice man who was sitting outside, we sat and waited.  And waited.  And then waited some more.  When our server finally came to our table, he acted like he was doing us a favor.  When the kid at the table next to us started banging on her table and yelling, I knew it was time to go.

We went across the street to Il Casaro.  A much better experience!
author: amanda c.

description:
It has been truly amazing to get to celebrate our anniversary each year at Mona Lisa Restaurant.  I brought my wife to this little piece of Italian Heaven almost 20 years ago and it continues to be our favorite place to eat in San Francisco.  Delicious food paired with phenomenal service. You do feel like you are treated like family by Maurizio and his entire staff.  We started off with some mouth watering Bruschetta and topped of the dinner with an Italian rum cake that definitely didn't disappoint.
Thanks again for a wonderful evening! See you again very soon!
author: Kenneth B.

description:
I had to take off a star due to the service received the evening we dined there.  More on that later.

The decor is your classic North Beach fare.  It was stuffed full of decorations, etc.  Some would call it gaudy while others would call it classic/typical of the area.  i would agree with the later.

The food had its share of hits and misses.  My Chicken Saltimbocca was surprisingly good.  It was simply prepared with roasted potatoes and sauteed spinach.  The chicken was moist while the prosciutto and sage offered delicious contrasts to one another.  The sauce/juice that was present had a good flavor profile to it.  The spaghetti Carbonara was so-so.  It was not a good as other places we had been too.  We couldn't pick out the reason but only knew so by the taste.

Roberto (?) was rude and not very attentive to us.  When he first came over to take our drink orders, everything seemed fine.  After that, things changed for some reason.  The wait to take our orders was extremely long.  In fact, several tables around us, where people arrived after us, had already ordered.  We tried to get his attention several times to no avail.  The menus were closed so that should have been a clue to him to come over.  It took several requests to just get the balsamic vinegar for our bread.  Then, after only having it for a few minutes, he came by and took the vinegar and olive oil, only to give it to a couple at an adjacent table.  Needless to say, both parties were shocked at that move.  The couple was kind enough to give them back to us after they had poured some for themselves.  

We might come back some time, as long as we do not have him again...
author: Gene D.

description:
We came in for a super late lunch/early dinner on a Saturday. My boyfriend ordered the chicken parm and I ordered the chicken Marsala. They serve you bread while you wait, but it was cold and didn't taste freshly made. 

We waited a decent while for the food andour waiter had left the restaurant to move a car, so when the food was ready it just sat there on the bar. Finally another server noticed and brought it to us. 

The flavors of the food were great. The Marsala sauce was delicious; however, my chicken didn't seem fully cooked and it grossed me out. I had to stop eating the chicken and just focused on the sides.
author: Michelle P.

description: Visiting from out of town we decided to stop by this place since it smelled very good.   Plain and simple very good Italian food.   There are a lot of choices in this part of town and I'm glad we decided to eat here.  We order fettuccini Alfredo, chicken parm and a pizza which I don't remember what it was called.  Everything was fresh it did take a while to get our food but since it's all made to order it was well worth the wait.   I would have taken pics of our food but eveyone was so hungry that I didn't get a chance to.  If and when I come back to frisco I will defiantly come back here to eat again
author: Alex M.

description: I was super skeptical about this restaurant because it seemed touristy. I went with a friend that was visiting and it turns out this place was fantastic. The pasta was great and the dessert was great. The ambience is crazy, but in a good way. This might be one of my new favorite spots.
author: Jonathan U.

description: Most amazing food, Service and ambience! Had the caprese, perfect blend, not over-vinegared, lasagna was BEYOND AMAZING! Even the house Chardonnay was great!
author: Linda C.

description:
If you are in the city and in the mood for Italian food, then look no further; Mona Lisa's got you covered. Besides the cutest ambiance (Instagram worthy), all the pastas on the menu are to die for. Creamy, saucy, tasty, and dare I say, addicting!!? 

Also, the owner Mauricio is always there to greet you as if you were the oldest of friends.
author: Arielle C.

description:
I was introduced to this place by my girlfriend and her family who have been coming for ten plus years now.

Aside how great all the sauces, delicious pastas and wines are; the service is one of a kind. The severs make you feel as if you are their top priority despite how busy they may be.

Tip: Come in with a big appetite because you might not finish the portions.
author: Daniel S.

description:
We here looking for good food with high expectations, while the food was great the service totally ruined the experience.

We were seated immediately into the small and busy restaurant and proceeded to wait 15 minutes before even being noticed to receive water, bread or a greeting. We flagged another waitress for some service, and while she helped us, our waiter was still nowhere to be found. 

Finally our waiter came to our table and without a greeting, asked in a very unfriendly way what we wanted to eat. 45 minutes later we received our food and our waiter never came back. 

All in all, a dinner that should have lasted an hour or so lasted nearly 2 due to the negligence of our waiter, and what a shame because the food was great. (Chicken Parm-- Penne Ala Vodka) 

If you're okay with going to a very busy place and waiting a long time for food and service, the food may be worth it to you, but for us, we won't be coming back.
author: Alex O.

description: We ordered the calamari and bruschetta after our hike. The owner personally seated us, he is very personable. We sat outside under some heaters and enjoyed the view. Prices are affordable and they got us seated within 10 minutes. If you're looking for an authentic Italian restaurant this is it. He even got us some wine on the house. Mauricio is so sweet and I would definitely come back.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
First time at Mona-Lisa (ML). The place was bustling when we dined on a Friday night, but we did not have to wait for a table.

From a decor standpoint, ML subscribes to the theory that more is more.  Very old school, chintzy, Italian restaurant, to the point that it was actually fun.

The food came out fairly quickly, but the waiter was very inattentive.  In fact, he replaced my wife's Diet Coke because we advised him that the glass was chipped, but he didn't bother to refill my soda, even though the Glass was empty. 

The Gnocchi al Quattro Formaggi was way too heavy and the cheese was overpowering.  The spaghetti al'Amatrciana was pretty good. 

Overall, it was OK, but with so many other options in North Beach, don't think we'll be back.
author: Eddie A.

description: This place is so much fun. Good service, but tight seating and very loud. We ordered the appetizer tower. It says it's for two, but probably better for 3-4 people. The lasagna was great but skip spaghetti and meatballs. They were dry, sauce was not very good and the noodles were under cooked.
author: D. K.

description:
After being lured in by the friendly owner while we were perusing the menu on the sidewalk late one Friday night our experience quickly went downhill. 

We were seated at the teeniest table next to the kitchen, right where the servers rounded the corner. They kept bumping my husbands chair and apologizing.

I don't know if not ordering drinks or appetizers affected our service in any way but it was subpar at best. We had had a very late lunch and weren't ravenously hungry. 

We got some crusty bread to munch on as we preceded to wait forever on our food. Our table was also missing the balsamic vinegar that was on other tables and our server never came around so we could ask for it.

After waiting a good hour plus on our food it finally arrived. 

My husband ordered Spaghetti Carbonara and while good it just can't top the decadence of the one we had years ago in Rome.

I had been craving a Margarita Pizza so that was what I had ordered and it was delicious!

During our time waiting we had plenty of chances to observe those around us and it was quite interesting! The table next to us got the five star treatment as the gentleman knew the owner. Their complimentary three tiered hor dourve tray looked heavenly! The strangest part was when the lady disappeared into the bathroom and a couple of minutes later the gentleman slipped in too. Oh dear! Only for both of them to emerge minutes later. 

So, to recap. The food was good but the service lackluster. I'd skip the Mona Lisa.
author: Juanita I.

description:
Like my wife's post says, this place ROCKS! Seriously the best Italian I've had in a while. Nothing fancy, nothing expensive and over priced, just some old school cooking! The owner was around and stopped in to chat with our kids and Check in on our family. I can't rave enough about the lasagna, my grandmother makes the best one I've had... but since she doesn't have yelp I feel safe saying, this one was neck and neck with hers! 

We will make sure this is on our list of places to eat everytime we visit San Fransisco. If you're looking for the old school feel with the food like Grandma used to make... this is the spot. Nothing was left on my plate after our son got done eating all the meat sauce. If I could give it 20 stars I would. Seriously AMAZING FOOD!
author: Anton S.

description: Awesome atmosphere, great Italian and thoroughly enjoyed the wine.  Lots of character and I recommend you check it out!!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Who is cooking ? Too much salt too much grease the food did not taste fresh the food is way over price. Entrees for $20 to $25 $30 each.
I live here in SF for 38 years and really never went to your restaurant because I always considered the restaurant a tourist trap well my gut intuition was right overpriced poor  Italian food .
I don't know how you get four stars you barely can get to two. based on your appetizers.

I will not come back. Good luck! Oh yeah you want unless is outdated over price also.
author: Douglas B.

description:
Authentic Italian, right down to the very long wait times. 

Pros: food was good, staff were friendly and fluent in Italian (with accents), food was good, atmosphere and decor were fantastic

Cons: service was excruciatingly slow (we were expecting this based on other reviews and it still exceeded our expectations!! We were there at 2 pm and there were only 4 other tables occupied). The only service I've ever had that was slower than this was in Italy - no joke - so maybe it's slow on purpose (which is why I gave them 4 stars. With American speeds it would be 5 and if I thought it wasn't slow on purpose then it would be 3 stars).
author: Ema J.

description: The homemade pasta was very good.  The Italian feel was great. I believe the owner was going his best. But we were surprised as to the service.  We were virtually ignored. Maybe she had too many tables. We don't know. But when glasses are empty and no help, that is not good service. Also, she appeared very disappointed with our 15% gratuity. Which is a Surprise to us with being ignored. We had not been here before. Not sure we would return.
author: Tim B.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco! I come here at least once a week when I'm in the area and always make it a point to try something new. I've never been disappointed!!! Everything always tastes amazing and homemade. You can always expect the best service while here no matter the time of day. They welcome you in like family. Maurizio and Luca are the best!!! I highly recommend this place again and again!!! :)
author: Amber K.

description: Fun place to sit on the sidewalk and watch the world go by. Good Authentic Italian food and Italian staff. Seemed a little pricey. Pictured Pasta Bolognese with homemade fettuccine pasta (extra $4)
author: Elissa M.

description: Stoped by for Margarita and some wine for lunch. Great service. Decent wine. Pie a solid 9.5!
author: Zig B.

description: Found this place wandering today. Tbh, the place is a little pricey but most definitely worth it. The waiter was very nice and very attentive to our needs. You truly get an authentic Italian experience here. The place has a very lowkey vibe to it and I found myself admiring all of the art and statues throughout the entire restaurant. My friends ordered a calzone and I ordered the Fettuccine Leonardo. It is basically chicken and Alfredo sauce with baby tomatoes. Extremely good and has lots of flavor. So, if you're ever in walking home from Pier 39, you might find this place. It's fantastic!
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
If you're looking for some of the most amazing Italian food in the city, this is your place! True old school feel and vibe, with amazing taste. When I say the food was delicious, my husband said it's the closest to his grandmothers lasagna has ever had... our baby was even eating the meat sauce like he couldn't get enough.

The owner was around the whole time and truly provided old school customer service. This will be a new staple for us every time we visit. It's no surprise they've been in business for 39 years!
author: Claudia M.

description: The waiter and front of house were absolutely horrendous - aggressive and rude. I've never in my life been lectured by a waiter. We booked a large group table for 11 and we were 10 mins late and they gave our table away and insisted it was our fault that they had to give our table away!  Worst customer service. We were shouted out of the restaurant. AVOID this tourist trap!
author: Dominique M.

description: Best Italian food and the host Maurico is so hands on and really makes you feel so comfortable even the waiters, need to eat there you won't regret it
author: Doris S R.

description:
I have been going here for a long time. Great food and service.
The rigatoni Aldon Smith is great.
author: Aaron B.

description: I have eaten at many Italian restaurants and Mona Lisa is by far the best I have ever had! The lasagna was amazing and my husband had the calamari and salmon dish which he loved. Our waiter Nicola was great! Would highly recommend when visiting San Francisco
author: Cyndi L.

description: The atmosphere and the food was very quaint the food was authentic and was excellent. I would highly recommend this place. Very friendly staff and just excellent service.  It is not for a family with young children it is more for adults and grown children.
author: Roxanne S.

description: Lots of vegetarian options!! Service was great, the food was even better. The server was very accommodating with changes. This is our new go to place for Italian food.
author: Eileen B.

description:
Been to this place several times. The host is always friendly and engaging. The wait staff can be a little busy at times, but they always refill the water. It can be a little hard at times to track down the waiter for the bill when it gets busy. I can also see why some people complain about the service since the waiters can be abrupt at times. 

As for the food, good amount of variety. Huge portions. I do have to mention some inconsistencies.  The first time I came, I ordered the squid ink pasta with calamari, but for some reason it didn't come with the calamari,  so I had to mention this to the waiter and they fixed it. It was great once they got it right. Second time I ate there I ordered the frutti di mare and it came with fish and was missing some items listed in the description. I had to mention this again, so they added the missing seafood, but the fish was left in it so it added a weird flavor and I didn't care for it. The last time I ordered the rigatoni with spicy sausage, meat sauce, and eggplant. The order was right this time, but it was very oily. 

Worth a try, just make sure your dish comes out as described in the menu.
author: Sherille S.

description: We go here every year on our anniversary! The staff is great and there menu is extensive with lots of wonderful meals! You won't be disappointed!
author: Steve H.

description:
Got lovely anniversary lunch today. Food and wine knowledge from my server Giancarlo was great. Presentation of the dish and atmosphere was very good We got very good Montepulciano riserva red  wine. 
Only complaint one noisy and rude guest next to our table.

Mr.and Mrs.Hutchins 

Pacific Heights
San Francisco
author: Roberto M.

description:
Only had delivery, but I was pleasantly surprised. The food was good.
I only got to try a couple of things, but I'll be back.
author: David T.

description: Absolutely very favor full wonderful service ambiance is just what I was looking for in Italian dining. Love Love Love it
author: Diana P.

description:
Incredible food, great service and amazing ambiance! We had a beautiful meal and shared a bottle of wine. Our server was fantastic and attentive. 
Everyone traveling to San Fran should make it a point to eat here! 
It's authentic and all of the employees speak Italian! The kitchen is open so you can see the food becoming a masterpiece and the art work is beautiful! 
The restaurant is perfectly positioned on Columbus avenue, right in the heart of North Beach or Little Italy!
author: Tommie S.

description: The best food, the best vibe, the best service truly truly truly classic Italian awesome!
author: R St John P.

description:
I live here. I've been to every restaurant on Columbus more than once.

This is by far the worst. Not even close. I had pasta with pancetta, but they must have heard my order as "pasta with rancid pancetta." The only thing worse than the taste was the after-taste.

My dining partner ordered pasta with cheese sauce. They served her naked pasta and started shredding parmesan cheese on it. We said, no, we want cheese sauce. They said, "We don't have cheese sauce. We have four-cheese sauce." So we asked, to their visible annoyance, to send it back and come back with "four-cheese sauce."

The salad was overflowing with oily dressing, making it inedible.

The draft beer provided ummistakeable evidence that they never clean their beer lines.

This place is beyond awful. What an embarrassment to North Beach.
author: Yowz A.

description: Great and friendly service and tasty pizza (specifically the Mona Lisa). Is pretty much always busy which is a good sign!!
author: Jenna S.

description: The Mona Lisa is the best restaurant in the area. Fast service, clean restrooms, and great food. When we first arrived, my family was kindly greeted by the w
author: David B.

description: Deep, rich, Italian setting. Homemade ravioli and gnocchi dishes.  Family run, active owner, friendly and efficient service.  Lively crowd on a Friday night but easy to get a reservation with short notice on Yelp. Tables arrangements sit from 2-10 people.  Outdoor sidewalk available for small groups.
author: George M.

description: We found this place on yelp. Needed pasta for a change. We are both vegan. Enjoyed the bruschetta, mixed grilled veggies and two types of pasta with veggies. All good. The prices seemed reasonable except for the mixed grilled veggies. That was astronomical for what we received.  Would return though. The service was good and fast.
author: Sophia S.

description: Truly a gem. I loved the vibe, staff and food  the sauce here is truly magical. The calamari was my favorite. I was seriously full off the calamari due to the large portion. My pasta was great too but I couldn't eat it and had to take it to go after devouring the calamari with my husband.
author: Linda N.

description:
We came here for my birthday and absolutely loved it!! We had a fairly large group, 16 of us, and they were very accommodating. The service was great - the servers were attentive, refilled our waters before they ran out - we never had to ask for a refill of anything. 

Food:
We could smell how great everything was even before we walked in. It made waiting for our food that much harder, but, luckily, our food came out fairly quickly. The appetizer platter was MASSIVE. We got two and they were served on what looked like tiered tea trays. Very pretty, presentation wise. I personally loved all the vegetarian dishes, and everyone seemed to enjoy the rest of the appetizers. 


As for the main dish, I really liked what I got -some squash ravioli, but my friend's walnut gnocchi dish was to die for. Would go back for that alone.
author: Tiana T.

description: Great little restaurant in the heart of SF's Little Italy. The customer service was top notch as well. Will definitely be back.
author: Pat M.

description: Simply put, one of the best restaurants in San Francisco. From the owner ( Moritzio ) on down this place is always a great night out. Chicken Picata and the antipasto tower are excellent. The Italian staff are fun and don't forget the dessert ! You will not be disappointed at Mona Lisa.
author: Socialle C.

description: I have to say I am not a big Tiramisu fan, but here it is made to perfection! Melts in your mouth. Epic and a must try! The food is great and I love the decor as well. Great place
author: Tim A.

description:
The one rating is not for the food at this place. When visiting this restaurant yesterday, the food was hands down thee best Italian food that I have ever tasted. 
The one star is for our server. Being in the industry for 8 years, the following was very disappointing. We ordered a soup, salad and calamari to start. Happily pacing ourselves with the appetizers while preparing for our entrees. There were 2 wine glasses that were empty on our table for more than 10 minutes. When they wanted another glass, we could not spot our server anywhere in site and had to flag down another wait staff to try to find our server. We asked how much longer for our food, to which he responded that he was waiting for the Caesar salad to be finished that we had on the table. Well my oh my, this was no small Caesar salad to start with. Shocked to say the least to hear from our server that they were trained to wait until all the food was completely gone until firing up the entrees. 
When clearing the appetizers off the table, there was no pardon my reach while our server felt inches away from my face with his arm extending to grab the soup bowl. This happened more than once, sadly. 
Our entrees arrived at last and everything was cooked to perfection. Zero complaints about plates, presentation, temperature, or anything else guests tend to comment on. 
We ordered two desserts which were pretty delicious. 
Our server only checked on us twice while there was food on the table, while one of the check ins was if we wanted boxes. 
To say if we'll be back for another shot...not too sure on that one.
author: Shelby D.

description: We love coming to Mona Lisa. My dad is friends with the owner and they always treat us with such respect and such kindness. I would suggest the Oso Buco over polenta or fettuccine. That is my favorite. I've never had anything there that I didn't like.
author: Gina D.

description: Best Italian food I've had outside of my hometown in NY. Genuine hospitality and they make you feel like family! Grazie!
author: Katherine G.

description: There are a few times in life when a meal is so expertly crafted and planned that it is nothing short of genius. Last night, We had one of those meals. Thanks for the great service.
author: Pooyan J.

description:
We were in our second night at San Francisco and decided on Italian to celebrate our time during the New Year holiday.  My brother found this restaurant and it was quite delicious.  Atmosphere was really nice and we got to hang out and have fun without causing a fuss around other people.

I ordered an Italian steak with a melted Gorgonzola Cheese topping, but definitely wanted my Fettuccine Alfredo pasta fix.  Food was really exceptional and loved every bite!

Only thing I did not really care for was our very minimum effort server.  He was big and was okay enough, but spent more time with other tables than ours.  I was quite disappointed with that.

If you want to come for the Italian food, that's cool.  It's best enjoyed sitting down (though the wait time was pretty long too).  Just don't expect THAT stellar of a service when compared to other restaurants around the area.
author: Long T.

description:
Candle lit dinner, good pasta & wine, with the lovely bonus of having a Mona Lisa painting with her perky breasts out-- honestly what could I complain about?

Appetizers:
I recommend the bruschetta bread. 
I believe our platter came with assorted salumi and Romano cheese. I was a big fan of the cheese; had a strong taste and I was very down for it. 

I had the Fettuccine Leonardo-
Cream sauce, tomatoes, and chicken. 
Went well with my White Zinfandel. 

Owner was very nice and thankfully authentically Italian. 
Thank you for letting me eat while enjoying your breasts out, Mona Lisa. I shall be back to admire your loveliness hopefully soon.
author: Annie N.

description:
I now understand the 3.5 star review for this restaurant. I am thankful that they drop off a bread basket as soon as you sit down. This was able to hold us over for an hour and a half until we received our plate of spaghetti and a plate fettuccini alfredo. That's right, an hour and a half wait for our dinner, and that's not including the 30-40 minutes it took for the waiter to come and take out order. Oh and if you think you're getting a refill during that hour and a half, it's not going to happen. So be sure to ration out your beverage. 

By looking around, I could easily tell that I was not the only one unpleased with the wait. I even observed two customers send their orders back because they were not prepared correctly. The staff appears to be untrained and is unable to handle the busy Saturday rush. At no time did anyone apologize for he wait, or keep us updated on our meals preparation process. One thing that really got to me, was when a table that ordered after us, received their meals about 10-15 minutes before us. Again, I did not have a complicated order, but definitely waited as if I did. 

It's sad to say, but I receive better customer service at Walmart.
author: Alex R.

description: Wonderful experience. Went here for my anniversary (I did reserve online because the wait could be deadly sometimes), and we were instantly sat down and taken care of. Lovely service, always making sure you have enough bread and water. The owner is very a sweet guy, you'll see him walking around talking to guests. I really did feel like I was in Italy for a moment. Everything felt authentic. The food was AMAZING. Definitely going back!
author: Eva P.

description:
Came to visit Little Italy and Chinatown today with family to take in the atmosphere and different cultures. My review is as follows: 
For the food: 5/5
For the service: 3/5
For the atmosphere 3.5/5
Overall: 4/5.

As a starter, there is bread with balsamic vinaigrette and olive oil. For the table of four, we had ordered the appetizer platter (for two), which was plenty for a party of four. We were all thoroughly impressed with the calamari (especially the sauce), along with the salami, and cheese. For my personal entree, I ordered the lobster ravioli. Though the entree was not plenty in portion it was plenty in heartiness. Everyone else on the table ordered the fettuccini pescatoro (and were equally pleased, minus the misratio in clams/mussels to pasta). Overall, I would recommend getting the appetizer platter with a bottle of wine, for an afternoon delight.

For the service - our waiter did not seem too interested in assisting us. On a busy night, I would have understood . . . Also, I felt that as we were the only young adults, we were frowned upon.
author: Narine G.

description: I had a great time in this restaurant. The food was delicious and the staff was friendly. I am not from the area, but I went back, that's how much it impressed me the 1st time. I recommended to anyone.
author: D C.

description: This is an SF city MUST! We visit frequently from Monterey, and our first stop is always Mona Lisa for dinner. I love the vegetarian options, however my husband is a meat eater and this is his favorite restaurant as well- win/win. I have had the opportunity to visit Italy before, and this is as close as it comes! Indulge, and don't miss out on an amazing dining experience from food to service! The owner knows what he is doing to exceed taste and service!
author: Jessica M.

description: One good Yelp review last year and the owner of this place goes crazy. Complements of the house for an assorment of Italian appetizers. This restaurant got even better. The best Italian restaurant Ive ever been.
author: Sam C.

description: Great food and great service! We had a wonderful experience and the owner made us feel very welcome. Pizza tasted like home (New York) so I'd highly recommend:)
author: Lana M.

description: Wonderful Italian restaurant in the center of Little Italy. Wonderful service, delicious pizza, a great wine selection. The tortellini was to die for and the lasagna was fresh. The risotto was made to order. Wonderful place, definitely a step above.
author: Lindsey W.

description: We stumbled upon this gem while walking through Little Italy of San Francisco. The servers were incredible and the owner was so kind and generous. The food tasted just like my parent's and grandparents in Calabria. I will definitely be back.
author: Louis A.

description: What a wonderful ending to our Beach Blanket Babylon night in SF.  The food was amazing from appetizer to desert.  I have been on the search for the best calamari for a couple of years now and I think I finally found it.  The place was packed but service was quick.  Will go back next time I'm in the City!
author: Mary G.

description: I love this place! Everyone is so nice, and they're all Italian, so I can practice!  I've never had a bad meal!
author: Karen W.

description: We had a party of 8 that we reserved a table via Yelp. The staff was super friendly & food was really good. Great atmosphere & a fun delicious dinner.
author: Sheila V.

description: Went there on 12/30/17 for my girlfriend's birthday.  She has talked about Mona Lisa for our entire relationship and it did not disappoint. Food was absolutely amazing. Service was amazing. Only thing keeping it from a perfect 5 stars was I ordered the Margherita pizza and they forgot to put the basil on.
author: David B.

description: I'm new to San Francisco all the way from The Bronx, NYC. I knew I was going to have a good time from the picture of Derek Jeter in the front. The service was expeditious, the food was delicious, and the overall experience was memorable. I'm definitely dining here whenever I'm in the area.
author: Beto D.

description: This is a great spot! I had dinner here tonight, and I absolutely loved it! I ordered the spaghetti with marinara, and my family ordered pumpkin ravioli, and penne pasta with pink sauce. It's very well decorated to say the least, and when you walk in you can see the hustle and bustle of the restaurant. I really enjoyed my pasta, and my family really loved their dinner. It was fresh, authentic Italian food, and the there's something on the menu for everybody. The portions aren't lacking, and it's reasonably priced as well. I absolutely love the Fiat car outside the restaurant. I was with 3 people, but you can actually eat in the car with 2 people. The owner was very nice and seems like a very hardworking guy. If you walk by here, you haven't had dinner, and you see the car outside the restaurant, eat here!
author: Taylor S.

description:
The food here is not good! It's frozen food heated up in the microwave. There's nothing original or tasty. The chicken was rubbery, the raviolis were microwaved and overall, not very appealing to my taste buds. The pizza was the only thing that was ok.

The service however-excellent. Everyone was super friendly and accommodating.  They were very warm and welcoming people-thank you!
author: Peanuts M.

description: My boyfriend and I will be dreaming about the calamari and Leonardo fettuccine after leaving San Francisco for sure! Delicious food and cozy atmosphere!
author: Erika R.

description: I've been coming here for 11+ yrs bc it's my wife's favorite, I finally have had the meal that just made me melt......Ravioli Zucca, Pumpkin Ravioli w/ Sage & Brown Butter Sauce. If I'm ever granted a last meal on death row [J/K, #Sorrynotsorry] I only want this w/ a sprinkle of parmesan.
author: Flip F.

description: Was recommended on a tour but service was terrible food was not the greatest. Atmosphere was nice tho. But we won't be returning there ever again.  Go at your own risk.
author: Michael J.

description: Stopped by for a quick dinner before heading to the giants game! Food was very very good! The restaurant was easy to find and the service was great!
author: Chase C.

description:
the most amazing place.... 
it made my trip to san francisco :)
we were visiting from la we had a dinner on sunday evening there the food was amazing. the owner made us so wellcome and gave us the best servise ever.... we had a dinner in thier cute car out side of the resturant it was could but it made our experiance 100 time better. if i could i would give this place 10 star.. thanks for the best food and a great servise ...thanksss
author: Sev A.

description: We have lived in the Bay Area for over 25 years and this is the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco. The food is as authentic as it gets and the staff is very friendly. The owner talks to each customer and loves making customers happy. We have been multiple times and each time we have returned the owner remembered us. You can't order anything bad off the menu because everything they make is absolutely fantastic. I highly reccomend this place to anyone and everyone.
author: Liz R.

description:
Our first choice ran out of pizza so we meandered over to Mona Lisa's and looked at the menu and  the fellow who drives the tiny fiat said I have a table for you come in, I will take care of you .... I believe he meant it , I am of the Italian linage and I know Italians love to nurture people will food ...He had me at hello.....

the place is buzzing with activity and the staff is hustling all over . The ambiance it sexy with some  quirky over tones which are to be pursued while you wait for your probably too busy to actually give you service waiter ....which made this a food experience , not a dining experience ..DO NOT expect to have a leisurely romantic meal here , you will be genuinely disappointed . Plus , the lighting is dim so everyone looks pretty ....the tables are small so ordering a variety of items will not be a comfortable endeavor , and since they pack them in ...expect to be crowded and rushed . 

The glass are probably sterile , but the cleaning lady has been here is a decade or so ...get over it if you want to enjoy - marred wine glasses with finger print and servers tossing giant chilled bottles of water under their arms in bulk to toss them on your table without making any eye contact what so ever .....

Being ignored by our server in the beginning was a bit off putting but we stuck it out ..he didn't recommend anything on the menu .... if he did say the Margerite's pizza was boring and I appreciated the honesty ...it was also only $12 buck and I wondered if he was like yeah move up the price point .....so I threw him raise a ordered a glass of wine - it was tolerable but I won't rave about it any memoir - this is not a wine list type of place ...if you want great wine here you should bring and pay any corkage fee with glee - your palate will thank you . 

We ordered and appetizer and I think our waiter not interested with that -- it was a very put the butts in the seats and get them out vibe . 

But the burrata came and it was lovely - the prosciutto  was delicious with a fantastic texture and intricate flavor ... and burrata was lovely right temp the dish a delight - the bread however was unfortunate ....Stale dry San Fransisco sour dough only resealed  by the delicious olive oil that boasted a true olive flavor and added that fat the the bread needed - they really should call ACME and figure out the bread but they are busy so don't really have to fix it ......

My happy level came up after the burrata ....and then the food came - meatballs as perfect as meatballs can me finding the delicate line between flavorful robust meat and tender juicy fall apart on your fork goodness -- someone grandmother taught them well ...I had the parpadelli with bolognese and the pasta was delightful light and smooth and absorbent of the sauce which was good but not a cream finished deeply robust meat sauce - but good ....the Lasagna was a muilti  layered  yum fest really highlighting the good parmesan and increasingly pasta ..... yummy --

At glance summary - nice enough - food is tasty - service is uninterested in you and assume you are a tourist and if you no like a tourist on the street will happily take your place - understand you are eating and moving on  enjoy !
author: Kt K.

description: This is my third time here. I should have paid attention to the updated reviews recently. This dinner was utterly disappointing. First off the table bread was hard as a rock. Secondly, the Caesar salad tasted nothing like authentic Caesar dressing but more like a flavorless dressing with refrigerator taste. The Bolognese pasta tasted like canned food and the vodka penne was a la gross. I will not be returning. Do yourself a favor and go across the street to calzones restaurant. Definitely a lot more tastier. :/
author: Emily C.

description: This is by far the BEST authentic Italian restaurant around. We loved every bite! The appetizer tower had the tastiest calamari at the top of the tiered plater, the middle section had an assortment of meats, and the bottom tier had caprese with fresh buffalo mozz, prosciutto wrapped cantelope, bruscetta and olives. My main course was the gnocchi and 4 cheese sauce. It was like little pillows of scrumptiousness! My son had the spaghetti vongele, and it had clams cooked perfectly with lots of yummy garlic. My husband's cannolini was baked and bubbling when it arrived at the table and every last morsel was devoured! We were so stuffed we had no room for dessert, but it looked like we missed out!
