I will try to save room next time :) Oh, PS, the service and owner are delightful!!!
author: Kerry Y.

description: Came here for homemade manicotti and ravioli on Christmas Eve. Definitely wise to make a reservation as this place fills up. The space itself is warm, vibrant and cozy. The service is great! It was our first time and the waitress was informative and patient and kind. The other staff members were great too, making sure we were seated in time. Food is fantastic. Looking forward to return and try other ravioli variations.
author: Isabel R.

description: This was one of the best meals we have ever experienced. Such excellent service from our waitress Maria and all of the food from start to finish exceeded expectations. Recommend all pasta, seafood dishes, and the meatballs were phenomenal. The entire staff is so helpful, courteous, and fun. Will definitely be back!
author: Catie F.

description: Very intimate cool location with very good food only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because it's so hard to park I can't come here as much as I'd like too.
author: Mark P.

description:
Sigh.... 

This review is long over due.

My boyfriend made a reservation here on Valentine's Day at 5:00. We got here at 5:07 (finding parking) and ordered around 10 minutes later. We ordered the calamari appetizer - they give you a lot, but there were no tentacles! The redeeming part of this dish was the marinara. 

The real juicer was the wait time for our main dishes. Ree. Dick. Q. Lus. 

We waited a good 45 minutes for very plain pasta. Service was atrocious and seemed annoyed at us asking to check on our order.

The pasta that we got was very basic and probably could easily be concocted by getting tortellini at Trader Joe's or Costco. Not worth the money or hassle.

Cons:
1. Longgggggggg time to get food!
2. Food was mediocre
3. Service was below par
4. Expensive for food quality that is below Maggiano's!

Bottom line? Will not return. Ever.
author: Sheena T.

description: Meal was amazing!!! Atmosphere and service were incredible. My dad has the lasagna and said it was the best he's ever had. Every meal was amazing!
author: Erica L.

description: Horrible, possibly spoiled food. No seriously, left with full plates on the table, no one even bothered to ask why and my crazy hubby still tipped.
author: Azra K.

description:
I just had dinner here last night for my girlfriend's birthday. And it was amazing.

North Beach has its fair share of Italian food, so it's meaningful when a restaurant is able to stand out among so much competition. I'll break it down.

The Food - I need to start here. The bread is classic Italian - slightly crispy outside and soft inside. We split the caprese for an appetizer - everything was fresh and crisp. I ordered the Mix Seafood Grill - a massive helping of shrimp, swordfish, and some of the best salmon I've had in years. My girlfriend had the chicken cacciatore, which we both loved. For dessert, the tiramisu was simply divine.

The Service - When I say "everyone was fantastic", I mean *everyone*. The owner himself was making sure we had the experience we wanted.

The Ambiance - there is a classic fiat out front that they've converted into a little booth for two. We had dinner while watching the setting sun change the sky's colors. 

It couldn't have been better. And my Italian girlfriend agreed.
author: Ittai B.

description: Best Italian food in the bay area and the coolest owner as well. Pay this place a visit and you will not be disappointed. My family and I have come here many times during 4th of July weekend and the owner has always gone out of his way to show his gratitude and even provide us with wonderful recommendations as well as a free appetizer at times.
author: Omar L.

description: For a restaurant that looks classy and more expensive, I expected a better meal and service. My Chicken Piccata was average, some of the dishes we ordered were good but not great.  As for the service, it was super busy. There was a bit of a delay getting a table and placing our order. Once the service started it was efficient and the wait staff were lovely.
author: Natasha R.

description:
The atmosphere is great, but the service and food are 5-Stars out of 5.   They took care of our table of 6 very well.  The owner gave our table a special Birthday treat with Sony and dessert.   Such a great guy!!
Go and enjoy.
author: Dave K.

description: I've gone to Northbeach all of my life...when steps of rome was steps of rome, when broadway joe's was on Broadway, when there was a carl's jr at the corner of Broadway and Columbus, when Carol doda and the killer piano were still around. Not sure why I never tried Mona Lisa.  Well my wife and I finally went last Friday for my birthday and we had the perfect experience.  We had a big evening ahead so we kept it light. We ordered two traditional pasta dishes.  They made the entrées in front of us, super fresh ingredients, came out piping hot, large portions and super tasty.  The ambience was romantic, the service attentive, and the manager was awesome.  He provided us with a free cheese veggie charcuterie meat appetizer plate which was a nice touch.  They also brought out the TASTIEST CREAMIEST TIRAMISU free for my birthday.  While free is great, as we are also business owners, we always support other business owners so I made sure and was happy to include extra tip to pay for the free appetizer and free desert.  Free aside, this place is fab for ambience, great service, great food, value; and kudos to the mgr for his leadership of the crew and overall friendliness.  He's pictured on the business card.
author: Kevin W.

description: We had a great dinner, and they were so kind!! They treated us like family and we ran into a couple that had been visiting for years and they couldn't stop raving either!
author: S G.

description:
Oh dear - where to begin? Reservations for 7pm - food arrived at our table @ 8:30 pm. Forgot the appetizer. Waiter refused to split the check between 2 parties. Kinda rude wait staff - just rushing all over the restaurant, pushing past guests. Probably a good restaurant for tourists who have no choice but to put up with that kind of service. Over-priced, over-rated!!!

Not planning to visit again. Try the restaurants on the same street. Much better service, much better food.  Oh well - live & learn.
author: Joe M.

description:
Last February while in SFO we stumbled upon Mona Lisa.  Our waiter Luca had just arrived from Italy to work in his Uncles restaurant.  We enjoyed our meal and the hospitality.  Last week we returned and to our surprise Luca was there and remembered us.  We so enjoyed our meal and wine and his great hospitality.  Eating at the Mona Lisa reminds us of  
Italy and will hold us over until the summer when we can return to Rome.
author: Karen W.

description: Horrible service, food was decent. I don't usually write yelp reviews but my experience here was horrible. Customer service wasn't great the waiter seemed to only help us when we kept bugging for his attention, we decided to not leave a tip because we weren't satisfied with the service. while paying we stated that we weren't leaving a tip, on our way out the waiter asked if we were leaving a tip we stated that we weren't and he then started rambling about how were we not going to pay them, that he needed money to pay the cooks as if they aren't already getting paid already, he insisted that we left a tip but no where did it say it was mandatory after basically arguing with him we decided to just leave and ignore his comments. Never coming here again
author: Lesli H.

description: I don't usually send reviews, but this restaurant deserves a great one! First off, the gentleman who sat us, was a happy guy with an infectious smile. I believe his name is Maulazio? That may or may not be correct. So, sorry if I didn't get it right. Anyhow, the food was dynamite, and being Italian, I know my food!!!! I will return!!! It was fun, the wine was superb, and everyone was Italian!!! It doesn't get much better than that! Thank you Mona Lisa for a great experience!!!! Cindy!!!
author: Cindy F.

description: Once again Mona Lisa proves FANTASTIC...no visit to SFO is complete without a visit here, this time I bring a party of 7.  It's always nice when your dining partners praise your choice, tonight, I created 6 new fans who are all ready to return tomorrow.  You cannot make a bad menu choice here, everything is delicious. Until I return.  Bon apetito
author: Anthony G.

description:
I genuinely had a wonderful experience here and have no complaints whatsoever. It's a genuine Italian restaurant - sure, it plays up stereotypes to draw people in (i mean, it's named Mona Lisa and has a fiat), but the experience overall was fantastic. Just don't be in a rush. The staff (as far as I could tell) and the owners are Italian to the core, so things may not be prompt or quick, but they will be good and delicious. 

My family and I were drawn in by the owner standing outside next to the menu, and while we were looking at it he mentioned that an appetizer was free for the July 4th weekend, and that we could trust his cooking since he was Italian, Etc etc, and for curiosity's sake we were like: sure ok. We were seated immediately, near the windows, so the dim lighting wasn't so bad, but I can imagine further into the restaurant it would be more difficult to take photos of your meal. The inside itself is beautifully decorated with a painted ceiling and fun pictures and statues. Throughout my time there, the waiters were singing along to the Italian songs and chatting amongst themselves casually, and I thought it was just really amusing and different than say, an Olive Garden or any other run-of-the-mill Italian place. 

The free appetizer we did get was a delightful crostini that we ate with our red wine we ordered - I believe we got the Cabernet our waiter recommended. The sliced bread we received as we waited for our food was also refilled promptly and delicious as well. It seemed as if there were not enough olive oil/balsamic containers to go around but our waiter took ours from an empty table so it didn't cause a bother. The place was busy and popping by the time we left, and it was pretty funny because there was an older fellow outside who must be a friend of the owners or maybe work for the restaurant who was greeting people and saying 'thanks for coming' etc, and he had a picture with the owners on one of the walls, so at first we thought he must be famous but we had no idea. Just a treat to people watch!

And, ok, the meal. I will dream of this meal I think, forever. I'm going to Rome for a few months next year but I don't even know if anything there can top it. The menu had so many unique choices it was so hard to choose, but eventually I settled on the gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce, spinach, and pecans. 

It was mind blowing. The sauce was creamy and so thick so I had to stop several times just to savor it, but I'm so glad I had the wine and the time. I didn't even end up finishing it all! My table also ordered an eggplant dish, a veal dish, and another pasta dish, and they were all delicious as well (I of course sampled - how could I not?) Anyway. It was absolutely fantastic, hands down the best Italian food I've had in America. 


Tldr: go. Order bravely. Take your time. Enjoy it.
author: Alina D.

description: Feels like a quirky east coast Italian Restaurant with a huge menu and larger portions.  The Italian Sampler triple level offering is excellent as is the Iron Skillet Cioppino ( I would order this and they have a version with pasta and crusted Pizza topping to hold in the steaming broth).  They have handmade Ravoli - 5 different versions.  I did not love my Veal Saltimboca - no brown sauce, sage too chopped and Veal tough and tasteless.  Ambiance is fun and quirky - NY Italian meets Hollywood.
author: Ted D.

description: Mona Lisa is a North Beach Italian Experience.  Food is definitely very good, not outstanding...but you go to Mona Lisa for the kitschy ambiance and Italian experience and have a very good meal at the same time.  It was a fun dinner in North Beach
author: Paul K.

description: This place has gone way DOWNHILL. Had dinner at Mona Lisa a few nights ago with a friend from LA. There was hardly anyone in the restaurant which to me is a big sign. I decided to take a table since I have been to Mona Lisa many times before with great memories and thought what the heck. The food was ok but our waiter was as friendly as an overcooked Italian sausage. Like we were an inconvenience to him. ZERO eye contact, ZERO warmth, basically a big fat ZERO when it came to service. Never going back there again. Arrivederci!
author: Frank R.

description:
With our latest Restaurant.com coupon in hand, we eagerly zipped across the Bay Bridge and into Little Italy.  It was a crisp evening, so the warmth of Mona Lisa was very much welcomed by my husband and me.  
We were greeted outside, ushered in and shown to our table just that quick.  
Fresh bread, bottles of water and a menu.  We're on our way.  But first, we had to try the bread.  A little olive oil, a little balsamic vinegar and uummmmm.  Delicious.  But we didn't want to fill up on bread.  How we managed any self control is beyond me.  Bread is a weak point with us.
So we ordered an appetizer, the mini calzones with pesto.  The calzones were stuffed with cheese and ham.  Fried (baked?) to perfection and the pesto was so creamy and a great dipping sauce.  It came on a lettuce bed that was dressed with some fresh tomatoes.  This would be a perfect lunch all by itself for the hungry business person.  And, the tomato, calzone and pesto combo was a real taste treat, said my husband!
Our entree' (I've shamefully forgotten the name of the dish) was a chicken breast that was grilled and seasoned with some special peppers.  On the side were roasted potatoes and also a side of spinach.  A little of everything on the fork for the perfect bite.  
Aside from the perfectly delicious food, the atmosphere is just plain fun.  All sorts of things going on, yet not in your face.  Look around.  Famous people's pictures who've visited are framed on the walls around the place.  The ceiling is a light show!  The music, I wish it were Italian as well.  Just a personal thing.  I like hearing the music of the place that the food is paying homage to.
Our server was gracious.  Service was excellent.  I'm so glad we had the opportunity to visit Mona Lisa.  This is now on our "Revisit" list.  I'm not a big fan of Italian food.  It seems to be mostly of three components: meat, pasta, sauce.  Boring.  I have been awaken to Good Italian Food!  And you can be too!
author: Reba Jane S.

description: What a total let down !!! The Resturant looked amazing the staff spoke Itialian but the lasagna was served in a bowel and it should have been because it was just sauce and noodles plus very bland . It was slop !!!! I
author: Rick M.

description: I had the pleasure at dining at Mona Lisa recently. I have been recommended to try this place out by Armando, Mauricio's nephew. Mauricio is a very friendly man and the food served is absolutely delicious. To be honest, the restaurant wasn't so busy when I had dined and the staff was exceptional. They had just finished their peak hours before my arrival, but were still working hard through what I imagine, exhaustion. Thank you Miguel for the chicken marsala recommendation!
author: Danielle M.

description:
Had a chance to try this restaurant, the food is terrific but the service is not on par with the food. I can understand if they are busy, but there were only maybe 10 people in the whole place. 

I would give them a second chance, but with so many other choices. It might be a long time before that happens. 

The choices are so great in little Italy, you can't afford to not be on your game everyday. I know restaurant work is hard, but to be successful it's being consistent.

Thanks for replay. I will do that, as all have off nights.
author: Jim C.

description:
If I could have demanded my entire meal be comp'd by the owner i would have. By far the worst service I have ever had at a restaurant period. Food was amazing, or server was probably the worst server I have ever met in my life....a "fine dining" Italian restaurant where I had to ask for more wine.

Seriously?????
And that final check?? "Tip included in final total??? "#%^%%%^%"
author: Stanley H.

description: Mona Lisa is the place to go in North Beach for the ultimate Italian experience and authentic, tantalizing food.  Don't neglect to order the family style appetizer to start your meal off!  Maurizio & Marco are delightful -- and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Tell them Giovanni Teldeschi sent you!
author: Linda H.

description: This place first of all had amazing service very funny friendly and nice then and on top of that the food was to die for , the best Italian restaurant I've ever been too and the price is like any other restaurant in San Fransisco.
author: Sergio B.

description:
Convenient after Beach Blanket Babylon, the food was solid, if unspectacular.  They sat us near the front door, which never closed, and we were chilly the entire meal.  Might have ranked it 4-star but for that.  Service was so-so, friendly, but we had to ask twice for olive oil. Very Italian atmosphere, which would have been more enjoyable if we weren't cold.

I had chicken parmigiana, which was good, just not as good as what my wife makes.  Roasted potato and spinach sides were excellent.  My son's pepperoni pizza had a really good crust and was cooked well, but it had a bit too much sauce for his preference.  We also tried the tortellini formaggio (very cheesy) and spaghetti carbonara (pancetta could have been crisper), which both had good flavor.
author: Roger N.

description:
Awesome restaurant!

I had late dinner here last night and the food was so authentic and delicious!

You can find here wide selection of pasta (vegetarian, meat or seafood) and meat/seafood entrees. Vegetarian/Gluten free friends won't be disappointed! I had the black squid ink linguine... Yum!

The owner was very welcoming and our waiter was very helpful and checked on our table few times.

I will be returning back very soon!
author: Cristina R.

description: The food was ok maybe a 5 out of 10 but the customer service really sucks, they took 20 min just to get us drinks and they were not even busy they only had 2 tables and the rest were empty and the food took 40 to come to our table and it was warm, I'm good off of this place
author: Tycoon N.

description: Thank you Mauricio the owner and our waiter Luca  who both along with the chefs made our birthday party so special! All so patient and efficient For all 12 of us The food was delicious and amazing the service 10 out of 10!! Amazing I felt I met new members of my family great service food and hospitality for sure you will see all of us again !
author: M K.

description: Truly the Worst pizza I have ever had: I ordered a basic Margherita pizza, the dough was fine but the sauce was simply terrible, left me a bad taste in my mouth for all the evening; also the cheese was stale. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the service, but the food was very disappointing. Would not suggest to anybody to go especially to native Italians. Moreover, I was disappointed by the appetizer, panzerotti, that were nothing special very badly fried. One star for the environment and for the service.
author: Caterina R.

description: I never ate to this restaurant , but Maurizio the owner is worth all the 5 star , Great personality very welcoming for sure next time I fell like eat Italian foods this is the place to visit ! Grazie paisa'
author: Nicola C.

description: A friend recommended this Italian restaurant. We went during a very busy dinner time-but we had reservations and were seated immediately. Staff was very friendly as were the other diners around us. Good family place. Great selection of food that was well prepared and served hot. Couldn't ask for a better place!
author: Chris S.

description: Asked for olive oil four times. The people sitting behind us and next to us got the olive oil after only the second time they asked. Made us wait 20mins even though we had a reservation. The bread came out cold and borderline stale. The calamari came recommended by the waiter and it was subpar at best. It was very chewy and oily. The sauce was great that came with it and paired nicely with our bread that was olive oil-less. Then the another table that was seated a bit after us and definitely ordered after us received their two entrees before us. We only ordered one to split. And then to round it off. The ravioli we ordered was minuscule in comparison to everything else. Not bad but not great. How is ravioli more expensive then a large order of calamari but yet so much smaller? Mine as well go to bucca di bepo and know what you're getting yourself into and get your money's worth.
author: Alfredo D.

description: My go to place. Penne alla vodka and their calamari are outstanding. Homemade pasta there too!!! Great service.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Came with a large group and they set up the tables to accommodate us when we got there. The atmosphere is nice with dark lighting and the service was friendly and quick.

We ordered the calamari ($17) and tomatoes caprese ($16) appetizers. Both were tasty but pretty pricey for the serving size. For the entree I got the lobster ravioli ($20). It was just okay in my opinion - there was not too much flavor in the tomato sauce and I couldn't really taste any lobster. Then for dessert I ordered a cheesecake ($8) which was good the first few bites but was way too rich that I couldn't finish it on my own.

Overall okay Italian restaurant in the area and very good for group dinners.
author: Linda X.

description: Big pilates but comes with a price. I don't think price value performance is worth it. Having said it, the food was more of a 4 star. We had meatball and salmon fetuccini pastas. Salmon was better but both dishes are good. It is also nicely decorated but very touristy. It is not your local neighborhood Italian restaurant.
author: Mete R.

description:
BAD. RUDE. INSULTING. WOW!! I was INCREDIBLY offended by the service here, and I'm not easily offended. So much so that I NEVER, EVER leave Yelp reviews, but this prompted me to sign in after YEARS of city eating. To be honest, it really felt like prejudice (over I don't know WHAT, sure we looked young and funny looking but hell, I was wearing a tie even).
It was the worst service I've ever seen GLOBALLY. Here's a breakdown:
* We came in Saturday night, 2 hours before closing. Asked to sit outside, they said sure. 
* THEY IGNORED US! After water came, we NEVER saw them again. Over 20 minutes, and they were NOT busy at all, maybe 3 tables full inside. 
* We asked to move inside because we had waited so long we were FREEZING. They said sure, and we had to move our water and place settings in OURSELVES.
* Still: SLOW, RUDE service. Mainly a short haired/short bearded guy WHO WENT HOME and walked past us as we were sitting (wearing a black shirt and black backpack).
* WOW!!!!!! We asked for a little vinegar and olive oil for our bread, and they said "Sorry guys, OUT OF VINEGAR", which is fairly shocking for an ITALIAN RESTAURANT.
* WHAT?!?!?! After he left, another waiter came buy 10 minutes later and BROUGHT A BOTLE OF VINEGAR TO THE TABLE OF TWO WOMEN SITTING RIGHT NEXT TO US.
______INCREDIBLY INSULTING!!!!!!__________
* Had to ask for a refill of water, had to ask for the check (which took FOREVER), NEVER was checked on to see how everything was going. 
* The table next to us had to SEND AN ITEM BACK because IT WAS UNDERCOOKED. The waiter asked if they wanted a discount, they said "No. We want what we ordered, but now we want it to go". 
* Again, we arrived 2 HOURS before closing, so it's not that we walked in 10 minutes before closing, but even an hour into our meal a guy shouted "WE CLOSED" to a group trying to walk in. 

Hell! We were just a group of to, a young guy and a young lady. We just wanted to have a quick bite and we pay/tip well! But for the first time ever: I DID NOT WANT TO LEAVE A TIP, THEY DID NOT DESERVE A PENNY. I WAS COMPLETELY INSULTED AND IT FEELS LIKE WE WERE "PRETTY WOMAN'D" (aka judged for appearing to not have money). 

I left a $1 tip and I hope they got the insult. Congratulations Mona Lisa, I'm against leaving bad feedback but YOU PUSHED THE ENVELOPE. We will forever laugh at how terrible and rude your service was, and if I were the owner reading this, I would definitely take a look at that server who served us Saturday night 6/10/17. 

It's a shame, the food was good. But you could have given us C service and this would have been fine. You gave us not even F services, but I'm giving you and I- FOR INSULTING. 

Shame.
author: Armand D.

description: I love Mona Lisa. A true Italian feel. Food is good. The experience is excellent. Everyone is very friendly.
author: Erra C.

description: Came across it by accident and it was he best thing that has ever happened to me. Literally so delicious and authentic. 10/10 would recommend!
author: Isabel M.

description: Came here on a Tuesday, the food was just alright and the service was alright as well. Nothing to brag about at all.
author: Isaac H.

description: I will not go to this restaurant.  Having other business in the area I stopped and parked in an parked outside the restaurant in a yellow space that is marked no parking trucks only until 1 pm and 6 pm till 2 am.  A server came out and told me it was nonparking tow away.  I asked where the sign was and he said there was not one but it was still tow away.  Had I wanted a meal after my business would havd been the perfect place.  I will never go there when again I am in the area for business.  The person in the area with whom I did business confirmed that the posted signs were accurate and it was not towaway.  I do not like people who lie to me just to save parking for their customers.
author: Cannon H.

description: The food was pretty delicious but the service wasn't that great. Our waiter was rushing us the whole meal.
author: Marissa S.

description:
From a Celiac:

Wow. This place has a lot going on! Decorations, busts, pictures, paintings, lights, and Italian men running around!

This place was very accommodating for a Celiac! They had gluten free options for pastas!!! They had a lot of chicken, fish and beef dishes. I had the Saffron Risotto. Honestly, it wasnt very good, it was too greasy and didn't taste like saffron. But, my whole family all absolutely loved their dishes!

I looooooved the bottle of wine we got. Very extensive wine list, always a prerequisite for a good rating from me. 

While I didn't like my dish, I'm sure I would've loved a GF pasta dish. I would definitely go back!
author: Brianna S.

description:
Let me start off by saying, I know good Italian food. I know good Italian food because I come to Mona Lisa every chance I get. Whether it's a birthday or just a night out, Mona Lisa never fails to deliver great service and even better food. 

I've been coming here since I was a kid, Maurizio has always stood at the door to welcome passer-bys and returning patrons. As I walk in, I'm always greeted with a kiss on both cheeks and a glass of wine. And on a few occasions I've even been seated in the Fiat outside. 

Funny story - I went on a first date to Mona Lisa, this guy was going on and on about how great the food and atmosphere are. He had no idea I was a regular. We walked in, and Maurizio greeted my with a kiss on the cheek and sat me down at my favorite spot in the corner. My date could tell something was up. After a few minutes, this guy was so confused when an order of Calamari was delivered to the table, "Courtesy of the Owner." I laughed and told him that Mona Lisa is like a second home to me. Dinner was outstanding, as always. I had Ravioli with Vodka sauce (my favorite) and he had the Pollo Piccata (my second favorite.) We shared a bottle of Pinot Grigio and tiramisu for dessert. Unfortunately, we didn't fall in love... but the food was great, so thats a plus!

Would I go back? Every day for the rest of my life!
author: Maria Francesca A.

description: Had my wedding dinner here and the dinner and staff was amazing. Service was awesome and the staff was very friendly and accommodated our every needs. I want to thank the crew at Mona Lisa for our great experience. Thank you
author: Sal L.

description: What an amazing dinner experience! It was like being back in Italy with the ambience and loving experience. The food was excellent, our waiter, Luca, outstanding making us feel like familia. The ambience trap sported you back to southern Italy. Definitely a five-star experience.! BTW, the tiramisu was so lite, creamy, with a nice hint of coffee - glad we had to walk back to our hotel!
author: J. Patrick C.

description: Had the tortellini in cream sauce with peas and prosciutto.  Large portion, flavorful and cooked to perfection.  I would definitely go back.   The place is not much to look at, but the food made up for it.
author: J L T.

description:
The best Italian food on Columbus street in San Francisco. We ordered penne with mushrooms, eggplant, and red sauce and the house lasagna with meat sauce. Both dishes, which we shared, were outstanding. The only negative at this restaurant is the service . . . It's not the best and not worse. Other than that, this place is a great place to visit for an Italian meal while in San Francisco.
Okay, yes we went back again . . . And it was just as good as I remembered. This time our waitress was outstanding and we have absolutely no complaints. If you like Italian food and you don't want to waste your money this is the place to go! Awesome
author: RvChick R.

description: The lasagna was great, the fettuccine Alfredo  tasted like noodles with a stick of butter melted over them, it was uneatable.  I'm hoping the sauce was just a bad batch and not indicative of the recipe.  The service was ok, not very attentive to empty glasses or bread.  I'd give it another shot if in town again but would ask to sample the Alfredo first.
author: Matt L.

description: We had great service and good food. The ambiance was nice and service was speedy.  The price point is about what you should expect for restaurant of this type in San Francisco, but the food is slightly below average for restaurants at this price point.  Interior is dated, but it is appropriate and has a nice vibe.  Still was a fun evening and the owner was cool AF.  He let us take pictures in his car!
author: Chris R.

description: It's quite expensive compared with the quality of the food. However they got a nice decoration
author: Hoang L.

description: Ordered to go...Food was not made on time, Calzone with Ham did not even taste cooked. So oily, cheese not melted and loaded with uncooked ham. Pasta was dry. Dissapointed
author: Cristina B.

description:
Yes after you get out of that #Awesome little car up front enter into a #Retro SF "Little Italy" the Maître d' and service is impeccable we had such a good time sitting down ordering food and cappuccinos the desserts are so authentic! Most of all while on #Vacay the people you meet should "Add-Value to your Life" Great Spot all around.
4-Star Only because parking is a BEAR in The City!!!


-Blessings
author: James O.

description:
Very rarely will I give anything lower than 3 stars unless I was completely dissatisfied with the whole experience. Aside from the lovely hostess with curly hair and glasses ( didn't catch your name, but keep up the wonderful job) my experience here may be my last. 

- It's a disgusting feeling when you do not feel welcomed to a restaurant or anywhere for that matter. I ate here with my younger brother and felt that our waiter prioritized certain tables over ours. Haven been a waiter, I understand different signs customers give me in order to accommodate their wants and needs. That being said, we closed our menus since we already decided on what to get. Our waiter passed us several times and clearly saw that we were ready, but still insisted on not acknowledging us. Finally, he took our orders. Losing my appetite already, but hey, hopefully the food compensates for his lack of friendly service.

- Food comes out and it looks semi-pleasing. My "Spaghetti Polpette " lacked sauce. The spaghetti itself was not cooked al dente as requested. My brother's pasta, "Spaghetti allo Scoglio" was appetizing, I give them that. 

- I took a couple bites and was not pleased, so I was waiting for my waiter to check up on us. He went to our table and asked us how the food was (kind gesture) but as I was speaking, he walks away to attend to another table, that did not even flag him down. Such a rude move. He comes back after attending to the table next to mine, and says, " you wanted more sauce?" "Yes, please".

- I was presented with more sauce in a timely manner. Sauce wasn't flavorful, but I really didn't want to be that "one guy" so decided to let it go. Did not end up packing our leftovers (which I usually do). 

It could have been an off day for them. Our waiter could have been having a bad day. But regardless of the fact, servitude, friendliness, and tastiness is always key, and Mona Lisa did not reach my expectations. Would I give this place another try? Yeah, I would, but would definitely try something else and request another server.
author: Jim G.

description: Service is good. Food is mediocre at best and highly overpriced. Would not recommend this place to anyone. Seriously, for the price you could get better portions, not rotten potatoes, and better taster.
author: Iurii K.

description:
This restaurant I have been going to for a very long time. I always sit in the front love the atmosphere always welcoming. There are quite a few tourists and just walk ins but I still come when I can. The menu is too long and a first timer might have trouble picking it's so extensive.
I visited with my two girlfriends last week . The one had only the casear salad which was good. The other had the cioppino an I had the Vitelli Palermo my favorite. The food is delicious and they brought us a complimentary antipasto plate which was nice. The cioppino
was full of delicious shell fish she barely managed to finish it. The service was on top of it the wine was good and they will be back. My other friend can't wait to go back for cioppino just 
waiting for that cioppino "Money " to come thru. The place is a little high.
author: Stef M.

description: Best authentic Italian restaurant in SF! The only thing better than the food is the service. Everyone is so nice, and the owner is amazing and knows how to take care of everyone who passes through the door. I'd give them 10 stars if I could!
author: Megan D.

description: Meh.  Nice authentic Devore, but the pasta sauce was very mediocre, the steak I ordered was over cooked.  The service was also mediocre.  The food and experience was not worth the price.  It's not bad, just a very expensive and mediocre restaurant.
author: Robert U.

description:
We searched areas in northbeach that had gluten free pasta options and this came up really close to our hotel. We were able to make reservations online and had no problems getting seated right away. Our order was taken quickly and food came out promptly. Our server was nice and helped with my gf requests. 

The atmosphere is like so many other cute cozy Italian restaurants in the little Italy district. Tons of little tables packed together, Italian flags hanging from the walls, the ceilings painted with resembles to the Sistine chapel and similar romantic art. 

The gluten free options here are good. They have a rice fusilli pasta and said I could have any sauce... And wow did they have a lot of sauces. Almost too many to choose from. They also have gf pizzas. 

We ordered the caprese salad which was good and they also made a tomato based calamari appetizer since I couldn't have the fritti, it was pretty good. I had the bolgonese meat sauce which was tasty, tho my pasta was really undercooked and tough to eat. My friends ordered a veal dish and the other a risotto with prawns. The one with the veal said it wasn't bad and the one with the risotto didn't eat much of hers. 

Price was ok. About 16 for the pasta and 11 or so for the appetizer was what I paid for. It was really nice that there wasn't any additional gluten free charge, that is hard to find. I ordered their house Cabernet which was good, I just thought 10.00 was a little pricey for just a house glass of wine.. But then again, maybe I've just been in the Midwest too long

Overall it wasn't bad. I would go there again but it wouldn't be my first choice in northbeach.
author: Elisabeth P.

description:
This is not bad Italian cousin restaurant but today when I went here with my wife I got the most terrible service ever from servers in my life. This guys were like a stupid asshole. They were every time late and confused with my orders: they brought another pizza, they forgot about beer, when I asked about 2 dishes they brought 1, and portion of panzerotti was smallest than usual - 3 instead of 4. Also when I asked to call manager server Roberto said he just left, also this Roberto was absolutely not friendly, rude and said he would call police cause we didn't want to pay for beer we didn't order. And at the end he even allowed himself to swear!! Is it what you called "great" service?! 
Will never come back here! And don't recommend.
author: Max F.

description: Oh my goodness can you say amazing authentic food!!! I was on family vacation and needed a place for 7 people that would take a reservation I came across this gem on yelp, once I seen the pictures and reviews I knew I had to try it. Staff was very kind, food did not take long to come out. It is Italian food the the portion sizes were very well worth it. I would definitely come back.
author: Marie S.

description: I absolutely love this restaurant! I came across it one day walking down Columbus and the staff is very friendly! I tried their calamari as a appetizer and ordered a chicken fettuccine as a entree. I had Wasef as my waiter and he was AMAZING! Even thought they were super busy inside he still was able to help me with any questions I had. I definitely recommend him as a server! The Owner Maurizio is very friendly and welcoming!! I highly recommend this restaurant weather your a tourist or live around the bay it's simply wonderful! Will definitely be coming back ASAP
author: Sierra B.

description: This is a very busy place, I was eating here when Mauricio was still in Italy. I was introduced to him by his Uncle Angelo who managed the place years ago. There is nobody more generous and accommodating than the staff at The Mona Lisa. They are in the busiest part of the most exciting part of The City...I even have less than perfect service sometimes...forgetaboutit....the food is great, Mauricio is a fantastic host...be happy you don't have to dust the place! You do need to be pro-active though, it's usually busy
author: Rodney M.

description:
1 large party
Reservation time: 7:30
Seated: 8:10
Entrees arrived: 9:15 or so

Service was bafflingly slow, even by Italian standards. It took at least 15 minutes for the server to greet us after we had been seated. We watched many other parties be seated and served, meanwhile we had to flag down our server to get wine and bread while we waited. My out of town guests enjoyed their entrees, but my bf and I thought our pastas were mediocre at best. I can think of lots of local Italian places with better food and service at a better (or similar) price point.

Edit: I appreciate the restaurant's response. Perhaps we would have enjoyed the pasta more if it was served at the right temperature. Sure, it was busy that night, but the slow service kept us from enjoying our dinner and I won't be back.
author: Kirby O.

description: This place was kind of mediocre. I've honestly had better Italian food before in my hometown. I was a little put off by the slow service. We weren't even there on a busy night. It's almost like we were forgotten. Our food finally came after waiting 45+ minutes. Ridiculous. This place was talked very highly of during one of our tours we took, but honestly I don't see why? I probably won't be going here again.
author: F B.

description: When I lived in San Francisco I would dine here at least once a week, and always brought my visiting guests. I often think about hopping on a plane just to come in for lunch. Living in LA now, haven't found anything like it. I hope to visit SF soon, just so I can eat here.
author: M H.

description: Fantastic food, great service, authentic ambiance! I would highly recommend! The homemade gnocchi was to die for!!
author: Jen B.

description:
I'm not going to down them for the service, it's busy, crowded, and you feel like cattle being herded in, i could live with that. My complaint is the food! Spaghetti carbonara had no flavor except for the burnt pan taste. My fettuccine alfredo tasted like noodles in warmed up watered down non fat milk....seriously!  Calzone appetizers were simply lunch meat ham with a small shaving of cheese wrapped up in a blanket, very bland.  I blame myself for not adhering to its poor yelp ratings. 
Go to another Italian restaurant with a better rating.
author: Angie R.

description:
5 stars for the service. From the hostess to the busser to the waiter, all excellent. We had a late reservation and were the last guests there, never felt rushed or uncomfortable at all. In fact, my waiter had the cooks add some pasta to my leftover Cioppino. Wish I got his name.
My husband enjoyed his Diavola Pizza, I had a slice and it was great. My Cioppino was OK..I've had better but the portion was huge. Prices are spot on for Little Italy, our disappointing lunch at the wharf cost more. Yeah, we should've know better but were playing tourist for the day. 
We'll definitely not hesitate to dine at Mona Lisa again if we're in the area.
author: Theresa U.

description:
The reason for my one star is due to my waiter who we asked to split the with specific details and guess what, he did as he pleased.

Then came back and said, " it's going to take a long time to fix". I don't care JULIAN it's your job!!!
HE DIDN'T FIX IT BECAUSE IT WAS GOING TO TAKE TOO LONG. So I guess this restaurant doesn't have respect for your money. I have never been so upset at a restaurant before.

To the manager, I would consider training your servers on how to refund because he pretty much told me my money doesn't matter.
author: Cecilia L.

description:
This service is so bad. The 2 waiters have rude manners which I'm pretty sure are non-excising. I feel really bad for the host who is extremely nice. He has to suffer from these rude people. 
          Not only was the service bad the silverware was dirty. When everyone on the table touched their plates, their fingers were dirty. 
     My advice is to never come here ever
author: Hanson G.

description: Excellent authentic Italian food amongst many restaurants in Little Italy - San Francisco. Marco was a Great waiter that took excellent care of my family. We will be returning back in the very near future.
author: Rob A.

description: Delicious and authentic, enjoyed the ambiance and hospitality. I would definitely return.
author: Rachel B.

description: Love this place, we come from  Folsom ca just for the Veal Marsella and Salmon Picatta.  Best Italian food anywhere , Period. Service is always exceptional.  Cant say enough good things about this restaurant  Update, 2-3-18. Went for dinner 3 days ago, Jan 31st. Happy to report the experience was even better then the last time. This place continues to out do itself. The staff are amazing. Every time you go you are treated as if you were the only customer. Food is amazing. I get the same thing everytime, Veal Marsala. There is none better then here. My partner had Salmon Picatta, again just perfect. The Desserts are awesome as well. You have A lot of choices for Italian in North Beach. This should be your choice.
author: Wayne V.

description:
Disappointed. Definitely don't want to go back. 
Why?
Service below average. Our cousin joined us after we had our food, and the server didn't give her a menu, water, and only barely acknowledged her presence (she ended up eating elsewhere). 
Food very expensive, and not very good. My meal was tasteless and bland. My husband didn't feel well after eating there. 
The decor and location are fine, it is cramped but that was OK. 
The topless Mona Lisa picture was interesting. 
I'd say, go there and just have wine, salad and bread and make up your mind before ordering anything else.
author: Lenny H.

description: Best Italian restaurant in Columbus avenue, I went there for dinner with friends and the owner welcomed us in a really friendly way, the food and wine  was amazing, I suggest to try the Ravioli with funghi porcini, I will definitely go back to eat good food :)
author: Andrea S.

description: Food was delicious and the service was great .. ask for Luca when you get there he is the best server .. My only complaint is that the calzone we ordered said prosciutto and mushrooms and it was ham and mushrooms.. I know prosciutto is expensive but that is what we paid for...Even that way it was still delicious
author: Pdx P.

description: I really enjoyed this restaurant. It was recommended to me by a local. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo and it was really delicious. The ambience inside is great and the service was great too.  For San Francisco, I thought the price was very reasonable. I have a pretty good appetite and when the meal was first brought to me, it didn't don't look like it was a lot. I thought the bowl was shallow, but it turned out to be incredibly filling. I couldn't eat the entire meal and had plenty of left overs. I would definitely return in future trips.
author: Charli G.

description:
The greatest Italian food and the best service in San Francisco.  They treated our table of six like family.  They helped us celebrate my wife's birthday on our 06/26/17 visit with a beautiful dessert and a room full of singing.
The owner is fantastic as he orchestrates the flow of the restaurant while visiting his guests at the table.
A+, first class establishment.  Cannot wait to visit again.
author: Michael G.

description: Great authentic Italian Food! My husband had the chicken parmigiana and I had the Lasagna both were excellent and made with fresh ingredients. The owner is friendly and the ambiance is true Italian. Excellent!
author: Diane B.

description:
Honestly yes yes ....

My expectations where the best about this place !! And yes ! 
I sure got the best I love the service ,  the recommendations  by our server where spectacular, 
Thank you so much to the whole crew 

FULL RECOMMENDED IN SAN FRANCISCO
author: Lyla H.

description: Very friendly staff. They recognize me as a returning customer every time I come here. Food is great, lots of seating available and probably my favorite Italian food in SF.
author: Henry K.

description:
We've been here at least 20 times over 15 years. It is always a pleasant experience. Food is fantastic and the service is usually on point.  I always bring out of town guest here.

Penne al Forno alla calabrese is my favorite!

How ironic that I write the review, only to have a not so great experience just 10 minutes later. They changed their recipe and when we brought it up to the owner he seemed bothered that we commented on it.   He said "well bye and walked away" Keep in mind we were literally the only people there. 

I hope this was a one off experience. We will try again next time we are in the city.
author: Jason S.

description: BEST. ITALIAN. EVER. Hands down you do not want to miss out. The staff and owner are incredible. Don't go anywhere else for italian!
author: Hayley H.

description: Impeccable service and our meals reminded me of being back in Italy. Highly recommend this option in a sea of restaurants to choose from in North Beach. Fun to sit outdoors on the street and people watch. The owner was a hoot and is from southern Italy.
author: Kira M.

description:
I believe the owner was at the restaurant Saturday night helping out. I don't know if that's common on him. He Seems like a great person and can see the passion he has for the restaurant and his customers.

Food and Wine was great.
author: Juan V.

description: Food is always delicious and great service. A real authentic Italian experience and a large varied menu with something for everyone.
author: Tracie B.

description: Great service (Samuel our waiter) really made us comfortable and welcomed. Great food and reasonably priced. I highly recommend the chicken parmigiana. We also had pasta arrabbiata good but a little spicy.   For dessert we had the white chocolate covered cram puffs really good.
author: Imelda G.

description: AMAZING! The owner is an absolute delight. I have been coming here since I was 12, and am now 26. He ALWAYS remembers me and my family when we come in, and gives us a complimentary appetizer. Mauricio is wonderful! Definitely check this place out; you won't be sorry.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Came here from out of town after a friend raved about the food here. It doesn't take much to impress me but the Italian food was awful. I came during lunch hours. The restaurant was not packed. I ordered the pumpkin ravioli. The spunk in stuffing was okay, the pasta itself was not very good and the sauce was bland. My friend ordered the fettuccine Alfredo. Bad choice. Tasted like Campbell's soup. No joke. 

Service was friendly though. I am told their sea food is what is good here. It's an Italian restaurant-I hoped for at the very least good pasta. Come on!
author: Marylin P.

description: Great food, great service, very accommodating! We were searching for a place for the family and were greated by owner outside in Italian.
author: Eugene K.

description: Food was pretty good. I would recommend getting pasta instead of pizza (pizza was pretty average but pasta was delicious). Pizza was only average because our waitress put pepper on it. Not crushed pizza peppers but straight up BLACK GROUD PEPPER, and she never checked back with us after our food took almost 45 minutes to come. So in conclusion good food but bad service.
author: Sami M.

description:
Normally I would only give this place four stars, but the service was so outstanding that I had to give it five stars.

Mauricio was awesome! My friends and I were promptly greeted when we arrived, and were seated immediately.  We shared an appetizer with caprese, bruschetta, and Sicilian candy.  The "candy" is candied garlic, and it's amazing.  I probably would have eaten the whole thing if I wasn't so afraid of knocking a persons' socks off when I spoke.

I had the linguine allo squallo (spelling?). It was an awesome pasta dish with salmon, mussels, calamari, and other seafood goodness that I can't remember. The red sauce was lightly seasoned and did not drench the pasta, which I like.   Mauricio suggested an amazing Greek (yes, Greek!) wine that was fruit forward with a nice dry after-taste.  The wine complimented the dinner perfectly. My friends and I also shared the pistacchio dessert and the tiramisu.  All of us were ready to take a nap after dinner!  My friends and I plan to be in North Beach again in a couple months and we will definitely be coming back to Mona Lisa : )
author: Yvette G.

description: Pricey but tasty. Their house salad dressing is great. Large portions. Light red and spicy red sauces are well done. Great alfredo and pesto. Friendly and polite service. Inflated North Beach prices really warrant a 3.5 rating. However, my family had a very nice experience and we would return.
author: Bon V.

description:
Pretty sweet restaurant. The owner is at the door greeting people the "old skool" way. Had the cioppino and it's right up there with the best of em' in SF. Been to North Beach a lot growing up in the area, and have probably been to most of the restaurants on or around Columbus. Mona Lisa holds its own.

Cheers!
author: Jim M.

description:
Being a North Beach girl for the last 20 plus years, I know where to go & what to go for.  The usual Italian restaurant for us in the neighborhood has long been Sodini's or Ideale.  Mona Lisa has always been considered a tourist spot.  But out w friends recently, the wait for Sodini's was 45 minutes, so we decided to give Mona Lisa's a try.  

Stick w certain pasta dishes & you'll be fine.  My man's chicken piccata was a true study in mediocrity.  It was over salted & the sauce was a clingy mess instead of accentuating & tasty.  Pass.

The carbonara, on the other hand, was delicious.  The bacon was extra crispy, which gave great contrast to the dish.  The sauce was rich & flavorful.  A decadent dish.  Lip smacking good.

The rigatoni w truffle I ordered was also very good.  Good balance of flavor, w just the right amount of truffle, this dish was lighter & cleaner than the carbonara.  My man kept taking bites.  He didn't care for his piccata dish, but really liked this.  And it was nicely al dente.  A win.

It's kitschy, but not completely over the top.  This is North Beach.

In a pasta mood?  Mona Lisa's not a bad call.  Just know what to order.

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: The customer service of the place awesome, but the food itself....it wasn't bad yet it wasn't 5 star either. It is a bit on the pricey end for me. Came here today Sunday Feb 12th, 2017 with my sisters in law and my kids. The staff was attentive and sweet they gave us a free appetizer to start. One of my sister in law ordered a seafood risotto, and the other sister in law ordered lasagna, my eldest one ordered kid sized fettuccine alfredo, and my little one and I shared spaghetti with meatballs. The portion for the adult meal in comparison to the kid sized plate was the same. Had I known it was the same portion I would've ordered two kid sized plates. I didn't even finish my spaghetti because it was over flavored and as for the fettuccine alfredo it lacked flavor and was a bit oily for my personal taste. Would I come back maybe, had I ever had better Italian food...yes. Sorry I really really love the friendly staff, but the food as for today just didn't do for my family and I. I was hoping for a 5 star Italian cuisine especially for the prices listed on the menu.
author: Tina L.

description:
Home... Best way I can described this place.
I've bragged before, I'll brag again, still one of the best & my favorite Italian Restaurants in SF. 

You can never go wrong with Bruschetta, but when it's made with fresh Ingredients, and the skill behind the kitchen that is Mona Lisa, it's simply Perfection!!!!
author: Bruce W.

description:
Thee Best Italian I have ever had!  Little Italy in San Fran is a must when ur roaming around CT (Chinatown)

so the 1st time we came here, we heard thru a recommendation from a spice place nearby, as we were trying 2 find the best Italian restaurant 2 go 2 n thanks 2 him.. we found this place!  thank u thank u!

that 1st time we went, I had the salmon risotto in cream sauce; it was like HEAVEN!  man, y don't we have this in Seattle?!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! yeah, it was that serious.. my wife had a gnocchi dish n she fell absolutely in love!!!

the day after our 1st visit, we went back n shared a pizza, I believe it was Calabrese which had oregano, sausage w/ full flavors of tomato n garlic, we may have added prosciutto.. it was really good!

everything is good

so many items 4 each form of pasta, just countless good stuff! on their menu

this 3rd time we went, we went 4 lunch n we shared a Calzone al Forno; it was the best calzone I had in my whole life.. definitely different from the American calzone, as it was softer like a pastry crust filled w/ fresh Italian tomato sauce that teamed up w/ fresh mozzarella 2 soak in2 the stuffed prosciutto that gave the eater something that will eject them out of their seat n out of this world because it was so good.. the only complaint will b if the inside was hot, since it was sitting @ the chef's counter 4 a little bit n cooled off

the service is consistently good

this place has a lot of photos of famous ppl who came here such as any1 from Derek Jeter 2 Martin Yan.. it is just that good since 1979! n the decor I bet has looked the same since then

just the Best Italian, @ least on the West Coast.. that I can say
author: Johnny L.

description:
This review is for the most amazing Gnocchi I have had in a very long time! My husband and I live in Fremont and drive in to the city, just to have this Gnocchi. We have even ordered it on take-out and reheated it a few hours later. It was still AMAZING! Light, melt in your mouth, gnocchi! We've tried all the different sauces they have to offer and they are all yummy! The Pesto, the gorgonzola, and even the Gnocchi Sorrentina (the tomato sauce based gnocchi) is great! The staff are friendly and the atmosphere is fun. 
Thank you Ristorante Mona Lisa!
author: Rachel M.

description: Came 2 days in a row. Although it's a busy place, they seated us quickly both days. Cesar salad is delicious, the pasta is fabulous. Service is exceptional. Every table is good. Make this a place to come when in San Francisco.
author: Trina T.

description: Just arrived late in the day and we started looking for somewhere to eat. Simply this place was great! The only real complaint? The place is tiny, I kept getting bumped by people walking by. Mad the foolish mistake of trying another Italian restaurant  ( wanted to try something else ) and that was an epic fail.
author: Chuck T.

description:
First off: this is absolutely NOT a place for a quick dinner. But if you're looking to spend a whole evening with good food and good wine, it's perfect.  

I mostly only had wine (of which there's a good selection), but I did steal some bites from others in my party, and it was all delicious. I'd love to come back when I have more room to eat!
author: Sarah F.

description: Amazing food, staff and atmosphere! The food is authentic, delicious and fresh. Great wine list too!
author: Casandra H.

description: Nice little Italian spot on Columbus Ave. One of the waiters was outside and talked me into dining with them. I had the standard green salad to start with and it was very tasty. For my entree I had eggplant parm. It's not the fried eggplant medallions you tend to see with this dish. Rather, fresh thin sliced eggplant served among lots of tasty cheese and red sauce. I also ordered a side of spaghetti to go with it. Very good meal and nice authentic service.
author: Carly C.

description: The restaurant had great service, and a cool, busy atmosphere. The food, however was disappointing. Both pasta dishes we ordered were "starchy" and heavy. Disappointing, especially for a North Beach Restaurant.
author: Michael A.

description:
Great service and atmosphere!
We both had spaghetti and it was amazing !
Healthy wine pour!
author: Sharon P.

description: As many reviewers say, the service sucks!  Very slow and not very friendly.  The food is below average in quality and some items like the shell fish are not very fresh. Prices are way too high for this sort of quality and experience.  You can do much better elsewhere.
author: Barry F.

description: Seriously everything I desire in a night out on the town with food and drink was fulfilled tonight. Outdoor ambiance, excellent wine and the most amazing lasagna. All next to my husband. Thank you!
author: Dana C.

description:
So the reason why we came to this place was because we had a gift certificate so here's what happen:
-first we are San Francisco natives and we do not usually go to your so called tourist spots. 
-second, we just came back from Italy where food was incredible.
- lastly, we thought that it was not going to be good so not high expectations.

What we found out was that the food was pretty good! Service was awesome as we sat in the front and although we felt like tourists, it still felt good and that we found a good Italian restaurant in north beach!

Mauritzio was awesome as he invited us so he can take pictures inside the infamous Mona Lisa car. He was gracious as he told us that he was from Calabria and we were just there near the Amalfi Coast in positano.
My wife had fruti de mare and I had spaghetti con fuglio and it was really good. He also gave us a free limoncello desert which was also good. 

Bottom line is you should try it before you judge it. Judge for yourself! We will come back!!!
author: Rick A.

description: I ordered food through GrubHub and they completely screwed my order. I really mean that, the order came completely wrong. I called there to complain and the guy on the phone said that they don't read all the details of your order when you order online. Then he said he couldn't do anything to help me since the food was already delivered. Then came the best part: he hang up the phone on my face. THE GUY HANG UP THE PHONE ON MY FACE. I tried to call there several times and they did not pick my call. Fortunately GrubHub could help me and gave some credits for my next order.
author: Rafael F.

description: Cannot say enough good things about our dinner at Mona Lisa last night. We were wandering the street looking for some good Italian but were paralyzed by choices. The atmosphere of this place really sold us. Dim lighting, funky decor, and very cozy. The food we had was classic and phenomenal. We tried an Italian sampler, bruschetta was truly fantastic and split spaghetti and meatballs. The presentation really sold the whole meal. Nice, weighty glasses and dinnerware made it a treat to eat here. We shared food and not only were our pastas split loving on two plates, but the tiramisu we ordered to go was in two small boxes!! (Also intensely delicious, by the way). I really loved the big, thick wine glasses (with an extremely heavy pour!) and the fact that the by the glass wine options were simple but delicious. Will definitely be back next time I'm in town.
author: Christin J.

description:
Our first experience here was phenomenal. It quickly became a family favorite. My wife ordered a pasta with truffles, daughter; fettuccini Alfredo, son; pasta w/ olive oil and I ordered some type of risotto if memory serves correctly. 

Since that first trip, we've ordered more or less the same thing, however I've ventures into some of the pizzas which I've been slightly less impressed with and my wife has ordered the spaghetti carbonara which she likes usually but here was a little less than impressed as it was a little sauce heavy. 

Having said all that, service is consistently great. Greeters and servers are friendly, warm and helpful. We will likely be back again, but we will most likely stick with offerings we've already enjoyed there.
author: Jarred D.

description: So happy I found some good Italian food! After a few disappointments, I stumbled by Mona Lisa. The chicken parmigiana was outstanding, their marinara has excellent flavor and the chicken was very flavorful and juicy. It typically comes with vegetables/potatoes but I substituted pasta and it was amazing.The service was alright-- not terrible but not personable or friendly. They're open pretty late too, 11 pm on Weekdays!
author: Victoria E.

description:
I brought my family (of 9) from out of town here for my graduation dinner. 
I made reservations (yep, they take reservations) two days before and was stuck in traffic on the way there and had to call to change the time. They had no problem accommodating to us! 

We arrived and ordered appetizers, a bottle of wine, and while we waited for our food, we were given a complimentary beautiful appetizer platter, which was SO delicious and must have cost $50 alone! 

Our service was great and the check was way cheaper than expected! 

Mona Lisa was an amazing place to dine for my grad dinner.

The all around environment couldn't have been any better.

I will definitely be coming back and will be sharing my experience with all!
author: Stephanie D.

description: That's probably one of the best Italian restaurant i ever been to. The owner is very funny the service is great but the best part is the food. I ate in different Italian restaurants in San Francisco but this one is special. I started with a typical Italian antipasti very fresh and tasty, as main course i had lasagna it was plenty of meat and cheeses i can still taste it in my mouth. The best meal i had in San Francisco. Thank you Mauricio.
author: Wasef B.

description: Incredibly delicious food...everyone in my party enjoyed their homemade pasta meals. Service was a little slow and bathrooms could stand some updating and attention. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Nikole R.

description:
I rarely write 1 star reviews but unfortunately this restaurant deserves it. It took an hour for them to bring our appetizer salad, and then another 30 for our entrées. Other parties ordered, ate, and left before we got our food. Two pastas. I mean seriously. I brought up the issue with our waiter and got no apology.
They need to learn what customer service is.
author: Ryan R.

description:
The food was genuine. The service was kind. The atmosphere was fun. We went to little Italy with intentions of going to a closet sized restaurant a few doors down. We expected they would be too full so we merrily went on our way looking for another gem. We found one in Mona Lisa. The place was charming, warm, relaxed and delicious. There are other spots to eat nearby that would compare closely but if you haven't already give Mona Lisa a chit. You'll be glad you did. 

I got the pizze de luxe. It would feed two easily.
author: Nate S.

description: This used to be my favorite restaurant.  Came to SF 10 years.  Last year a service problem but tried again this year.  No more coming here!!! Monday night and even had reservation.  We were put at a table and half an hour later still sat there with no waiter.  When I finally got a waiter to stop he said no no we to busy!  So we got up and left!  No one even stopped us!  Went across the street and had great service and food!
author: Linda M.

description:
This is my second time going to Mona Lisa in the last 2 weeks, that says a lot. Hands down, best Gnocchi (4 Cheese) I have had, the kind that just melts in your mouth with flavor, the main reason I came back. 

Second time around was just as amazing. I recommend sitting outside, as you get to people watch at the same time as enjoy spectacular food, with exceptional service provided by Robert. 

If you want  Italian (Sicilian made - which is the best), Mona Lisa is the place to stop. Trust me, I eat, ALOT!
author: Cameron B.

description: Probably this is my favorite Italian food restaurant in San Francisco I just love their seafood pasta with white wine sauce , I been here so many times and is always a good experience, give it a try .
author: Alex A.

description: It's an excellent restaurant. Their foods are wonderful! They have fabulous deco and service is good. Highly recommend this Italian restaurant.
author: Fang L.

description:
HIGHLIGHT of my trip to SF! 

We had a large group (14) who couldn't agree on where to eat. Thankfully my fiancés cousin wanted to dine at Mona Lisa because one of his buddies who knows the owner highly recommended it. Loving Italian food I went along with it and as did everyone else.

We were greeted and seated promptly. Our server was extremely attentive and guided us thru the menu. We were served delicious complimentary appetizers. Such a nice gesture from the owner. My food was to die for. LOVE LOVE LOVE the amazing sauce they use for the Lobster Ravioli. My food was excellent and I was extremely satisfied. Didn't feel bloated afterwards, it was light, yet fulfilling. Everyone was content with their selections as the portions. 

It's difficult to dine with such a big group and satisfy everyone, they nailed it! 

Afterwards we took pictures with the Mona Lisa vehicle - such a touristy thing to do but we LOVED it. Will definitely return and try more items.
author: Zuly V.

description: This establishment is THEE reason we come to San Francisco. The family that owns this fills the restaurant with love. The waiters are sweethearts, and care beyond all needs. PLEASE try out the Mona Lisa. We are always treated like family. Love them all so much! OH and the food, is INCREDIBLE!!!
author: Lauren B.

description: I would give this place 5 stars for food quality but the service tends to be hit or miss so for this review four stars it is. We have been here several times and this trip to San Francisco came just for Mona Lisa food.  Had a reservation without issues. Great selection of food...one of our favorites is the lobster ravioli, but honestly everything is delicious.  Their bread is average.  Unfortunately our waiter forgot to put in our order and never came back to clear our plates after our appetizer or the salads.  Service does tend to be on the slower side usually so if you are in a rush you will have to keep onto of your waiter. The food always trumps the service and will always bring us back.  Of course we will be back again next time we are in town.
author: Corine M.

description:
The WORST SERVICE EVER! 

Our group of 14 people were bad treated 

The "waiter" C i r o is EXTREMELY : RUDE & ARROGANT!!!

We own a travel company and we don't intend to recommend or ever comeback to this place!!!

Watch out!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Mario C.

description: I have never written a yelp review before, but this was the worst service I can ever remember having. Bad food and wine didn't help. I don't want anyone else to waste their time here. Being in the industry, my expectations were  already really low for this place but they weren't as low as what I experienced. I thought I'd at least get a decent pizza and glass of prosecco - not the case.
author: Tara H.

description:
NORTH BEACH EATING PART VIII: SOUTHERN CUISINE - COLUMBUS DAY

I ate here at lunch today on Columbus Day. As my title stated I generalized the cuisine as southern cuisine. When I have been starting my North Beach adventure I would go to Italian restaurants trying to find specialized, regional cuisines. One of the major problems of trying to categorize the regional cuisine of the restaurant is the extensive menu. There are so many items on the list I was worried about the quality of each dish. In addition I couldn't what in the menu what the regional cuisine of this restaurant; the only reason I stated southern cuisine of this restaurant was because it stated on the Yelp information. Having quick lunch I needed to just one item, but I wasn't sure what item to ordered. It was either Fettuccine Mona Lisa or a risotto dish. I asked the waiter his recommendation about the risotto. He asked if I liked meat or seafood. I was thinking about the seafood. He went down the list to pick certain items. In the end I decided to order the Fettuccine Mona Lisa for one reason. In the past if a certain restaurant names a dish after its own restaurant name I'm assuming the dish is its specialty. That's why I ordered the Fettuccine Mona Lisa. 

As mentioned before one of the reasons why this menu was confusing was because I couldn't tell what is their specialty. There are several items named after the restaurant (Fettuccine Mona Lisa, Chicken Mona Lisa, Pizza Mona Lisa, and Veal Mona Lisa). There are also dishes named after the City (Spaghetti San Francisco, Chicken San Francisco, and Risotto San Francisco). Since this restaurant is on North Beach why doesn't the restaurant name some of the dishes after North Beach? Lol.

Now back to my only dish, which is the Fettuccine Mona Lisa. Two great things about this pasta is that the pasta is cooked al denta and the sauce is creamy but not heavy. One thing I didn't like about this pasta is it was quite salty due to the olives. Since the olives are cured having the olives with the ham makes dish quite salty. I would recommend either having the olives or ham alone in the pasta but not both. With abundance of items on the menu I feared that this dish would not maintain its quality. Other than the olives the pasta was quite tasty. 

Even though I only had the Fettuccine Mona Lisa today, I've eaten here before. The last time I ate here was about 10 years ago. I don't think the menu has remained the same but what I remembered was that the menu was very extensive that made it intimidating. What I ordered last time was the salmon, but there were so many different dishes of salmon I couldn't remember what I ordered. However I do remember the salmon was dry and overcooked. The fear of having too many items is some of the dishes won't be as good. Even though I've only eaten here twice in the last ten years my rating is based upon two items - a tasty Fettuccine Mona Lisa and a dry salmon. In a sense my rating is based on one word - consistency. With too many dishes consistency is hard to achieve. I feel if the restaurant cuts more than half of the dishes in the current menu I believe the quality of the food will be much better and consistency will be better achieved.
author: Gerald R.

description: My boyfriend and I got amazing service and amazing food here. We reserved the car outside and were served. Everyone working there was so welcoming, we felt like family. The owner is a great man who made our night very enjoyable with the recommendations and constantly checking in! We loved this and will remember it forever.
author: Nazaneen G.

description: Love this place!! Maurizio is the best owner and treats every customer like an old friend! The food is incredible and the service is outstanding. Best pizza for the best deal. Go to Mona Lisa and request and Josh and Dino as your server!
author: Megan M.

description: Love this restaurant, its in my neighborhood North Beach, and always have a great time there, with the great food, ambience and Mauricio the owner, is just the best and he  goes out of his way to make sure we have a really nice time there.  I originally come from New Zealand and when I have out of town guests from New Zealand come I take them there as  they love it so much too.  Cheers/Grazie Mauricio!
author: Polly X.

description:
Food is great, service is wonderful and Maurizio?...... Is number ONE!!!
A special place to spend a night in good company. Great atmosphere!
author: Erica S.

description: I've been eating here for years when I come to San Francisco. Mauricio the owner is always so hospitable and the food is absolutely amazing. Being married into an Italian family, I'm picky about Italian food and this is one restaurant I can't wait to get to. Personally, my favorites are the bruschetta and cheeses as an appetizer, I'm a chicken parmigiana fan and this is hands down amazing with the substituted penne instead of the roasted potatoes and spinach, although those are great too! The desserts won't disappoint. I'm baffled that the star level isn't at least 4 stars here. You won't be disappointed. Buon appetit
author: Chad M.

description:
I'm in Frisco a lot with work,  but when here at Mona Lisa, I feel like I'm back east at a family reunion.  Great service that goes well beyond keeping your water & wine glass full. 

I have never had a meal there I would not recommend.  They are all delicious and modestly priced for SF.  

Maurizio is your host and genuinely welcomes all. If you can speak some Italian, you will find yourself having a great time chuckling up with the Maurizio and the staff as they truly enjoy hosting patrons with a jovial graciousness rarely seen.

The Pastas here are renown and the veal dishes are superb. For something lighter, my personal favorite if I am not quite up for a big meal is the Antipasto Misto ($19.95).  It is a very well presented platter (see my pics) of thinly sliced meats (prosciutto crudo, salame and soppressata), olives, cheeses and peppers.  It makes for a meal in itself and goes so well on the front patio with a favorite glass of wine.
author: Kevin T.

description: Ambience = A....Squid ink risotto = A. They don't skimp on the expensive squid ink and it's amazingly flavorful!
author: Vanessa G.

description:
From the moment we walked in we felt this place was special. If there were a checklist for great service, this place could check off all the points. Fast? Check. Personable/ attentive waitstaff? Check. Incredible food? Check.  The atmosphere was awesome on a Saturday night, it was busy and bustling but we still were tended too frequently!
Highly recommend this place. And try the tiramisu!
author: Scott H.

description:
Don't quite know why everyone is bashing on the restaurant so much. The staff was friendly and provided good service. Food was cooked well and quite tasty. Desert was good but was not cooked fresh since it was frozen. I would reccomend you check it out if you like Italian food. 

Remember! Tony bennet went here so it must be good!
author: Andrew T.

description: One of my girlfriends and I spent a day in the city and decided on some Italian food. We came across this place. It's definitely filled with character and culture. It's a cute spot for a date, candle lit dinner. The staff was very friendly! We ordered some pasta and cioppino and couple glasses off wine, but with that they threw in a free appetizer in the beginning and free dessert in the end! The appetizer was what seemed to be a sampler of cheeses and meats. Very good! The dessert was some type of ice cream which was also good! That is what I call great hospitality. Little gestures like this definitely makes guests want to come back! So thank you! Great food and very authentic.
author: Dina J.

description: Long list of menu, so be prepared for that. The calamari wasn't hot, big in portion and was "meh". My fork was dirty. Overcooked pasta. Decent flavors though...
author: Kevin L.

description: Looking for a great traditional Italian restaurant, look no further. Amazing food and service
author: Paul V.

description: The ONLY reason this place gets 4 stars is because of the food and the atmosphere. As most reviews state, the service is awful. Even the owner was laughing at his not so friendly slow server telling him to hurry up and that he is lazy. Not professional, but pretty damn funny. I had the chicken a magio, which was a chicken breast filled with ham and mozzarella cheese with a tomato sauce. It was absolutely delicious. My bf had the seafood pasta, which is what I usually always get  when I go to place like this in the bay, But I had it the night prior in Oakland. It's a good life, yes I do know this! I recommend the food, not the service
author: Laurie R.

description: This place is my absolute favorite place to eat in all of SF! This is not the place if you are watching calories. Everything here is sinfully decadent and worth every cent. I highly suggest the gnocchi personally. Between all the people we have taken to eat there we have tried most things on the menu and not had a bad meal. I also suggest the tiramisu with a little Port...mind changing.
author: Amy P.

description:
We were dying to get out of a horrible cab experience and literally hopped out onto a corner and yelped a nearby place.
