We attempted to pop into a few other places, but none of the menus had something we could agree to (my guy, once he gets "chicken parm sandwich" on the brain, is in tunnel-vision). So - he wanted chicken parm and I was craving seafood (this IS San Francisco, afterall). 

We ended up at Mona Lisa - our server sat us outside in the little corner table - super squishy (I was literally sitting in a bush) - the table was super small and didnt have enough room for bread plates, bread, waters, our drinks, etc etc. I had my wallet and phone resting on the table (I dont carry a purse), but had to move them to my lap once the wine came.

The server took forever to take our order and the food took three times that long to arrive (or, maybe we were just starving) - regardless, it was worth the wait. We swallowed our meals practically whole (again, starving). My guy ordered the chicken parm (of course) and they were kind enough to throw a handful of spaghetti on my guys plate at his request - it came with lots of sauce and the chicken seemed tender. I, to satisfy my seafood craving, went with the super expensive Cioppino - it was $32 - for LUNCH. It came as a mountain of seafood in a tomato broth. I literally forced myself to eat every last tentacle in there... a) because of the price and b) because, starving.

The food, in my taste, was a bit too salty - I was dehydrated a bit any way, so maybe it just stood out a bit more than usual. Also - true to SF fashion, the bread is sourdough - we arent huge fans (but it IS delicious dipped in cioppino broth).

For an $80 lunch (yep. Literally - one glass of wine, two beers, a chicken parm plate and cioppino), I'd probably expect a bit more, but it satisfied everything we needed to refuel and carry on with the rest of our walking tour of the City.
author: Heather H.

description:
My boyfriend and I are on vacation here from Austin, Texas and stumbled upon a whole neighborhood of Italian restaurants. We looked at the menu outside and a group outside told us that the food was amazing and that we had to try the mini calzones. We decided to give it a try. 
We were seated by a very friendly man whom I pretty much assume is the owner. He was great! Asked us if we spoked Italian. We don't but he did! Fantastic! 
The place is very decorated. It's very busy decor but almost cozy. Fun to look at. Real table clothes, gas lamps, bread and water in funky bottles as soon as you sit down. Awesome. 
Biggest complaint? Service. 
We waited 5-10 min to be greeted by our server. It wasn't busy. I heard the two servers talking about what tables to take. They were the only one on as far as I could tell before dinner rush actually started. 
The appetizer we got was ice cold. The waiter took them back and then told us that they were out of it so we got the mini calzones. Which were great. 
Main course was okay. My boyfriend loved his NY strip that he got. Although it was a little more done than what he asked for.  I got the chicken parmigiana and was so disappointed.  The chicken was tiny and tough and it cost $22.95!!!! 
My boyfriend wanted another beer and had to ask twice to get one. I asked for another glass of wine and never got it. The waiter was not attentive at all. Forgetful? Preoccupied? I could tell he was in the weeds but come on. Ask for some help from your co workers! 
Overall I paid $127 to treat my boyfriend to a birthday dinner that we will mostly remember by the terrible service of our waiter. :(
author: Amanda R.

description:
The good: open late on Thanksgiving
The bad: the food. We had the De Luxe pizza and the arugula salad. How can someone screw up pizza this bad (especially in SF). The crust/dough was pathetic... As for the salad it was just old.
The so-so: The service. I withhold judgement since it was late on Thanksgiving.
author: Paul R.

description:
My family and I visited San Francisco, Monday last week and we decided to take the boys to a nice Italian place for their birthday dinner.

The Mona Lisa won it in spades! 
The decor and ambiance made it seem like something right out of a movie, I half expected to look over and see Robert DeNiro and Joe Pesce eating at a table.

We were warmly greeted and seated almost immediately, the service was great, Matteo was our server an he was happy to answer our menu questions and had great wine reccomendations. 

When Matteo learned it was our boys' birthdays,  he made them feel special, we felt like we were getting the VIP treatment.

The food, the food was amazing, some of the best Italian cuisine I've ever had. 

We know where were going for dinner next time we travel up to San Francisco!
author: R B.

description:
Awful. The owner was outside and invited us in so we tried it. As soon as we sat down we considered leaving and I wish we had. First off..it's got tv's everywhere and weird nightclub lights on the ceiling. Not the least bit romantic. 

Expect to pay $40 dollars for sparkling wine but don't expect them to pour it or an ice bucket to keep it cold. Expect bad bread. Don't expect parmesan or black pepper. Expect to have to go up to the owner himself and complain because the staff are awful. It's a joke. The owner is a moron. More interested in acting the big fella than running the floor or training the staff.
author: David L.

description: Awesome service and authentic food. Had a great lunch with 5 friends siting outside and people watching. Could find a place to make that work anywhere else. Been coming here a long timr
author: Ian C.

description:
We used to be regulars at Mona Lisa but a lot has changed.  Service, as described on just about every review site, is terrible but I thought it would still be worth it.  For example, they brought the appetizer when we were all nearly finished with our main courses. Water was never refilled.  The waiter seemed determined to never make eye contact.

The most annoying part was the tinny AM rock music (albeit Italian) blaring from overhead speakers making conversation almost impossible.  It did not contribute to a comfortable dining ambience at all.  As we were leaving I approached the  manager (or the short man running around table-to-table acting as such), and mentioned that we were long time customers and I wanted to share some feedback.  He immediately said "Yeah, I know.  The service was bad.  Ha ha."  I said I wanted to comment on the music not the service. I was told in a gruff sarcastic tone that "It's Italian.  What do you want?  Sophia Loren?"  Kind of an odd thing to say.  

The food was okay but not stellar.  The waiter forgot to give us our leftovers to go.  There are so many places to eat in North Beach.  Sadly, we won't be going back to Mona Lisa.
author: Bette S.

description:
The food here is delectable
Their pasta and appetizers are rich and delicious.

Perfect ambience.

My grand daughter loves their bread.
author: Michael B.

description:
Went here with a group of family (7 total, 2 kids) for a birthday dinner for my wife in SF. The menu is huge, so plan on pouring over it for awhile. Most of the meals we got were good, and the prices are reasonable. We had some bruschetta to start, and the tomatoes were incredible (even in late Dec) - but only four small pieces of bread for $10. Only one meal was unsatisfactory - the pesto gnocchi  was really not very good - the pesto was very funky and woody tasting, drowned in olive oil, and lacking any of the balance of a good pesto (I don't think there was any parmesean cheese in it at all). I had the 4 cheese gnocchi and it was very good, although not surprisingly very rich. Most of the other meals were were good - average to above average - and also reasonably priced. 

There weren't many good options for the kids. One of them got a pizza made for a large adult (lots of leftovers) - I had a slice, and it was just OK - the crust was a bit soft for my taste. The other kid got a small plate of penne and marinara which was good.  The wine list was long, but not overwhelming.

Service was a little spotty, and I see others have complained about it on here. I understand that a good Italian meal is meant to be savored over the course of several hours - but we spent alot of time waiting around in a relatively empty restaurant (we were there at 5:00, before the dinner rush). Just getting the bill after the plates were cleared took another 10-15 minutes.

They have a huge menu, so there's probably something for everyone here.
author: Rob N.

description: The owner was hilarious and accommodating--very friendly. Our server Josh was one of the best servers I've ever had.  I'm a server myself and was legitimately impressed by him. He was kind, funny, and informative.  The food was equally as good as the service. This is absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in North Beach, I 100% recommend this place.
author: Bennett E.

description:
Old school Italian in North Beach. It was a warm day on my visit and the restaurant didn't seem to have any AC, so I opted for a table outside where it was pretty pleasant on the sidewalk. I'm sure the inside would have been nice at dinner. 

I can't knock the server; he was working his tail off and did very well.

My lasagna seemed like they prepared it by layering the noodles and cheese in a small dish, covering it with a ton of sauce, and leaving it to blast in the broiler. While that wasn't what I was expecting, the sauce was excellent and I scooped up the excess with the bread.

Overall, Mona Lisa didn't blow me away, but they did enough stuff right that I'd go back to eat there again.
author: John D.

description: Outstanding food and service. Haven't had Italian food this good since my trip to Florence last summer (and my waiter just happened to be from Firenze). This is authentic old world Italian!!
author: Neil M.

description: Coming here was such a pleasant experience! My partner and I were wandering around North Beach and were drawn to the restaurant because of how charming and classy it looked on the inside. As we were browsing the restaurant menu outside, one of the waiters stepped out to invite us in and told us about an appetizer special they were having, which immediately made us feel welcome. The staff was incredibly polite and attentive. And the food was awesome. I definitely recommend the lobster ravioli (I forget the Italian name on the menu) because it was by far the best I've ever had. This is a place I would love to come back to!
author: Charlie S.

description:
Such a beautiful restaurant for our anniversary dinner!  My boyfriend got lots of points for bringing me here as a surprise.  

We were seated in the back of the restaurant where it was quieter and more intimate.  Our server was extremely knowledgeable as he had worked there many years.  He knew exactly what to recommend for the perfect wine pairing with our meal and when the first glass didn't suit, he promptly and gladly made a second recommendation which suited us more.  

I had the Spaghetti allo Scoglio - 19.95 with white wine sauce with shrimps, clams, mussels and calamari and he had the Fettuccine alla Pescatore - 19.95 with
tomato sauce, prawns, calamari, mussels, clams calamari tentacles and garlic.  Both of us were very pleased with our meal, the service, the romantic atmosphere and the entire experience.  

I look forward to coming back to this restaurant for another lovely and memorable evening.
author: Lisa G.

description:
Stumbled upon this quaint Italian restaurant.

The freshest Crostini I've ever had on the house! 

Ordered the Fettuccine Leonardo & it was deeelish! 

Definitely fresh ingredients & great customer service! 

This place needs more stars
author: Pam V.

description: The place has some great food we tried the steak, chicken and sea food and it was all amazing with their Italian touch. The place is good for families or for a date or for anything actually. Mauricio the owner is a very funny guy and he's always taking care of the customers, the staff did a great job as well. Next time and every time i'm here i'll go to that place for sure. Check out Mauricio's car it's one of a kind.
author: Mason Z.

description:
Most people wouldn't review dessert first, but I've thought about the Limoncello dessert every day. http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=_x8nOsxHyV-rb68HQPflfg&userid=Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w That's not the point, but it is the catch. It all started when I tried to find a place on Columbus and as much as I wanted to try a new spot, we chose Mona Lisa.

I said I'd been there, but it was at least 6 years.  I hoped for the best and let him order. He went with the antipasta (salumi and cheese with caprese and olives) . http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=QiYcY6qAaJEzbpExMBpHbg&userid=Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w

The Crab Ravoli is just as good as it looks, Crab is my favorite and this is great. . http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=DJYLQzvpzDTe5Eu6wgu92g&userid=Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w 

As soon as I saw the Limoncello thing, it was on. Destiny in a champagne glass filled with frozen whipped creme, frozen sorbet and limoncello. At the bottom, I realized I was buzzed and that was the best dessert I've had in awhile.

I was pleased, but the night didn't stop there. ;)
author: Rebekah T.

description: The BEST prices in town for the BEST pasta!  True Italian, period,  Homemade pasta and sauces. Not a plastic, ultramodern place.... Not Nob Hill, but a real genuine Italian eatery like New York's Little Italy, or a bistro in Rome!
author: Pat H.

description: Walked in just before closing, but they were nice enough to invite us to eat. We had a group of 5 and service was great. I, unfortunately, forgot an item in the restaurant, but I am hopeful I can grab it when they open today. The gnocchi tasted light, soft, and fluffy just like my grandmother and I make. It was like eating our homemade food without all the hand rolling tedium. I will be sure to visit here again when I return to San Francisco! Grazie mille!
author: Adria T.

description: Great food!! Outstanding service!! It's a must when we are in the City! Waiters and owner are awesome people and will do anything to please your dinner/lunch experience!!
author: Einer L.

description: My son and I used to live above this restaurant. The owner is the most amazing and sincere person I have ever met. Almost everyday he cheerfully greeted us as we walked out of our home and took a special interest in my autistic son who adored him. Everyday he'd give my son a new Italian word to learn.  So greatly inspired were we by this man, that we wrote a book about a crab visiting the Mona Lisa. As for the food, it is the best in all North Beach without question, doubt or argument.  There is a reason why everybody famous eats there.....
author: Mike M.

description:
We came here with a large party on a Saturday night because no other restaurant would take our party of eight in North Beach. We put our name in with the owner, and he didn't take down our name but guaranteed that we would be seated within a reasonable timeframe and to check back in at the time he told us. We checked back in and sure enough, he got us seated right away!

The place was very Italian mafia like, and I loved the feel and ambiance of the restaurant. The service was really slow, but then again the restaurant was packed! We had to ask our waiter several times for just the bread. We were starving!  The menu is a bit overwhelming, but I'm sure there is something for everyone! We ordered the gnocchi and the Fettucine Mona Lisa. I honestly don't remember which gnocchi I ordered, so to me, that means that the dish was just not that memorable; however, the Fettucine Mona Lisa was amazing! The sauce was awesome, and I'm sure any of the Fettucine dishes are on par. I would definitely recommend this entrée, and how could you not since this may be a signature dish with the restaurant name in the title!

Thank you for seating us on such short notice and large party! Very accommodating.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Save the cost of flights to Italy and just eat here. Nuff said. The owner is hard core, bad azz Italian and the servers are adorable. Food is Michelin 5-stars. Wine is delicioso. As Nike says... fill in the rest.
author: Monica M.

description:
So I'd give this place 4 stars for their service and 2 stars for their food, hence meeting in the middle at 3.

Service: We were seated immediately and when we complained of the cold, they immediately closed the window/door. They also overloaded our table with freebies and big, generous pours. We were given a free plate of bruschetta and tiramisu ice cream!

Food: I ordered the rigatoni with artichoke and truffle oil and it was just very, very bland. I couldn't finish my plate because it was just like eating empty carbs :(. I really wanted to like my dish though! My friend ordered the porcini ravioli and I helped her finish that since it was much better than mine, but it wasn't spectacular. There was definitely a lot more cream than necessary.

Also, just a note that this place is very kitschy inside and is a tourist trap. Plenty of other good eats in North Beach so I'd give this restaurant a pass in the future.
author: Christina C.

description: This place was fantastic.  I found it on yelp while searching the neighborhood for something yummy.  I had to order the pizza because as a Sicilian that is my favorite go to food.  It was so fantastic.  They brought out a meat and cheese tray before the meal and it was totally worth it.  Be advised drinks are a little over priced and when I say drinks I mean coke and sprite.  But the food is worth every penny so I stuck with water because soda changes the flavor of the food.  My kiddo ordered the pizza too and she raved about it.  She's a really tough critic.  My other half ordered the lobster ravioli and he said is was to die for.  Worth every bite and he licked his plate clean, the sauce was yummy. Now I will be honest we were here about 3 months ago but I wanted to make sure that I got my update on here.  Can't wait to visit again.
author: Keli R.

description: Moricio the manager is awesome our waiter was Roberto awesome absolutely the best Italian restaurant me and my  wife have eaten at . She is a vegetarian and they had about 25 things to choose from. They all speak Italian to each other that was cool . No canoli but that is my only thumb down
author: Chow W.

description: We chose this restaurant because they had plenty of gluten free options for my friend I was with. The restaurant has a very authentic feel with all of the workers greeting you in Italian and the ambiance of the place. Great bread to start off with, they even gave us a free (huge) appetizer on the house! The margherita pizza was so good, but I could only finish half. My friend devoured her gluten free pasta. Lovely staff, delicious food!
author: Taylor H.

description:
Cozy, ( read close quarters!) but comfy, we had a table by the window, so we can people watch,  everyone out strolling  around North Beach on a Saturday evening.   
Our waiter was pleasant, and my dinner good.  What I liked best, was the huge selection of pasta, because that's my fav.
The only issue, if I had to point one out, would be their desserts,  I would have like to have seen a smaller, but "house made" selection.  All in all, I was happy to have my pasta, and a great table by a window, with a street view!
author: Winny S.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend a while back to celebrate our anniversary. It took a while to get our food, but not to the point where it was irritating us. We tried the four-cheese gnocchi which was so good! We also got a calzone, which I've never had before and it was good. 
Customer service is kinda bad. My boyfriend sensed the workers there were talking about us in Italian and it's kinda obvious I guess, since we were practically the only ones there at the time...

Food is really good though, but I'm not sure when I'll be coming back here.
author: Eden G.

description: This place was the total package! May come off as touristy, but don't let that discourage you from enjoying some of the best pasta your taste buds will ever experience. Great staff, friendly and very welcoming. Owner walks around taking Italian, it's a fun experience. Good for both family and romantic nights out. The TORTELLINI AI QUATTRO FORMAGGIO and FETTUCCINE LEONARDO were amazing. Both creamy and full of flavor. In a sea of Italian restaurants this place really stands out! Molto Buono!
author: Sarah D.

description: I've been coming here for over six years to enjoy their delicious pasta arrabbiata. It is one of my favorite places in town for pasta arrabbiata. They are always very accommodating with my vegetarian diet. The waiters are very friendly and very Italian!!
author: Rey R.

description: Some of the best Italian food that I've had in a long time. Get the fettuccine primavera and you will not be disappointed. The restaurant owners/ staff are mostly Sicilian and are very knowledgeable about the menu. Pro tip- come here on a Sunday afternoon even if it is a little chilly out. I snagged a table on the sidewalk patio with my dog and they turned on the outside heaters, it was toasty in no time. Plus there's the awesome view of the Roman Catholic Archbishop.
author: Nasreen S.

description:
Just alright, decent food.  When we came, the place was ridiculously packed.  I mean, I felt like we were sitting elbow to elbow at our tables.  

The hostess at the front was super friendly...and had an awesome memory.  She didn't miss a step when figuring out who was next for a table.

Anyhoo, we had ordered a bottle of wine.  Apparently, they were out so the server literally ran to the other restaurant in their chain to grab one.  He ran back to us, cracked open the bottle, and it was delicious.  

The food...wasn't as great.  I ordered the spaghetti bolognese...doesn't get any simpler than that.  It was alright...we went home and made it ourselves the next day.  Much better when it's made at home...

The sampler was pretty good though.  It came with a melted garlic cheese thing (Sicilian candy), bruschetta, and caprese.  Haha.  

3 stars...but I probably won't be back.
author: Jen W.

description: Great Italian.  This is another automatic stop every time I'm in San Francisco.  Right in the heart of Little Italy on Columbus Ave.  Beautiful interior design and decoration too.
author: Tom B.

description:
This place deserves 2 stars... The waiter was in a rush to take our order, we understand your busy but I hate to feel rushed about what I order.. It meatballs were AMAZING, sauce was perfect. I got the Fettuccine w/ shrimp a little blah but the shrimp was good, Sauce was not too flavorful.. Cant complaint about the wine either considering you just poor it out of the bottle. 2 stars 1 for the meatballs and 1 for the wine! 

However when it came time to pay the bill, I told the waiter to split the check w/ my co worker, he said he had it and understood.  WRONG...He got it all wrong, And I know that it only takes a matter of seconds to fix an incorrect bill. He tried to explain to us that he could not. If a customer tells you to split the bill due to OUR company policy because I'm using my corporate card you need to be considerate and take the time to change it. Talk about customer service!  He did not want to change the check which was very unprofessional of him to say he could not do it and we explained we needed done for our company.. The night was ending so it was not that busy where he could not take the time to fix our bill...
author: Frenchie B.

description:
Service is terrible. Rushed us. Told us they were busy so they could not answer our questions and I can't tell you about the food yet cause it's still not here!!! The people behind us already have our food and we've been waiting so long we pulled the cards out and started playing games. My water cup had been empty so long I drank all other people at my tables water. Service = -10 hopefully this food is good. 

Oh also... No bread refills:( we are wanting to ask the next table for there's... Cause the bread actually is really good! There's a plus!!

Okay our food did come and it was okay. Pasta was good but chicken was not so good. The chicken sage dish had Wayyy to much sage! Food I'll give a 3
author: Tara B.

description:
Decent place to get Italian food with a huge menu selections. Can be overwhelming when looking at menu.  Love the decoration and the vibe at this place. I ordered:

- Antipasto Misto: mix of prosciutto crudo, salame, cheeses, olives and soppressata.

-Ravioli Aragosta (lobster) with tomato cream sauce.

-Spaghetti allo Scoglio: white wine sauce with shrimps, clams, mussels and calamari.

Everything tasted alright to me but nothing scream out spectacular. The service was friendly so that is always a plus.
author: Owie N.

description:
Salmon Carpaccio is only big slices of salmon with few onion rings and small capers. No oil, no balsamic. Bruschetta is the same quality - old tomatoes and old leaves of basil. I called  Italian owner of restaurant, he was not happy to know that his food is too far from Italian style. He told me - Look to my small  eyes, I am Chinese. It was bad joke, I don't like racists. We did not eat more, pay and leaved this place.

I can't write comment here and I answer you in my review.
Thank you for your comment, hope my review will help you work better.
We visited your restaurant 02.23 around 5pm. I was with my friend Susanna. We travel a lot, and I visited Italy few times in the year. So I love this country and know taste of Italian food. I am sorry I did not make photos. Wish to your personal respect guests more.
author: Karina P.

description: Great service. The majority of the people working and eating spoke Italian, which was a great indicator of how good the food was. Pizza and pasta was amazing.
author: Nick K.

description: Well, the wine was great! Unfortunately that's the only positive thing I have to say. We waited 20 minutes for drinks, and an hour and a half for our food to come out. My husband's wasn't the warmest, and my food was cold. I hate sending dishes back, but my chicken was just too cold to enjoy. Definitely over priced as well.
author: Hailey D.

description:
Wow!

We happened to come upon this spot and were thrilled that we did.  Food was spot on, piping hot, freshly made and served with great service.  The interior was also lovely. We were not disappointed!
author: C. B.

description: Great service. Kind environment! I always enjoy going in and feeling like I am in someone's home. One of my favorite places in SF.
author: Rachael D.

description: Decent food, but terrible service. Our waitress brought us an expensive dish we didn't order, and the manager refused to take it off our bill. We ended up giving it to the waitress since we didn't want it, but we were still charged for it! Don't come here-- we won't be coming back.
author: Julia F.

description:
Mona Lisa in the flesh of flavors!!! While traveling to this area I really wanted some real traditional Italian food.  This place really hit the spot! The staff greeted us in Italian and we had a place to sit right away during lunch.  It was so romantic :) the eye candy made it a great dining experience as well haha! 
Now to the food! We had free bread, oil, and vinegar 

Fettuccine alla Piero - 20.95
light cream sauce, with shrimps and asparagus

So good!!!!! I mean really really good!!! It was served hot, fresh, and full of flavor! 

The waiter was very tentative to the table and that accent! haha! 

 I liked the oil and vinegar so much I bought some from the market next door! I had to have a to go box and even brought it all the way back to SD the next day to eat or lunch! 

Traditional, Romantic, Unique, and Enjoyable! What does that spell! TRUE Review!
author: Connie G.

description:
Every time I go here, I have a delicious, fabulous experience!  The owner always greats me with "Bona sera, Bella!" and a kiss on each cheek!  Whether it's just me and my husband, or me and 18 of my closest female friends, the service is always impeccable, food scrumptous, and ambiance delightful!!!

I HIGHLY recommend the Ravioli al Quattro Formaggio, which is creamy with nutty hints of parmesan and smokey wafts of gorgonzola.  For those who, like me, want more protein on their dish, I aways ask them to add chicken, which they cook up in the sauce to perfection, so it's never dry!  For those who REALLY like to guild the lily, ask them to throw in some pancetta or prosciutto as well...mmmm, deliciosa!!!!!

Also delicious are the Chicken Saltimboca (which comes with tasty sauteed spinach and penne with red sauce), the Veal Parmagianna (really, sooooo good!!!!!), and the Osso Bucco.  

For something lighter, I enjoy the Prosciutto pizza and the Caesar Salad.  Also, their antipasto platter is a true joy!!!

There are two things I DON'T recommend here:  the gnocchi in marinara sauce (for some reason, it always disappoints people), and the desserts aren't particularly special.  The coffee and drinks are fabulous, though!!

The service is always friendly, maybe a little flirty, always very accomodating!!!  My water glass is NEVER empty, and I never wait very long for my order to arrive at the table.

I've been coming here for years, and am happy to say that if anything, Mona Lisa Restaurant only gets better with age!!
author: Amy L.

description: Great restaurant. The food is well blended with the mixture of sauces and seafood. Delicate taste. Beautifully prepared and served. The staff is formal and well organized. Very polite. Not too easy on the wallet but its worth it. Seated and served within 15 mins
author: Julian G.

description: We ate at this place a few years ago which was our time in SF.. the food was awesome .. the staff was amazing ... loved all the decorations !! You won't be disappointed !!!!!
author: Christina Bella P.

description: What a friendly staff and a generous pour of chianti wine by the glass!  and the outdoor dining on the sidewalk is perfect for eating/drinking/people watching/relaxing while taking in the sites of this wonderful section of San Fran.  I will definitely go back.
author: Diana Y.

description: Amazing service!! Best Italian place in San Francisco! Food was great, owner is very kind and willing to serve, the price was average.
author: Daniela O.

description: Great fresh food. Went around 3 pm just me and my gf, waiter was nice and we had a great experience! Food was a little pricey, but it is SF.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Well, Valentine's Day is definitely not the day to eat here. So far, it's taken at least fifteen minutes to get water....just got it after 18 minutes.
I can overlook the long wait for the water since the wine was plentiful and food delish but would still avoid on Valentine's Day.
author: Allyson H.

description: Molto bene! We enjoyed the most delicious dinner. The bruschetta was amazing and the ravioli ai quattro formaggio was the most fabulous ravioli I've ever tasted.
author: Kyle B.

description: Best Italian cousine I had so far in San Francisco. I was actually walking for an early dinner in another restaurant, but saw the beautiful vintage car the restraint had set as additional table on the street and decided to stay. Risotto porcini wad excellent and highly recommended. The choice of lambrusco they suggest was at the right temperature and refreshing for hot afternoon.
author: Benjamin P.

description: Excellent service, warm inviting Italian decor and the best vegetarian lasagna I have ever had.  All meals come with complimentary fresh bread and the night we came they threw in toasted bread with olives and tomatoes.  Great place and cute too!
author: Megan K.

description:
We hesitated on coming here with the bad reviews. But we took a chance since our two other choices had 1+ hour wait. Are we glad we did. Not sure why the bad the reviews on the wait. We didn't have to wait long at all. 

The cioppino is to die for!  The caprese, pizza, aglio e olio, and lasagna were all good too. The Alfredo was just meh. We are definitely coming back here again.
author: Catherine N.

description: I researched on Yelp to find a good Italian restaurant in SF for our one night visit and my family was more than thrilled with this place! The ambiance is interesting and fun, our server was friendly, funny and very good with our son...and let's get to the food! It was delicious!!!!! Definitely recommend Mona Lisa Restaurant if you are looking for Italian in the city!!!!
author: Tiffany G.

description: Horrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrible Sevice!!!!!!!!! We had to get up and try to purchase our beverages. We left after 55 minutes waiting, it was a surprise birthday dinner and unfortunate that we had leave ..  I'll take my business Lee where!!!! FoeHunnid
author: Fabian G.

description:
I give this place a solid 4 stars. My friend and I were exploring North Beach and decided to dine at one of the many Italian restaurants we passed by. Mona Lisa gave us a vibe we didn't get from the other restaurants. Plus, they had a car outside which you could dine in.

Since it was such a beautiful day, we were seated outside so we could enjoy the weather and people watch. Split the lobster ravioli and the signature Mona Lisa pizza. I wasn't blown away with the pizza but it was still delicious. Loved the lobster ravioli though! I would have finished the entire dish if I hadn't had to share.

Extra brownie points:
-The server was extremely attentive, making sure we had clean plates, utensils, and our water was always full
-The table next to us had ordered a salad which came out twice, and our server decided to let us have it rather than having it go to waste. The dressing was yum!

I always question restaurants that are located on the big streets but Mona Lisa was delicious!
author: Christina Y.

description: This place is very authentic, the owner is always standing outside to greet the guests which is nice and welcoming. The decor is very Italian and they have great Italian music playing. The tables and chairs are on the old side but not a big deal for me. Our waiter was attentive but didn't smile very much but at least he was somewhat attentive. He brought us an appetizer to share on the house which was nice. I ordered the squid ink risotto and scallops and my husband had a pizza. The pizza was just ok but my risotto was amazing, the portion was big enough for 2 people to share. And it came with a lot of scallops, they were not stingy with the scallops. For alcoholic drinks they only have wine, nothing else. So if u want a any other type of alcoholic beverage you won't be able to get it. The kitchen and tables are basically in the same area and I can hear the Latino kitchen staff cursing up a storm in Spanish as if no one would ever understand them. The kitchen staff should be told to be more professional at work and not use profanity at work which is a family restaurant. We ordered dessert, the chocolate cream puffs which were so great. Thumbs up for the dessert!!! We ordered coffee as well but we never got offered refills. As soon as the coffee was delivered we got the check so we felt rushed and it was not very busy at the time. But I would definitely come back to Mona Lisa.
author: Dono L.

description: I can't say enough about this place... just come. Speak to Mauricio and you will have a smile on your face from the great conversation. Eat the food and your stomach will also be smiling. E stato una Bellissa serata :)
author: Emily K.

description: Just perfect! Mona Lisa was the first Italian restaurant I visited back in September 2015 when I was just arriving to SF. It was also the place I had my first date with my boyfriend and our first choice for spontaneous week day dinner dates. Since day one, the service has been amazing each and every time. The food is to die for! We recommend the Penne al Forno alla Calabrese for the main course and the Bruschettas for appetizer. The owner makes everyone feel like family and all the waiters are attentive and welcoming. Totally deserves a 5 star review and your visit!
author: Annette O.

description: Anytime I'm in SF (Go Giants!) I must stop here! By far the best Italian food I have EVER had! Authentic food, quality ingredients, great staff that is friendly. I have known the owner for many years and he always makes us feel like home! This is southern Italian food which means the flavors are bolder, more red sauces etc. the bruschetta is amazing! Fresh and great favors! I love my chicken parm even though it's not really Italian but it's awesome! I have been coming here since the late 90's and never had a bad meal! I always tell my friends to come here and they always thanks me for the great food suggestion! Keep up the great work! Yum!!!
author: michael b.

description: We have come here twice in a week. Both times were amazing. The food, ambiance and service by Josh was terrific. We will definitely be back!
author: Caroline R.

description:
I am a total foodie and I absolutely loved Mona Lisa! The service is impeccable from the moment you walk up and you're greeted by the owner, whom attempted to speak to us in Italian (which I absolutely loved) to the server that was extremely prompt and courteous. I also enjoyed the intimate atmosphere with eccentric decor and open kitchen to be able to watch the cooks prepare your food. They don't have food warmers, which is a refreshing change so your food will come as soon as it's prepared, hot and fresh!
I ordered the lobster ravioli and you could tell by the texture that the pasta is homemade and the lobster is fresh! The sauce was creamy and just the right amount of herbs. My husband had the Napoletana pizza and it was one of the best pizzas we've ever had. The crust was buttery and flaky. 
We enjoyed it so much that we went back another night before we left San Francisco and the owner actually recognized us as we walked up! He had an appetizer sent over to thank us for coming back again. The experience was even better the second time, if that was even possible! This restaurant feels like you're eating dinner with your family in Italy!
author: Alison F.

description: It was a great place to sit outside with great company. Kitchen is immaculate, restaurant is cute and warm. Staff is great and sweet. Pure Italian language in little Italy in north beach! Awesome trip
author: Catherine R.

description: I have been here multiple times. The waiters are often busy but friendly. The food itself never disappoints. I would suggest the lobster ravioli or the salmon with esparagus.
author: Miguel V.

description: Overly salty and burnt lasagna. We came here because the restaurant next door had a wait and we were starving. I ordered a lasagna becaise it's just something you can't go wrong with. But at Mona Lisa, apparently you can. I had two layers of pasta and the lasagna was topped with chunks of meaty sauce and burnt chunks of sauce and pasta. Out of hunger, I peeled all the burnt bits and ate it, and when I brought up the burnt lasagna chunks to the waiter, he simply said it's supposed to be that way because it was in the oven. Disappointing.
author: Patty D.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  I've been coming here since 2006 and the food is amazing and consistent. This being because Mauricio (owner) takes pride in his business, cuisine, and his employees. His Chef has been here since I have been coming. It's my birthday today and Mauicio hooked us up with appetizers on the house and on top of that let my fiance park in front of the restaurant where the wooden car is so she didn't have to look for parking on Columbus!!! Love the food, the homely feel and the service! I would give them 10 stars if I could. It never is is a problem to have a big party with all my kids and nieces an nephews there. I'm Sicilian and this is home in North Beach for me. Go eat, laugh, be loud, bring your kids and be merry!!! Bon appetito
author: J. M.

description: I had lunch there with my family and the waiter, who was angry for some reason I couldn't understand, kept cursing in Italian. Most of the customer  there do not speak Italian so cannot understand but if you understand it's not a very pleasant experience. Furthermore the food is average quality and very expensive.
author: Carlo B.

description: Stopped in for dessert. The tiramisu was excellent. It was moist and creamy. The staff was nice. The ambiance was nice, too.
author: Aaron G.

description: Everything here, from the service, to the food, to the ambiance is amazing. The owner greeted us at door on a Friday night and got us in ASAP. They have a great wine selection- I love the Pinot Grigio. I had the arugula salad with chicken and I'm just so bummed I didn't have more room in my stomach (thanks a lot delicious bread) My two friends also really enjoyed their meals. We all love here in San Francisco and are willing to fight the throngs of tourists to get to this gem. If you want authentic Italian, Mona Lisa is it.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Delicious! I ordered Salmon Piccata, which is not on the menu and it was made to perfection. My companion had Veal Marsala and it was also to perfection. The service is wonderful and the restaurant is quaint and comfortable. I will be back often.
author: Dawn W.

description: Service was suberb.  Enjoyed the fresh food.
author: Cheryl L.

description: Seven of us, 4 adults and 3 kids. went there for the first time for an early dinner after a day of being tourists.  Everyone really enjoyed their food. The service was impeccable, 5 stars. We never felt rushed. Our waiter made us feel like guests in his home. Three of us couldn't decide what to order and asked the Waiter for his opinion. Wow, were we glad we listened to his recommendations! Everything tasted fresh and authentic. I had the spaghetti and meat balls delicious, my wife had the bolognese which she thought was good but not as good as the meatballs. Overall great experience! 2 appetizers 2 bottles of wine 6 entrees $225, an excellent value and 3 of us couldn't even finish our meals, so we get leftovers too!
author: T S.

description: After over a year we're yet to find a decent Italian restaurant in SF. This definitely isn't it, but we never really thought it was going to be. It's a busy, quirky place in the middle of tourist-ville with a "stack em high, sell it cheap" approach. The pizza was a bit weird & doughy. Should've gone for pasta maybe? My mum was visiting from England & she enjoyed it I think (more the decor/atmosphere than the food though). It is what it is. Probably won't rush back.
author: Fi M.

description: Just finishing a late lunch. Hit it during happy hour so they served a complimentary appetizer that was splendid. Wine by the glass was fantastic. Then the lasagna arrived. Wonderful, very authentic. The staff and owner were funny and welcoming. I'm sad I live 500 miles away!!
author: Michael O.

description: For the better part of a decade, whenever I would visit my best friend living in San Francisco, I would pass this restaurant and remind myself that I had to "pop in there some day." Well that day was yesterday. My fiance and I had an impromptu dinner there last night after holding a fundraiser. Granted, I was hungry, but I ordered spaghetti with meat sauce and it was delicious! They introduced me to the wondrous world of calabrese peppers and you can feel the love and family camaraderie of the staff, customers, and owners. If there's anything you can get from this review, ask for calabrese peppers - which I happen to think are on the milder side of hot. Your tastebuds will thank you.
author: Angelica R.

description: I lived in San Francisco for 15 years from 1989-2004.  I even worked across the street from Mona Lisa for awhile, and I never got the opportunity to try the dining experience here.  Today, visiting on vacation with my family, that all changed, and I'm so grateful.  Having been here a week, we've had many interesting dining experiences.  On the last night of our vacation, I wanted to take our family (visiting from out of state) and local San Francisco guest to a place that would make our time here mean something.  Tonight, Mona Lisa delivered.  When I called for a reservation early in the day, I was greeted with kindness and positivity.  We walked in at 6:30 and we were greeted again with the same upbeat kindness as I experienced on the phone.  We were led to a beautiful and comfortable table and promptly offered drink and menu choices.  They then brought a complimentary antipasti platter, which was delightful.  I have to say, the experience was seamless.  From drinks to apps, to salad, to main course, I was so impressed with how well everything flowed.  I waited tables in this town for years, and I was touched to be in an establishment where pride in service and quality of food still mean something.  If we were just adults dining here, it would be easy.  But in addition to impressing us, they managed to delight and impress my two small children as well.  I had the gnocchi.  I'm so glad I saved half of it.  It was so good, I look forward to eating the other half for breakfast.  My family raved about how delicious everything was.  Even though we were totally full, we had to order a Tiramisu to share.  I'm so glad we did.  It was perfect like everything else.  As we were leaving, the owner was so kind, inviting us to visit again.  I was looking for the right place to completely make our last night in SF memorable, and from beginning to end, Mona Lisa delivered.  They are humble, elegant, fun, and delicious.  It will be a destination stop on every visit from now on.  Thanks Mona Lisa!  You keep my faith in the heart and soul of a city I truly love.  Great job.
author: Gabrielle W.

description: I am a happy first timer ! If you love Italian food and happen to be in SF please stop by here and don't waste your time trying anything else! There are very delicious entrees and a variety of selections ! Yes it is like little Italy in there and they have a cute vintage car outside that you can dine in & sight see if that's what your into ! I had the chicken parmigiana which was flavored just right. Many wines to choose from and a small selection of beers ( if wines not your thing ). Can't wait to come back & try more dishes !
author: Kristin S.

description: We walked down the Italian district in San Fransisco  we were looking for real Italian food as we walked down the street a restaurant owner walked out the front door saw us looking at the menu and put his arms around us and said I have a table left. We went in the place was packed and we were only looking for a drink but decided to have an appetizer we ordered the beef carpaccio  which was fantastic and the fact that it was a family owned place that had real Italian hospitality made the experience. 1st class place i will be back.
author: Paul F.

description: Camille's in Providence RI is five stars, so these guys get four. The spaghetti and meatballs were great, some nice Italian wines and good service. The food won't blow your mind, but it will fill you up, and the nifty decor and ambiance will make you happy. Can't ask for much more than that. We had some melon-wrapped-in-ham appetizers that were excellent.
author: Greg M.

description: Hands down my absolute FAVORITE place in little Italy!! The food is to die for and the service is amazing, they literally treated us like royalty. If you are in the area DO NOT SKIP this memorable gem!!! Also don't forget to take pictures with the antique car!!
author: Gianna N.

description: Better than Italy! I've traveled all over Italy, and my first bite of Fettichini ai gamberoni (fettichini alfredo with shrimp) and almost went to Italian heaven! The owner Maurizio made our party of 12 feel like we were in his home. The food all around was phenomenal and the service spectacular! Come here! Do not pass up this restaurant!
author: Jackie E.

description: I am so bad about not reviewing restaurants but this one I couldn't resist! Amazing!! I had the lasagna and my friend had the ravioli porcini and both were so good we ate every bite! Must try! Great service and wonderful atmosphere.
author: Orlala I.

description: I can't begin to say enough good things about this restaurant. This past Saturday I had made a reservation and we got there a few minutes early, but our table was 5-10 minutes delayed in turning over. As always, Mauricio, the restaurant owner came over greeted us and apologized for the delay. Upon sitting down, Mauricio provided our group with a complimentary appetizer sampler. The food and ambiance here are always on point and their waiters and waitresses are very friendly and knowledgeable. The food here is outta this world, healthy portions and easy to share with friends and family. This is my go to spot in Little Italy - above all else make sure to ask for the tiramisu for dessert. Mauricio - always a pleasure dining in one of my favorite restaurants in SF.
author: Teddy P.

description:
This was not my first trip to Mona Lisa, but it was definitely the most amazing. I've come here multiple times and the service has always been amazing. Today, I was with one of my best friends and the owner, Maurizio, offered to let us sit in the Fiat for dinner. At first I was hesitant, but it turned out to be amazing. 
They set the table, gave my friend and I glasses of wine, and we enjoyed the beautiful weather. 
For dinner, we started with the Calamari, and of course it was delicious. I had the Pollo Picata and my friend had the penne all a Vodka. We shared both and it was perfect. 
It's safe to say that I'll be coming to Mona Lisa frequently!

Grazie, Maurizio and all of the Mona Lisa Team!
author: Joanna T.

description: Great atmosphere and high energy place often with lots of tourists and family due to their fair price and decent food. The small car outside with Mona Lisa on the hood is a good touch. I had the basic margarita pizza and bolognese pasta which were both very tasty. If you are cluster phobic or don't like people walking all around you then this is not your place. When you are there, just relax, have a drink, and enjoy the food and your company!
author: Louis Z.

description: My son and I were visiting from Yokosuka Japan, when stumbled this quaint little restaurant. Maurizio treated us like we were a member of his family-- we were overwhelmed by the hospitality and personalized attention. The food was awesome and the best I had in a very long time. It was the last meal before our departure the next morning-- so the highlight of our week long trip. Will definitely recommend this place for great service and awesomely delicious food!!
author: Janine R.

description:
Came to Mona Lisa on Saturday to meet up with my friends.  Unlike other Italian restaurants in and around the block, this place had very little wait.  The decor was really nice but the seating was very cramped.

Had the spaghetti carbonara - pancetta, eggs and cheese for $13.95.  The portion size was acceptable; not large, not small either...but this dish was just unappetizing.  The pancetta bits tasted so salty and the pasta itself lacked any flavor.  My whole plate of pasta was sauceless and yet was really greasy.  I felt gross eating it after a few bites :(

Extremely slow service and not the most friendly either.  Our food came out 1.5 hrs after ordering, so we filled ourselves up with complimentary bread as we waited.  If you are in a hurry, this might not be the best place to go (we spent over 3 hours total for dinner!).
author: Veronica C.

description: A group of 4 of us ate here on a Saturday night. We made reservations, so did not have to wait for a table. The atmosphere was great-- Very cozy. The food was delicious!! The wine was awesome. Although our server was very busy, he did his best to not to keep us waiting long and checked in on us frequently. Will definitely be returning next time that we are in San Francisco!
author: Erika M.

description: Love love love this place! Great food, service, and ambiance.... we live in San Diego but this is a definite stop while in San Francisco!
author: Bernadette B.

description: The food was excellent with a great selection that you expect in Little Italy - very fresh mozzarella, delicious marinara sauce, really wonderful veal. The staff was very charming and Italian. The restaurant itself is not the cleanest or most up to date but the food more than compensated in my book.
author: John T.

description:
Last week I had friends/family in from Uruguay. They have travelled all over the world. While sightseeing, they requested "Italian" food in the city as thats one type of cuisine everyone agrees with.  Kids, vegetarians, older folks, etc... and thats what we had. There were 7 of us including 2 very tired young kids and a bay in a high chair and it was a fantastic experience.
They were attentive, friendly, food was fantastic. Entree recommendations were spot on!!!
There was plenty of food, fairly priced and an overall great feeling. We felt welcomed, not rushed. Would suggest this place anytime and I plan on revisiting when other guests arrive.
author: Karen G.

description: My fettuccine wasn't particularly special and the service was slow (I won't hold that against them, it seemed to be an off night for them on the whole). But the server was helpful and the ambiance was what you want from a North Beach Italian joint. The bruschetta was also quite tasty. It's a place I'll have to come back to to properly judge.
author: Ben W.

description: I had so much fun with my best friend here, and especially the first time when I took my boyfriend for a dinner date. Bt the way the staff are friendly! :)
author: Melissa C.

description:
My first time here - highly recommended by my local foodie freinds. Homemade pasta was soooo good. Sicilian candy aka over roasted garlic cloves - delicious. Suggest the Italian sampler : bruschetta - caprese - Sicilian candy.
Will be back.
author: Angelina S.

description: I have to tell you that this restaurant was amazing. The  food, staff, and the owner were top notch. It felt like home really, by far one of the best Italian restaurants that I have been to.
author: Anthony G.

description:
This place is really awesome. 
I came here with a girlfriend and everybody was very welcoming. We got a nice table and the server was pleasant and professional.
Great food and awesome service. I have been to Italy several times and am usually disappointed by Italian restaurants in SF. Mona Lisa was worth my time and money. I will definitely come back.
author: Akrem A.

description: Great service, great food and friendly/fun atmosphere in heart of San Francisco Little Italy.  I will definitely go back!
author: Jesse G.

description: Went here yesterday for the first time. Pretty awesome pesto tortellini. Can't really pronounce anything on the menu, so I ordered something that I could pronounce. Real good authentic Italian food though. Would definitely come back and recommend this place for anyone who likes pizza and pasta. There's so many different types of pasta vegetarian, seafood, meaty. Give it a shot, you won't be disappointed.
author: Miranda W.

description: Let's start off with saying the food isn't the problem. It's not terrible pizza but it took 40+ min for food. Then they totally forgot about us during the 40 min. After finishing our meal, I asked the owner for a check and his response was "who is your server?" How am I supposed to know that, and then he proceeded to do nothing so I had to track down a waiter to get me a check. As the owner, with all the photos you have around the restaurant showing yourself off, maybe work on your customer service.
author: Erika S.

description: The service was excellent and the staff was even more so. Bravo to my new favorite Italian restaurant!
author: Joie M.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend for our first Valentine's Dinner because my old roommate recommended it. We made reservations 3 months in advance because we were worried about the Vday rush. Luckily they seated us immediately next to the window even though we were an hour early. The seating was pretty cramped and the tables were so tiny that there was hardly any room for the bread and our two entrees. I think the decor was too cluttered so it was kind of distracting.

Other than that, this place is a definite must if you're a risotto-fiend like me, because they have at least 20 different selections to choose from on the menu. I gotta give them props on their menu because it was kind of hard to decide what you want cause the menu they show on yelp does not compare to the lengthy amount they actually offer at the restaurant.

I ended up getting the crab and asparagus risotto and boy was that plate larger than I was expecting. Still had enough to take home for leftovers! When it was served the food was still steaming hot, freshly cooked from the kitchen and was absolutely scrumptious. The risotto was mouthwatering and as soon as you take a bite, it's just heavenly because it had such a creamy consistency. Finished the night off with a cappuccino tartufo, which was a perfect end to the meal.

I highly recommend this place, because of the intimate ambiance, friendly staff, and the food is just too delicious to pass up!
author: Alexis A.

description:
My wife and I went here for dinner one day thinking it would be like a place we visited in New Orleans called Mona Lisa, that we loved. Unfortunately it was not. 

My wife ordered the chicken parmigiana dinner with penne pasta - the chicken was cooked perfect but the pasta was undercooked. I ordered the spaghetti bolognaise and I don't remember how it tasted... 

The host was very friendly, but our server was very pompous. Would probably never go back.

There are better places to eat if you're in North Beach.
author: Adrian P.

description:
We live across the Golden Gate so do not come into San Francisco often as with traffic it is 1 1/2 hours or so but when we do and we want authentic southern Italian Food as the paternal side of my family is from Calabria, we come to this ristorante. Mauricio treats us, and all customers, as family.  The photo with the Spaghetti allo Scoglio and also sometimes I have pasta only with Calamari with double the tentacles and I usually joke that there is more seafood than pasta. These dishes are better than many times I have had in Italia. Mauricio is  very generous as he sometimes and we are only 2 people, gives us on the house a of tower of antipasti, salmon(lox), fried calamari, mortadella, capicola, prosciutto, formaggi, olive, bruschetta etc. I tell him joking that we are so full to " take home the entrees" !!! So now I tell him he does not need give us anything but as he is a "Capa Tosta"---I can get away with saying this as I am half Calabrese/half Pugliese--instead of the Torre Calabrese only una Barchetta like the small boat in the Neapolitan song 'Santa Lucia".

When I am here I can close my eyes, Italian music in the background, Italian being spoken by waiters & the beautiful different plates of delicious Italian food being taken to the tables of customers make me feel like I am in Italia. The smiles on their faces indicates they love the food.

=============================================================
Per i turisti italiani nostalgici per l'Italia, all'interno con Mauricio, camerieri italiani, il cibo e l'ambiente, vi sentirete come se foste in Italia

Viviamo attraverso il Golden Gate, così non veniamo in San Francisco spesso come con traffico è 1 1/2 ore o giù di lì, ma quando lo facciamo e vogliamo autentico cibo italiano del sud come il lato paterno della mia famiglia dalla Calabria, arriviamo a questo ristorante. Mauricio tratta noi e tutti i clienti, come famiglia. La foto con Spaghetti allo Scoglio e anche a volte ho pasta solo con Calamari con doppia i tentacoli e ho solito scherzo che c'è più pesce che pasta. Questi piatti sono meglio di molte volte quanto ho avuto in Italia.   Mauricio è molto generoso come lui a volte e siamo solo 2 persone, ci dà sulla casa una torre di antipasti, salmon(lox), calamari fritti, mortadella, capicola, prosciutto, formaggi, olive, bruschette ecc. Li dico scherzando che siamo così pieni di " dar portare a casa l'entrées"!!! Così ora io gli dico che non ha bisogno darci nulla, ma come lui è una "Capa Tosta"----posso farla franca con questo dicendo come io sono metà Calabrese/mezza Pugliese -- anziché il Torre Calabrese solo una Barchetta come la piccola barca nella canzone napoletana ' Santa Lucia ".

Quando sono qui posso chiudere mio occhi, sottofondo musicale italiana, italiano, essendo parlata da camerieri & belle diverse tavole di delizioso cibo italiano prese ai tavoli di clienti mi fanno sentire come se fossi in Italia. Il sorriso sui loro volti indica che amano il cibo.
author: Mando R.

description: Such a great find! The decor was quirky and fun and the service was personal and so welcoming! We had pizza and calzones all around, but all the other food coming out looked fantastic and authentic.
author: Erika N.

description: Very good Italian food. Portion of salmon could be bigger. Truly enjoyed the atmosphere and the owner/Chef is very warm and hospitable. Delicious Cesar dressing paired with crisp fresh romaine and grated parmigiano cheese. I would definitely go back the next time I visit San Francisco!!!
author: Salpi P.

description:
Decent food, TERRIBLE service. 
PROS: The atmosphere was nice (decor, music, etc.). My husband loved his prosciutto calzone, and my friend liked his gnocchi pomodoro. You get complimentary bread, balsamic vinegar, and olive oil. 

CONS: The service! 
1. We went today around 1:30. It was not busy at all...one other group of 4 was there at that time. It got busier about 30 minutes after we had sat down. First, the restaurant was open for business, but the door was locked. We knocked, looked confused, and no one came to open the door for us. We finally got in because a customer came out of the restaurant. No one greeted us, and we were standing there for a few minutes before being seated. He told us from across the restaurant to sit anywhere. He could have at least come to the door where we were standing. Then during our meal, we saw the same "lock out" incident happen to a woman and her 2 children. They were locked out of the restaurant and her husband and friends were already at the table (I saw him flag her through the window to let her know where they were seated. The woman was knocking and waving through the glass window door, while the server was looking at her and made eye contact with her and blatantly IGNORED her! My husband got up and opened the door for her. 

2. It took about 30 minutes before we got our order taken. Additionally whenever we thanked the server for anything he brought us, we were ignored. My linguini tierra was just okay....not bad, but not great. I wouldn't order it again. I'd rather try something else.  

OVERALL, the food was not bad, but based on the service I would not come back here for a long time. I will try other restaurants in the area first. Too bad, because they have a large menu and their pizzas actually look quite good. I am curious to try one.....but the service was unwelcoming, and we felt uncomfortable (as if we were a burden to the server).
author: Ashley D.

description: All food was delicious!! My husbands chicken dish was bomb!  Tiramisu too die for and risotto with prawns almost too much to finish.  My dad's gnocchi were good but buried under the thick sauce.   Only reason for 3 stars was too crowded, perhaps a few less tables so patrons could move more freely and it would be a much more enjoyable experience
author: Alana M.

description:
Second time in 4 days. Here on Friday for our daughter's 18th. Great food, thanks Maurizio and Mario for making it so fun. In the city for college orientation so we stopped for dinner at Mona Lisa. Just as good as Friday. Bruschetta e deliziosa! 5+
Dorothy
author: Dorothy R.

description: Great food! We ate in the car! We were famous for a night. Lots of tourists took our picture. An experience of a lifetime.
author: Michael D.

description: My boyfriend and I came in for lunch yesterday. As we walked by, the Italian waiter and I'm assuming the owner/manager greeted us with smiles and lovely Italian accents (we are Jewish and Israeli so we are as warm and loving as Italians and appreciate the familia hospitality). We conversed back and forth for a minute before deciding to sit and eat. I wanted to order something that wasn't on the menu (gnocchi in fettuccini sauce with shaved truffle... I have a crazy truffle addiction lol) and they gladly accommodated which is always appreciated! My boyfriend got fettuccini pasta with fettuccini sauce, salmon, peas, and mushrooms. My boyfriend also ordered a glass of their house wine (not sure if it was Pinot Noir, Cab, or Merlot lol). The owner/manager also treated us with a plate of delicious assorted appetizers. Everything was exceptional...Including the service! We will DEFINITELY be coming back on our next San Fran trip :)
author: Pearl M.

description: Yummy yummy yummy!  This place is amazing.  We are only in town for 3 days but we will be back! There food is amazing and the owner is too!
author: Elisa R.

description:
We went here for my brothers birthday and had the best dinner here. I dont eat italian often because I have never been impressed, but this place turned me into a huge fan. The food was absolutley amazing, everything. The apppetizers, full course meals, and the wine was great. 

The service was out of this world. Greeted at the door and the waier made us feel like we were family. Finally gor the traditional italian experience to the best of my knowledge. I love this place and cant wait to come back. The food is awesome.
author: Diana M.

description: The fried calamari was on point! The margarita pizza in my opinion was a little too doughy. I was looking for something a little more thin crust but it was good nonetheless. But the crab pasta was the highlight of my meal. It was just perfect.
author: Kay Y.

description:
Never ever ever going back ! 

If I could I would give this place zero stars. It was the most disgusting meal I have ever tried. The sauce was so salty. My mouth hurt just after a few bites. On top of the nasty food the service was just pitiful. We waited 30 minutes for the waiter to take our order. And when I complained about their horrific excuse for Italian food they refused to take my plate off the bill. They did however offer to get me a new plate but you couldn't pay me to try another dish from there. So I left the restaurant hungry, pissed off and $19.95 +tax poorer.
author: Emily T.

description: Had another great dinner. Anytime we have the opportunity to come to the City we always make it a point to stop in at Mona Lisa. As always the food never disappoints. Had one of my all time favorites, the eggplant parmesan with ham and mozzarella, truly amazing.  The food is always presented beautifully and definitely generous portions. The staff is great, and the owner Mauricio is very personable and ensures everything is running smoothly. This is great Italian comfort food and will always be our #1 North Beach Spot!!
author: N G.

description:
I have recently discovered this fabulous place from a friend who goes here often. You can recognize the restaurant by the wooden vehicle out front (you can also enjoy your meal streetside if you want to by sitting in this car). There's a great ambiance to this place. The people are also extremely friendly and helpful. You are always greeted with great smiles and an uplifting vibe.

Now onto the good stuff....FOOD! Yes it is absolutely delicious! And for me to say that means a lot since I am a little picky when it comes to what I eat. You can tell everything is fresh. We have had the apps (they have a sampler of all the apps...it is 3 tiers of different appetizers if you can't decide) and I have had the veal...yum! I have also just gone for a glass of wine and am still welcomed as I'm enjoying a full course meal with am entire party. Some places rush you out if you aren't having a full meal and spending money, but not this place. Come in for a meal, snack or just a glass of wine. If it is nice out definitely try and sit outside. People watching is great in North Beach. Each experience I have had here supercedes the last. I'm sure I will be back here soon and often.
author: Belle B.

description:
Mauricio saw us walking past the Mona Lisa and invited us in!  That was a nice way to start dinner - feeling like "FAMILIA!"

It was nice to see olive oil and balsamic vinegar on our table to go with the bread, none of which is in short supply at Mona Lisa Restaurant.  We all drank water with our dinner, and it tasted good (filtered? Although I know SF gets Hetch Hetchy water, so it just might be great tasting anyway).

There are definitely enough choices on the menu to make anyone and everyone happy!  We had two adults, two teens, and two kids in our party.  Everyone was super pleased with their meals.  

We had spaghetti alla pescatore, fettuccini Alfredo, fettuccini with crab, two orders of spaghetti with meatballs, and finally an order of fettuccini Nero with calamari (squid ink in a white wine sauce).  That last one was for me and I was thrilled to see so many tentacles in my dish, not just the rings.  I mentioned loving the tentacles, and so our waiter hooked me up!  His name was Mario F., and he was simply an excellent waiter.  My daughter commented about how impeccably clean his long sleeves were!

The ambiance was fun, and there was definitely a lot to look at on the walls... Even a Mona Lisa that, um, forgot to cover her top half!
author: Carla J.

description: A group of us went here for a friend's birthday. Our waiter was very friendly. After winning him over a bit he even surprised us with a complimentary appetizer! The food was all delicious and the atmosphere was great. Definitely recommend
author: Alison T.

description:
An absolutely wonderful place to visit. We were in town for a birthday celebration and this restaurant made for the best birthday dinner we could have hoped for. I personally had some of the best authentic Italian food I have ever eaten. My BF wasnt quite as impressed with his dish, chicken marsala, but he still thought it was pretty good. Bruschetta was tasty as well. Had great wine selections. Service was wonderful. We sat outside and loved being able to people watch, although if you are hoping for a more intimate meal, the inside has a wonderful atmosphere as well. We felt like we were right in the heart of the city and the entire experience was truly magical. 

The price was what we expected for a good dinner in San Francisco, and we felt like it was completely worth every penny. Dinner came to a little over $100 for two, including wine. 

The only possible complaint was that we had called ahead for reservations and were told we couldn't get in until 10:30. We decided to go for a walk and look at their menu around 7:00, and the owner saw us outside and told us we could be seated right away. They definitely were not full. I would recommend just showing up unless it's a big holiday or something.
author: Amy R.

description: My husband and I went to Mona Lisa the last weekend and it was awesome! Food was incredible and service was great! We ended up having our meal in the little car they have in front and it was so much fun!
author: Gabi T.

description: da best italian food in da bay, hands down. gnocchi gorgonzola is to die for. I love the decor. The sicilian candy is a must order for appys. great for groups on weekends. my girls favorite spot in north beach
author: Josh R.

description:
I was raised in Italy and I know Italian food very well: my father is a chef and i myself like to cook. 

I went to this restaurant for Christmas eve with my friend because of the good reviews . The environment was very nice and warm but the food was really bad. We both ordered risotto with Porcini.  The rice was overcooked, there was no salt, and no taste at all. Porcini mushrooms were not good either and they tasted strange.

The service was really bad too. The waiters didn't listen to any customers. One of then poured the water all over the table while he was aiming to the glass and didn't do anything about it.

The owner come nearby me and poked me and told me to eat fast. I was horrified by the service. Normally, I do not like to make big deal out of anything at the restaurant so i left without saying anything.


Bottom line: I will never go back to this restaurant and i would not advice anyone to go there.
author: Ashish N.

description:
First and last time coming here. 

My friend and I came here on Saturday afternoon around 4 pm. There were only 4 other occupied tables in the restaurant. I had questions about the menu and also about tuna tomato sauce. When I asked our server about it he laughed at me, rude much? So I chose the salmone ravioli. Huge mistake! It was almost too fishy and salty to be edible. I was starving so I ate it trying not to gag with each bite. My friend ordered a fettichini style dish with asparagas and shrimp. Her dish was much better than mine. 

When we were finally done, I tried making eye contact and to flag down our waiter for our bill as it was never delivered to us. He never even acknowledged us. I put my card down on the table and still nothing. Finally after waiting over 15 minutes with our plates piled up on the table we were fed up and dropped cash on the table and walked out. 

On our way out the man at the door thanked us for coming in and I told him we would never be back. He acted shocked but at the same time like he didnt even care. 

If you get the server who looks like a horse (look at his teeth) BEWARE!
author: Chloe A.

description: Visiting in San Francisco - looking for some authentic Italian! found it at Mona Lisa's! Food was wonderful- we couldn't decide so we took the waiters recommendations- and he was spot on! Very attentive but not annoying- will definitely be back! I don't comment on places but this place was absolutely worth the effort!
author: Leisa M.

description: Hey Grace! I'm definitely willing to give the Mona Lisa another shot! I believe that I'd have a great experience as every business has it's down days. I heard about you guys through Yelp actually a group of my friends and I just decided to stop by and check out the Mona Lisa. Honestly I greatly appreciate that you took the time to yield to my response Grace, it really speaks volumes for you as a manager and your establishment! Hope to hear back from soon.
author: Daniel P.

description:
The plan was to walk through North Beach and find a neat little Italian restaurant for dinner. With a mini wooden Italian car parked outside and every inch of wall space inside covered in Italian paraphernalia, this place is definitely quirky and what we were looking for.

Despite the cramped seating, the service was great. The temp inside was insanely hot; halfway through the meal they finally turned the AC on. 

Although the bread came out cold and bland, the rest of the food was delicious. And the portions were just perfect, so four out of five cleaned their plates. Three types of ravioli were ordered; I thought it was cool that they were all different shapes. My chef friend was disappointed that the ravioli was not fresh made and was instead from the freezer (detectable by a tough freezer-burned piece). Interestingly, the menu only listed "homemade" next to a couple of the ravioli dishes (including mine). The sauces were tasty and I especially liked my "Ravioli ai Quattro Formaggi": creamy and rich. I added Italian sausage, which probably would have worked better in a red sauce, but I needed my meat.

Prices were pretty high, especially if some of the dishes are actually defrosted and served. Pasta is cheap and easy to make, so I don't really think the high prices are warranted.
author: Lindsay H.

description: Great dinner and customer sevice. We thought we were in italy. We will definitely dine @Mona lisa again
author: Karen W.

description: So great!! My family went for lunch and were extremely impressed by the authentic Italian feel with decorations, opera music in the background, and staff from Italy itself. The menu is incredibly long with tons of great choices and the food did not disappoint. The servers were so friendly and even chased me down the street when I forgot my purse! I highly recommend Mona Lisa.
author: Michaela S.

description:
Our party of 6 had the best time at the Mona Lisa last night! This is a great place for a group of friends to meet for excellent food and service, in a fun, inviting atmosphere. Mario our waiter was so patient, accommodating & fun! Because we got there early (6pm) the owner allowed us to park right in front of the restaurant! (Call ahead).
My gnocchi with shrimp in a tomato sauce was delicious and hot with plenty of shrimp. Everyone had a fantastic time. Some people sat outside at little tables sipping wine. They have a neat little vintage Fiat convertible parked outside.
author: Margery M.

description: Oh God,  that was good!  The spaghetti with sausage tastes like grandma is in the back making the sausage fresh.  Every bite is an explosion in your mouth!  You have to try the mix antipasto...  Yum!
author: Rick C.

description: The BEST gnocchi hands down. My family goes every year before Christmas and Mauricio always welcomes us. Great food, great service, great atmosphere. If you're looking for authentic Italian food, this is the place.
author: Nicole B.

description:
Been trying to contact the manager via email as well as at the restaurant. My father called and was told "the manager is never at the restaurant." 

If you need more reasons not to eat here - they are missing a toilet seat in the bathroom. 

Your choice.
author: Jennifer J.

description: They sat up pretty fast but 10 minutes later we still didn't have menus.... Finally our waiter came & took our order & 58 minutes later our food was still not ready... I asked our server about our food & after all this time he still had the nerve to tell me "oh is coming, please be patient"...... Definitely not patient at all when you have children with you..,,,needless to say our food was never served & I asked the server to please just pack our order to go. After waiting 1 hour & 15 minutes my children were hungry & tired........not acceptable at all..... they tried to accommodate us but obviously the kitchen wasn't able to keep up with the orders....., way, way too long of a wait when you have kids with you.
author: Addy Z.

description: Great food and great service!! Lovely group of guys! The atmosphere is as authentic at it comes. A must stop if you are in San Francisco.
author: H S.

description: By for the best Italian restaurant I ever been too. Food outstanding . The owner Mauricio know his food and customer service . I highly recommend.
author: A M.

description: OK guys just got to say took the family here for our annual Christmas gift to the family for lunch and a play it was our first time at the restaurant close friend of mine Dominic used to hang there a lot I got to say the food was outstanding the service was great fun restaurant excellent food we will definitely be back thank you very much for accommodating the nine of us we will see you guys soon thank you .again food was excellent.
