My daughter Jessica is a big foodie, like all of us.  she works in the industry and she couldn't say enough about the food and the restaurant so guys will be back soon look for us thank you again.
author: Kirk S.

description: Amazing service. Amazing people. Amazing food. If you come to San Francisco, come here.
author: Courtney D.

description:
1. LOVED eating in the Mona Lisa Car! But, you'll get A LOT of attention from people walking on street. 
2. Food was alright, pricey tho. 
3. Service was alright.
author: Cindy C.

description:
We brought our family of 8 here after the 5:00 Beach Blanket Babylon show on a Sunday. (Note: if you are going to BBB, make your reservation for 2 hours after the show start time). They were extremely crowded, yet did their best to seat all comers, and were very accommodating to us, even though we were 35 min early for our reservation. 

Once we were seated, the server was gracious and prompt, nothing like some of the reviews here. The owner also came over a couple of times - once while we were waiting, and once while we were eating, and also while we were waiting. Everyone who worked there was calm and hospitable. The first thing the server said when we sat down, after asking us if we had to wait a bit, was "I will do my best to make it up to you now". 

The food was delicious and plentiful - probably the best and most important part of the review!  We started with Calamari and Bruschetta, and then we each had either salads or pasta for our entrees. Everyone left happy and felt like it was a great North Beach experience- not easy to achieve on a cold, rainy, crowded holiday evening!
author: Laurie T.

description: The service was terrible. Plenty of time before responding to it. The food arrived cold. And the price is not justified
author: Yarden H.

description: After visiting Super Bowl city we took a cab to N.B. we were hungry and decided to stop into this place.  Mario was our waiter good service, we started off with some garlic bread, lots of garlic.  I had the chicken Parmigian and friend had the spaghetti both dishes were great
author: Ron S.

description:
The decorations are tacky and overwhelming.
The meat in my lasagne tasted like $1 Walmart meat.
The waiter was acting like he was better than everyone else.
author: Luna S.

description: Totally recommend the coppino (seafood stew ). Service was excellent. Penne San Fran was a solid choice. Seafood mixed grill was mixed reviews, swordfish a little dry. So. Get a bottle of wine, sit back and pick from massive menu.
author: Cindy K.

description:
We went to Mona Lisa on a recent trip to San Francisco. My husband and I had been once before and it had been very good. This time, however, it was quite marginal for me. I think the rest of my family liked it better than I did.

I ordered the Spaghetti Bolognese and it was WAY TOO SALTY!!! I could not eat it, so I asked the kitchen to add some cream sauce. They looked at me strangely, but did so and it was much better. I still did not enjoy it that much. I think I should have stayed with what I had previously, which was either the veal or chicken piccata.

The bread that came to the table was very good and so was my glass of wine, a Lambrusco. My mother in law enjoyed her food and my husband thought his chicken parmigiana was decent, although it had the same salty meat sauce.
author: Susan M.

description: This place is delicious and has a warm friendly atmosphere.  A definite favorite SF restaurant of ours.  Can't wait to go back.  Maurizio, the chef / owner, is a pleasure to talk with.   There's so many tasty options, I ordered the Chicken San Marino, YUMMY!  We don't usually order appetizers, but we got the bruschetta - amazing and the best I've ever had.  FYI - I don't like tomatoes, lol.  As for the dessert, we ordered one of each and my favorite was the Panna Cotta
author: D H.

description:
It is an interesting story and overall it does deserve 3.5 stars for our experience.
but i see the restaurant manager's effort to make things better this place deserve another chance but god knows when we can find it and i am not even sure that i will give another chance rather than trying new places since we live in midwest :)
But hope fully they will get consistency with the service and food at the same time..

Here is the story:
2 couple + 1 baby.
Late dinner (close to 10pm)
not much customers around. 
------------------
1st of all decor would be really impressing if they did not try to make the restaurant look like a touristic place. All the flags takes away from the beauty and authenticity from the restaurant.  
2-Food was good quality... Not saying amazing but good... 
I love the idea of open kitchen which was partially open so i can see the cooks on duty... 
We've got veggie lasagna, margherita pizza and four cheese ravioli, all of them was really good... 
3-The catch on this place is. at least for us.. waiter did not see us as a spending customer. We did not order any wine or any other expensive things. I do not wanna say he was rude but he was definitely on the edge of it.. He was not disrespectful but sometimes you feel it he can go to that direction really easy and quick. 
Since the service is the most important thing for me for a restaurant i would lean to give 3 stars according to my experience...

end of the story 
food was 3.75
atmosphere (could be 5 but 3.5)
service 3.25
author: Adnan O.

description: Recommended by a local, the minute we walked in we were treated like family. The food was so good, yummy and homemade. Highly recommend this place for genuine Italian food.
author: Denise V.

description: Amazing food, fast service, was seated and had food in our table within 15 minutes. Would recommend for anyone wanting real authentic Italian food!
author: Anthony P.

description:
Thank you for responding. I did not tell any of the staff of the bathroom because one of your male staff members came out of it before me. 

I am happy to hear the bathroom has been fixed though!
author: Nicole A.

description:
This was my first time here at the Mona Lisa. I went to dinner with a friend and she recommended we go here to eat so I was cool with it. My friend speaks Italian and was speaking Italian to one of the guys when we walked so I think the other waiters thought I could speak it too because they started speaking only Italian to us (but English to the other tables) so I felt a little lost and left out, BUT our waiter was very nice, he helped me pick something out from the menu to eat since I couldn't decide on anything. It took the food a little longer to come than the usual waiting time I thought, but I was busy catching up with a friend so I did not mind or really notice it much and I was starving so that helped. 

The overall experience was nice, it was warm and toasty inside, the food was good, and the service was good as well.
author: Jenai C.

description: Had an early dinner there on Sunday.  The food was just great and the wait staff was so nice to do separate checks, smiled, and chatted with us and made us all have a good time.  Shout outs to Marie and Jasper who were our food servers.  Will certainly go back any time I can.  Good place to eat after seeing BEACH BLANKET.
author: C.Michael T.

description:
I was having the most horrible birthday ever when my sister took me to North Beach. I stumbled on the Mona Lisa and decided to eat because of the friendly owner singing Italian out front. I loved it !!! I had a dish that was not on the menu of spaghetti noodles with prawns in a sauca rosa sauce. Which is a creamy version of red sauce. It was wonderful. 
I go back whenever I am there. I love Mona Lisa !!! 
K
author: Kristina M.

description: This place has a really interesting atmosphere. I had the pesto tortellini. It was delicious. They have a huge selection of risottos and a great selection of vegetarian pasta. I had a hard time deciding what to get, because I had so many options. The service is a bit on the slow side, but it was also 8pm on a Saturday night.
author: Ashley M.

description:
I don't ever write reviews and I'm never the one to complain, but the experience here was ridiculous. It was ridiculously loud, over crowded, had horrible service, the food was a struggle to eat because of it's extreme saltiness, had absurd rules on sharing dishes, expensive prices for awful food, and much much more. I never want to give a restaurant a bad rating, but this was too much. With the service telling us we were wrong and mistaking orders- it was an experience i truly regretted. It was a waste of my money and this one star is undeserved. 

There are many wonderful restaurants around and hopefully Mona Lisa will take these reviews into consideration and work on these issues in the future.
author: Nikki A.

description: In one word, exceptional. I've never had a better meal. Absolutely the best Italian restaurant in the Bay Area, hands down. This place should be on your "need to go" list when you visit San Fransisco.
author: Dixon F.

description:
I NEVER write reviews on Yelp, but for Mona Lisa, I had to. 

My friend and I just ate here tonight, and if you know how to cook a box of pasta and throw any red sauce on, dont come here. 

I am no chef and can cook better food than here. 

We got the Caprese salad. The tomatoes were flavorless, colorless beefsteak tomatoes and barely any basil. 

The pasta was under cooked and our De Luxe pizza was less than average.
author: Sumeet S.

description:
After trying many Italian restaurants, I keep coming back to Mona Lisa. Been here for the 4th time yesterday evening and can now officially announce Mona Lisa as THE BEST Italian restaurant in SF!

Not cheap, but justified by the food tastiness and quality.

Pasta - real al dente
Sauce - melts in mouth
Meats, poultry, seafood - perfect

Not sure about all unpleasant comments below... I never had (and hopefully never will) a bad experience at this place. Especially pay no attention to some indian dude, who wrote "the pasta was undercooked". That's what a real "al dente" pasta taste like - you idiot! 

Any ass can cook regular pasta at home...
author: Alex P.

description:
I came to Mona Lisa with a friend on my first night in San Francisco. We were seated outside at a cozy table for two (it would've almost been romantic if circumstances were different). Anyway, he ordered a salad and I ordered the prosciutto and melon and we shared a pizza. He enjoyed his salad. i enjoyed my prosciutto and melon and the pizza was eh. A little on the dry side but the prosciutto on top was yummy (can you tell I love the stuff?) 

Overall, dinner was ok, company was better (and better looking). Maybe next time I can try something else and my review might change.
author: Robin F.

description: Very very good place to have authentic Italian food in north beach! I had the appetizer with roasted garlic. Then for my entree I had chicken piccata with pesto. Very delicious.  Our server Maria was fantastic!
author: Jen S.

description: First time here & it was AMAZING!! The meatball appetizer was good! Best meatballs ever & the sauce is so fresh! The pescatore risotto was amazing and so was the porcini one!! Definitely coming back!
author: Emily Y.

description:
After exploring North Beach with the bf, we had a hankering for Italian and were drawn to the cute outdoor tables at Mona Lisa. 

The service really was impeccable, and exceeded our expectations. The host seated us immediately and water and bread was served shortly thereafter. We were just enjoying mulling over the extensive menu when our host walks by and apologizes for the wait. We hadn't even thought that we had waited a long time and were just enjoying the sunny day. Our waiter came a couple minutes later and again apologized for making us wait, even though we weren't inconvenienced and comped our appetizer for us, which was exceptional given the (lack of) circumstances.

The bruschetta was truly delicious. Tomatoes usually aren't very ripe in January but the tomato topping tasted fresh and flavorful. Our Diavola pizza had a nice, crispy/chewy crust and was scrumptious as well. Our glasses of wine were well-priced and impressive for "house wine". 

Again, the staff literally went above and beyond the call of duty during our meal. We hadn't noticed anything lacking, but they still made our experience memorable. We will be back the next time we want Italian in this neighborhood.
author: Liz G.

description:
Scary bad! I have to rate it one star because zero is not an option! Caesar salad: Made with mayonnaise as a base, or a REALLY cheap store bought dressing. Chicken San Francisco: Chicken drenched in salt topped with canned artichoke hearts. Gnocchi Fondenti: Think mashed potatoes and cheese. Also they are so proud of the wine by the glass that they don't list the brand and the won't let you taste it, is it still 1965?

Unfortunately we wasted a dinner in a wonderful food town like San Francisco. Please learn from our experience.
author: Fred M.

description: Great restaurant and people watching. Sit outside if you can, or even in their Fiat 600 if available!
author: Kat D.

description:
LOVED THIS PLACE. It's so good. My boyfriend & I ordered the pesto, fettuccini Alfredo & calamari as an appetizer. So so so good! The owner is really friendly & caring and the decor of the restaurant is so romantic & nice!
The reason why it's 4 stars & not 5 is because it took 40 minutes to get our food. I know we had an appetizer, but I mean c'mon, it doesn't take 40 minutes to make pasta and the restaurant wasn't even full.. But either way! I really liked this place & if I'm back in SF I'll go back :)
author: Jezabel C.

description: This place is amazing!!! The food and the atmosphere were fantastic! I love how all the staff spoke Italian, it made me feel like I was back in Italy. Definitely would recommend this place!
author: Kara R.

description: From The Olive Garden to Bucca and now I finally got a chance to eat at the Mona Lisa  Restaurant... Which was my very very first time eating at a Italian Restaurant in the Columbus Street area... I had a really good tasting Veal Parmigiana w/ Spinach and Potatoes which came out of the kitchen really nice and hot!!! Not only did, I have the Veal Parmigiana w/ spinach and potatoes... I also liked the sourdough bread as the appetizer...
author: William B.

description: Best Italian spot in North beach!!! Risotto is always perfect and the service is always charming.
author: Klint N.

description: Great Italian restaurant in the heart of North Beach San Francisco. I love all the decorations on the walls and the history. A bit pricey, but still worth it. There are a lot of Italian restaurants to compete with in North Beach, but they hold their own.
author: Peter K.

description: A group of us, 9 to be exact, spent a day at the treasure island flea market and decided to take a drive to North Beach.  We didn't have reservations anywhere and being such a large group I didn't think we would get in anywhere.  We happened upon the Mona Lisa and Marcello, was kind enough to move all of the outside tables to accommodation our group.  When we shared that one of our grandparents was from Calabria they hooked us up with 2 appetizer platters at no charge.  The platter had prosciutto bruschetta and cheese an olives...a perfect antipasto plate.  We also had the candy (roasted garlic) very tasty.  The service was very attentive and the food was good.  We had many different dishes and the seafood risotto was one of the favs.  It was interesting to see all of the negative comments around service.  We actually had 5 star service.
author: Margo J.

description:
I go here when I am in North Beach and want to sit outside and feel like I am in Italy watching people and listening to the people have a coffee and speak Italian. North Beach is known for Italian restaurants, but many of them are as authentic as The Olive Garden. Food-wise Mona Lisa isn't exactly what you'd find if you went to Rome ... but close enough where its a good place for Itali-o-philes can get their fix of Italy.

Sure, they have a young guy from Italy standing outside like a Carnival barker trying to get tourists in for lunch or dinner. He uses such cliches as 'We have an ah special -ah menu ... We made it ah just-a for you!' That usually defines a tourist trap. But here, it sort of works. I saw him pull in a few couples in Teva sandals and cargo shorts who flew into his web of Italian bravado salesmanship. In the long run they are lucky he got them and not a few of the places across the street who's food is blah.

The taste of the food is great here ... it isn't the freshest ingredients you'll find in North Beach (go to North Beach Restaurant for fresh) but it isn't the worst Italian food you'll have either (Colliseo across the street uses hamburger alone in their bolognese sauce). They do tend to load up with the cheese ... probably a little too heavy. But, the food here never tastes bland, which is the problem of many places on this street.

The outdoor tables are small and indoors is cramped and dark. But, I would say one of your best bets at getting a true North Beach Italian restaurant experience and getting good food as well would be Mona Lisa. Many Italian ex-patriots eat here (or at least sip coffee or wine on an outside table). More concerning is that I have noticed a few Italian ex-patriots eating subs from next door while drinking that wine and coffee at Mona Lisa. That may have something more to do with the tourist prices ($16.50 for a plate of pasta ... owch!) than the food quality. (I hope)

Over the past few visits, I have noticed that the portion sizes have gone down. Now a $16.50 plate of pasta comes in a big plate with a little bowl section in the middle. You essentially pay an entree price and get a first course serving. I always stick with the pastas although I have heard they do a good rissotto.

At first, the menu was a bit concerning ... usually any place that offers the same menu for dinner and lunch and offers no less than 40 different menu items like a cheesecake factory throws up a huge red flag to me. But, I have to admit, I've tried different things and they all came out pretty well.

Skip the overpriced desserts.

The biggest dissapointment here is they pour minescule amounts of wines and charge $9 per glass for the cheapest wine (chianti). If you are going to charge almost $17 for a small plate of pasta and $9 for a glass of wine, how about pouring it at least half full?

You could do better for Italian food ... but not in North Beach. Mona Lisa is a winner. Rosa Pistola probably has the best Italian food I've seen in North Beach ... but Mona Lisa is more comfort food and less gourmet.
author: E T.

description: This is a nice place with great decorations but it is quite cramped, you barely have any space to move between tables. Staff is nice and knowledgeable but service was slow, we had to ask for water a couple of times before they refilled our glasses. The food however is really good. The bread is tasty. I had the Fettuccine alla Pescatore: the pasta was cooked perfectly, the seafood was really fresh and the tomato sauce was light and full of flavor
author: Adriana M.

description: Mona Lisa love. Every time we come here we have an amazing time! The food is delicious and keeps us coming back. The love throughout the restaurant makes you feel a part of the family. We would give you a million stars if we could!
author: Han J.

description:
We had a wonderful experience at the Mona Lisa!!  We had a party of 18 people and they were more than happy to accommodate us!!  We had a family style dinner with appetizers and it seemed like the food kept coming.  The food was so yummy but my favorite was the eggplant parmigian.

The entire staff was so helpful and really took care of us.  Giovanni was especially attentive and was always making sure everything was good!  We were celebrating 4 birthdays in our family and he sang for each of us.  Mauricio was also especially helpful.

Thank you so much for a wonderful experience, excellent food and excellent service!!  Next time I'm in San Francisco, I will definitely come back!
author: Melissa R.

description:
I finally had a chance to visit Mona Lisa Restaurant for lunch.  I enjoyed the service and the ambiance very much.

  The food was so-so.  There was nothing that really stood out as an original inspiration--I had the  Rigatoni Alla Borrelli - 15.95
(baked rigatoni with sausage and eggplant in tomato meat sauce)
This was a bit tasteless even though it included sausage.  It was also oily.  The rigatoni did not taste homemade.  It was overcooked and looked like it could have been leftover from the day before.

The beef carpaccio that we started things off with was good--very true to its Italian roots with arugula, capers, lemon wedges and pecorino cheese.

Dining companions enjoyed the Gnocchi ai Quattro Formaggi - 14.95
(four cheese-cream sauce) and the pizza Calabrese - 13.95
(Garlic, tomatoes, oregano, sausage, cheese)
author: Thomas D.

description:
My favorite Italian restaurant in the world.

Owner was extremely nice and I felt very comfortable sitting down and eating.  Walked down Columbus ave and was personally invited in Italian to sit down and eat.

Wonderful cozy little spot.  San Fran has a leg up on the rest of the country with getting freshest food.  Great time here and I will visit again when I go back.
author: Jonathan G.

description: I go to Mona Lisa every time I want to have the best possible Italian experience in SF. It all starts with Maurizio greeting you at the door with some of his jokes, then if you sit outside you have a beautiful view on the heart of North Beach and if you're inside you're surrounded by all sorts of colorful decorations and pictures of the many international celebrities who have been there. The menu is great, you'll always find what you're craving for in there, and the food is fresh, tasty and authentic. My favorite dish is the risotto allo scoglio, a beautiful looking dish, perfectly cooked with amazing seafood. Maurizio will likely surprise you with complimentary appetizers and those are just amazing! Portions are abundant and you'll feel full but you have to try the tiramisu as well, probably the best I've ever had!
author: Massimo C.

description: While the host was fantastic (and the reason for the 3 stars), the food was mediocre at best. The house salad's "creamy italian dressing" tasted like it was made from Miracle Whip. The cannelloni was okay but the sauce was oily. The bread was very good and the olive and oil dip was good. Overall a bit over priced for the quality.
author: Kristina L.

description: all i have to say is the aldon smith is the best i like the spice it comes with. the owner of the place is a cool guy very funny. he even made us a special sauce for our bread which was good. small place with great food im not italian but i bet this is what italian food is suppose to taste like. 5 stars from me because everything was great the night i went.
author: Rigoberto C.

description: Was really looking forward to trying a new Italian spot in the city -as Bucca di Beppo is my usual go to place; however I am really disappointed from my experience the the Mona Lisa. Firstly, the wait was ridiculous; second; our waiter was terrible; and third: the food was disgusting. I got the Diabola Pizza and I'm not even kidding you -this stuff tastes like the kind of pizza you will find at a gas station. Couldn't tell if I was eating a cardboard box or a pizza. Definitely won't be back.
author: Kenny C.

description:
We searched for gluten free restaurants and this one came up. Once we got there, our waiter said we could order any pizza with gluten free crust and we could get any pasta with gluten free fusilli. I decided on the arugula salad and a side of sausage. One friend had the antipasto (lots of meat - great deal for the price) and another had the spinach salad (lots of walnuts) with a side of meatballs. The sausage and meatballs were both great! 

The inside of the restaurant is very neat. The ceilings are painted with murals and it is very colorful. It's in a great area of the city as well. Lots of places to walk around and see
author: Colleen L.

description: I've always liked Mona Lisa's and come every so often. But today they seemed to have a cockroach problem. The first one at my table, I was willing to let go. Food in a city, I'm sure things happen. But ten minutes later, one on the table next to me. In the daytime. I think I'll wait a while before coming back. Hopefully, they'll fix this problem soon.
author: Natalie T.

description:
Of all the Italian restaurants in North Beach I chose to come to Mona lisa on an early friday evening, prior to going to the Giants game. The restaurant itself is kinda small and very intimate, the main kitchen is in the front of the restaurant, so you can see and hear as the chefs make your food.

The menu is a little intense, there is a very large selection of pastas, pizza, seafood, chicken, and beef, I felt like I was reading an Almanac. I had a hard time deciding what I wanted but settled on the Ravioli al Quattro Formaggio (homemade ravioli in four cheese sauce) , Mona Lisa Pizza (Pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, peppers, cheese), and the Spaghetti and Meatballs (spaghetti and meatballs lol). 

The food didn't take too long to arrive, when it did at first my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach, my plate had only 6 raviolis and was sure it was not gonna fill me up. The raviolis were really delicious, the However as I continued to eat them I became both full and unable to handle the taste. As delicious as they are, they are very rich and cheesy, It'd be good to get this if you were sharing with someone. The pizza was thin crust, crispy, tasty sauce and full of flavor from the veggies and meat, One of the pizzas is a good portion size, good for 2 people. The spaghetti and meatballs were okay, I mean the dish itself is pretty standard, a good spaghetti isn't gonna wow me that much. Overall I was very pleased with the food here, definitely will be a place I come back to again.
author: Tony R.

description:
No joke, THE best Italian food I have ever had and I'm not even in Europe =) I came here with my boyfriend and our friend accidentally. We were originally trying to eat lunch at the restaurant next to this one, but that was closed. I was sucked in here because I love Mona Lisa and the Italian guy at the door greeting people. It was actually kind of embarrassing because we passed the guy at first then decided to eat there. Hah!

We walked in and the greeter asked us where we wanted to eat. As he was leading us towards our table, he said he liked me so he's going to give us free appetizers--- the freshest bruschetta bread!

I ordered the pasta with salmon, my boyfriend ordered alfredo, and our friend ordered chicken with potatoes and other delicious sides. We tried each other's entrees and they were all equally delicious! Like I said from the beginning....THE BEST Italian and pasta I have ever had so far.

Besides the food being amazing, the service was bad ass as well. Everyone there was helpful, friendly, and I loved when they would say "Grazi." The way they said it was so sincere and respectful =)

Basically, every time I visit San Francisco I will definitely make my way over to Little Italy!!!
author: Jorgess M.

description:
OUTSTANDING service, ambiance, and flavors. 

My husband had spaghetti with meatballs, I had the Gorgonzola tortellini with a glass of white zin. The spaghetti was the best we've ever had, and hubby *always* gets spaghetti & meatballs when we eat Italian so we had a lot to compare to. My tortellini was amazing but it was my bad for adding Parmesan cheese to my cheese tortellini which was covered in cheese sauce--a bit too salty for my taste. Next time I'll skip the Parm but we can't wait to go back and re-live the perfection. Bellissimo.
author: Ashley P.

description:
North Beach...with a throng of Italian restaurants to choose from, how do you know what's good?

On this particular evening, I let my eyes do the walking. I passed Mona Lisa Restaurant and looked through the open windows to see beautiful chandeliers and ornately painted ceilings. That was enough to pique my interest!

The menu looked to have the standard fare and the wait was only 10 min, so it was decided. When we were seated, the positioning of the table was not ideal; I was sitting in a high traffic area for the wait staff. But I pulled close to the table and made the best of it.

The wait staff were courteous and as attentive as they could be on a busy Saturday night. The kitchen really seemed slow and it took a while for us to get our food. I'm not sure if they were unorganized or if they were just slammed, but for a pasta dish the wait was longer than expected.

I ordered the Penne al Forno alla Calabrese, a baked penne with meat sauce, ham and mozzarella. It was piping hot when it arrived at the table, much to my pleasure. It was overall enjoyable, but nothing spectacular.

Overall, I think Mona Lisa is pretty standard Italian food. It was good, but didn't knock my socks off.

Perhaps next time I'll follow my nose!
author: Greg S.

description:
Best Italian dinner I've ever eaten outside of Italy- paired with the best atmosphere in all of San Francisco!!

We asked for outdoor seating and were served outside in a convertible Fiat 500!!! Had a wonderful time, GREAT service, amazing views of down town and a lovely night.

Thank you Ristorante Monalisa!
author: Kristopher K.

description:
I am a fan Of risotto this was the best risotto 
I had the Alfredo risotto DELICIOSO!!!
author: monica m.

description: I was brought here by a friend who is a regular at this spot and I can totally see why! The service is good, food is great and lots of options. I had the mixed seafood grill (the swordfish could have been a tad thicker as it was too dry once I got to it from the hot plate) and my friend had the penne with gorgonzola sauce and chicken. Passed on the wine and desserts as I am not a huge fan of alcohol or mid day sweets but aside from it having very small tables (for two) it was an amazing 1st experience. I would happily return.
author: Bella B.

description: One of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to! Took my out-of-town friends there and everyone was happy with the choice. Great service, great food, and awesome atmosphere. I'll definitely come back here again.
author: Shirley R.

description: When I think about the Mona Lisa Restaurant, I think of only great attributes. From the moment Maurizio, the owner, welcomed us with his thick Italian accent to his fare well, the service we received was impeccable. Our server, Joshua, was fantastic, engaging us in fun and interesting conversation, whilst keeping our stomachs happy. This authentic Italian restaurant is a must if you happen to be in San Francisco. It is one of the best I've ever had. I personally had the opportunity to try the gnocchi (delicious) and the meatballs (fantastic). All I can say is MANGIA! I will surely be returning the next time I am in San Francisco!
author: Neil S.

description: We booked the car parked out side the restaurant for my Wife's Bday and it was an awesome experience. Even the food was really good and staff was very friendly
author: Namit R.

description: Great food, wonderful atmosphere. Great service. Excellent experience. Parking in Little Italy can be a challenge sometimes but completely worth it.
author: Sarah B.

description:
5 years ago, my husband and I are in town for a marathon event.  We're wandering around North Beach trying to find a lunch spot, and wandered into Mona Lisa.  I knew it was a great place then because all the other tables were occupied by SF finest police officers.  

Fast forward to a few weeks ago, and we wandered in again. Service is over-the-top hand-kissing wonderful!  The menu has options for every palate, including mine, which leans vegetarian.

Okay, so back we go on Saturday after farmer's markets, errands, and other events and experience the same great service, delicious food, options for everyone, and a cappucino to finish the day.

It doesn't hurt that the servers are fantasy-worthy.   Yes.  I said it.
author: Ellen B.

description: First time here and  came with some friends for a late lunch.   Had a wonderful appetizer,  of bruschetta,  calamari,  and meat and cheese sampler - all of which were fantastic!  I ordered the pesto lasagna,  and  my  fiance had the chicken capranese.  I would recommend either.  Service was great there - all around a wonderful experience.
author: Mike J.

description: Outstanding food and service! The veal parmesan was terrific as well as the four cheese tortellini. A must try :)
author: Shawn J.

description:
Went to go to franchino next door but they were closed. Glad we came though! Their pasta fagoli was fantastic and we all had gnocchi which they have about 7 different kinds. Server was straight Italian but very nice and polite.

Recommend for some solid Italian!
author: Brian N.

description: Absolutely amazing! After living in Italy, this is as close to authentic Italian food as I've found in the states. I had the Arrabbiata and my momma has tortellini ticolli. Both were to die for!
author: Kacie C.

description: Great service, large portions, good food. Will be back for sure. The owner is very friendly!
author: Darcel T.

description: Amazing food, amazing service. We come here every time we are in San Francisco, the best Italian food in North Beach and beyond. Thanks Mauricio and staff!!
author: Kristy G.

description: Dinner last night was really fun and service was outstanding. Food was also great! Can taste fresh pasta and ingredients. Will definitely be back again.
author: Maria R.

description: Where else in SF can you be served in a convertible Fiat on Columbus St?! As a birthday surprise I reserved the Fiat Car, and the girl loved it. The food was great, and so was the staff. The owner Maurizio was great to meet, and he even stepped in as photographer so we could have pics of the great night. I'll be back here soon, because I can honestly say that for the complete experience, it was the best date money I've ever spent in SF.
author: Vinny V.

description: I was frantically trying to find a restaurant on a Friday night for our group. This place had a large menu so everyone found something they could enjoy. They have gluten free pizza and pasta! We got right in at 6:45 pm. Great service, great food.
author: Jayme G.

description: I love arrabiata sauce. Anywhere I go that has it, I try it. This place has hands down the best arrabiata sauce. It's got a great atmosphere. I will be back for sure.
author: Steven C.

description: Food is fantastic!!  Service was ok. Our sever was very nice but once once our food came he never came back to refill out drinks or check on us until we had finished our meal.  The came back to all the other tables around us but we felt ignored.
author: Gail W.

description: Don't go there. Extremely rude manager/owner. We made the mistake of looking at reviews at another reservation site and reserving the place. But one quick chat with the guy at the front who essentially said "I don't care if you have a reservation or not. We are busy, just wait" was enough to walk away.
author: Food C.

description: Had dinner in the car this past Friday night: cozy, romantic, and very attentive service. Great bruschetta and the salmon with garlic and herbs was spot on. The wine list was Italian focused and certainly matched the food well. Highly recommend to anyone looking for great food and a fun experience not to be forgotten. Thanks for a great evening!!
author: Alison M.

description: Horrible service. I walked in around 4:50. 25 minutes later, I hadn't received the glass of wine I ordered or any food. I got up and walked out. There was one waiter and about 7 tables. Totally unacceptable service.
author: John A.

description: I have stopped at this restaurant a couple times while in the city. I can say I have yet to have an issue with the food or service, everything that we have ordered has surpassed expectations! The gnocchi is phenomenal and made daily. The best Italian food I have had outside of Italy.
author: Stephanie C.

description: If I could give this place 10 stars I would. The food is outstanding ( lasagna and risotto are my fav), but you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu. Aside from the delicious food, the ambiance is better than any other establishment in the city. The service is great and Mauricio the owner is so sweet and always warmly greets folks at the door. Absolutely love it! Stop reading this review and go right now :)
author: Karen O.

description: Great food and best service in San Francisco. I Highly recommend a waiter named Josh, he was quick with our drinks and orders, and was always checking in for more. By far the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco, if your ever nearby I highly recommend a visit.
author: Brandon K.

description:
This is YOUR kinda place ~ if you like a heckling foul mouthed and rude owner who insults pedestrians and possible clients all in italian, along with his entourage of  jerk waiters. 

Food, as appealing as the food is, i ABSOLUTELY don't deal with rude.  Nothing is more unappetiziing.

So heres the scenario, I was really in the mood for some italian and seafood right off San Fran. I pulled up on the patio outside, unknowing of my company - ordered the spinach salad and the risotto and mussels. 

I patiently awaited, the waiter forgot my beer. Then, after not being prompt for bringing it... criticized the busboy for forgetting. This is just the beggining...

As I got my salad, a few pedestrians walk by - and I hear this table of four making a mockery of anyone walking by -  I thought to myself - (jerks) and blew it off.

Then my main plate was served (or better stated Shoved!) , not giving me time to finish, and was rudely shoved the main plate in front of me, as if to hurry  things along(??) - 

 while I was only mildly disappointed, I then noticed a lady ask if they could also join on the patio with a dog they had. They owner feigned not understanding English well - then - as they walked away exclaimed ( Che catzo! che mangiamo caca?? - WTF? Do we eat shit here? How about we eat dog shit soup?? - at that point - I lost it, and yelled at him "Ya Basta! Che sto mangiando!" and his pathetic response - "Scusi? Scusi" and I had to repeat myself to him. Only to hear back -  "Ooooooh! Parla italiano!?" (he speaks italian) -

 the remainder of th meal, he turned his coward back to me with his real cool mullet and wanna be mafiosos and inwardly heckled. 

As I left, I gave him a hard stare, of which he couldn't bring himself to look me in the eye.

Sorry Guido, but...  next time, even though I may not look italian, I studied romance languages - douche bag!
author: Joe G.

description: Wow! Ambience, authenticity, menu selections was off the charts! I had the gnocchi with prawns a basil. Really delicious. Be careful when the waiter asks if you'd like Parmesan cheese on top. He added a little too much which made the pasta just a bit salty.
author: Ron L.

description:
I love Mona Lisa. Every trip I have made to San Francisco has included at least one trip to Mona Lisa. 

There is not one thing on the menu that disappointed me. The feel of the whole place is very relaxed and homey. I felt like I could have been at my family dinner table. The place is coated in art and fabric and flags and maps...as if someone just got back from a tour of Italy and had to stash all of their knickknacks somewhere. I love it. 

The food, the wine, the service, the atmosphere...it's all wonderful. You won't leave either hungry or upset that you chose Mona Lisa #3.

Mangia!
author: Tony L.

description:
Food was decent, service (management) was terrible, was a tourist and felt treated like one.  

The roasted garlic was good as was the pasta.  Waiter was pretty attentive and polite but...

The waiter spilled cream sauce and oil all over the patron, her clothes and bag (unintentionally) and when the matter was addressed with the restaurant manager, he told us to "take it up with the waiter".  No gesture was made to make things right by the restaurant...just to try to pry it out of the poor waiter...pathetic.

Can't go back to any restaurant that treats its customers like that.
author: Mike M.

description: Most delicious food ever. Calamari was superb . Service was excellent. A bit pricy but it's all worth it!
author: Colin D.

description: We celebrated our 20th anniversary on 9-7-16 at Mona Lisa.  We have eaten there many times and it is always an excellent experience.  This was no exception.  Incredible food and amazing staff!  We travel over 50 miles (Sebastopol) to eat there and have never been disappointed.  They always accommodate special request and actually made me a dish not listed on the menu.  That is something I would never request at any restaurant but they are not like any other restaurant I've been to.  We have had family meals (2 young children) and romantic candle lit dinners for two at The Mona Lisa.  Perfect for any occasion.  We can't wait to go back!   Thanks Mona Lisa!!
author: Devin R.

description: I recently had my birthday dinner here with  25 of my friends in this tiny romantic restaurant. It wasn't the best spot to have such a large group but they definitely made sure that we were happy and satisfied. The food was amazing, I had the Gorgonzola gnocchi which was perfect. I think Mona Lisa would be a wonderful spot for a date night in Little Italy :)
author: Ava M.

description: I was in San Francisco for work recently. I hate traveling without my husband and kids--I missed them terribly--so I took along walk. I was hungry but not sure for what... probably just company? Well, I stumbled upon the Mona Lisa by way of the waiter Casper talking to me on the sidewalk outside. Hooray!  A friendly face! Of course I ventured in. I felt like I was walking into someone's house; it was that personable and inviting. The food was amazing--I can't stop thinking about the meatballs, the bruschetta, the cream puffs, the olives... The ambiance is wonderful and was just what I needed. I travel to SF several times a year and I will stop there every time. Such a great place.
author: Louise E.

description: We ate dinner here Saturday night. The food was excellent, the service was fast, the owner Mauricio was very nice and entertaining. He even comped us delicious tiramisu. Sit outside to enjoy people watching too.
author: Kathy M.

description:
I just want to say that Mona Lisa restaurant is 1 of the finest Italian restaurants in all of North Beach.
The owner: Mauricio is kind generous and very talented in the way he treats his customers. All of his Italian recipes are authentic and very delicious... The crab risotto is to die for... This has become my favorite restaurant in North Beach and I will recommend this restaurant to everyone... You must come here and try this outstanding Italian restaurant. It truly is 1 of the best!
author: Michelangelo M.

description: Took our daughters here for dinner during a great trip to San Francisco!  It was my oldest daughters 15th birthday and she certainly got some attention sitting in the Fiat out front for dinner! Was so fun for all of us. Great people and great food! Thank you!
author: Tracy W.

description: Don't be fooled by those pasta plates! They look small in portion but they're pretty deep. I was happy about that. I ordered fettucini w/ my boyfriend - nothing special but not bad either. Just add some salt to bring out the flavor. My favorites were the calamari and pizza - delicious!!! Ambience is nice but kinda dark so don't expect to take good photos. LOL. Service was good. I would go back again. :]
author: Reese A.

description:
Our party of six was seated promptly, we enjoyed the engaging courteous staff. The food was excellent I mean really excellent, and... Surprise! Gluten free pasta and pizza. 
My friend, a vegetarian, LOVED her eggplant parm. We had two picky teenagers with us and they were delighted... 
Great job guys thanks!
author: Lorna R.

description: Was there Friday night with last minute late reservations, which they accepted. I had the four cheese gnocchi and I requested a little marinara on the side and it was 'heavenly'!  They may be the only reason I might return to San Francisco!
author: Judi G.

description: Such a wonderful restaurant! Everyone was so accommodating and friendly. First trip to San Fran and we were treated to one amazing night. Seated and served our wine and delicious cheesecake in the fiat out front. A truly unforgettable evening!!!
author: Angela T.

description:
After a gorgeous day traipsing around the city,  a friend and I decided to stay in town for dinner and satisfy an Italian craving.  Wow did Mona Lisa deliver!  From the food, to the wine and the waiters, everything was authentically Italian.  

Although the dining room is small it's intimate and cozy.  I'm always about the food, and the menu was so extensive it was hard to choose just one entree.  I ordered  the gnocchi and it was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  I've never had better.  

The bottle of wine we ordered wasn't in stock but the bottle they recommended was even better.  Our waiter was absolutely adorable and we all got a good laugh when he couldn't understand a joke we told because his English "wasn't so good."

Of all the choices in North Beach, this one is definitely worth the visit.
author: Misha A.

description:
Intimate Italian restaurant in North Beach...but then again...aren't all the Italian restaurants in this area small and intimate? I've tried a few Italian restaurants in North Beach and this one wasn't any more memorable than the others. Service was very attentive and friendly.  

Bread before the meal
-crust was a bit too hard...it would be perfect if the bread came warm 

Gamberoni Piccata - $20
(prawns in white wine, lemon sauce with capers)
-prawns were very fresh and tasty; good portions; dish was a bit too salty though

Risotto Alfredo with Prawns - $17
-good taste and portions; you'll enjoy this dish if you like very heavy and rich sauces

The menu is very extensive so I would come again to try other dishes.
author: Angela F.

description: We went to Mona Lisa's based on a cab drivers reccomendation. I am so glad we did! It was our anniversay and I guess they overheard us talking about our anniversary because after our meal (I'll get to that in  a minute) they brought us a big piece of Tiramasu wiht "Happy Anniversay" written in chocolate sauce on the plate! It was the best Tiramasu I've ever had hands down. Our waiter wa a smaller sized young man who was absolutely phenominal! The food was crazy good and I am actually a chef with Italian in my background. I ordered linguine with the meat sauce and meatballs. I also paid the extra $4 for the hand made pasta which turned out to be the best 44 I've ever spent. This place is classy and a great experience from the minute you walk in the dorr. My wife got a chicken dish with a light wine sauce that had artichoke hearts and Sicilian olives. It was to die for! Two big chicken breats on the plate with fresh sauted spinach and roasted potatoes. I will make this place a stop every time we travel from Elk Grove to the city for sure
author: Chris M.

description: We chose this place because of the very nice gentleman out front (owner? host? we're not sure).  He made a very positive impression on us and we became immediately interested.  We were absolutely delighted with our choice.  The setting is great (my kids love to play I-spy and this place is great for that, there are tons of things to look at.). Our waiter was perfection.  I wish I could remember his name, sorry, but it looked like every one working there was equally great.  Our food was pretty good, (the calamari was awesome and the olive paste/dip for your bread you get is straight yummy) although I did dock one star because my husbands spaghetti and meat balls was just ok and my linguine with shrimp and asparagus was good but not great.  Dessert though- delicious!  I would absolutely go back in a heart beat.
author: Meghann V.

description: Average at best.   House wine wasn't good at all.  We found the dishes inconsistent throughout our party of 4.  Portions weren't big.  We definitely won't return.
author: Vince R.

description:
My friend and I must have looked like tourists when we went here for lunch.  

We are given menus and wound up ordering a Caesar salad to share along with individual pizzas.  As we were finishing up our lunch, I found out that we had been given dinner menus instead of the lunch menus.  On the lunch menu, the salad was $2 cheaper and some of the pizzas were also a few dollars less expensive.

When the bill came and I saw that I had been charged the dinner price for the Caesar salad, I complained.  The waiter argued that the dinner Caesar salad was bigger, which is why we were being charged more.  However, he eventually agreed to lower the price.  

After he walked away, I talked to the people at a neighboring table.  They had ordered the same sized Caesar salad but said that they had ordered it off of the lunch menu.  In other words, the waiter had been, in the language of diplomacy, disappointingly inaccurate.
 
The food itself was O.K. but nothing special.
author: James L.

description:
Fun Italian vibe and service! Very large Italian menus - all of the basics and more.

Order the meatballs to start!
author: Vicki L.

description: From one Italian to another BENISSIMO!!!   Eight days in wine country, Sausalito and San Fran and this restaurant was the very best. If it's not on the menu, forget about it. Some of the best red sauce this side of home. Owner was happy to meet us and made us feel like we had shared meals many times. Our waitress was friendly and went out of her way to locate the exact wine we requested. Both were genuine individuals. Every dish from the antipasto thru the pastas to the was desserts delicious.
author: Pat C.

description: Homemade and savory! From appetizers to dessert, a nice change of pace from the tourist restaurants. A perfect glass of Prosecco kept the atmosphere in check.
author: Sharon M.

description: My first time to SF I went to this classy Italian style restaurant. And my gosh did I love their seafood. A bit pricy, but I was prepared to spend. By the looks of it, a very popular place with celebrities. I recommend if you are visiting SF as a couple, this ougt to be on your list.
author: Daniel R.

description: Reminiscent of Buca de Beppo as far as kitsch is concerned, but the menu is large and varied. All the pasta is homemade, as are the meatballs. Portions are generous and the service is good.
author: Connie C.

description: If I could give this place 6 stars, I would.  They made my 30th bday so special!  You will know the place by the 1960s Fiat out front, which you can even sit in!  Service and food were both fabulous, not to mention the champagne.  Very reasonably priced.
author: Katie D.

description: Great food and great dinning experience. Walking down the street looking for gluten free options, we stumbled upon this gem. Complimentary bruschetta was fantastic. Five of us all tried different dishes to share, we loved everything. Service was impeccable and worth all five stars!
author: J M.

description: We come every time we visit San Fran! Real authentic Italian and eclectic decor. Service is always very friendly. Recommend for families and groups of friends!
author: Amanda T.

description: This place is beautiful in the inside it was warmly welcomed in from one of the waiters my back was hurting so bad from walking all day so I thought what the heck I will go in and see what they had to offer. Their menu is so extensive it's almost impossible to even figure out what to order. I don't think that's a bad thing I like a lot of variety on my menu I was immediately brought out bread with a huge thing of water the servers were very very professional I actually even ordered a bottle of wine, which was very very good tasting, it took me a long time to figure out what I wanted. So I finally decided on crab ravioli and a pink sauce. Although it was not in a pink sauce the sauce was very salty for my liking. The crab in the ravioli was very fishy tasting and I don't like that, I probably should have gotten something different I did eat all my food though except the sauce. I'm sure if I went back I would have pick something along the lines of an Alfredo I was hoping my food had a lot more flavor like garlic basil the typical Italian flavors it was lacking. It was nice to try a new Place but I wouldn't highly recommend there. Also it was quite expensive probably cuz my $40 bottle of wine otherwise their hospitality was excellent. I'm giving 3 stars just because the decor it is very beautiful.
author: Mary G.

description: My favorite restaurant in San Fran!  Since being here on business with colleagues for the past month we have eaten at many restaurants in the city. Mona Lisa never disappoints.  Great food, excellent service and VIP hospitality always from Mauricio!!  Been there 3 times already and will be back!
author: Mario S.

description:
Been to Mona Lisa a few times over the past couple of years and used to make it a regular stop whenever I visited San Francisco.  .  We had reservations, but arrived a bit late (about 15 minutes).  The host was nice but the manager seemed to want to 'punish' us for being late.  At least that was the gist of what I overhead in Italian.  (So, if you make reservations, be on time!) 

The decor is nice, though.  You do feel like you are in a restaurant in Italy, but on a weekend night people are really packed in.  Of course, that is a lot like Italy, too.  :-)

Maybe I just ordered the wrong dish on this trip, but I was not impressed.  I usually like their pasta dishes but all of the pasta dishes we ordered on this trip seemed to be a bit short on flavor.  With so many great restaurants in North Beach and San Francisco, we probably won't be back to Mona Lisa anytime soon.  At least not on a weekend night.
author: Jim M.

description: We came here on a recommendation of our VW bus tour. It was  a great experience. We ate in the Fiat convertible car parked out front. Call and reserve the car in advance. It's fitted with a table and has a perfect view of the Transamerica bldg. Service was awesome and friendly. Food was delish. I had Saffron Risotto with Prawns and my wife enjoyed the Chicken Marsala. Also, indoors, the place was happening.
author: K M.

description:
Such a disappointing North Beach restaurant.  The area has become so toursity (and seedy with all the nearby strip clubs).  I liked the decor so came inside and was dismayed to see "$12 per person minimum" on the menu.  I nearly left but we decided to stay. The cheese pizza was odd , with a liquidy pool of milky cheese on top making the crust soggy. Having just returned from Italy I can assure you it was NOT authentic nor was it really recognizabe.

The arugala salad was excellent (with capers and lemon) although a little light on the fresh shaved parm.

For a small pizza, arguala salad, cup of tea, and 2 milks for the kids I felt like we paid WAY too much.  Mona Lisa is a tourist trap I'd recommend you avoid.

Next time I'm in the area I'll be sure my YELP app is working (sadly, it wasn't loaded right on my phone) and if in doubt, I'll try for a side street over the main drag.
author: Kara T.

description:
I don't know where to start...like a kid in a candy store? Ate here for lunch Sunday afternoon. The menu is very extensive and portions are large, with each plate approx. $17. There were only 3 or 4 tables so we had excellent service. Our server and busser were both very friendly and attentive. Our drinks and basket of hot bread arrived quickly, and our appetizer came out fairly quickly as well.

The dessert menu was fabulous, and all desserts are $8. I purposely didn't touch any bread, and took it easy with the calamari and my pizza so I could indulge.  

 They offered to box up our leftovers, which we declined as we had a flight to catch. Wasn't expecting that, but was very impressed. Heated seating outside. Here's our notes:

Caesar salad - homemade croutons, lots of dressing if you like that. 

Calamari Fritti- Light crispy coating, these were delectable.

Pizza Napoletana- crispy crust, but pales in comparison to Tony's, which I had the day before. Cheese, garlic and tomato blend was perfect but will not order this again. Next time I'll try the Margherita.

Gnocchi Fondenti- If you can't get enough cheese, then this one's for you as it was dripping with cheese! This is a light fluffy gnocchi, not as doughy as we had a few days earlier at Fior. It was softly tender and melted in my mouth!

Chicken Parmigiana- small portion with no pasta, accompanied with decent potatoes and spinach. Lightly breaded and very tasty. 

Tiramisu- Lovely, light and  heaven in your mouth. Always the perfect end to a wonderful Italian meal.

Chocolate Protiferoles - these little cream puffs were smothered in chocolate - OMG I thought I was going to have to buy an extra plane ticket for my ever expanding fat arse!

Chianti - how do you screw this up? Large wine glasses - gotta love that! After the Chianti, we had another red, Valpolicella Cesari which was excellent. 

Loved this place! I would highly recommend it for a romantic dinner.
author: Lisa D.

description: Love Mona Lisa. A great place to enjoy a meal. And if you look at the walls, you'll see the younger version of the host.
author: Johnson H.

description: Good pasta, fair service, and fair prices. We stopped by because it looked interesting and very busy. Great dinner!
author: Richard O.

description: Awesome place! Owner is very friendly and the food is superb. Will definitely be coming back for my birthday :)
author: Julie M.

description: My wife and I are in town from Arizona for the Fourth of July weekend.  We went out for an early evening walk, and ended up in North Beach.  We decided to get a quick bite to eat.  We started with the bruschetta. It was made fresh and was absolutely delicious.  We also shared a Pizza Calabrese.  Again, it was delicious!  Most important, was the service.  Our waiter, Roberto, was very friendly and funny.   He was singing the whole time while he waited on tables.  Also, the owner (didn't get his name) was hanging out near the front door greeting people, and interacting with everyone that came in.  If you're in the area, give these people your business.  You won't be sorry!
author: T A.

description: Nice restaurant, good food, mediocre service. We had the fettuccine alla piero and really liked the pasta. Good ambiance, okay food and customer service.
author: Lety J.

description: Very poor customer service, my husband and I walked in last nite and there was hardly anyone there eating and a couple of  workers walking around. After standing there for a couple of minutes waiting to be seated, we got the feeling we weren't welcome. Im guessing our casual  clothes that we were wearing wasn't  good enough. To bad they were never told to Never judge a book but it's cover. Cause this book had more than enough to spend. I will let my family and friends and co - workers know about this incident.
author: Mari G.

description:
Hey, did you see that Derek Jeter had dinner at Mona Lisa a couple of nights ago.

Have the papardelle pasta with wild mushrooms, garlic & olive oil.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Arrived early for my Valentines day reservation they took us in right away with no hassle. Great calamari gritty nice and salty. Wife enjoyed baked ravioli w/ mozzarella while my spaghetti bolognese was delightful. Pizza napolatena was light and tasty. A great new dining experience for us and a wonderful valentine's day
author: Richard H.

description: Since moving to North Beach, I've been attempting to try all the Italian restaurants in the area. Some negative reviews deterred me from trying Mona Lisa, but after a positive recommendation from my girlfriend I decided to give it to a shot. I'm happy to say that I was pleasantly surprised. Great service and good food made for a positive experience and a happy customer. The Macara homemade was delicious as was the minestrone. Surprisingly good coffee as well. Will definitely be back.
author: Brent S.

description: I brought a friend visiting from Calabria, Italy because another resturant recommended as a bona fide Calabrian Cucina. Mona Lisa's is fantastico! The owner and staff are gracious and generous (true Italian hospitality) and the food and wines are amazing! The Cioppino is the best I have ever had- anywhere. highly recommended to anyone seeking geniune Calabrese/Italian Cuisine in Little Italy. We have been back again and will recoomend to everyone we know! Grazie Mona Lisa!
author: Kt S.

description:
Mona Lisa is one of our "go to" restaurants in North Beach.  I would say that many (most) places on Columbus are over priced tourist traps that serve mediocre food at elevated prices. Mona Lisa is not cheap... but the quality and service are always very good. 

I highly recommend the veal dishes and the pastas are very fresh and never disappoint. Caesar salad is very good. Service is always good. Decor as you might guess is Mona Lisa / Italian style. 

Side note: I took my wife here a couple years back on her birthday and we had to wait about 30 min for a table even though we had a reservation. The owner (or manager) was very sorry about the wait and brought out some champagne and sang to her while we waited. It was a class move and it made the night very special for her. 

This is one of the few places in North Beach that we do not hesitate to recomend to people.
author: Ken W.

description:
If your looking for authentic and tasty italian....come to Mona Lisa. My friend and I were on the prowl for Italian and came across this place. It looks small from the inside but its quite roomy once you walk in. We were seated promptly and the customer service was on point. The man who seated us stands out in front and greets guest....luckily for me he also helped scare away the meter maid! Thank you! Who puts 30 minute MAX meters on streets w/tons of restaurants?! Ridiculous! I had to go out to my car every 30 mins to ante up on the meter! YIKES! Almost didn't enjoy my lunch BUT I still did!!!! Muahahaha. Here's what we ordered:

-Fried calamari $13.95
-Risotto Pescatore $16.95
-Linguini alla silana $13.95
-1 coke
-1 sprite

Keep the bread, butter and vinegar & EVOO cominnnn'!!!!! :)

-Fried calamari was pretty tasty and the portion was HUGE. My friend and I added a ton of crushed red pepper to the marinara sauce. Spicier is always better! 
-The Risotto was sooooo bomb! Best Risotto I've ever had! My friend who is in love w/Risotto absolutely fell in love with it. It was very creamy and cooked to perfection. Some places cook the Risotto way too long and it loses the Risotto rice texture but Mona Lisa did it perfectly. No wonder it took awhile for the main dishes to come out. It was worth the wait!
-The linguini alla silana was very good also. It definitely tasted home made for some reason! Hahahaha. The mushrooms and eggplant went so wonderfully w/the sauce. It was delectable! Momomomom.

One complaint...
#1. The restaurant obviously is pretty famous because there were photos of celebs up everywhere who have eaten at Mona Lisa! Which was fun to look at. However, I felt very clustered and bunched in. Too many tables crammed into one restaurant....half the time I was trying to zone out other tables conversations and listen to my friend talk. It felt intimate but invasive at the same time. BUT it also ment that Mona Lisa probably gets very very busy! Personally, for me...the tables were put too close together

All in all definitely go try Mona Lisa. The service is very good and the food is so tasty and authentic! I'm definitely going back!
author: Annie P.

description: Great service, great food. Ordered the Mona Lisa fettuccine and it was by far the best I've ever had. I will be coming back.
author: Kevin B.

description: Our favorite place to go in little Italy! The Gorgonzola tortellini is amazing and the bruschetta is perfect!!!! We've never had a bad time here and the servers are always so friendly and helpful! A must go at least once!!! Not to mention delicious espresso at the end of the meal.
author: Jessica S.

description: Food great Service even better a taste of Italia in North Beach!!!! From the appetizer plate to the veal marsala!!! Buon Giorno!!!
author: Tom H.

description:
After reading some many yelp reviews, felt confident that this was going to be a pleasant experience. And it was. Overall the evening was a hit with my party of 7, with just a few minor negative points. After I polled my party, their grades ranged from B to B+, which totally agreed with.

Reservations at 8pm, got there a few minutes before and was immediately seated. Bread and water was quickly brought. Dinner napkins were placed in our laps. 

Started with their Italian sampler. It had bruschetta, tomatoes caprese and roasted garlic. Everything was done fine, with fresh ingredients. We also had the fried calamari which was ok. Nicely fried although not much flavor, but it was ok. Soon afterward the manager/host decided to send a complimentary appetizer tray our way. Whatever the reasons - whether just being nice or it was a kitchen mistake that he wanted to give to us, I really appreciated the gesture, and it earned some major brownie points with me. The appetizer plate had some more bruschetta, some olives, some parm-reg cheese, and some prosciutto. I enjoyed the prosciutto and the rest, although the extra food really filled me up and left less room for the main courses!

I ordered 5 entrees to share so we could all get a taste of more items.

The Spaghetti Carbonara (pancetta, eggs and cheese) was awesome. Perfectly cooked, creamy with a nutty/salty from the pancetta.

The Gnocchi Pomodoro (tomato sauce and basil) was my (and everyone else's) least favorite dish. Granted, I'm not a big gnocchi fan, but the times I've had very good gnocchi it was light and puffy. Here is was a bit doughy. But I'm the first to admit that gnocchi is not my favorite, so you might try it yourself and like it.
    
The risotto porcini (mushroom) was creamy and delicious. Just the right amount of flavor from the broth. It was good, very good.

The chicken piccata was also pretty good. The chicken was moist and tender, and the potatoes and spinach on the side had very good flavor. My wife finished all the spinach and loved it. 

The pizza Napoletana (basic with cheese/tomato/oregano/garlic) was done very well. Good crust and good flavor.
 
Service was friendly and efficient, especially the host. Waiter helped exchange plates, refilled water and was generally very effective. Only a few missteps:
The appetizers came in a quick manner, but the rest of the meal took a bit longer. Not 'look at watch several times and frown' long, but 'look at my watch and wondering' long. Also it took a long time to get my bill. I think they use an old, old credit card machine. Bread was served cold. A bit pricey. Yes a few minor gripes, but overall their ambiance, service and food will make me visit again.
author: Dom L.

description: Went with my brothers for a reunion dinner and waited almost an hour to be seated. I guess that's what I get though for not making reservations on a Saturday night. Their lasagna was amazing and the closest thing to authentic Italian cuisine since I went in 2006. The Pinot Noir was also fantastic. The only reason I cannot give five stars is because before our meals came, a server walked up to our table and took the oregano off our table to give to another party. I understand the other party's needs but the server could have taken one from the back. When our food arrived, we had to ask to have it back. Nevertheless, I would definitely return, as the food makes up for any service mishaps.
author: Eric B.

description: LOVE it here!  Maurizio, the owner, is a fantastic host.  Warm and generous, and full of smiles - a great person to be around while you enjoy your meal.  To start, we had calamari, bruschetta and the caprese salad.  All I had to do was close my eyes and it felt like I was in Italy all over again!  Each starter was phenomenal on its own - flavourful and done JUST RIGHT!  We had the vongole with spaghetti and asked for it pomodoro picante - which was not on the menu but they were kind enough to oblige us and again, it was fantastic.  They were extremely generous with the clams that were on each plate.  Branzino for the third course - cooked perfectly and served with potatoes and spinach.  We had cappuccino to finish everything off and shared the raspberry pannacotta....shoulda ordered my own cuz it was to die for LOL!  All in all, a great experience not only for the food but the ambience as well.  Will DEFINITELY be back next time I'm in town.  And Maurizio, if you're reading this, grazie per tutti!!
author: Shefa A.

description: Took our daughter here for her 18th bd. Had butternut squash ravioli in sage butter, eggplant parm, and salmon in garlic and all three dishes exceeded our expectations. One of the top 2 eggplant Parma I've ever had, including in NYC. Fantastic food.
author: Eric B.

description:
This was one of the few restaurants opened around 10pm in North Beach so we decided to give this a try. I think we came at the wrong time because the restaurant only had 3 other customers and us, yet our waiter forgot about us. Quite sad actually, we were just sitting there starving and tired. We ordered a dish of risotto and I ordered a simple tomato basil pasta... terrible! The foods tasted like it was in the fridge then heated up on high heat. The pasta tasted like it was either undercooked or overcooked, we couldn't tell, but it was doughy and weird tasting. I saw the cooks taking the tomato sauce out of a container and heating it up on top of the pasta. I'm sure this is a great restaurant, or maybe my tastebuds are wrong, but we def didn't enjoy our meal. I think the owner came up to us and saw my place still full, and said in a cute Italian accent "please finish, for me, please eat" *hand gesture for eating*. =]. I ended up not finishing my pasta... I think we paid way too much for these foods, and they gave us Italian portions...

The interior is very nice, loved the various paintings on the wall. Some say its cheesy but its nice having something Italian-like in the bay.
author: Rita K.

description: Are you kidding this is by far the best, I come all the way from the east bay on bart and on foot to have dinner here. We have tried all the other " Italian " places up and down Columbus but I have a problem I am full blooded Italian and you can always tell the difference with not only the food but the service, ambience and even the bear hugs at the door to great you. I have friends that insist I take them there for the lasagna which is a feast. I love the veal Palermo, you haven't lived unless you have tried the pasta de mar. Dang just made my self hungry.
author: John L.

description: This place was recommended by friend and I decided to check it out.  My first impression was wow this place is crowded. We were seated in the back of the restaurant where the tables were so  close that waiters and customers walking by would bump our elbows if we stuck them out too much.  It was also too warm, so much so that I broke a sweat when the food finally came. Btw, it only took 1 hour to serve our food. Once they did, they got one of our orders wrong. When we asked our waitress, she reassured us it was the right plate. By that time we were fed up and took a couple bites of our meals and asked for the check. Needless to say, we will not be returning to this establishment.
author: Charles Z.

description: One of the best Italian Restaurants I have experienced in a long time. I had the pleasure of meeting the owner, Mauricio, he is the BEST, treated us like family. Our server, CIRO was very nice and attentive. Our glasses were never empty!!  For appetizers we started off with an antipasto plater, delicioso!!! I'm not a fan of clams, but for my birthday my order was a special request with prawns, salmon and clams on top of linguini noodles with a creamy white wine sauce!! Worth the visit!!! Best birthday and dinner spent at this restaurant. Good food, great atmosphere and friendliest staff.  Must visit!!!
author: Serena T.

description:
The worst seafood pasta I've had in my life. If I made spaghetti with only ketchup, it would be more tasty. We were 7 people and ordered all different kinds dishes and the only decent one was the Pizza which was too salty for my taste and I do like salty. 

Don't get fooled by the music and the ambiance, once we got seated it was the most depressive music which killed our mood to go out after. The service was also really bad, we had to wait a really long time for everything even though it was only 2 other tables. They include 20% tip in the bill because they know no one would leave a good tip.
author: safoura h.

description: Outstanding experience. Authentic Italian hospitality. The wine was delicious, the food was amazing and the service was top-notch definitely recommend this place. Be sure to  hi shake hands with Mauricio's (the owner), he's a good man!
author: Jonathan C.

description: The manager & waiter made my friends & I feel so welcome! We ended up getting a free appetizer & desserts. The calamari was good & crispy how I like it. The desserts were pure bliss, one was a pistachio ice cream & another was a cappuccino ball. My lobster ravioli was fresh. Everything was yummy & made the dining experience truly enjoyable. Whenever I'm in SF again, I'll definitely return!
author: Robin G.

description: Decent Italian. The menu had a large variety to choose from. The meat lasagne was definitely something I would go back for.
author: Peter B.

description: Mona Lisa has been a staple of our SF lives for 5 years. The staff always goes above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The location is perfect for enjoying the North Beach scene. The menu has everything you could possible be craving. Highly recommend it!
author: Kelsey C.

description:
I can't say enough about Mona Lisa.  When I go there, they make you feel like a movie star.  Mauricio, the owner, is so friendly and nice;  the staff is tremendous and attentive and very efficient.  I feel like I am in Italy every time I arrive.    The appetizer tray is so delicious that it's a meal in and of itself.  The menu is very diverse with Italian preparations.  The amount of food that you get on your plate is enough to feed a small army.   They are very generous with their portions.  The surroundings in the restaurant are very charming with all the pictures of people  that have come there, along with the items plastered on their walls.  The desserts are very  appealing, especially the sorbet/limoncello.  It is outstanding and refreshing on a nice San Francisco day.   The prices are very reasonable and not overly expensive.   You get a good bang for your buck, and enough to take home, if necessary.   I give this restaurant a 5 star rating, as it is truly the epicenter for North Beach Italian restaurants in San Francisco.   If there is one place you have to stop and eat Italian food, it's Mona Lisa.  And this writeup is coming from a customer who is made to feel like a movie star every time he comes there and brings guests. 

Grazie mille

Divo
author: Ricardo R.

description: Great atmosphere. Great Food and a fun owner who will literally entertain you.
author: Mel R.

description: Antipasti plate was unbelievable! Ordered the Spaghetti Salsiccia. Sausage was perfectly seasoned and served with plenty of sauce. Stayed warm the entire meal. Wonderful atmosphere and quick service. Molto bene!
author: Mary N.

description: Good food and great service. Very welcoming, great atmosphere. The owner greeted us himself. I loved how the place looked with all the paintings and flags all around.
author: Irlice P.

description: My boyfriend and I have been saying for months now that we would try one of these lovely Italian spots . this place Mona Lisa was the first place we stopped at and we got to sit in the old school car and have dinner. It was absolutely fabulous . The food was that authentic comfort italian food. Like going to grandma's for dinner. The service is great, everything we got was amazing . We had random people taking pictures of us. We felt like celebrities and paparazzi would not leave us alone. My boo and I have found a place that we can go back again and again and be completely satisfied . It was so romantic and I can not wait to go back with the friends and family. The owner mauricio is a down to earth funny person and will come and talk to you and make sure you are happy with everything .
author: Brandy R.

description:
My friend was craving pasta so we decided to try Mona Lisa. We were quickly greeted and seated outside. It was a little cramped for parties larger than 2 on the front patio, but a nice atmosphere and view of the neighborhood. 

The menu is large, so there is something for everyone here. To drink I ordered the house wine, which wasn't bad, but a bit pricey at $7.50 a glass. 

For lunch I ordered the Ravioli ai Quattro Formaggi. The four cheese sauce was so good, but very rich. I ate half the dish and most of the four cheese sauce to dip the bread they bring the table (which was dry).

Overall good food, but a little pricey for a casual lunch.
author: Liz M.

description:
I love this place. I don't have a bad thing to say about it. Every time I walk by, something pulls me in. I feel like I'm walking into a scene from A Bronx Tale if Lorenzo Anello took Rosina out for a nice summer evening dinner. 

Something about the older Italian dudes, sitting out front at their usual table discussing todays events with vigorous hand motions interests me to no end. And this is all before walking into the place. 

Once inside it's a very romantic atmosphere with low lighting and a very nice decor. I am always treated very nicely, if I'm dressed up for an evening out or sun burned and sweating in my Dodgers jersey after watching my boys smash on the Giants at AT&T Park. The service is always great and quick. I also like the way you can watch the cooks work their magic as the kitchen is right up front. 

The food is delicious! I usually go for the ravioli or chicken parm. Never had an issue of any sort here. By far, my fave restaurant in Northern California. My first all time being Miceli's in L.A. Mona Lisa is a close second. 

All this and really good prices too. Don't sleep on this place.

The saddest thing in life is wasted talent.
author: Mike C.

description:
Nothing to write home about but I will be back. In a city with a million great restaurants it's extremely hard to stand out but this well established North Beach favorite has been around because the food is good and the service is above average. When we arrived at 8:05 on a Tuesday evening with no reservation we were promptly seated at the second to last table. Within five minutes all the tables were full.

The huge menu was a little overwhelming but after much discussion I ordered the Mona Lisa Fettucini and she had the ravioli.
