She mentioned the raviolis were a little "saucie" and I have to agree but it was still good. The Fetichini was good not only because the pasta was extremely fresh but the sauce was was full of flavor although not in the top ten for this city but still darn good.

The ambiance is a bit cluttered but even with every table full the restaurant is no too loud. I give it a low four stars but will be back in the future.
author: Justin S.

description:
If you want to understand Italian cooking, book a table for dinner at the Monalisa Restaurant and order arancini siciliani, Risotto alla pescatora e Salmone Pisciaiulo .... and enjoy you dinner with a good  wine too ;)

I am Italian, and I leave in USA since 2007. It is not easy find a place where you can really test good italian food, but here in Monalisa i had a wonderful experience. It was like be back at home!!!!!
Everybody is so friendly and charming, just like italy and the food it is simply delicius.

You must try also the amazing PIZZA they make, OMG never had a pizza so good in USA!!!!!
Can't wait to go back again in this restaurant.... i Leave in San diego but everytime i go to San Francisco i never miss the opportunity to enjoy the magic atmosphear and the Delicius italian food in Monalisa.

So really thanks to Monalisa and I hope you guys will enjoy soon this "temple of gastronomy"
author: Elisabetta M.

description: The food is delicious and the service is fast. They have the biggest menu I've ever seen with amazing food. There's no bad dish here. Highly recommend.
author: Alisa S.

description: Another wonderful family owned restaurant. The food is all made classic Italian style, which makes for a great sauce. The atomosphere of the restaurant is very romantic. You can even share a bite to eat with your date in a restored Fiat that sits out front of the restaurant. I was very impressed by how interacting the manager was on a busy Saturday night. Taking the time to walk around and interact with every table. Really changes the customers experience from good to great.
author: Wynton F.

description: This was the one of the best restaurants that we visited on a girls trip to San Francisco.  The atmosphere was amazing.  The homemade pasta was delicious!!! The staff was entertaining and over the top amazing.  We will be back to this place for sure.
author: Linda R.

description: Truly smazing place not sure why anyone would have a negative review but to each his own i guess.Staff was amazing and hospitable treated us very kindly and were very promt and courteous it was a very romantic setting a lovely place to go on a date.The food was very good i had the ravioli bolognese and the wife had the stuffed chicken and the kid had pizza all three were delicious thechocolate mousse dessert was awesome just a great all around experience i highly recommend stopping by when in the area you wont regret it.
author: Tyler N.

description: Went a few years ago and had a GREAT experience with the antipasto and fettuccine alfredo a few years ago, but this time wasn't so great. I had crab linguini which was just bleh and the staff didn't seem as friendly as before. Still a great restaurant.
author: Alex P.

description: Excellent restaurant and excellent service. We had a large party and our waiter, Mario went above and beyond to ensure that our entire family was happy. Food was delicious!  We would definitely recommend this place!
author: Jess M.

description:
3.5 Stars

When you step into this place, it looks quite dark. No worries though, your eyes will adjust to it. The decor is quite nice, but it can get a bit crowded. I had the Chicken San Francisco, which I originally thought it had some pasta, but it was chicken, potatoes, spinach, and other veggies. I thought it was pretty good. However, the potatoes were quite salty.  

The waiter seemed like he was in a rush. He came and took our dishes without really gesturing whether we were ALL finished with our dishes. My friend still had food on her plate, but she was pretty much done.

When it came time for the bill, the waiter jotted down the wrong prices on both of my friends orders. Their dishes were a few dollars less than what he initially wrote. When we asked him about it and showed him the menu price, he told us that it was busy and they calculated them by hand. Fine, but he only corrected one of the dishes and not the other. He was so in a rush that he did not correct the entire bill to what it was suppose to be. So we took the time to calculate it ourselves. 

Despite of the ending, I would maybe consider coming back because there is such a huge selection of dishes here and the dish I had was good.
author: Mandy D.

description: We waited for over an hour for our food because there was a large party in front of us.  If we were told by host that we would have to wait that long, we would have went elsewhere.  My son, who is vegan, ordered pasta with tomato sauce and got pasta with tomato sauce and meatballs.  We asked  the wait to change it and we suspect that they just removed the meatballs and tossed the pasta around.  On a positive note, they did not charge me for my 2nd glass of wine.
author: Brenda W.

description:
Three of went there for dinner and we all loved our meal. We had to wait about 20 minutes, but it was well worth it. They have an open kitchen so it is great to see the talented kitchen staff cook. They do a great job and are very fast.
One suggestion, if asked if you wan to sit outside, don't do it.
author: Jamie B.

description: Omgoshhh hands down best Italian food I've had.  I had some strange calamari pasta in black sauce no idea what it was,  looked funky but lordy lordy it was incredible.  The flavors were pure simple yet I could not taste the ingredients.  The chicken marsala is superb I loved the spinach.  I was also able to enjoy their beaded calamari, I loved the fact it wasn't heavy breading.. Light & flavorful.  I wish this place was closer but I'll Def make the 6 hr drive just to try more on their menu.
author: Keriyana C.

description: We were seated quickly, and the Caesar salad and pizza were delicious! I would highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Jaime B.

description:
Cheesy Italian decor instantly makes me uneasy. Thankfully the food was decent, not the disaster I expected after looking up at the faux Sistine Chapel ceiling. 

The white wine seafood risotto lacked the bold flavors I've grown to love and expect. The spaghetti carbonara was just ok, mainly because the sauce didn't have the  rich cream base that the salty ham is supposed to balance out. 

Overall a decent Italian restaurant in North Beach, but not the type of place that gives me flashbacks of living in Rome. If you are looking for a good North Beach date spot, look elsewhere.
author: Tom L.

description:
I honestly meant to go to Franchino and didn't realize my mistake until I paid the bill.  HAH!

No worries though, the food and service here was excellent.  My friend had a seafood risotto and I ordered the mushroom ravioli, washed it down with a glass of Chianti.

The lighting is dim and the tables are intimate.  Good for a date.  The atmosphere is classic, traditional.  Go on a quiet weeknight and avoid the crowds of tourists on the weekends.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
This should be only a tourist spot, but it is not!! A couple of local SF friends joined us for a wonderful evening, starting with one of the best sampler platters, enough to enjoy and good variety. We shared the gnocchi, three cheese, a bit of heaven in each mouth ful.
We than shared the carpaccio, do not get this, it had been plated many hours(days) before, and the thin slices of meat stuck to the plate and had gotten hard and crusty.
Wonderful deserts, all four of them!
Big downfall is no hard liquor, I really craved a drink before dinner.
There are many great Italian resurants in SF, this one has atmosphere, great food, and most of all a family of Italians meet you at the door, and you feel like you have been going there forever, I value this aspect.

We will be back.
author: Deborah S.

description: I love and love this restaurant! I have eaten at Mona Lisa's for years and the great food and service is consistently GREAT!!!! Mauricio has from the start made me feel as one of the family.  I highly recommend this establishment has a venue for "getting to know someone", family gathering or simply a time alone to reflect and enjoy fine dining.  As someone that has been to ITALY and well traveled this is a very authentic Italian restaurant!
author: Diane C.

description:
Why do I not have good experiences in North Beach?  *Sigh*  Perhaps it's just Italian food and me don't mix.  So last night a group of us went to dinner here before we were going to dance the night away at Dragon Bar (look at my review there).  Let's break it down.

~ Neighborhood ~
Situated in the heart of North Beach, it's one of your busier restauarants.  It's right across from Steps of Rome on the corner of Columbus and Vallejo.

~ Parking ~
There are a few parking places.  The China Town Parking Garage charges $2 for every 30 min.  NOT WORTH IT.  Go a few more blocks north to the Vallejo Garages where it's $3 every hour (first hour is $1, past that from 1-2 hours it's $3, 2-3 hours $6, etc).

~ Restaurant Atmosphere ~
The restaurant has, as my friend stated, a European feel.  Many tables are set up, close to each other, and it feels like you're in an alleyway in Italy.  Also all the Italian being spoken was great.

~ Food ~
They give you lots of bread which my friends devoured as we were waiting for our food to come out.  I got the Grilled Mixed Seafood Entree.  It came on a sizzling plate with potatoes, spinach, salmon, 2 shrimps, and tuna steak.  Nothing special actually.  I felt it was overpriced grilled seafood.

~ Service ~
Slow...but I think that's to be expected.  It was prime time dinner and it's in North Beach.  It took maybe half an hour to get our food.  We were so hungry.  

I just feel like I can get the same quality food, better service and at cheaper prices...but again this is North Beach.
author: Carolen M.

description:
Worst Italian restaurant in SF. 

First line says it all and here's why:
-the atmosphere was lousy.  Loud,  obnoxious  hip hop music.  What kind of "authentic" Italian place doesn't play Italian music? The decor was also very tacky and worn down. 
-the service.  It took nearly 25 minutes for our server (Maria D) to bring bread and take our drink order. We asked her 4 times to refill our drinks (1 coffee and 1 iced tea),  and she never did.  She was rude,  slow,  and never checked on us once. When we asked her to split our bill (2 ways) she refused.  After some convincing she did,  and on the check it had an area for where the check was to be split.  She was just being lazy. 
-the food. I cannot speak for the rest of my party,  but my over priced spaghetti and meatballs was absolutely awful.  Sauce definitely came from a bottle. The bread we had at the beginning was stale and tasteless. 

I will never return to this awful restaurant and highly recommend avoiding it. Management should be ashamed to run such a shabby establishment
author: Dominic D.

description: My wife and I had dinner here on a Saturday night. The food was great and very reasonably priced. Great ambiance in the restaurant. Great service! We will definitely come back!
author: Darren J.

description: The best Italian food ever service is the best i love this place. The lasagna is great plus the complementary appetizer sampler is great plus great imported beer this place can't be beat
author: Joe M.

description: Decided to have lunch here since it was close to the hotel and didn't seem too busy. I really liked the colorful decor with all the flags, and it had a very cozy feel to it. I had the veal piccata which was extremely flavorful with the white wine lemon sauce. Service was very prompt as well.
author: Daniel L.

description:
The food here isn't great, but isn't bad either. 

I'm definitely not a fan of their cramped seating.

They have a  little "Mona Lisa" car in front of the restaurant where they can seat people to eat. It's a little cute but I find it awkward... Especially when tourists walking by stop to strike pose for a picture...right next to you having dinner.. but whatever floats your boat.
author: April S.

description:
Amazing, this is very original food,, special dinner in the old 500 fiat original Italian style,,, thanks Maurizio for the special dinner
Molte grazie..
author: Christian M.

description: As far as Italian goes they are okay. I ended up ordering pizza here and it was decent. If you want a sit down restaurant with a large selection this is definitely a great place to go. They do serve great cappuccinos  and that is always awesome.
author: Aron H.

description: GREAT service, ambiance, and food. Very authentic and great experience. Been here twice in two days! Thank you to the wonderful guys here!
author: Cara L.

description: I loved this place.  I've been coming for years.  They treat you like family and make great recommendations.  Everything I've eaten here is delicious.
author: Noni M.

description:
When you have to serve jury duty in San Jose mosey over to the Mona Lisa Cafe. Fresh sandwiches, creative salads that can make you feel good about eating out.  I hired this restaurant for catering on more than one occasion. One time for a teacher appreciation and another time for a company luncheon. I still hear raves months and even a year later.  The chef has an excellent selection of catering meals that differs from the lunch menu. 

My husband is about to serve jury duty in March, so I'll send him over.
author: Susan N.

description: The best meal, wine and service. Went for a birthday celebration and the staff took special care and made the night memorable.  We will be back.
author: Gayle S.

description: A highlight of our San Francisco trip! Between the atmosphere and the incredible food, you will feel like you just stepped into an authentic italian family kitchen. I had a seafood platter that included 7 different types of seafood as well as a delicious sauce and long perfectly cooked noodles. We sat outside on the street table next to the little fiat, and loved being able to see the people and experience the atmosphere of San Francisco. We also took pictures in the fiat that includes wooden seats. The car actually drives and adds another level to this great little restaurant. Go check out the Mona Lisa restaurant. You will be glad you did.
author: Alan S.

description: Worst take out by far. Do not order to go. They just slop everything in a box. Over cooked salmon. No utensils. Completely wrong order. When asking for a manager. They were on vacation. Asked for a supervisor. None at the restaurant. Are you serious?! Walked over to the restaurant. Oh wait. There they are! Do not expect service here.
author: Ninotchka A.

description:
What a great evening! We went to Mona Lisa for the first time and had the best evening.

Turns out my husband and the owner are from the same town in Calabria, and we ended up having so much fun talking with everyone at the restaurant the entire evening. 

If you appreciate/love the experience of dining in Italy -- this place makes you feel like you're there! The music, the atmosphere, the people -- so fun!

If you eat seafood we definitely recommend La Voce del Mare - we cleaned the plate and made sure every ounce of the sauce was gone by using the bread to soak it up!
author: Brittany G.

description:
So living in San Diego, on our way down to the wharf, we walked through Little Italy and through Yelp was told this place was very good.
Hmmmm it was ok, the pizza was kinda small and i think the prices a little bit pricey . I think our Little Italy in San Diego is way better
author: Delphine R.

description: Love, love , love this place!!!  Very real Italian food extensive menu.. Great wine list also the manager who stands in the doorway is very nice & friendly. He always makes me feel welcome. I say that because sense I am a young African American women some restaurants servers give bad service thinking where not going to leave a good tip or any tip at all..  So they make me feel very welcome and the service is excellent food is great!!  I drive all they way down from vallejo on the weekends just so I can get my fix!! The chicken Marsalis with roasted potatoes & spinach is the best. Also the bruschetta is also one of my favorites!! The tomatoes and  herbs are so fresh!!!  If you want a true authentic Italian experience this is definitely the place to go!!!
author: Ms K.

description:
Last Thursday was my first time at your fine Ristorante . From the greeting , the carbonara to the service providet by Maria all was very good.
Grazie e Ciao
author: Beat K.

description:
Amazing service, delicious food, and a great ambiance.

I've been coming to Mona Lisa for years, and the service is always exceptional. The hosts, servers, and owner are all so very welcoming and take care of their guests.

Their pizza is delicious, and their pasta is mouth watering. Almost every time I have come here, the owner comes to my table with a huge 3-tier serving platter of bruschetta, garlic bread with cheese, roasted vegetables with fresh cheese, and sets it on my table saying it's on the house. Now if that isn't service, I don't know what is!

The food is always delicious, and I never leave here disappointed!
author: Sarah H.

description:
Ok food...but this place is hyped up a bit too much. There are millions of places just like this in the neighborhood...where the experience might be better.

Or original plan was to get some wine and split a pasta (it was 3 in the afternoon), and we just really wanted to taste the delicious food everyone was raving about even thought we weren't that hungry. 

We took too long to decide I guess because the waiter came back to ask us if we were ready to order about 20 times. He kept suggesting an antipasti dish so finally we asked which one was good and he said the bruschetta and the antipasti platter. Some sort of miscommunication happened then and he said ok...I'll get those for you. This ended in me chasing him down and explaining that we just wanted the antipasti platter and not to spend over $50 on just appetizers. 

The antipasti platter turned out to be a tray of lunch meat and some tiny pieces of cheese with some teanie tiny olives for around $20. 

By the time we got to that point in the meal we decided to forfeit and get our check (which visably upset him because he was thinking we were getting pasta). Oh well.

I'm sure this place is amazing, but my experience was just one of the worse ones. My favorite thing about italian restaurants is the servers because they're usually so nice and friendly. If you want amazing food apparently come here, but if you like friendly (patient!) service go somewhere else.

By the way....the menu has about 200 pasta dishes on it...how do they think people will pick one in 10 mins??
author: Juliet S.

description: Mona Lisa is great.  The only problem is that it is so great, there are so many people in line and in the restaurant, sevice is a little slow (hence the 4 stars instead of 5).  Maurizio is obviously a showstopper and very generous.
author: David P.

description: Love the atmosphere and the food, only complaint is that service is consistently a bit slow.
author: Melissa R.

description:
Decided to stop in here to have some dinner with friends. 

We got seated pretty quickly on a Saturday night, place felt dark and a little clustered. 

We wanted to start off with calamari, but they ran out...
So we got garlic bread and Antipasto Misto - mix of prosciutto crudo, salame, cheeses, olives and soppressata. Garlic bread was really garlicy, I had that taste in my mouth until the next day...it was still pretty tasty. The antipasto was pretty good, not that much meat of each, maybe 2 or 3 thin slices, but good to wet your pallet before dinner. 

Lingiuni al Nero di Seppie - black squid linguini with calamari in white wine sauce- I've had this dish at other places, this one was ok, it was pretty blame and needed some more flavor, maybe more salt. I guess they had some squid left?! =P

Also had a bite of their meat spaghetti, lobster ravioli and Don Mario pizza. Those were all pretty tasty and everyone seemed to really enjoy their dishes. 

Services was pretty good, seemed too busy to come back and check on us.. we would have to wait or waive them down when we needed something. The food is decent for having so many choices up and down the street, I can't say it's the best, but maybe because my dish wasn't the best.
author: Annie D.

description: This place is awesome! The tab was a little bit pricey,but the quality matches the price. I have never found risotto as good as the one in this place! The customer service is great!the owner  (I believe ) finds you a table and then  the waiters take exellent  care! I will return to this place
author: Jose Manuel C.

description: It was very busy on Saturday night, a lot of places had long lines.  We walked by Mona Lisa restaurant and were literally pulled in by the owner.  We loved that he wanted our business, and sat us immediately. The décor was dark and a little crazy, but in a good way. Our waiter Mario was fantastic, he was attentive and made us feel special.  Our food was delicious, we ordered a bottle of Pinot Grigio excellent. The Caprese with mozzarella, and prosciutto to start was fresh and filling.  We decided on 4 cheese ravioli in a cream sauce, and the crab ravioli in a tomato sauce.  Both cooked perfectly. They also sent us a complimentary tiramisu, which was one of the best I have ever eaten.  thank you to the whole staff for making date night unforgettable.
author: tonya m.

description: Bad service. Greasy food. :/ expected more from this. Place as looks so hyped and was recommended to us... Perhaps it was a bad night but I wouldn't go back and try again.... Came out with a greasy Palate .... Olive Garden would have been better than this... That's how much I disliked it.. Also our server felt more like the busboy, he barely spoke English and I had to speak Spanish with him to make sure he knew that my food was way too greasy... Service was too slow ...
author: Fernanda D.

description:
After spending lots of time Yelping for the perfect Italian restaurant to take friends the night before our wedding, I decided to wait until I made the trip from Houston. 

Our hotel turned out to be walking distance, a mile or so away from Mona Lisa, so on many walks about town we passed the place. I was worried because it looked small and we were going to have seven people. When a gentleman from the restaurant approached me outside one day, I asked if that was OK and if we could make a reservation. He said it would not be a problem, and gave me his business card. The next day I called and made the reservation. I ended up having to change it to eight people, and they were still able to accommodate us. 

The pace of the meal was great; the service was adequate but not above and beyond; but the food? Absolutely amazing! I have been home for a few days and I'm still thinking about it! I will definitely go back next time I visit San Francisco. 

Here's a list of some things my party ordered, and I will also post pics:

Appetizers:
Calamari Fritti - 13.95
Tomatoes Caprese - 12.95

Dinners:
Tortellini al Gongorzola - 13.95 - My vegetarian friend ordered this, although there are lots of vegetarian options. I went with the gnocchi but this one tasted great too! Everyone wanted to taste everything so there was a lot of sharing taking place. 
Gnocchi Ruggero - 16.95 - I had this. It was gnocchi with gorgonzola cheese sauce, walnuts and spinach -- HEAVEN! 
Gnocchi Fondenti - 14.95 - Baked four cheese-cream sauce with nutmeg. For some reason the baked dish seemed to come in a smaller portion. My friend had asked about sharing this with her husband, and the waiter rightly recommended against it. However, my portion for the Ruggero was definitely enough to have been shared. 
Ravioli Aragosta - 16.95 - Lobster in tomato cream sauce. Two in my party ordered this and I had a couple bites. It was also fantastic. 

We skipped dessert because we were off to Ghirardelli for ice cream, which I'll probably Yelp next. Definitely try the gnocchi or ravioli if you go -- Mona Lisa does it right!

Why not five stars? The place only has beer and wine, and for beer Peroni hardly counts. Sorry. I did have an Anchor Steam, though. Can't go wrong with that. I did wish they had some fancy pre-dinner mixed drinks or martinis, though. Also, the waiter said it would be a $3 refill for sodas. I don't know if we were not charged after all because my party really wasn't happy with that and they might've overheard, but yeah, that's just kind of ridiculous if that rule is actually enforced.  Lucky for us, it wasn't. 

To address some other minor complaints from fellow Yelpers, I found the decor cheesy yet entertaining. It made the place fun. As for the space issue it's San Francisco. Every restaurant I've been to there has tables close together you just sort of have to deal; at least they took our reservation and hooked us up with a nice long table in the back.

The Verdict: Just thinking about that gnocchi makes my mouth water. I can't wait to go back.
author: Cara S.

description: Terrible Service! Tonight! Slow. Slow slow. Waiter didn't even take our dirty bread plates away. Just stacked the damn dinner plate on top! I was appalled. Never gave us an oil bowl. Had to beg for service, wine, food and then our friggin check! Bathrooms were so disgusting a gas station restroom would be cleaner. Waste of money tonight. Never going there ever again. So disappointing. Tourist trap.
author: Mick M.

description:
Last night we celebrated My Hubby's BD. Went to the place after a recommendation of the Marriott's Concierge. 
Great things: The food, the service and the portions. Our kid got gnocchi with meat balls and alfredo sauce. The best dish on the table and it was hard to compete with the cioppino, some salads, calamari, risotto and 2 other veal dishes. Very tasty but make sure you request less salt.
Good things: The music. Some updated or old dated (like San Remo) music will be appreciated.
Parking: Challenging but we had a spot in front of the restaurant
So why only 4 starts? It is a charming place with excellent service and great food, but! - the restroom. The owners must take some actions there, how much is a renovation of a tiny toilet is? 2K and it is all tax deductible. When you see an old, not clean enough, with dirty rugs toilet rooms-  one will be very concerned about the sanitary and some other health issues.
author: MisoSoup O.

description: Mona Lisa is the Italian restaurant we enjoy the most in San Francisco. Start with a Brunello di Montalcino and the Bruschetta. Add some meatball to the appetizers. Then move on to the Ravioli ala Zucca. Finish with the Limoncello Gelato. Bellisimo!
author: Lloyd M.

description:
Bad. Bad, bad.... BAD. This review will be short.  If I get really going on this place, I'll have to write a book.
My wife said her spinach salad was make out of leaves that she would have thrown out.
I ordered Oso Bucco in a "white wine sauce". When it came it was totally smothered in a brown, gravy-like substance and had the appearance of a cow pie. Seriously, whatever meat was under the "gravy" was cooked to smithereens, was tough and way too salty. I asked our waiter about the "white wine sauce", and he looked like a deer in the headlights. He said he'd check and came back to me saying "yes that's the wine sauce." Even he looked surprised.
My wife had a salmon & pasta dish that she said was terrible. I REALLY wish I could say somehting nice about this restaurant, because we enjoy going to SFO for lunch in North Beach and have rarely had a bad meal in that area. 
The 5 star reviews for this  place make me wonder if we just got a very bad day or what. We won't risk our money and our stomaches again to find out though.
author: Douglas L.

description:
-Cheesy decor
-Good service
-Stale bread
-Good salad
-Good lobster ravioli in tomato cream sauce
-Overpriced wine
-VERY bland fettuccine with shrimp in cream sauce (like, terribly bland)
-Decent portions

I probably won't come back
author: Julian P.

description:
While our food was fine, I'm calling it like it is: tacky tourist trap. I'm ticked I fell for it - I was in a rush and my kid was freaking out about being hungry and we were a block away...desperation move. 
I'm first generation Italian and I know Italian egos - these guys are full of it. I'm convinced they stay in biz not by return customers but by their location and tacky awning which draws in yahoos who think Italian food is all sauce and ravioli. 
The decor is frightening - the Sistine chapel?   I'm seriously? Mona Lisa (who is of course in France at the Louvre) portraits allover, including a nippley topless one, and every cheesy renaissance Italian decoration one can imagine. Cherubs. 
The worst part was the service - rude waiter and very slow service. He basically forgot about us and when we pointed this out he made no effort to improve things or apologize. In fact, he challenged us - there's that ego. You can get away with tearing me that way in Italy cause I'm an American, but you don't get to treat me like that here, jack. no tip..have never ever  done that before but this guy was a jerk.
author: CB75 B.

description: best italian restaurant in san francisco!! order the cioppino and you will NOT be disappointed! we make it a point to always come here when we are in town and we are consistently blown away by the quality of food at mona lisa.  highly recommended for an authentic italian meal!
author: Diana H.

description: AWESOME! !!!  GREAT food.  We had the Mona Lisa Pizza,   Asparagus Ravioli,  Salmon White Sauce and the Lasagna and it was fabulous.   We will be back again and again.  So worth it!!!! Loved it!!!
author: Camille F.

description: I love this place. The waiters are the real deal, the food selection is a vast list of amazing pasta dishes - we finally chose the Canelloni & Ravioli combo with a lovely marinara and my son chose the pesto gnocchi. We both loved our food. The waiter was perfect, we sat along the sidewalk and chatted with passerbys as they admired our happy expressions. It was my birthday and when we'd finished our meals the waiter came out the door with a lovely slice of Tiramasu with a lit candle, singing Happy Birthday Loudly! Others joined in and oh - the tiramisu was delightful. I love this place as it's not pretentious, the waiters are polite and efficient and friendly, the food is predictably GREAT and the ambience is perfect for North Beach casual. Highly recommended! Load of great vegetarian dishes too!
author: Doña S.

description: Was our second time here and will be our last. We walk in and there are plenty of tables open. Yet they try to cram us in a tiny two top with no room, so we move. Slightly annoying, no biggy though. Our server comes by and takes our drink order, she didn't tell us her name though, and comes back and we order an app. She then comes back and takes our order, we decided to split a pasta dish and I asked her to ask the chefs to make it spicy. She then proceeds to point at the crushed red pizza pepper at the table and says "you have those." Unreal and so so rude. We tried to look past it. The antipasto was okay, no salami tho. And the pasta was fine, a tad under cooked, expensive though at $28 especially since we were not given any utensils to crack and extract the crab from the shells with. Anyways, we tried to just finish and go but as we were eating two male servers were literally YELLING at the top of their lungs in italian I believe, at each other across the dining room to the point where multiple parties were looking up disturbed. Another side note, servers were walking in and out the door with their aprons on which is unsanitary. Needless to say, we won't be returning. Food is good but service is not worthy of the money. Also, very unprofessional to see servers on their phone and drinking wine.
author: Alexis F.

description:
Everything was kinda average. 
Ambiance is nice, food and service about average. The salmon Risotto was good but could have less garlic in it! 

 A little pricey for what you get I would say ..
author: Shirin E.

description:
OK, right off the bat, the decor is a hot mess, with statues and Italian paraphernalia everywhere. But in a cute, kitschy way. Food is alllllright, I'm sure you can find better places in North Beach but for that particular night, it did the trick: 
House salad: weird tiny cubed tomatoes on overly dressed salad - skip.
Pasta with crab and asparagus: yum, included big chunks of crab in a creamy tomato sauce.
Pasta with eggplant: yum, perfectly cooked pasta in a spicy tomato sauce with huge pieces of eggplant.

Minus some points for being a sweltering hot and a bit overpriced (I guess that's expected for a place on Columbus). I didn't regret my meal but I wouldn't come back.
author: Rina M.

description: Very nice family run venue in SF's Italian district.  Extremely enthusiastic hostess & waitstaff.  Food (Caesar salad, risotto pescatore) was good.  House Chianti was served almost warm.  Open kitchen so it was fun watching the staff.
author: Dwight A.

description:
We were on the look out for a good restaurant in North Beach at the last minute and we were debating with one of our party on an unknown empty sushi bar when we got an awesome street review of Mona Lisa by some nice folks walking by. We decided to hoof it up one more hill after I called and got us a seat in 10 minutes. The wait was 45 minutes everywhere else.

Glad we ended up there, instead of being sick from bad sushi PLUS the hangover the next day, and even though it was crowded and our waiter was way too over worked, they got us a great meal on time for us to make our show at 10 pm. Took a little too long to get our booze but our meal was very nice. I disagree about the previous review not to get seafood here... I had a very nice salmon with asparagus that was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Someone else had the lobster ravioli that I tried and that was excellent as well. 

We were also really impressed with how extensive the menu is!  We didn't have time for desert but enjoyed the friendliness of the staff despite being very busy. I liked the kitchy/ italian-euro decor.... it reminded me of another favorite place in the past. They really pack em in here like sardines so they must be doing something right!
author: Lisa J.

description: Absolutely love this place. The best Italian restaurant on Columbus St. Wouldn't go anywhere else. The meat balls are off the hook...hella good! And the fettuccine Alfredo is bomb. I order both and mix them together. I always feel I'm somewhere else when eating inside. Also perfect for an inside seating romantic date.
author: Lady L.

description: Loved this place. Had chicken saltimbocca  and spaghetti bolgnese ! Friendly servers and good atmosphere!
author: Teri A.

description: Had the Masi Campofiorin (too young, but yummy). Mozzarella with Proscuitto and "Sicilian Candy", shared Manicotti with spinach and ricotta, finished with shared Osso Bucca. No room for dessert but all the usuals were available. Service was excellent. Only wish they had a sparkling wine by the glass to start the meal.
author: Amanda R.

description:
I like this place a lot! The service was superb! I came here with a 2 of my girlfriends after a long day in the city. The neighborhood is in Little Italy..not exactly too appealing at night. It's very crowded, and busy so be aware. The man who sat outside (I believe he was the manager) was sitting us, and he was very friendly. He gave us a free appetizer on the house; he was sweet and welcomed us in right away.

When you enter the restaurant, it's heavy and very decorative. I felt like I was literally in Italy. You can see many pictures of celebrities and their autographs along the walls. I guess this place is pretty famous? The tables are all super squished together so if you stand up, you're probably standing in the way of the waiters. By the way, the employees treated us so nicely..double tip for them!

The menu contains around 300 different dishes so you can't really pick a "favorite." We actually asked the waiter for help, and he answered that there's too many to name. it really depends on your taste buds. I got the Penne Salsa Rosa and the sauce was very savory. It contained bits of tomato inside, and it's even better with the cheese that the waiter puts on top. My friends got the Spaghetti al Pomodoro (it was just regular spaghetti with marinara sauce..nothing special) and a gnochhi dish (a bit heavy if you ask me). It seems like the small portions aren't enough but it is because they also give you bread dipped in olive oil/balsamic vinegar.
author: Kayla K.

description: Love this place! Live inSF and it's a go to when we want good Italian food at a reasonable price. Large portions. So good!!
author: Erin L.

description: Been to this place several times over the past year and I want to try other things but I cant. The 4 cheese tortellini with Italian sausage is to die for. That sauce can not be duplicated. It is very rich and creamy. The staff was very courteous and friendly. I usually go on a Tuesday around 5, so it's not too busy. I also liked the baby spinach salad.
author: Tareau B.

description: Wow! Excellent customer service! Mauricio, the owner and star of the place really takes care of his customers himself. He greets serves and makes sure you're taken care of. The food is delicious. Brings you right back to a homy feel.  Great ambiance inside and out.  The place was popping the entire time we were there. Word of advice if going for dinner on a weekend avoid waiting by calling in or come before 7pm to get your seats. Wait time or not it's fantastic. Take a picture with Mauricio too!
author: Grethel C.

description: This place is like my second home. I was there last Friday celebrating my buddy's bday and of course Mauro(owner) came out, shook my hand as he always does and he set us up with a free appetizer tray. The tray was a sampler of all their starters and non disappointed. I had the chicken marino which was delicious. The bday boy had the risotto salmone, he was also happy with his meal (Btw, all of their risottos are delicious and they will gladly substitute anything you want). We sat around shot the breeze with Mauro while sipping on some beers. If you can, sit outside the people watching is great. When I asked for the check it arrived promptly with another surprise, 2 complimentary desserts. If you're in North Beach stop by and say hello to Mauro, let him take care of you.
author: Juan B.

description: By far the best Italian restaurant I have eaten at in the City.  I have been coming here for the past 15 years. They will customize any pasta dish of your liking. I have been getting the gnocchi in goganzola cream sauce with shrimp for years. It just gets better and better.  Great atmosphere and great Italians.  The service is wonderful and they strive to please!  The best of the best!!!
author: Kavon M.

description: Terrible. Boo, boo, boo. Never and nor shall I attempt ever again. I was wanting to and willing to spend well over $100 for a descent Italian dinner. The Host was not hospitable, he was rude, sexist and a complete ass. We wanted to sit outside in the late afternoon. We ordered a Caesar salad of which was obviously from a typical plastic bottled brand. We had ordered entrees as well. We were hoping for a Caprese salad at first yet, he mentioned to us ten minutes later that they happened to be out of it. We did take two bites from our salad, tried to get any attention from the crappy service, did not happen. We left $10 on the table for the two bites of nasty wilted lettuce and had great Chinese food right down the street  at the House of Nanking.
author: Out O.

description: The owner is just awesome.  My niece parked in a tow away zone and the manager moved his car so that she could take his parking spot.  He could not have been nicer or more considerate.  And we totally enjoyed our mean.  Thank you!
author: Pat J.

description: Outstanding!!! I celebrated my birthday at Mona Lisa with my family. The food was excellent and service was amazing! I had the Chicken Parmesan, my wife had the manicotti and my kids shared a fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. Though I was initially taken aback by the sides of sautéed spinach and potatoes with my dish, all of our meals were wonderful!!! The owner even parked his Mona Lisa painted Fiat in front of the restaurant and invited my kids to jump in at take a few photos... Mona Lisa is a great establishment with an outstanding staff!
author: Joe S.

description:
This is not a good restaurant to go to if you are in a rush or need to be somewhere... it is more of a leisure and relaxed type of Italian place. The wait staff is friendly and authentic, but sometimes a little less attentive than one would expect. We waited almost a half hour just to get the check... 

The menu has a huge variety, almost making it impossible to choose something, but the Sicilian candy app was delicious. The food is cooked in a nook at the front of the restaurant, and you can actually watch the chefs prepare the dishes. 

All in all, great ambiance, but a little small and cramped with inattentive wait staff.
author: Ashley s.

description:
On a rare evening out with my daughter, we planned to have dinner at a nearby restaurant but it was very crowded and noisy.  We decided to try another place a few blocks away.  Passing Mona Lisa, we were drawn in by the menu and bright, festive decor with many flags from Italy and colorful murals.  We agreed that we should take a chance.  We were pleasantly surprised.

We both ordered a glass of Chianti which was surprisingly wonderful. Then we shared the spinach, Gorgonzola and walnut salad, which was fine. I ordered a bowl of minestrone rather than a pasta dish and it was the best I have ever had anywhere, including Italy!  The broth was rich, the vegetables and pasta were perfectly done.  The waiter brought over some Parmesan cheese to sprinkle over the top to complete the dish.  We both agreed that it was a full meal with the baguette slices that were provided.  My daughter ordered, the California Pasta was creamy and rich and the pasta was cooked perfectly.  To finish our meal, we shared a delicious hazelnut dessert.

The service was attentive and but not overly so.  Once, when I was looking around the restaurant, the waiter came over to see if we needed anything.  He and the others are Italian and were friendly and charming. The Mona Lisa's prices seem comparable to similar restaurants in the city at about $40 per person, with wine and a shared dessert.

We will come back with other family members!
author: Mary M.

description:
Excellent service by waiter.  Good food.  

That's all that's needed right.  Can't ask for more.
author: Benji S.

description: My family and I had the pleasure to dine at Mona Lisa on Saturday night. After waiting an hour for the restaurant next door (yes we had a reservation), we approached the owner and hostess at Mona Lisa. They told us it would be 20 minutes or so, during which they brought us a lovely bottle of the house Chianti to enjoy street side while we waited. The food was quite good, the service and ambiance were excellent. Thanks, Mona Lisa, for saving our evening out in North Beach! We're fans!
author: Linda L.

description:
Mona Lisa makes me wish I lived closer to San Francisco. 

Back in the day, when I was an undergrad at SF State, my bf and I would head over to North Beach to check out the restaurant deals.  If you went early enough (around 5pm exactly) you could get the early bird specials.  Well Mona Lisa lured us in one of our first trips and since then, whenever we're in the city, we try to make a stop there.  

Unfortunately I don't think they do that early bird special anymore but it doesn't look like they need to.  The place always seems to have a crowd and we usually have to make reservations nowadays if we can't get there early enough to walk in.

What caught our attention, you ask?  Well the friendly staff for one.  We were going so regularly that they would hook us up with free appetizers.  Unfortunately for us, we were picky back in the day and wouldn't eat bruschetta.  It became like an episode of Mr. Bean with us hiding our food around the table so it would look like we ate it.  Over time, we now of course love it and wish we could take back those free orders.  In addition, they have the most AMAZING FOUR CHEESE sauce.  Yum!  I could live off of cheese and this sauce proves it.  You can basically order any pasta with it though we usually alternate between the tortellini or ravioli.  I prefer the latter but it is extremely rich as it is a cheese ravioli.  Their cheese sauce has driven us to try and recreate our own at home... we've found a good substitute, but we'd rather just go to Mona Lisa.

We've brought friends here who have tried other things off of the menu.  We have too, but every time, we always go back to the four cheese.  Even our friends have been amazed by how delicious it is.  So if you like cheese/alfredo sauce's, give this a whirl first, then try their other stuff.
author: Christine N.

description: I have just got finished eating here and I have no idea how anyone can say the food or service is bad.... this place is awesome... prices are right and the people and food is absolute impeccable... I would recommend this restaurant to anyone......
author: Paul S.

description:
I went to Mona Lisa restaurant yesterday. I was planning to give a 3 stars... but as soon as I got home I got sick. My stomach went upside down.

I took their "Risotto Pescatore" with seafood... it was tasty but apparently not French. My stomach got crazy.

My boyfriend got the "scampis del golfo" and was really happy with it. The atmosphere is nice but I will not go back!
author: caroline s.

description:
The best Italian Restaurant around!  The food was great, the service was great and management was the best.  Mauricio was very charming and welcoming.  The atmosphere was quaint and inviting.  The servers frequently checked in on us and the food servings were enough for 2 meals.  We laughed, ate, and we're very pleased.  I recommend this restaurant to anyone that is looking for good eats, good atmosphere, and lots of fun!  Luv ya Mauricio!  

The Sacramento Girls!
author: Shelly D.

description: After being seated, it took them over 10 minutes to get to our table.  We decided to order a few appetizers on the menu, and the waiter looked at us like we were crazy.    Once the apps came, we ordered dinner.  The waiter was in no hurry, even though there were only 3 tables in the entire place full.   The food was average, including my 2 kids meals.   The best part was the Calamari, which was the best I have had.   That being said, I left not impressed with the service, or the food.   Definitely not recommended if you have children, and even if you don't, I would think twice.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Probably the most fun I have had in San Francisco! The food was delicious.  The service was a little slow but wonderful, more like the service you get in Italy, not rushed but you feel well taken care of.  All of the servers are Italian and the owner, the host, is a charismatic fellow who entertained a majority of the night. 

If you can...sit in the Fiat!!! I'm not kidding, they have a 1951 Fiat sitting at the curb that they turn into an outside dining table; an experience that I will never forget.  People walking by were asking if they could take our pictures, people were stopping their cars on the road to take photos of us, it was a great way to spend an evening.  We had a little wine and some wonderful food; the menu is extensive and I don't think you could go wrong! 

Also, I had this Hazelnut mousse like dessert (that I could never spell the Italian way correctly) that was like the creamiest nutella that you have ever had!
author: Gussy H.

description: I feel bad writing this review because the staff was so nice, but our food was just not good. Prosciutto chicken was so rough and not tasty. Spinach ravioli was just ok. Pricey for the quality.  But the wine was good and the service great.
author: Adriana R.

description:
I randomly went to Mona Lisa with a friend the other night as we were walking through North Beach. The atmosphere looked good and it had a nice Italian decor inside. I ordered the risotto and calamari and thought both were OK. The calamari appeared to be of the processed/frozen variety as it only came in the circle shapes and was missing the calamari heads which are my favorite part. The salmon risotto was very tasty and I would recommend having it again. This place actually has a huge list of risotto items. 

On the downside I thought the service was a little slow and our table was very wobbly. Overall I would not be against eating here again but I would recommend trying somewhere different in the area next time.
author: Michael C.

description: Awesome food! So many vegetarian options. Went with a large group, including kids. Pumpkin and asparagus ravioli were delicious. The staff was friendly and personable and has good recommendations. Dessert was even better. The tartufo was a big hit and we demolished it quickly! Will definitely go back.
author: N R.

description:
We had a 7pm reservation and we were finally sat at our table at 745.  While we were waiting they tried to cancel our reservation on Open Table. During the course of the evening they did this to many others. 

Food was average Italian...nothing spectacular.  I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Laura P.

description:
Let me start off this review by saying that I am from Texas. Austin, Texas to be exact. When I walk into any restaurant I expect to be greeted warmly, chatted up by the waiter (usually), and then left the hell alone to enjoy my meal. It is the Austin way. 

I was in town for some training and a colleague and I, on recommendation of another colleague, stumbled to Mona Lisa for dinner. I'm a creature of habit when it comes to masticating my food, and whenever I'm in an italian restaurant I'll scarf down on Eggplant ANYTHING.

After pouring over the menu (because it has multiple pages all in phrases like "Eggplant -insert italian word here that Blair doesn't know-") I finally decided on the Parmigiana di Melanzane. I was BLOWN AWAY by how insanely delicious this dish was! All it was seemed to be thinly sliced eggplant delicately layered across each other to form a bit of a dome, then a divine marinara sauce was covered with Parmesean and Mozzerella strewn throughout. 

I say, "All it seemed to be", but let me tell you, dear yelpers, that it was enough! My face about exploded in happiness. The tanginess of the sauce combined with the tenderness of the eggplant and creaminess of the cheese seriously transported me to Italy. Our waiter was incredibly sincere and nice, and the doorman had quite the crush on my colleague and gave her his personal "calling card" with his crazy italian accent at the end of the night. Dinner AND a show? I'll take it!

Like I said, I live in Texas and I've legitimately thought about hopping on a plane back to SF to have a taste of this dish again. Weird? You betcha. But I'm from Austin and that's kind of our slogan!
author: Blair A.

description: Wonderful food and wine. The atmosphere was a little over the top, but enjoyable. It was on the pricier side but better than other restaurants I've had on this block. Excellent wine selection and delicious pesto.
author: Carrina F.

description:
For those of you looking for a good Italian meal-DO NOT GO HERE!  First of all with a menu of 200+ items to choose from, I was a bit overwhelmed.  I couldn't stop looking at the menu because every time I found something I wanted to order, a few seconds later I'd see something else that looked appealing.  Way too much to choose from.

Now, let's get to the food.  I finally settled on the lasagna.  It was basically a bowl of grease with some noodles and cheese swimming in it.  It was absolutely terrible and had zero flavor.  Knowing I was going to a show after dinner and wouldn't be able to eat for the rest of the evening, I tried to consume as much as I could so I wasn't starving later.  After about 5 more bites, I just couldn't stomach the grease anymore.  Thank God there was bread on the table to help fill up my empty  tummy.  

By the end of the evening-about 4 hours later, I finally made it home and not a moment to soon.  I barely made it home before I started getting sick!  Praying to the porcelain God on a Saturday night was not my idea of a good time, unless I had drank my night away and which case I would've accepted the punishment.  But since I only had a glass a wine all night, I knew my lousy dinner had to be the reason I ended up sick!  

PS-Another flaw, this place only serves beer and wine.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Yes, it's touristy, and yes, the decor is tacky, but the food was actually pretty good.

I actually preferred Raina B.'s vegetarian dish (I'm a bona fide carnivore so this means a lot). She had penne with roasted eggplant, and the sauce had this smoky flavor that was delicious and unexpected. My spaghetti and meatballs was decent comfort food, but nothing special.

The dishes are pretty pricey ($16 for a vegetarian pasta), but I guess that's to be expected for a restaurant on Columbus. Our waiter really turned up the charm and challenged my roommate to a thumb war for a complimentary tiramisu. She lost miserably, but he brought one by anyway.
author: Lisa W.

description: My husband and I only had 4 hours in San Francisco. A weird turn of events hand us land in front of Mona Lisa and it was the best mistake ever. The host, who was also the chef and owner. Put us at the table in front of the restaurant that is actually a car! My husband and I dined in the Fiat and it was one of the best experiences we've had! The food was wonderful and the portions generous. The waitstaff were so friendly and helpful! We hope that if we're ever in this area again, we can make a stop back here!
author: Courtney B.

description: I had the risotto San Francisco. Amazing!! My wife had the chicken piccata. Amazing!! Service, amazing!! We will be back!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: I had dinner here yesterday and the food was amazing.  The fettuccine was  delicious also the appetizer tower with calamari, deli meats, with fresh tomatoes and Mozzarella Cheese was  so good.  This is a item I think all diners should  enjoy with the romantic setting and Italian music that sets the mood of old world Italy.  I just can't tell you how comfortable and relaxed I felt dining here.  I dine here once every few months and enjoy the feeling of home being that I am a native of North Beach.
author: Ron L.

description: My boyfriend and I ate here a month ago and OMG. Seriously the best Italian food we've eaten ever, in our entire lives. First of all the menu is giant and wine selection vast. We shared a glass of the house red which was smooth and nice. My boyfriend had the chicken caccitora which he ordered on a bed of linguini and I had the 4 cheese ravioli in cream sauce. The entrees were bursting with flavor and the pasta was fresh and obviously home made. The portions were also huge! We had calamari to start with which were fried to perfection and came with extra lemon which is always a bonus in my book! We were just visiting and almost didn't eat here because of some of the yelp reviews but I'm so glad we did. We are both still talking about our meal there! I would totally recommend this place. Loved the lighting and ambiance too,  and the staff were very nice.
author: Jeanette L.

description:
I came here for a romantic dinner. Don't mind the mobster Italian ornateness, this place will knock your socks off. We arrived and there weren't many people there. We sat near the window and asked them to cork our wine....this was $20. Oh well. 

We skipped the appetizers and had break with oil and balsamic vinegar. 

I ordered Lobster ravioli with a creamy tomato sauce, $18. My bf ordered a seafood linguine with calamari, clams and shrimp in a marinara sauce $18. 

We decided to skip dessert. I was stuffed. I said that it was one of the best meals I ever had...the wine was good too, but I brought that. 

My recommendation: If you bring wine, bring a magnum so that its worth it, and try the lobster ravioli. It was just divine.
author: Heather H.

description: Fantastic meal!!! Cannot give a higher recommendation. We walked by Mona Lisa on our way to another eatery, it ended up being closed, and were greeted warmly by the hostess and a server. We decided to stop in on our way back and are happy we did. The server was great, he answered all of our questions and gave some outstanding recommendations. The menu is extensive but they are very accommodating and will customize your pasta dish. The antipasti plate was fresh, the mussels and clams, amazing! And the entrees, even better.
author: Phil P.

description:
Very good! My friend and I arrived around 10pm and starving. We were eager for good straight out of Italy pasta. Our hunger pains caused us to burst through the doors and we were immediately seated by the owner. 

Our eagerness and knowledge of the Italian language earned us a free appetizer by the owner. The food and the wait staff were excellent. My friend and I were so pleased with everything that we celebrated with a bottle of red wine and closed down the restaurant and later hung out with our fine Italian stallion of a waiter afterward. 

Bellissima.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Growing up in an Italian family, I was spoiled by all the great food my Grandparents and Mom made for us.  That said, I'm very picky about Italian restaraunts since they have to compare to the delicious home cooked Italian meals I'm used to having.

When our family was in SF over Christmas break we were looking for a place to eat and the owner was outside inviting people walking by to come in to eat.  He and my Mom were speaking in Italian to each other and she decided we'd eat at Mona Lisa.  It was packed, full of energy, and smelled so good.

He sat us down in the middle of the restaurant and said he would bring us a special appetizer.  What he brought out was something not on the menu, but was a special ground sausage dish that his Mother always made.  It was so good and he gave it to us complimentary.

The rest of the meal was delicious, great sauces, al dente pasta, and delicious bread.  The meats and seafood were succulent and everyone was very pleased with the dinner.

It was a great night, meal, and a fond memory of our time in SF.  Some people on here say Mona Lisa is "touristy", but if they serve really good Italian food, who cares?
author: Jeff C.

description: My husband and I love this place!!! We have been there well over a dozen times and every single time it's great! The service is always attentive and fantastic and the food is incredible! We try to order something different from the menu but the salmon with marinara is delicious and the Gorgonzola steak is one I would recommend as well. And try the Sicilian candy! We Will definitely go back again
author: Heather L.

description:
This restaurant is a hold-over from the American Italian dining experience of the 60s and 70s. The menu is too long; who wants to read through 200 entrés? It also doesn't give you confidence that they actually prepare anything well.

We tried the "family platter" of appetizers, so got a taste of various standard Italian bits and bites: buschetta, melon with prosciutto, etc. That's hard to screw up because it's largely about just getting fresh ingredients.

My entré was the baked eggplant. It was inedibly salty and pretty drab. Tomato sauce was nothing special, pasta was hard and overcooked. I complained about the saltiness but the waiter didn't offer to do anything about it. I will give it to him that he made good wine recommendations. 

The evening was on the pricey touristy side to top things off... I certainly wouldn't go back.
author: Aaron G.

description: I feel the atmosphere of a restaurant truly makes up half the dining experience & 'Mona Lisa' has definitely mastered a beautiful, romantic look inside it's cozy, charming restaurant. Our waiter was very knowledgeable & attentive. The linguini al scallops with the white wine sauce & the garlic parsley, the fritti calamari, the tiramisu, etc.. I'm getting hungry again just thinking about all the food we were served!
author: Jules F.

description:
TOURISTY ITALIAN EATERY WITH SURPRISINGLY GOOD FOOD

There was a long line outside the door so we were hesitant to ask how long the wait would be.  The host told us it would be just a few minutes so we decided to wait.  In no time, we were led into a stuffy, crowded dining room to a cozy table.  The menu had so many choices that it was hard to decide.  I thought the prices were a little steep but we were in North Beach.  We decided on the following:

Sicilian Candy--We started with a big bowl of roasted garlic that tasted delicious on the bread.

Antipasto Misto--A platter of prosciutto, salami, soppresata, olives, and assorted cheeses arrived at the table.

Spaghetti allo Scoglio--White wine sauce with shrimp, clams, mussels, and calamari were delicately tossed with perfectly cooked pasta.  I love it when the pasta is cooked al dente.

Linguini allo Squalo--L ordered the linguini with a rich tomato sauce of swordfish, salmon, shrimp, mussels, and clams.  He said the seafood tasted fresh and I totally agree.

The waiter was very entertaining and was always right there if we need more water or wine.  We were hesitant about trying this place because it seemed so touristy but we were pleasantly surprised by the friendly service and the quality of the food.
author: Rob L.

description: Our New Year's dinner was very uncomfortable. We were 3 families and asked to be split up because it would have been easier at the time of ordering our food and paying. Once we told the waiter we wanted separate tables, he became upset and rude. The food was very good, but the service and the attitude we received was terrible. My wife walked out and ran into the restaurant's owner, and explained to him what our discomfort was. I hope he listened and does something about his rude staff.
author: Daniel R.

description:
Ghetto Fabulous Italian Restaurant. 

The decor reminded me of an old Italian woman's cluttered home but it had a close familia' feel. 

The penne arrabbiata with a side of sausage (yum) was a bit above average & mixed with pink sauce per my request...cool thanks. But the crab ravioli was a bit too fishy and just OK. The Burgess Syrah really complemented the spice of my pasta. 

However, the tool of a waiter was quite annoying...trying to sucker us into getting the more expensive wine. It's one thing to know what you're talking about and know your wines but to obviously try to sneak a different wine under your nose just based on the price....classless & sneaky. The guy just wasn't comfortable in his own skin and it was obvious.
author: Barbara D.

description: Great service!  Great food!  Water glass was never empty (and I was thirsty after a weekend in Napa!) Our server Andrea is a pro, made us feel welcome and seated us right away. He took great care of us. We wandered around looking for the perfect Italian dinner experience and this was it!
author: Chad H.

description: I come to San Francisco once every month for work, and I've never missed out on coming to Mona Lisa! They have the absolute best gnocchi alfredo in the world. Something about their alfredo sauce is simply perfection. I literally think about how amazing this dish is before ever dinner I eat. Fairly priced, pleasant service, a must go to. One tip - the bread is hard and room temperature. I'd prefer soft and warm.
author: Hudson W.

description:
If you happen to be alone and want to go out to eat, this place along Columbus would be perfect. I was just checking the extensive menu in front when they commanded, "Table for one..." - and I just followed; I was hungry anyway. Whoever decorated the place just went hogwild, with the autographed photos, busts, sculptures, paintings on the wall, paintings on the ceiling, the lights in the front, the servers with Mona Lisa ties (...you can really tell who can tie a tie) - the place was a total crack up. Of course it's for tourists, but the locals can enjoy it as well.

You better have an idea of what you want to eat, it has the most offerings of an Italian restaurant I 've ever seen as it runs a couple of pages long in a small font.  I had a house salad, which I thought was tasty because they chopped the tomatoes up enough so you could really taste them. I had their cheese ravioli and osso buco (could have used more of what the dish is famous for). Both dishes were fine...but when I got the dessert menu was when I had my flashback - I was back in Rome - reading the dessert menu of about 15+ items - knowing they did not make their own desserts. Don't get me wrong. It made me wonder why their menu was so long - I hope their dishes are not premade and frozen - the food tasted fine and, frankly, if I'm in the mood, I love the Italian ornate scheme of the restaurant. 

There were lots of people in and out so I don't know if it was a combination of tourists and locals. I would go back again - it's a fun place to practice your powers of observation while having a nice Italian meal.
author: Dee Z.

description: Had dinner here 2 nights ago and loved it!!! The owner mourizio, welcomed us it and sat us right at a table bringing appetizers over on the house like we were family! Has such a great time, good food, entertaining and delightful staff. This place is a new favorite for the hubby and I!!
author: elisa I.

description: Excellent service, food and atmosphere.  The interior is very unusual and quite lovely.  The servers were so nice.  We had a table right in front of the kitchen and could see all the food preparation. Everything was wonderful.  Thanks for a fabulous experience.
author: Marian P.

description:
Mauricio the owner is the greatest host, and makes you feel at home.  I have never been disappointed with this restaurant, this is a must for anyone visiting San Francisco!

Mauricio the owner is the greatest host, and makes you feel at home.  I have never been disappointed with this restaurant, this is a must for anyone visiting San Francisco!
author: Yeshua S.

description: Mouricio was fantastico!  Love the authentic Italian Ambiance and food! Molto Benno!
author: Lina R.

description:
We happened upon Mona Lisa when we were walking through North Beach and had a hankering for some Italian (and walking through there, who wouldn't?).  This place is pretty authentic - most of the waiters looked and spoke Italian.  The service was fast and our waiter was as cute as a button.

 Anyway, the prices were cheap for San Francisco, and the food was decent.  Not the best Italian food I've ever had, but it was definitely good.  They have a HUGE menu with about a zillion types of pasta and a zillion types of sauces, so there's definitely something for everyone.  They also have a variety of meat dishes and risottos if you're not in the mood for pasta.  Overall, I'm glad we stumbled into this place, and we'll probably be back.  

Oh, and parking around that area can be a bitch, but try the North Beach garage around the corner on Vallejo between Stockton and Powell.  We had no trouble finding parking there.
author: Tricia B.

description:
Had the eggplant Parmesan tonight as it was recommended by the waiter. It was swimming in oil!! There was no breading & it seemed like just eggplant covered in cheese drenched in oily sauce. Should've opted for the pesto. Cute restaurant, cozy atmosphere. Pricey too.

Something odd happened. The bill was ~$86 & my friend put down a $100 bill. The server rejected it & asked for a smaller bill...seriously??!!! He even asked one of us to go next door to see if anyone could break a hundred! A good waiter would do that for you! Apparently the explanation was that most people charge their bills & they didn't carry much cash in the restaurant. Ummm, most restaurants I've frequented love cash & don't like credit card charges bc of the fees. So, he never accepted the $100 & my friends had to find 20s to use instead. Very strange!
author: L P.

description: Penne al forno calabrese, garlic bread with cheese and Cioppino was awesome.  The service was a bit slow and they brought our appetizer with the dinner.  Service was friendly, and drinks were filled often.
author: Jenna W.

description:
Awful.  TOURISTS BEWARE.  I live in SF, and am ashamed that I took some visiting friends here.  The food is crap, as should be obvious by any place with this large of a menu.  It's designed to attract unsuspecting tourists, and its clear the staff caters specifically to this audience.  Upon signing our check, the owner came over and told us we needed to wrap things up quickly because he had another reservation.  So rude.  We asked for our leftovers to be boxed up, and when they didn't show up back, we asked.  Our server ran to the kitchen, and came back to let us know that they were already thrown away.  No apology, no offer to correct the situation.  Just a blatant response, and he was off to another table.  As we stood up to leave, a bus boy accidentally stomped on my girlfriends foot, turned to look at her, and then went back to what he was doing.  Again, no apology.  

This place is nothing but a crap restaurant designed to churn and burn through unsuspecting tourists, with very little regard for customer service or quality.  They clearly know that they won't see any repeat business anyway, so why try.
author: Evan H.

description: Excellent Italian food. Pasta was very good, the atmosphere was nice and I had a good experience.
author: Filippo M.

description:
went here with gf for our first vday dinner
place was a little to cramped for my taste
had too many things hanging on the walls
menu was huge
if you like risotto, this place has quite a selection
food was good overall, i had the bolognese, gf had the risotto
also ordered the caesar.
finished the night with tartufo
walked out really full
willing to come back
author: Andi I.

description:
Mmmmmmmmona Lisa, I miss thee.
Walked around all the Italian places nearby before finally deciding on this one. It was a Thursday night and this place was super busy. Asked the dude in the front how long the wait was and he said he had some tables for two. We decided to sit outside although I kinda wish we would have sat inside to check out the decor. 

The waiter was prompt with our order and we decided to get the Spaghetti Aglio e olio and the Penne Salsa Rosa. They served us some bread and butter while we waited for our food, and we got to people watch until our food arrived. My Penne Salsa Rosa was amazing, it tasted just how I had imagined it. My friend liked his as well but he said it was a little too oily for him. I could only finish 3/4 of it because I had eaten a few hours prior. I wish I had more room so I could have tried some dessert or at least finish my pasta :( . 

The italian guy in the front kept talking to us in italian and according to my friend he kept saying to eat up, since we were both pretty stuffed with food still on our plates. The owners are really nice and warm with customers and the waiters are pretty attentive, or water was being filled up every 5 minutes. It took a while to get our check, but it was pretty busy and I didn't mind.

Loved this place, want me some Sala Rosa.
author: Saralee C.

description:
Like said by other Yelp reviewers below, this is another busy Columbus Ave tourist trap restaurant that pumps out mediocre meals in a crazy crowded, noisy, uncomfortable room.

I gave the place an unflattering & honest review on SFsurvey.com last year.

Just got a hate e-mail from the owner's nephew, Tellin' me "to shut my trap or he'd shut it for me".  Now there's a marketing plan to invite and welcome customers!

Do you need to eat here?   Didn't think so!
author: Tom S.

description: A very authentic Italian eating experience. The food was outstanding, our server was great, and the owner spoke with us for a while as well. We have been all over Italy and the restaurant is just like the old country.  Highly recommended!
author: Tony G.

description: I had mixed experience with this place. The first time I went there a few years ago, the food, wine were amazing. I went back recently, the pizza I order was so watery. Disappointed.
author: Desmond L.

description:
Pros:
Pretty good food & wine

Cons:
Rude / stuck up servers
Warm water (no ice)
Poor ventilation / WAY too hot inside

I should have realized something was off when this was the only place nearby that doesn't have at least a half hour wait for dinner. Oh well.
author: Mike J.

description: Love there food so good & great wine list wonderful indoor scene very neat pics & decore all over so cool I always go here when I am visiting S.F :)
author: Shaynapet M.

description:
I made a last minute reservation for 10 at Mona Lisa on the afternoon of NYE. The restaurant was very kind about accommodating us and even held our table for us when we ran thirty minutes late.

The menu is very large... a little on the overwhelming side especially because everything sounded great. We started with the Bruschetta, Calamari Fritti, and Sicilian Candy --- the first two were standard but the Sicilian Candy was very yummy and of course garlicky so  be sure to bring some gum if you plan to order this! : )

For the main course, I ordered the Salmone con Gamberetti alla Crema and it was SO very good!! I tried the Risotto al Porcini and Gnocchi al Gongorzola from friends at the table and both dishes were excellent. Another friend ordered the Chicken Marsala and it was oddly sweet in a not so good way, so I would recommend staying away from it. For dessert we had the Cappuccino Truffle and it was incredibly delicious.

The place is small but cozy with beautiful ceiling art and the service was friendly. Thank you Mona Lisa for a lovely NYE dinner - we had a fabulous time dining with you!
author: Komal P.

description:
Great Feeling to feel Italian For one knight the owner great host very good hearted 
The service is great and the food is excellent  Was there on a week end and we had a great time waiting in  line  the place was completely  full and the  owner was able to please every one ether with wine or an antipasto on the house 
I recommend These place if you want to have a good Italian meal
author: Giovanni L.

description:
If you can look past the touristy location and stale standards (sorry Frank and Tony), you'll find surprisingly good pasta. My penne with house tomato sauce and some grilled chicken was better than expected, and my grandparents would have shared my appreciation for the massive bowl of parmesan cheese the waiter brings to top off your dish.

Ambiance is so so (cavernous and busy) and prices are high. But the food is worth a visit, perhaps on a day you decide to play tourist in your own town.
author: Jason B.

description:
This was certainly the worst Italian food I've ever had. If you can call it food. And this dining experience certainly is in the running for worst paid meal I've had in some time. 

We wanted to go to Franchino's. We walked over there after consuming some delicious Dead Guys at the Rogue Public House. Unfortunately, it was closed. In our inebriated, famished state we looked around for the first place that looked decent. And there, before us was Mona Lisa. It looked clean, inviting and pleasant inside, so after checking Yelp to see that it had a decent 3.5 rating, we decided to give it a go. 

We realized upon entering that there weren't that many people in the restaurant and all of the patrons were crammed in the front of the house to give the illusion of a very busy cafe. Oh well, we had a nice spot by the window. We ordered - garlic bread with cheese, Chicken Saltimbocca and Spaghetti Carbonara - really standard, generally very easy to prepare Italian fare. 

Ugh. I'm still trying to shake the garlic bread. So unbelievably garlicky. So unbelievably bad. My pores are oozing garlic. My breath is so incredibly smelly and this, over 24 hours later. I don't know if the garlic was bad or if there was simply too much of it but it's a powerful stench. And I love garlic. 

Then the Spaghetti Carbonara. Salty. So salty. And then I found a giant piece of egg shell in my food (unfortunately too late, I was crunching on shell for the rest of the night). The Saltimbocca was watery, raw looking and had a smell to it. Not a pleasant saltimboccay smell. 

Anyway, we alerted the waiter to the shell in my carbonara. He apologized but that was it. No adjustment to the bill. 50 dollars later, I spent the plane ride home to DC gripping my stomach and hoping that my row partners couldn't smell the stench of garlic upon me. If this is what passes for Italian food in San Francisco you can count me out. I don't know a single Italian from Rhode Island (the Italian capitol of the country) that would serve nor prepare what I ate. 

Curse you Franchino's for being closed!
author: Mindy S.

description: The Mona Lisa was such a great experience! We were able to meet the owner of the restaurant the minute we were seated and he was nothing but nice! All of the staff was great! Our drink orders were taken right away, and the service was prompt. The atmosphere of this restaurant is so relaxing. We sat outside on the patio and were able to watch the city goers. It was such a great experience I am looking forward to the next time I can make it
author: Megan N.

description: When I was in San Francisco I was craving Italian food and the name Mona Lisa stood out to me! I ordered chicken fettuccini alfredo, it was so yummy. I had a salad before the meal with bread and butter. It is a romantic atmosphere for a nice night out with your other half.
author: Naomi D.

description:
Where's that 1/2 star when you need it?  2.5 stars for this Italian joint.  I would've rounded up but I paid good money for a meal and I didn't get anything in return.

Me and the GF decided to have an adventurous Friday night.  Get totally wasted and walk around North Beach aka Lil Italy looking for some squid ink pasta for her.  We walked on and off the beaten path and ended up here, Mona Lisa Restaurant.

First off, if you let someone sit outside on a fairly cold night, you should give them a discount.  I felt like I was an hour advertisement for this place since there was a lot of foot traffic and everyone and their mama was looking at our food.  

On to the food...
Garlic bread:  It was basically the free bread that they gave but with butter and garlic.  It wasn't even soft and fresh.

Antipasto Misto (meat n cheese appetizer):  The prosciutto was good.  Unfortunately, the meats were a bit cold.  Not so fresh cold cuts from the fridge? Probably.
