Lingiuni al Nero di Seppie (squid ink pasta):  The GF was so disappointed.  The squid ink did not taste fresh at all.  She something along the lines of "I didn't know you can get squid ink in a can." Nuff said...

Risotto allo Scoglio (Seafood risotto made with a white sauce):  Very bland flavor.  The prawns were overcooked, had itsy bitsy clams, and I don't think I saw the mussels.

Normally, being drunk lowers the bar for flavor in my food.  This place just did not satisfy that drunk hunger we had and everything was less than okay.  The best part of the meal:  It was Friday night and I was drunk. :)
author: Suzi K.

description: The worst place to eat in San Francisco! There are so many other places to eat that are better with better service! I just ate here recently and our server sucked!!!! And this place is clearly family owned because all the servers pay attention to their family/friends drinking espresso outside. The only way they want to talk to you is if you put your credit card out on the table before even bringing the check to you!! The price for what you get is over priced!!! They barely give you anything for a plate that cost $20 the server completely left my table never took our plates not brought the check! I will never eat here again!!!! And the food is plain!!! Buyer beware!!!
author: Crystal H.

description: Mona Lisa Restaurant just had some great pasta from the this North Beach Italian restaurant. I also find the staff very friendly and helpful. Plan to continue return the next time I am in the area.
author: Michael N.

description: A North Beach tradition!  One of the best Italian restaurants in San Francisco.  You can't go wrong no matter why you order from the menu.  Highly recommended!
author: Jordan A.

description: Bad ass dinner! Food was amazing! Best meal I had in San Francisco. The gentleman that saw us in was a true gentleman and the waiter was perfect. The whole dinner was a great experience.
author: George B.

description:
I love their ambiance and outdoor seating. 
The food is pretty good too (I guess it's hard to ruin Italian Food: a lot of pasta, sauce and salt).
Be sure to tell them that it is your birthday, so they would give you a free piece of dessert.
author: S ..

description:
This place has a VERY LARGE MENU. I have not tried nearly half, but I love it because a few things. 

1. Their cioppino is a repeat order. I love to order a side of cooked spaghetti to mix in with the soup once it's half eaten. Changes the meal a bit. 
2. Sicilian Candy (roasted whole garlic cloves) is also great used as a bread spread. 
3. They have plenty of wine to choose from, but I tend to stick with the Chianti Rufina. Something about Chinati and Sicilian/ Italian food is a must. 
4. The staff is awesome and the owner loves his heritage and conversation. 

I would love to sit in this restaurant all day and try a bite of everything for a more legit review, since they have so many different things to offer.
author: Rox T.

description: The owner of this restaurant is such a sweetheart! My cousin plays on his son's soccer team  and he really spoiled us! There's like appetizer tower THING that is seriously incredible. If you wanted to just share that with a few people and have some wine, you would be in great shape! Strongly reccommend for everything from a romantic night out to a fun girls' night. Great place that is as "North Beach" as you can get.
author: Krista K.

description:
I was frightened that it was a tourist trap, but my Mom wanted to stop and since it was the first place she was even slighted interested in I agreed. I am so very glad I did!

We sat outside for lunch and had a wonderful view of the church across the street, so Nice ambiance, check.

The maitre'd (owner?) was cheeky Italian, insistent that his place is the best, and we obviously deserved the best. Treated well, check.

There was an entire bus-load of Italian tourists eating inside, and they all seemed very pleased with their experience. Must be a good sign!

Thanks to the full house, our waiter was incredibly busy. He was still polite and made sure we knew we mattered also. Another treated well, check.

Now for the food...WOW! I had the Gamberoni Piccata, and my mom had the Fettuccine Mona Lisa. In spite of enormous portions, we cleaned our plates. The house bread is wonderful too. Terrific food, check.

I feel it may help to mention that I live in Houston, and it's not bragging to say we have our fair share of fantastic restaurants. I am truly picky, and can say that Mona Lisa is top-notch.
author: Rae D.

description: I have been here a few times. Love the food so much I am taking my children who are very picky eaters there. They will love it.
author: Robert H.

description:
For my 21st birthday I wanted my family to get together and have a great Italian meal as well. Now my family and I are frequent visitors to San Francisco, so we were looking for something that would send us over the top. What we found was this little whole in the wall, meet your neighbor next to you, and scrumptious food. The staff was wonderful. 
Now to the food: I had Tortellini with a fresh pesto sauce that was amazing, my mouth is watering as I am typing this. All the other dishes that my family had were amazing as well. The Veal Mona Lisa was exquisite, it tasted like butter. I  am planning to celebrate my 24th birthday in San Francisco this year, I believe we will be stopping by to enjoy this wonderful place again.
author: Quelli L.

description:
This is the third time I've been here,  should have written this review a long time ago.  A party of about 12 of us,  food was excellent from all the conversation around the  table.  Good salads and they brought out a killer appetiizer platter.    Very good prices, super service, at the end of the birthday event they brought out a bunch of small desserts,  so I give them a solid 5 stars.
This is the kind of place that North Beach is all about, great service and food and just an enjoyable event, they treated us very well. 

Great italian food, huge variety, well prepared,  as  good as it gets in the City !!
author: Neal G.

description:
So this review is a bit tricky....

I would have given a 3 1/2 star review for this place for the food and service. 

Upon leaving the restaurant however, I removed my purse from the hook, which was hanging under the table and noticed something moving. Upon closer inspection I saw that it was in fact a cockroach. 

This cockroach apparently had climbed into my purse from under the table. 

I didn't want to make a huge scene as the restaurant was full, but maybe I should have let out the supressed scream after all. 

The manager offered to comp us wine for our next visit, which quite frankly will never happen!  

I walked to th nearest parking lot, dumped the contents of my purse, and retrived said bug. 

After getting the little critter into a envelope, I returned to the restaurant and was met on the sidewalk by the manager. 

I handed him the bug and he offered to comp the bill. 

I appreciated this although sadly, I was left with a bad feeling in my stomach and a strong desire to chuck the remaining contents of my purse into the nearest garbage can.
author: Therese H.

description:
just because this restaurant located in the heart of columbia street and in the middle of italian neighborhood.... this restaurant has horrible food and bad service. i ordered italian choppinno for $32.00. pasta with italian sausages for 29.00. what of waist of money, stay away!
service was bad...the waiter rush us out, pick up our plates before we finish eating! no water or bread has been offered.
author: Boris S.

description: Mona Lisa's is THE Italian restaurant in San Francisco. If you are looking for great service, kind staff, and amazing food, this is the place for you. I had the Mona Lisa chicken and my boyfriend enjoyed the spaghetti with garlic, olive oil, and clams; we enjoyed every bite. For dessert, you MUST get the tiramisu! I WILL be coming back to this restaurant in the future.
author: Brittney G.

description:
Pros: Romantic. There is a candle in the middle of the table, and it's pretty dim inside. There's a lot of decorations, perhaps too much? The guy that worked there was really friendly. He lured us in when we were standing outside looking at the menu haha.

Cons: There is a huge light hanging from above that blocks your view from the person sitting across from you. Not a problem for me because I'm short but could be if you're really tall. The music is SO loud! (I thought they were playing Japanese techno but it's all Italian). It's a bit expensive. The average meal is ~$17 with little portions! We ordered the black squid and the fettuccine primavera. The fettuccine honestly wasn't that special. The squid is good, if u like that.
author: Vicki L.

description: Great pasta from scratch with delicious sauces.  This is the place this chinese kid takes his eye-talian friends to eat.  We've always had great food and service here.  They even took my reservation that I yelled out on a double decker your bus as we passed the restaurant: " table for 2 at 7 pm please Mauricio!!!". Sure the folks on the bus were impressed by my manners and cultur, but who wouldn't?   My fav is the veal milanese with beef ravioli.  Their alfredo sauce is really good also.  With indoor and outdoor seating, this place is a must visit.
author: Doug W.

description:
This review is long overdue and based on the actual experience rather than the food (did not actually eat a full meal here):

On a first date we went "Italian restaurant hopping" down North Beach. Getting an appetizer at one place, main course at another, etc etc. 

Anyway, as we were walking down a friendly man said hello and to please come in! We said we'll just have a glass of wine since we just ate and still welcomed in. 

We asked to sit outside because it was such a nice night out. The owner of the restaurant [I think] also came outside to say hello. I honestly forget how the subject came up, but we had told them we were on a first date and they went all out for us. 

They brought us a candle outside to make it romantic. Brought us some cheese for the wine we were sipping on and basically made the entire experience something to remember. 

They never made us feel unwelcome because we just wanted a glass of wine. 

Unfortunately, we did not try any of the main dishes, but on our anniversary we plan to repeat our path down and will definitely make it a point to come here again for some Italian food and wine!
author: Wendy M.

description:
Went there with a large group the other night.  In fact, we took over the restaurant.  Five out of six of us at my table were disappointed.  My veal marsala was tender, but pretty much tasteless and served luke warm.  Fellow diners who tried the parmigiana were underwhelmed by the sauce.  
The salads were not impressive and most of us left our dessert, tiramisu (I think) on our plates. 

Maybe the restaurant is okay for individual tables, but they cannot handle large groups.
author: Suzie S.

description:
Was treated like royalty last weekend at Mona Lisa. Wasn't planning on staying and eating. Just wanted to sit and relax our feet from walking all over the city the entire day. The owner and the waiter both greeted us, and brought out the menu. Couldn't say no to authentic Italian pizza, so we split one while sitting out on the patio.

The wooden convertible Fiat 600 was parked outside the restaurant, I thought it was just a regular car parked like everyone else. Tourists and passers-by kept photographing it.

The owner was very charismatic and definitely knows how to market his restaurant. Once we were done our pizza, he set up a plank/table above the front seats and gestured me to sit in the back of the car. That's where me and my friend ordered pizza and felt like celeb's while random people walking by started taking our photos. It was a hilarious, unforgettable experience with fantastic food and dessert.

Taking away a star because the waiter seemed to ignore our request of no onions on the pizza - he was telling me it was good for my stomach and I had to have it. I really despise onions, I will eat anything but onions. Thought that was a little strange, but maybe that restaurant doesn't like to customize things on their menu. Understandable. So I picked the onions off :)
author: Nancy H.

description: We tried this restaurant a year ago while in San Francisco. It was so good that it was a must stop again this year on our vacation.  The owner is very friendly and allowed my daughter to take a picture in his vintage Fiat parked outside. Custom paint job with Mona Lisa on the Hood and all wood interior. It definitely attracts attention for the business. The place is filled with Italian memorabilia which gives it an authentic Italian feel. The fact that the staff all speak Italian does that as well. They have an extensive menu, but if you want something custom they will do that for you as well. So far, we have only made it through the first few pages and ordered the pasta dishes and they have been very flavorful. Good homemade pasta and excellent sausages. If you like good Italian sausage than by all means try theirs. Their wine selection is also favorable. Plan on spending an hour to an hour and a half for dinner just to enjoy the atmosphere. Save room for desert, as they have a great and flavorful selection of those as well.
author: Robert G.

description:
Three of us had lunch at Mona Lisa last weekend, on a busy summer Saturday, and the food was ok. That's kind of a problem for me since you aren't paying 'ok' prices. It was expensive for lunch. The service was alright but spotty. We were seated right away but then it took quite some time to get water and then even longer for them to check back on us. 

One of the girls in my group had the lobster ravioli which we all agreed could've been crab. It didn't have that sweet or rich lobster flavor we would have liked. 

All in all I would say it was ok but in North Beach you rarely need to settle for OK.
author: J. M. J.

description:
The food is really great and the seafood dishes were fresh and tasty. They have a plethora of menu items to choose from -- it was really hard to choose, so I'll probably have to make another visit to try the other things that looked good.

The nice, breezy outdoor seating made for a relaxing meal with a bonus of people watching. The waiter was attentive and the gentleman at the next table raved about how it was the only Italian restaurant in North Beach that he frequented.
author: Kim L.

description:
Went on saturday night cause had friends in town and had an amazing night. First of all the menu is very extensive. We shared the calamari and prawn appetizer and that was crispy and done just right. We then ordered the crab linguini and the chicken cacciotore for our entree meals. The food was super delicious especially the chicken. We ended the meal with their Tiramisu dessert...Was super delicious..Cant even explain how delicious it was...

So overall a great experience- the waiter was super great as well...

We will definitely be back!:)!

Parking is atrocious so make sure you take a cab or something...thats the downside!!
author: Veee W.

description:
I've been coming to Mona Lisa for several years now, and have always had a really consistent experience. My fiance's family has been going here for at least 7 years now, and it's our go-to Italian place when they visit us here in SF.

You CANNOT judge the food by the surroundings. The place is... over the top, to say the least. When they say Mona Lisa, they friggin' mean it. There is literally a ten foot Mona Lisa plastered to the ceiling. Ridiculously ugly murals everywhere, tons of autographed photos, dozens of random flags... they have found use for about 98% of all wall and ceiling real estate. I'm surprised they haven't started using the floor.

ALL of that being said - we love it here! The staff is excellent. They treat us like gold. Always very helpful, funny, and kind. They always seem to be hustling, but never once have we not been treated right. Smiles seem to be constantly draped across all their faces, and they treat each other like family. I can only assume some of them are.

The food is also great. The portions are, as expected based on the decor, massive and glorious. Huge plates, excellent sauces, and great, great veal. My personal favorite is the veal picata. The downside to their great food is the ridiculously overdone menu. Instead of just saying "we have these ten sauces, these 5 noodle types, and these 8 meats" they literally write down every possible combination. Just reading the menu is exhausting. 

Overall, I really like this place. The reasons they get docked a star - 1) the menu. 2) every time I take someone new here, I have to preface their terrible decorum. I feel like it's so overdone that it detracts from the place. Great food though, and I'll be returning for a long time coming.
author: Nick B.

description: Food was great, with a pretty good sized menu of Italian favorites! Great atmosphere, and all of the staff were yelling back and forth to each other in Italian! Does it get any better? LoL! We had the calamri to start which was ok. Then ordered Veal Parm, and Lasagna. Soooo good, but got stuffed, had to take the rest to go!
author: Sean D.

description: Mona Lisa Restaurant is our FAVORITE place to eat when we're in SF!!!! It is ALWAYS good, from the food, to the service, to the view(outside tables are always my favorite) you get to enjoy great food and watch everyone walking by(checking your food out)  and cars, buses, bicyclist going by!! Great time every time!! Also, we all love sitting outside, because we get to chit chat with the owner, Maurizio, GREAT guy!!!!!! Always happy to see us and we ALWAYS get great service from him and all employee's there!!!! I would highly recommend this restaurant to everyone!!! There are many restaurants to choose from, but Mona Lisa is by far THE BEST ONE IN TOWN!!! We've been there many many times and we'll be back soon!!! Service and food has been PERFECT every time!!! Great authentic Italian food!! BEST Cesar Salad EVER!!! Bruschetta is great and also the Fettuccini Alfredo, DELICIOUS!!!!! Don't forget the desserts....VERY VERY YUMMY!!!  :) :) :) We'll drive from Turlock(Central Valley) about an hour in a half to two hours, just for dinner here...it's really that good!!!
author: Debbie A.

description: Absolutely scrumptious!  David Beardman had the Chicken Mona Lisa and I had the Saltimboca. Both are fantastic. Can't wait to go back.
author: Steve J.

description: Awesome experience, by far the best Italian food I've had! The restaurant itself is real nicely decorated, I've never been to Italy but it felt like I was there! Staff is real attentive and courteous. Only flaw is that they do not have a full bar like they said they do! Both me and my fiancé loved it, we were there for our 5 year anniversary and we couldn't have picked a better place!
author: Angel C.

description:
I just went there for the first time last with my husband and his family and we can't wait to go back. First of all the ambiance is great and makes you feel like you've been transported to Italy. The combination of painted murals, lighting and other decor elements gave it a great vibe. We were greeted by a very nice Italian guy at the door who walked us to our table right away. 

Once we were seated is when our wonderful evening really began. Our server Franchesco was great!! He was very friendly and provided us with top notch service. 

We started by ordering the Sicilian candy (roasted garlic), caprese salad, and calamari. Each item was better than the next, yumm! My husband had the Penne al Forno, my brother in law had the calzone, and us girls split the meat lasagna and parpalle porcini (I think that's how it's spelled). For dessert we split the tiramisu and some cream puff soaked in rum......yuuuummmmmie! Since I had a chance to taste each item I can say honestly that everything was extremely good and I can't wait to go back. 

We had such a great time that we are planning to make it a once a month event with the family event and we will definitely ask for Franchesco again! Ciao!
author: Lynette M.

description:
It seems like people either love or hate this place!  I'm in the minority since thought it was fine.  Not amazing, not horrible, just decent, solid pasta and snacks.  I pass Mona Lisa twice a day, every work day.  On the way home, the owner/staff is usually outside beckoning passerby inside, like most places in North Beach.  I'm always thrilled when one of the two tiny Fiats are parked outside - so cute!

Last Friday afternoon around 6 pm I passed by a table of (Italian) folks dining al fresco - looked like so much fun and the bruschetta and calamari looked delish.  So we headed inside - WHOA.  Decor is jam-packed, over the top, filled with all manner of themed pictures and knick-knacks.  Made us wonder if this was all part of the original set-up, or if everything had accumulated over time.  

Anyway.  Bread came straight away and was a little stale, not my favorite.  I am big on bread.  We ordered calamari and bruschette which were both good, a little heavy.  We split tomato gnocchi, which came nicely separated out into two little bowls.  Very nice, the gnocchi itself was just okay, weirdly soft for some reason.  Service was very nice - a little over the top theatrical, but attentive and very friendly.  Overall a fun place, but with all the similar restaurants in NB, not sure I'd go back.
author: Jaimie M.

description:
I'd give 4.5 stars if I could, because the food was very good, but not mind-blowing, so I'll have to round down. I'd definitely go back here again, though. It was a hot day over the weekend, and my gf and I were wandering around looking for some Italian food for lunch with outdoor seating. We saw an empty table on the sidewalk at the Mona Lisa and grabbed it. 

I had the Ravioli Granchio (crab ravioli), and she had the Spaghetti alle Vongole (spaghetti with clams). Both were excellent. The prices were pretty standard, and the service was good.
author: Carl R.

description:
Had the Antipasto Misto, Tortellini al Pesto, and tried some of my boyfriend's gnocchi, tried a bit of my sister's Lingiuni al Nero di Seppie.

I really liked the Antipasto Misto, the prosciutto and cheese was soooo yummy. And for the pasta, I can't decided if the Tortellini is better or the Gnocchi (I forgot which sauce it came with... but it was either the Gongorzola or the Four Cream Cheese Sauce.) I like the Tortellini al Pesto, because of the delicious pesto sauce. But the gnocchi was so creamy and soft. 

The Lingiuni al Nero di Seppie was ok, it isn't as rich as the tortellini and gnocchi. But it still had a lot of flavor. Not to bad, but definitely like the others more.

The service was ok, but inside the restaurant felt really small and cramped. Still, the food is really good. I would definitely come back.
author: Alicia W.

description:
So, this last week I twice stopped by the Mona Lisa with mixed results.

On my first visit, everything was quite fantastic from the server to the food. Absolutely magnificent!

Tonight however, only the food shined through. The service was atrocious. I ordered for takeout and unknowingly my order was short an item. Unfortunately I didn't realize this until I was already home and didn't feel like walking back.

All in all, I'd say the food is a very solid 4.
Service is really hit or miss.

If you get a chance, try the Fettucini Leonardo, magnifico!
author: Tanner E.

description: Food was low grade dog food, WAY over priced and THEN we read the yelp review from 4/6/12 from someone saying they saw ROACHES! Then we saw duct tape on the baseboards and up the wall so we couldn't help but frantically search for roaches! We were truly disgusted! To top the evening off, the service was pathetic! But that's not where it ends.........After we left no tip and a note saying horrible service, the waiter chased us down the street and made a huge scene on the corner!
author: M D T.

description: The cab driver recommeded this place. The place is small but the food was excellent. The service was not bad either. Would have given 5 stars if they had some more wines on their winelist that were under $40. Only option was to get their house wine that they serve by the glass.
author: Jay S.

description: My family ate here on our vacation to San Francisco, as it was recommended to us by friends, and we are very happy that we did! Being from New York, we struggled to find an Italian restaurant in California that met our standards, and this one exceeded them! The menu is very extensive! My mother, who is vegetarian, had absolutely no problem finding an entree that she would enjoy. The waiters spoke Italian, which was a nice touch, and was at our table multiple times during the meal to make sure that everything was okay! It was actually one of the cheapest restaurants we ate at, as well!
author: Veronica P.

description: Mona Lisa is to me what Alioto's was to my mom.  Whenever I'm back home, I come here, I take friends there and I recommend it to everyone that loves authentic Italian food. The servers are so nice and Italian and the decor is also authentic.  As for the food, everything is good.  I personally love the Insata de Mare, seafood salad and the Ravioli Aragosta (lobster ravioli):)
author: Heidi D.

description: Wonderful atmosphere on New Year's Eve. Delicious food. Maurizio the host has been the most hospitable.
author: Jeff Y.

description: Tourist trap to the extreme -- that being said, the interior has a cozy North Beach interior with authentic Italians as waiters and authentic Mexicans as cooks. The pasta tasted fresh and homemade, but simple dishes like the antipasti mixto felt they came from Costco. Lobster in the ravioli tasted canned. My asparagus ravioli was nice, but not at the prices they charge. The service was pushy; when my friend asked for recommendations it always would default to the highest items on the 500 item menu (over $40 for seafood pasta -- at this place -- give me a break). The kicker was the handwritten receipt where the waiter manually writes in "Grauity (sic) is not included". All this after being so pushy, flirtatious with my friend-girl (jeez, we could have been on a date for all he knew). Overpriced. Overburdening. Not worth the deal.
author: Christopher C.

description:
I went to dinner at this restaurant with a friend over labor day weekend.

The food was alright. I do have to give them credit, because I ordered some steak dish rare, and most places dont have the balls to cook it rare.  To my surprise, my meat came out very red. The food was pretty good and to my satisfaction, however, I didn't like how the only knife I got was a butter knife, and when I asked for a knife to cut my steak, they gave me a pointy butter knife instead.  The cut of meat definitely was not filet mignon, but it was more like flank steak. There was a bit of tendon in there that I needed a chainsaw to cut with. I managed to eat the meat after sawing the meat with the dull butter knife.  

The decor of the place was nice. The ceilings and walls are painted very nicely. 
The prices of the food seemed reasonable. I came here once and left content. Not sure if it's worth a repeat visit.
author: Richard D.

description:
It was the first day of February...what better way to celebrate than to surround myself with hot Italian waiters and solid Italian food?

Why, oh why did I stray from my very like-able Franchino???  I -always- seem to stop in when I'm in town, but to be quite honest, there's something about the guy there that I just can't put my finger on.  As I was walking up the street, with every intention to stop in and order my favorite pasta dish, I encountered "the man" standing on the sidewalk chatting with passerby.  For whatever reason, I decided to go to Mona Lisa instead.

The first thing I loved was I did, indeed, get surrounded by thick accented waiters.  That didn't hurt my feelings at all.  I ordered a glass of Chianti and while perusing the menu, thought about going with veal (sorry Tina R.) but instead decided to compare a salmon pasta dish that was on their menu.  It sounded so similar to the dish I had planned on ordering at Franchino.  It wasn't even close.  I had to shake a little salt and pepper on it, and those are two ingredients I almost never use in restaurants.  This dish, the salmon with pappardale (sp?) noodles, fell flat.  It lacked much flavor other than the taste of the salmon.  There wasn't a garlicky, lemony, robust flavor that I'm used to.  Sigh.

Much to Mona Lisa's credit, I'd previously visited on a few occasions in years past and found other dishes I'd had to be quite enjoyable.  I've had the veal marsala and their chicken parmesan, and both were total wins back then.  

All in all I would return, but if I had to rate based on the bread and my salmon pasta I had that night, I might only give two stars.

The waiters tho....OMG.
author: Michele D.

description:
I have been reading some of these negative reviews and must say my party and I did not experience anything close to what they have to say.

I attended with my friend Carl, and Chewbacca made an appearance (you'll have to see for yourself).

We were greeted by the very friendly manager (owner?) with a glass of wine. This made us feel at home and we don't even speak Italian :). It was a Monday night, but the place was still pretty packed. After a brief conversation with the manager over our complimentary glass of wine, we were promptly seated.

The manager recommended bruschetta and calamari. When he saw that we only ordered the calamari, he brought us a plate of bruschetta to try. These unexpected treats where management goes out of their way to surprise and make you feel welcome are part of Mona Lisa's charm and uniqueness. This is true Italian hospitality. The Calamari Fritti was superb as well, and I'm picky with my calamari.

Before our main dish, we ordered a bottle of Merlot per the server's suggestion. We relied on the server because the wine list was so long. His recommendation was great; we went through 3 bottles of it over the course of our meal.

For my main dish I had the Lasagna al Pesto, which is cheese lasagna with pesto sauce. To die for. My friend Carl had the Tagliata di Manzo, steak with rosemary. Before he gobbled it down I had a couple bites. Simple, succulent, everything a steak should be. Just enough garnish to bring the taste out without distorting it; a fine balance.

It might have been because we ordered 3 bottles of wine :), but the manager insisted that he also treat us to dessert. He brought out homemade Tiramisu and Coppa Caffe, along with a cappuccino for each. I've bounced around North Beach for awhile and have yet to find better Tiramisu.

Ambiance and mood were nice. The Mona Lisa painting on the wall demanded most of my attention. High ceilings are important to me (repressed claustrophobia perhaps?) and Mona Lisa provides enough breathing space for me to feel comfortable. The open kitchen is also a plus.

Mona Lisa is a place I'd bring a date or a few buddies. It's romantic and quiet in parts, but expansive enough that a larger table can raise the volume a bit.
author: Matt G.

description: If you're looking for a tasty gluten free pizza then go here. The spices really make it tasty. The only thing is the size. I thought we would get a large pizza for $18 but it was really a single portion size. The service was slow and we had to ask for water but being at a window table helped because it's a fun place to people watch. The owners are very friendly and even let people sit in their vintage 62 fiat that's parked in the front. I would definitly go back.
author: Beth K.

description:
Be warned, $3 tea does not come with complimentary refills, something I might expect from a high-end restaurant, but this is not!

Anyway, I took my visiting mom last night since I liked it so much the first time. My mom's chicken marsala was unexciting,  my shrimp and asparagus in light cream sauce was very good but my boyfriend's veal parmigiana was far too salty, as was the spinach it came with. 

I doubt I'll return again.
author: Cristina S.

description:
I have NO idea how this place gets such horrible ratings.  I have dined at MANY restaurants in the city and this one ranks in my top 3, for sure.  

yes, the restaurant is a tourist trap.  Then again, isn't all of North Beach and Chinatown a tourist trap??  If you are here from out-of-town, do NOT expect to get your midwestern Ragu sauce-in-a-jar here.  This is authentic Italian food, and hands-down **THE** best ciopinno in San Francisco!!  

The service here is incredible.  Both Giovanni and Wilson are extremely attentive, and very knowledgeable about the food and the wine.  They have never made me feel rushed, only welcome -- as if I were a fellow member of their close Italian family.

LOVE this place !!!
author: melissa c.

description:
Good food isn't enough to get above a 3 star. Service is lousy!  They focus more on getting you in the door than being a waiter to you. I'm sure other neighboring restaurants are more attentive to the customer.

An example of bad service is I was ready to order a shot of limoncello after dinner.   The waiter took so long to come back to us, i just asked for the bill.  This is no joke, no exaggeration!

The food here, however, is tasty and just down right satisfying. Your call really.
author: Craig T.

description: Charming spot in north beach. I love the old school ambiance. Service was great. Food was great. I had the chicken Mona Lisa and my date had the fettuccine Leonardo. Both dishes were great. I loved that the chicken was thin and the prosciutto on top was so good. For an appetizer we had the prosciutto de melon. Such a simple dish and the ingredients melded so well with each other. A perfect balance of salty and sweet.
author: Linda N.

description: The staff here is always so attentive and friendly that I actually think it makes the food taste a little better...not that it needs much help, but it does make a difference to me ; }  I was here recently for Dinner on a Wednesday evening and much to my surprise...found the place packed with happy diners...we were still seated almost immediately and no one even batted an eye at our very casual summer clothing in contrast to the very well dressed diners around us...bonus points for no snotty attitude. It may have been senior citizen night because at almost 50 I felt like a spring chicken in there and really got a kick out of all the crazy flirting going on...but who could blame them? There are very Italian, very attractive people working in North Beach...just sayin ; }  That all being said...the food, as always, was delicious, authentic, and very filling. I had the gnocchi & a great spinach salad with a citrus dressing, both were great.
author: Sandra B.

description:
I am very happy with this place! I definitely recommend this restaurant.

I came here during late afternoon, so I obviously missed the rush if there was any during lunchtime. We were seated immediately. The person was very nice and welcomed us by saying, "We've been waiting for you all day! Come in!" 

I ordered the Risotto Carciofi and my boyfriend ordered the Veal Mona Lisa. I am very pleased with their food! The Risotto was very delicious. It was creamy and had enough flavour. The garlic wasn't over-powering, but the cheese is heavy. (Sort of a given...) There's artichoke in this dish, and the pieces were pretty big...so if you're not a fan of artichoke, don't order the Risotto Carciofi. The Veal Mona Lisa was good, but the sauce was a bit too sweet for my taste. I prefer my meat more savory...but my boyfriend loved it! 

The workers, overall, are very kind. We accidentally spilled vinegar (sorry guys!) and they were very calm about it. The only problem was probably the waiter. There was no lunch rush at the time we were going, but he was just impatient. Which left me thinking, "Where's the rush, buddy! There's only four other people, and they're all eating!" 

That aside, I do recommend coming here and I would love to try their other dishes. (:
author: Bianca W.

description:
My sister and I scouted this place out while looking for a cute place for good Italian. We came back the following evening while there was some big event that closed down the whole street, which made parking an extreme pain. 
Fortunately, because it was just us we got a table immediately. If you want to come with a large group you'll probably have to wait.
Our host and waiter were both very authentic, friendly, and gave good recommendations narrowing down their extensive menu.
This would be a very fun place for a nice romantic dinner that's not too pricey. 
Great atmosphere, good food, great staff. I'd eat here again.
author: Emily P.

description:
so, before i say anything else, i'm not big on italian food. (i know, how unAmerican of me...) haha

I gave this place 3 stars bc the service is quite good. my first time here was some time in december, and coming back two months later, the server remembered me! how awesome is that!? hahah. but aside from that, they were really polite (both times), food came out in a timely manner, and my water was never empty. 

The food, well. like i said, not big on Italian. However, in comparison to other italian places, this place did not fall short...if i were more into these flavors (marinara, white sauce, oregano, heavy cheese sauce), it would have been good. My Italian buddies really like this spot...especially the gnocchi here, which is absolutely disgusting to me...

If you're into Italian food, i recommend you try this place. its just not my taste...
author: Linh P.

description: Delectable cuisine with moderate service. If you are looking for dinner and a show as the Italian accented wait staff argues over where your party will sit and who will serve you then dine at Mona Lisa. The food is really good and even some specially ordered and modified dishes came out as wanted. The only qualm I have with this restaurant is the wait staff. Although the arguing in Italian is quite stereotypical and funny.
author: Matthew F.

description: Food was delicious!! Penne al forno calabrese was some of the best pasta I've ever had---definitely a long wait for it, but ended up being worth it. The restaurant can get really packed and there definitely weren't enough servers. The owner was great and friendly, and the busboys were great (they actually attended to us more than our server, who was MIA most of the time). If you're not in a hurry, I definitely recommend this place!
author: Lauren G.

description:
We had our wedding luncheon here, with a party of 14, and let's just say, it was amazing.

The variety of the menu was fantastic because we had every type of diner from vegetarian to midwest "meat and potatoes only".  The portions were good sized and every bite was savory from first to last.

The staff took care of our every need, the food was delicious, prepared in a timely manner and the desserts... OH MY SWEET JEEBUS amazing.  Each and every dessert that was ordered was over the top yummy.

The only reason that they get 4 stars rather than 5 stars is because I find it a bit tacky that a male employee felt the need to use the ladies room rather than wait for the mens room to be available.  I wouldn't normally care, but my 13 year old neice "had to go really bad" and shouldn't have had to wait...  As an employee of the restaurant, he should have known better to survey the restaurant and realize that there were about 10 women at our table, 2 women in another party and only about 5 guys total in the restaurant not including staff.

Even with that mishap, I'll definitely come here again.
author: Missy L.

description:
What a jewel of a place. 
You walk in to a rich atmosphere with all the sights and smells of grandmas house in Venice (you remember grammys house in Venice dont you?)
The food is good, the wine selection is vast (although they were out of my first choice) and the prices are fair for a nice sit down dinner. 
But what really sold me was the staff. Friendly, extremely knowledgeable and prompt. 
I'll go out of my way for excellent service and im sure i'll be dining there in the not too distant future.
author: Jeff H.

description: It was my birthday.  This place went above and beyond to give me a fantastic authentic Italian dining experience. They started off with an excellent 3 tier platter of meats, calamari, bruschetta , tomato with mozzarella cheese paired with fantastic wine. For my main course the sea food mixed grill which was salmon, swordfish , prawns and scallops all delicious accompanied with potatoes and spinach. Desert was tiramisu with various types of gelato. All excellent. But the owner and his staff really made my night. Mauricio and his staff were very funny, witty , and just great people still able to have a blast with their patrons and yet still manage to provide excellent service to a packed restaurant. The owner even gave my girlfriend one of his Mona Lisa ties. :0). For fun there is a fantastic old fiat convertible parked out front which patrons are allowed to take silly pictures in. I had a blast and highly recommend this place to anyone. Thank you Mauricio and staff. A great birthday dinner.
author: Julian P.

description:
Probably the worst dining experience I've ever had, both times I went.  And I'm not even picky, look at my other reviews. 

I've been here twice and absolutely hated every aspect of it both times.  The staff is fairly rude and very inattentive.  Never even got a chance to order a second glass of wine either time because the waiter barely came back to our table.  I should say I was dragged here the second time I went in case you're wondering why I went back. 

The food, both times, has tasted like a giant salt lick.  I ordered a penne crab dish and the crab was diced crab legs with the shell still on the legs.  So it was impossible to eat unless you enjoy eating the shell of the crab and choking. 

The decor is tacky.  Put it this way, both times I came there was no wait, whereas there was a 30 minute wait at most other places.  That should tell you enough.
author: Reid R.

description: Honestly we will not return. We sat down and the server took our folded napkins in our wine glasses on the table and handed the napkins to us. Then he poured our water. I noticed the dead cockroach floating in my water and handed both of our waters back to him. We got an apology from server who stated it must have been from the napkin. We did not ask for discount of any kind. But they should have offered. Our food was bland. We couldn't enjoy our meals after the bug in the glass. We'll never return regardless.
author: Laura B.

description:
What drew us in was the atmosphere and the fact the place was bustling with activity which is often a good sign. 

We ended up being disappointed by the food and the service. My pasta with a white sauce and clams were very bland, and the bread was dry.

I would have probably given the restaurant a 2 star, but what knocked it down to 1 is what happened when we got the check. 

It was barely legible which only made me want to check it more than I otherwise would. We asked to see the menu again, and found that the server had added a dollar to the price of not just one, but two of our dishes. 

I could give him the benefit of the doubt for one mistake but two? I wonder how many tourists never verify the check and get screwed. A couple bucks here and there and the server is nicely rounding out his tips. I guess he's going to need it because my tip sure was not generous.

Come to think about it, getting treated as a tourist in a busy place in Italy was probably the most authetic part of the experience!
author: C And L D.

description:
We were trying to go to Franchino which was next door but the line for the place was out the door and there was a lot of people waiting so we went here instead.

There was a lot of people in the restaurant but there was no wait.  On the inside they had set up the seats so that they can maximize the amount of people that will fit so it will feel snug.

I had the veal parmesan and my fiancee had the chicken piccata.  Usually when I get something parmesan it comes over spaghetti but this did not come with any side so I found that extremely weird.  Overall the veal was good but had a little too much sauce on it.  The Chicken piccata was good but was a small portion and had too much capers on it.

Overall I think it was a good place to go, but personally I would recommend hitting up Franchino first next door!
author: Scott S.

description:
Last night, my wife and I, along with a few friends were craving for Italian in the North Beach neighborhood. With so many Italian restaurants, we decided to give the Mona Lisa a shot. They also have a small yellow car parked in front of the restaurant, where you can take pictures and post it on Facebook. Cool. 

The host (maybe the owner) was very friendly and seated us immediately. The restaurant is cute and is decorated with some autographed photos of celebs and paintings on the wall and the ceiling. We got free appetizers, which was cool; however, the garlic bread that came with was cold. Also, they only sell beer and wine. Not good when a member of the group is up for a mojito. The service was decent. We had to summon our waiter a few times and he almost forgot about our drinks when he brought our entrees out. 

As far as the food, it was very good. There are no complaints about the food here. I ordered the chicken Stimbata (spelling is probably incorrect) with prosciutto and mozzarella baked in white wine. The chicken was moist and the prosciutto complimented to an already flavorful dish. My friend really, really enjoyed the linguine with scallops, but not the price. My wife ordered the spaghetti and she loved it. It was clearly that they made their own pasta sauce it was definitely full of flavor. 

If you're in the mood for Italian, then give the Ristoratne Mona Lisa a try. However, there are so many Italian restaurants within the proximity, choosing where to eat could be a challenge. We'll probably come back here again and eat, but we'll also give other restaurants within the area an opportunity as well.
author: Albert B.

description: Went with party of 13 on a busy night. Service was okay considering how crowded it was and food was pretty good. Waiter and manager spent a lot of time arguing. It's kind of a tourist trap but worth a visit.
author: Tom S.

description: I've eaten at at least six italian spots in town and I think this one is the best. We had Gorgonzola pasta and two glasses of Cabernet, which are enormous. Service was wonderful and the decor is great inside. Its gorgeous. We had Tiramisu for dessert and split it. Delish..
author: Stephen H.

description:
This is one of tourist spot in SF.  Each plate was pretty big that we shared.  I don't usually eat dessert because I cannot have enough space for it but I think you should order dessert in Mona Lisa.

Cannoli was good!
author: Hiroko S.

description:
I LOVE RISOTTO.  I get excited when I go to a restaurant and they have ONE risotto on the menu.  This place has 20.  

First let me start by saying that this isn't some smart, fancy modern restaurant with a celebrity chef where you will find the words compote, pork cheeks, crostini, aioli, micro-arugula or truffles on the menu.  They have no gimmicky mac & cheese sandwiches or Korean bbq sliders.  There is no Wagyu beef anything here.  This is an old fashioned Italian restaurant with old fashioned waiters in long aprons who call you Bella that have been there a WHILE and no paper to go menus.  There are no itemized credit card receipts.  You'll get one of those stubs ripped from the bottom of a check that your boss won't reimburse you for.  It'll take forever to get your check some nights and the decor is definitely OG.  

That being said, if you want an amazing old-fashioned Italian meal that you can't finish and if you're like me and love risotto, you'll love this place.  Parking can be a bitch, it takes a while to get your food sometimes and there are no to go menus that you can carry out.  The waiters will bend over backwards to give you great service, though and will always make you feel special.  

My favorite dish was the Risotto Linuccio (beef, mushrooms in a tomato cream sauce) about 5 other risotto dishes and 3 of the gnocci dishes.  My co-workers all had a favorite menu item here.  One guy swore that the pizza was the best.  Another lady wanted the lobster ravioli every day.  It was comfort food at it's best when we were working long hours.  The bread is delicious and the owner will often stop by to see how your food is.  

Like some other reviewers, we were drawn in when the restaurant across the street was closed and the owner outside invited us to look at the menu.  The menu is huge and there was something on it that each of us could eat.  Score!  After eating here the first time and being treated so well, we decided to keep coming back.  

The place is pretty huge (cavernous in fact) and it often gets busy so don't expect super fast food.  If you can chill and enjoy a leisurely meal where you'll be treated special, you'll enjoy it here a lot.  

The only downside I can think of is that you can't get an itemized credit card receipt so our boss used to hassle us about turning the receipts in.  The next time I'm back in San Francisco be it for business or pleasure, I'll be back.
author: Jeannette S.

description: Had an amazing time at this restaurant. We got there in the evening, the weather was beautiful and we got to have dinner in the back of the cutest car sitting out front!!! The food was fantastic and the staff were very friendly. This is a must for anyone visiting SF and wanting Italian food. Call ahead and see if you can sit in the car. Too much fun!!!
author: Angela S.

description:
There aren't a whole lot of places you can go wrong in North Beach (and if you do misstep, you probably won't have a chance to do it again at the same place, as it will be crushed by the invisible hand), and Mona Lisa certainly isn't one of those.  The place has almost no white space; décor and design seem to be a product of its 30+ year heritage, not unlike your Great Aunt's front room, and that's not necessarily a bad thing.  Tacky to some, beloved by others, warm to anyone.  Just relax and enjoy.

Bruschetta was fresh and light, the risotto was cooked beautifully and all of the simple flavors did precisely what they were supposed to do.  The house chianti was a nice surprise as well -- much smoother than we anticipated.
author: Tyler R.

description: Mona Lisa is by far the best Italian food in San Francisco. Being an Italian American I truly enjoyed the resteraunts decor as well as the service. My date and I were amazed the hosts hospitality when we first arrived. After her first bite she let out a moan as if she creamed herself... Fella's if you're trying to get it in take your date to Mona Lisa . I recommend the anti pasto misto, the penne al forno alla Calabrese, spaghetti carbonara, chicken Marsala , And for wine the Crusher, a petite syrah
author: Salvatore A.

description: The place is cluttered!...but the food was pretty decent for the price. I had the spaghetti carbonara and it still missed a little something in it...I bet there are other Italian restaurants around north beach that has better tasting food.
author: Billy A.

description:
During the Weekend of Columbus Day in the city, where it is SO BUSY and tables are scarce, we walked by this fabulous place, where we were greeted with a hearty buona sera ! later we found out, this was THE OWNER Mauricio! The Host with the Most! gave us the outside table, catered to my Mom , sister and I- made us feel like Family, we are Sicilian, and this means everything to us! We had some excellent Wine, snacks- the food and service was so amazing- we came back for Dinner- I LOVED the Osso Bucco over Polenta. PERFECT! We cook authentic Sicilian and Italian- and were beyond impressed- we thought our Nana was in the kitchen! The next day, Sunday was the cities big Columbus day Parade, we came to Mona Lisas AFTER the festivites, bringing our extended family and were greeted as old friends, Mauricio fawned over my Mama! He remembered what wine we drank, and what our appetizer was - sat all 8 of us inside and our server remembered us as well, an our wine choice. AMAZING! We are coming back next year same time, for Dinner etc and will be sitting in front of his other Restaurant Colloseo on the street for the Italian Parade.
Mauricio and Staff VA BENE!!! Thank you and see you soon!
Ciao! Grazi! 
Tina, Theresa and Jennifer!
author: Tina K.

description:
The little car that stands at the front is the best part of the experience. 
The service is very so so, the risotto meh !!   Salad not worth $10...  will not be going back. This place survives on tourists alone. 

On the next block is Pinocchio. The food and service there is much much better.
author: Ria G.

description:
While vacationing in S.F. we asked our taxi driver for a recommendation for Italian in No. Beach.  This is what he came up with.   Was busy on a Sunday night of a 3 day weekend.   But we were seated right away.   Big Menu/Big Selection.   I wasn't too hungry so I ordered Pesto Spagetti.  It was a good serving and it was just okay.   My son had the Brigante Pizza and he liked it.   Hubby got  a Antipasto Misto and a side of sausage.  He said it was just okay.   
The service wasn't anything special and it took a loooonnng time to get our check.   It took so long that my husband just glanced at the check and paid it.  Hopefully we didn't get any extra $$'s added to our bill like some of the other reviewers.   Look for a better restaurant in No. Beach and skip this one.
author: Marla G.

description: Very good food. A tad touristy and overpriced, but solid guido food. Menu is way too busy
author: Robert A.

description: My date brought me to this romantic restaurant . Great food , great date . Lots of romance . Try it !
author: Stephanie D. B.

description: This place is huge. It looks small but inside the restraunt is massive, especially for this area. Has very nice ambience. Gnocchi was alittle undercooked but it was still pretty good- just alittle difficult to eat. The gorgonzola sauce was VERY rich but good. Franchinos is still my favorite but this place is also a good choice, Franchinos was just closed on holiday i believe so we came here. Nice and warm inside and the food they serve you is really hot. More expensive than franchinos, but it has a much more elegant feel as opposed 2 family feel.
author: Brittainie B.

description:
While wandering the North Beach area for some Italian we stumbled up to this restaurant. While reading the menu the owner, who was sitting outside trying to entice customers, offered us a free appetizer (bruschetta) with our dinner. We all saw something on the menu we liked, so we accepted. It had a cozy atmosphere (aka the tables were overly close to each other), but it was setup more like a fancy restaurant. The menu was pretty intense, with over a hundred dishes, with each being a slight variant of the next. (i.e. linguine, linguine with shrimp, linguine with clams, etc...). 

The bruschetta was decent and my dish (pasta with seafood) was average. The service was really good, but since I have only tried 2 places in north beach at this point and there are soooo many, won't probably come back for long while.
author: Matt H.

description: I own and operate Vision Motorcycle Tours and we bring groups here from all over the world. The service and food here is over the top, from the moment we arrive "Moreico" the owner will greet us outside the restaurant with a glass of wine and the festivities start from there. I would recommend the Mona Lisa to anyone traveling to San Francisco.
author: Larry P.

description: Excellent! Went here with a group of 9 people and was not disappointed whatsoever. We had the giant appetizer platter which was phenomenal. Fried calamari n scampi was amazing.  The owner was very nice and made sure he took care of our group. We will most definitely be back here!
author: Rod S.

description:
The food was OK, the service was OK..........the ambiance was fun and that was the best I could find to say.

I was in town for business and walking around looking for a place to eat. We happened upon Mona Lisa, and wished that we had looked at other people's reviews on Yelp. 

The service was slow and I had better food just up the street at Firenze by Night a few days ago.

The open window that we sat by gave us some protection from the passing people on the sidewalk while still getting the feeling of sitting outside. The decor inside was funky..........my friend made the comment and it was so true.........nothing is white inside.........cheesay frescoes, etc. but it was fun.
author: Richard R.

description:
I don't think I have ever seen a more extensive pasta menu. Over 50+ variations of spaghetti, penne, linguini, chicken, seafood, etc. etc!!! But I'm a very simple pasta person. Penne + red sauce + _______ = happy. 

And their food is decent! I forget the name of the dish that I ordered, but basically it's penne + chicken + red tomato sauce. The pasta is pretty decent, but I certainly don't think it's worth $16. I feel like I could get that for half the price. OH, and I wish my pasta was cooked a bit more. I like it a bit mushy, but it came out still pretty stiff. 

This place is packed on a Friday night! I didn't get there until 8:30 (my friend had already gotten us a table about 15 minutes earlier), and pretty much ordered within 10 minutes. Yet, the food doesn't arrive until 40 minutes later. The ironic thing was that I was facing the kitchen, and the chefs  were working those pans non-stop!! I honestly didn't think the place was so big, but it's packed!! 

This place is probably 3.5 stars, but I had to round down since the waiter also gave us the wrong bill. And it took another 5 minutes to get their attention.
author: Lina W.

description: My husband and I went here and were very disappointed.  For the price I would expect much better.  My husband ordered lasagne and it tasted like it came from a box.  I ordered steak (should have known better) and it was terrible - a thin piece of tough meat.  Mine came with spinach and potatoes and the spinach was drowning in garlic, the potatoes were drenched in rosemary.  The service was friendly enough but very slow.  Ambiance was fine and is what drew us in, but we would never go back.
author: Gina C.

description:
My favorite North Beach restaurant to date! The food was delicious! Unfortunately, I don't remember what I had : ( It's just my memory, though. It was amazing. They have an extensive list of different combinations of pastas, sauces, and meats.

The restaurant is very crowded and a little noisy, but that is part of it's appeal. We sat right next to the window, so there was no traffic passing us. It seemed popular and we were lucky to get a seat walking in. It might be good to make a reservation. Our server had an Italian accent. He may have been acting, but regardless it made the experience better.

Definitely returning.
author: Daniel B.

description: Ok, I can probably count on one hand how many times I've gone to SF. It's a great city. Every time I've gone I have always made Mona Lisa a must stop. I love the lasagna! I've had other dishes there but it's been a while so I don't remember to well. But trust me, it's ALL good! Great atmosphere. It can get pretty crowded but it's not too unbearable. Very nicely decorated. It is a little pricey but definitely a great date place. Give it a try if you ever find yourself in SF!
author: George R.

description: We just ate here, and while the food was nothing special, the service was terrible. There were only 8 people in the entire restaurant yet it took twenty minutes to take our order. The food came out in good time yet the waiter never checked back on drinks, and we had to ask for plates to be cleared. When we finally got the check, none of the prices matched what was listed on the menu. Utterly disappointing and time I wish I could get back.
author: A C.

description: Absolutely Brilliant food here. I really enjoyed it all. Service was fine. No problems there. Food came in a decent amount of time for a weekend night. I would go here again for sure.
author: Jason M.

description:
Enjoyed lunch there yesterday. Excellent service and food. My husband had the Spaghetti and meatballs and it was very very good. Tasty and with lots of sauce too. I had the Fettuccine with Mushrooms, Olives and Ham-absolutely wonderful! I have never had any type of Fettuccine like this one. It really was excellent and  we would go back and try other things on the menu-which is extensive.
  We went to see Beach Blanket Babylon later that night and came back here for coffee, wine and dessert. They did not have any decaffeinated coffee, and I ended up with something they called coffee.  My husband had a glass of red wine. The dessert was good-chocolate cream puffs with a chocolate sauce over them, but way too pricey. They charged us over $30. The lunch menu prices were reasonable, but this was ridiculous!
  The Chef cooked in front of a long bar in the kitchen area and it was interesting and fun to watch him. The place is decorated like a restaurant in Italy and is very interesting.
 My other complaint is when I went in the back to use the restroom. The doors into both and men and women's restrooms were filthy and looked like they had not been cleaned in years. There was an old, dirty, torn rug inside the women's bathroom that should of been tossed away years ago. Coming our of the bathroom is an opening into a back kitchen or maybe where they wash dishes, etc. The doors into it were also filthy and it makes you wonder how clean is the rest of the restaurant??
author: Linda J.

description: The dining experience we enjoyed at Mona Lisa was exceptional. Owner Maurizio made us feel as warmly welcome as if we were being hosted at his home. He was attentive throughout the meal while his staff provided incomparable service. The wine he recommended was some of the best I've ever had and every dish was exemplary, delicious, generous and authentic. We highly recommend the three-tiered appetizer tray which featured prosciutto parma wrapped melon. The melt-in-your-mouth charcuterie plate was also delectable and Mona Lisa's take on the classic tris di pasta - each of the 3 portions representing the Italian flag - was top-notch. Mona Lisa is an incredible find.
author: Leslie M.

description:
The restaurant is a lot bigger than it looks from the outside! 

My sisters and I came on a Wednesday night and the restaurant was still pretty packed at 9pm. The waiter was really delightful and we enjoyed his thick Italian accent! haha 

The Menu is huge! It's actually quite overwhelming and it's really hard to pick. I decided on the Crab Ravioli, while my sister got Spaghetti and Meatballs. Portions are ok, but a bit small for $20 a plate. Although the food came piping hot and delicious! =D

Good Food, great service, but $100 bill for three girls is $$$$. Tourist trap!
author: Jo L.

description:
We started with a couple of sampler platters. From the calamari to the bruschetta, to the prosciutto with melon, everything was scrumptious. There was a great seasoning on the calamari and they don't skimp on the prosciutto. I had the risotto alfredo & prawns. It was so rich it was ridiculous- in a good way. Truly the best risotto I've ever had. My dinner companions had the chicken saltimbocca, risotto allo scoglio,  gnocchi in pink sauce, fettuccine pescatore, and the chicken S. Marino. If there was an award for second best dish at the table it would go to the S. Marino. It is rolled chicken breast with mozzarella and ham in a tomato-cream sauce, incredible flavors & texture. Even though no one at the table needed another bite of food, it wouldn't have been complete without dessert so we shared a platter of tiramisu & bomba. The tiny bite I managed to eat of the bomba was really good. Our waiter was friendly, attentive, patient, and spot on when helping choose menu items. Another thing to mention about Mona Lisa is they have an adorable little car that is parked out front and a party of two can actually enjoy their meal from inside it if they choose. 

Click here for the full story & pictures:
http://consumingcolumbus.blogspot.com/2012/12/mona-lisa-will-make-you-moan_29.html
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Four types of gluten free pasta were available - we both had rigatoni: my date the gluten free and I the wheat based - and they both were wonderful.  My dish was the Rigatoni alla Borrelli with sausage and eggplant; I couldn't have been happier - my Sicilian grandfather would have been proud: the sausage was spicy and flavorful, the eggplant tender, the rigatoni al dente.  Both the owner and our waiter were attentive and fun to converse with, the service was prompt but  relaxley paced, just like we had hoped for.  By the way, I recognized Derek Jeter in one of the pictures immediately - among a few other folks- some people just need to get out more,..nuff said.  Oh, I don't have any Rembrandts in my home either though my dogs do nice water colors.
author: John K.

description:
Here is my nightmare with this place:

Me and my partner were looking for a nice Italian restaurant to have a date night and we ended up at Mona Lisa..

here is my BAD experience:

= they bring the most stale piece of bread

=  They let the bruscheta sit on the counter for 15 minutes to the point that when it came to the table the bread was soaked in tomato juice and soggy.

= My risotto was not fully cooked and it had a crunch i could not get over.

= I kept asking for water but the guy brought nothing but the bill, 15 minutes later we walked out to buy a bottle at the corner store.

= the bill:   18 + 14 + 8 + 3 = $43  NOT  $51 as they said. ( who did the math here)

= the guy that was outside offered free appetizer , but they claimed ignorance when the bill came.

 We just paid and ran out..

What a disappointment and what a bad time we spent there.

I wrote them a message and I hope they respond soon!
author: Fran M.

description:
I came here this past Monday only because Franchino's was closed.  Plus, we were tired and didn't feel like walking around North Beach in search of food.  I found the service was friendly, yet average.  The decor was quaint.  For dinner, we ordered the Chicken Parmigiana and the Rigatoni alla Borelli (baked pasta with sausage, eggplant, and meat sauce) along with two glasses of Chianti wine.  Our total come out to be almost $60.  The food was good but not the best Italian food I've ever had.

I honestly don't think I would come back here for a meal because I loved the food at Franchino's better.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I took the wrong turn for a restaurant that was recommended by yelp and thank god i did! Mona lisa is a nice quiet restaurant with a great menu and delicious food. The person i was with wanted to leave the place when they found out that it was the wrong restaurant, but i wouldnt have it once i found out they have seppie! Such a rare dish in this country even in italian restaurants. The seppie was great and i highly recommend it especially if you have never tried it. Get it with the risotto or the linguini! Thank god for my bad sense of direction!
author: Jeremy R.

description: I live in North Beach and I only have a few Italian restaurants I go to and this is one of them.  It's one of my favorites because no matter how busy, they always seem to squeeze me in.  I love the ambiance and the service is from true Italians.  Even my friends from Italy thought it was wonderful.  Chicken Piccata was excellent and portions were huge. I know this neighborhood very well and just because there are many tourists in NB, doesn't make it a "tourist" restaurant.  They do a really good job here.
author: Paul S.

description:
One of the few restaurants in SF where I couldn't finish my meal because of how bad it was. Well, to be fair, it was someone else's meal, but I can always be counted on to finish other's leftovers, especially when it's calamari! But no! This was the second worst calamari I've ever had (there was one time calamari made me throw up, and this didn't).

But yeah. Bread was stale, olive oil was old. Pizza was edible, but very soggy and sloppily put together. Even the service was slow, after luring people in with their charming Italian accents.

This is the definition of a tourist trap. The annoying person outside speaking Italian to tourists, the ugly neon sign, the tacky paintings on the inside....I've been to Italy and while there are restaurants there that look like Mona Lisa, they're still tourist traps with bad food. The best Italian restaurants in North Beach are not on Columbus, but there are a few good ones on Columbus, and if you must satisfy your people-watching urge, go to Calzone's or Pellegrini. I've heard Franchino right next door is quite good too.

I guess the only reason to go here is that it is fairly reasonably priced, and with 200 different menu options (I got bored waiting for friends and counted), you're sure to satisfy the pickiest of eaters. But anytime you have more than twice as many types of food items as wine items, not a good sign.

And if you want a truly authentic Italian experience that reflects Italy's commitment to using the freshest, most seasonal ingredients, go to Delfina in the Mission. where there's never more than 25 items on the menu and it changes every day to reflect what's in season.

Having an Italian accent or speaking Italian often has no correlation to the quality of the food, and is often even negatively correlated.

The Delfina folks don't have an Italian accent, nor do they only hire servers who speak Italian; and Thomas Keller speaks perfect English and seems to do French food pretty well.



Does anyone else notice how many 5-star reviews this place has from people who have never written another Yelp review....
author: Mark A.

description: Popular landmark with mediocre service and overpriced food. I ordered gnocchi and they tasted store bought, the other dishes were nothing special as well. If you are a tourist go for it, otherwise go somewhere to get value better for the money.
author: Tanya C.

description:
Came to North Beach with some friends for a late night dinner on a Friday. We weren't really sure where to eat, so we chose Mona Lisa after the guys out front lured us in--all it took was the availability to seat a party of 5 on the spot.

The menu was a little overwhelming at first, but you'll soon realize that everything is a variation of something else. I ordered the pesto tortellini, which was a little on the salty side. Everyone else seemed to like their dishes though (lobster raviolli, veal marsala, pumpkin raviolli, and a baked pasta and sausage dish). I guess I should have been more adventurous in my ordering.

The biggest downfall of this restaurant for me though was the service. Although we got seated quickly, the waiter rushed through our orders and didn't even ask if we wanted anything to drink besides water. Once our orders were taken, we didn't see him again until he came to pick up our plates. I had a little less than a third of my dish left and contemplated getting it boxed, but the waiter swept up my plate without asking if I wanted to pack it and quickly placed other dishes on top of it. Oh well--I guess I need faster reflexes. The waiter disappeared once again and didn't even suggest dessert for us. After several attempts of flagging him down, we finally got him to bring us our check. Lucky for me, my friend from out of town paid for my meal. Also thought it was weird that we were charged an automatic 18% gratuity for a party of 5 (didn't catch any notice on the menu).

There are so many Italian restaurants in North Beach that are bound to be much better, so I doubt I'll come back here again. Mediocre food (with slightly high prices) and poor service didn't really do it for me.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Maye I'm biased because I love NJ and NY italian, but North Beach - and Mona Lisa specifically - isn't great. I will say the service is pretty good and the atmosphere is fair, especially with the outdoor dining. The food was OK at best and the prices seemed high for the quality. The pasta and chicken dishes I've had have been a 4 at best. Also the bathrooms are pretty gross for a restaurant with linen tablecloths. I gave the place two tries, but won't be back.
author: Sooz V.

description:
My pizza capitale, was covered with too much cheese, the tomatoes were unripe, and the crust was super soggy. I was expecting a much thinner crust, fresh mozarella, and vine ripened tomatoes. 
Ceasar salad was average, tomato salad caprese was pretty good. The cheese was very fresh, but the tomatoes weren't very ripe. 
Calzone was super duper salty, and the dough was also salty. The prosciutto inside wasn't even prosciutto, instead they used slices of Oscar Mayer Ham!

Spaghetti Marinara was the high point of the meal, but then again, you can't really mess up red sauce and boiled spaghetti. 

The waiter gave more attentino to the potraits hanging on the wall.  Most of the time he was talking with the busboy, and hostess, or checking out the females walking in the street.

I used to be a huge fan of the Mona Lisa way back in the day, but I guess somewhere in between then and now, everything went downhill. Never again!

There are way better places in North Beach.
author: Robin K.

description: I was recommended this Italian place by a Co worker who mentioned it being one of the best places to eat in little Italy. I ordered two different pizzas, the calzone Al fonte and the De lux pizzas. I really wish I had ordered a pasta, but next time! I would say that my other half is a pizza critic because he said for a gourmet pizza it was good-had it had another type of cheese to make it stand out it would have been better. For flavor, the pizza had a nice variety with spicy sausage. I don't know what we did, but we were given free bruschetta and it was yummy. I would like to go back and try a pasta next time, but I enjoyed the experience.
author: Nicole M.

description: Best Italian food in San francisco!! Great service. Love the atmosphere of this place!!
author: Justyna B.

description: Spaghetti and Meatballs were tasty. Price was good. Service was interesting, pushy to being ignored. Their beer selection needs help. Felt like I was being pulled into the Condor Club by the guy on the sidewalk trying to get us to come in...slow down dude!
author: Bob V.

description: This place is awesome! ! The food great the service is great!  We have been vacationing in San Francisco for 7 years and Moricio the main man ALWAYS remembers us and makes us feel welcome.  We only see him once a year! You will not be disappointed.  I have been reading some of the yelps by wanna be food critics..the key word is wanna be.  I'm not an avid yelper, so for me to do so means alot!!  Please give it a try you will LOVE it
author: Pete G.

description:
This restaurant has been my favorite since I first went there in 2004! Though I don't get to go there as often as I'd like, every time I am there is an amazing experience.

The environment, though very busy, is pleasant. A bit crowded, but hey, it's San Francisco, what do you expect? The staff is extremely friendly & the FOOD. OOOH, the food is absolutely amazing. My favorite meal there is the chicken parmagiana. It's a perfect 'date night' restaurant!
author: Tiffany K.

description: As I've said in the past, I generally enjoy Mona Lisa and have taken friends and family here when they visit. This was the case last night, when I strayed from my usual ravioli and got a caesar salad with shrimp. Unfortunately, this morning I'm suffering a gnarly case of food poisoning. I'm disappointed and don't think I'll be back, despite my previous experiences (which have all been wonderful).
author: Ginamarie G.

description: I've eaten here twice. I didn't like it the first time, but couldn't remember if thisa was the same place this time. It was. They serve potatoes with their chicken parm. It was covered in something spicy - maybe too much black pepper? It hurt my mouth. My dining partner ordered spaghetti bolognese because he's 12. He liked it, but I thought the pasta was a wee bit too al dente and the bolognese was thin. Hmm, garlic bread dry, salad over-dressed. Service was friendly. Eh, not the best....
author: RIbbon M.

description: Went here last night with friends and we left before even ordering! We were sat right away, but after that the service was non existent except for when a waiter knocked over a glass of water on our table when walking by and proceeded to move everything and changed our table cloth. That whole process was awkward and everyone seemed frantic. At this point it had been 10 minutes and we only had water and bread at our table (brought by someone I could only assume was the busser), not one server had stopped by to say they would be with us in a bit to take our order. After waiting another 10 minutes my group decided that we would rather try our chances somewhere else. If they couldn't even take our drink order within 20 minutes who knows how long it would have taken to actually receive the drinks. On the way out I mentioned our situation to the hostess and she seemed to be completely unaware that we hadn't been helped (note- we were sat at a table by the window, clearly in her view of where she was standing). Leads me to think that this place is highly unorganized and the employees have no idea what they are doing and their observation skills need a lot of work. We will never go back, especially since there are plenty of Italian restaurants that are in a one block radius from this place.
author: Stacy B.

description:
There are over 80 things on the menu.

It's ridiculous.  It's as ridiculous as the cheesetastic decor.  I can deal with the over the top atmosphere but the menu gives me a headache. 

So I had the gnocchi.

It was ok. 

With soooo many restaurants in the city, I really don't need to come back here for just ok.
author: Jen I.

description:
Being gluten free sucks.  Especially when you are strolling North Beach, looking for food options and all you want is to go face-first into an Italian dish.

At Mona Lisa I found a delicious dinner option that was filling, well cooked, and mouth watering. Chicken with spinach, ham, and melted cheese, side of two vegetables. Perfectly prepared, though very rich, it was fantastic.

Very romantic, even though I was just there with a girl friend.  Super touristy, but sometimes that's ok.
author: Stephanie R.

description: This was my first Mona Lisa visit, and it was a excellent.  My family is Italian\American and although pasta is prevalent in Italian cuisine, there are so many other choices.  It was refreshing to have some options besides pasta outside of NJ\NY area.  For my appetizer, I ordered the arugula salad, it was huge and the tomatoes were surprisingly good for January.  My entrée was saltimbocca and it was delicious, most restaurants skimp on the prosciutto, but not here.
