But...the waiters made us feel at home, wine list was good, and I guess I might go back for an early glass of wine. Just no more of that icky risotto.
author: OffToRio B.

description:
Crowds...arrrgghhhhh...! But the wait in the cold wasn't very pleasant either but hey, it's San Fran ya know. I like the ambience of this place, and the service is fair for the most part. There zin selection isn't very good, mostly cab's n white's. You know when a place is busy is when the busboy's just throw the bread basket on your table an spill water on the table cloth with no excuses..!!! Lame. I ordered the Chicken Marsala dish. It came with a spinach and pasta side. The food was exceptional but certainly not for the 30 minute wait in the ice box.
I was expecting a bit more from this place but oh well. Our waiter was very cool and that is what saved the dinner more or less...! Gimme some bread & olive oil pleez..!
author: Sven S.

description:
My friend had her birthday dinner here. We were slightly late b/c of the Bart and getting ready for a bar after, but we called in and said we would arrive by 9:00pm instead of the previous 8:30pm reservation. But, once we got there, by exactly 9, we weren't seated until 9:45pm. I understand the restaurant was small and our party was 10 ppl, but 45 minutes is a little much. 

Anyway, once we got in, we were seated and the waitress was extremely sweet and suggested some wines for our group. I ordered the Chicken caccitore and it was good. I was debating between that one or the chicken parmigiana which i love making myself at home. But, it was a pretty good portion, so I had to give the rest of my dinner to my friend's boyfriend, b/c i felt wasteful and couldn't take it to go b/c we were going to a bar after. 

The b-day girl got risotto w/ shrimp and she said it was great. For the price and the ambiance (which is very quaint and romantic btw) I felt this place was worth it. It's like the better Olive Garden but not spectacular. Therefore it gets 3 stars.
author: T. T.

description:
I ate here with a few of my friends, and the food was *amazing*... we all loved our food and actually said to ourselves, "we have to rate this place on yelp!"  The staff was very attentive without being annoying and te atmosphere was totally cute.
I would definitely go here again. :-)
author: Amber U.

description:
I am rather indifferent to this place- I did enjoy my food but be advised that if you order the fettuccine with crab you have to crack it yourself and they did not give us a cracker thing... I will not order that dish again! 

I added some extra stars because their menu was large and in charge so if you go with picky people they should be able to find 1 thing they like! 

Its very similar to all the other North Beach restaurants with the tacky Italian decorations etc. nothing that special stood out to me.
author: Janae L.

description: The food was okay, but the service was poor. I had reserved for a party of 10 people at 8pm. They had all of us waiting outside on the street in the cold for 30 minutes before we could be seated. the food arrived fairly quickly but missing cutlery, serviettes and plastic found in a friend's desert, not to mention the unfriendly vibe from the waiters as we left brings me to give only 1 star. I won't go again.
author: Cameron H.

description:
Out of all the Italian restaurants in North Beach we decided to have dinner at this place. In hindsight, we should've chosen another restaurant because the food and service here was below average at best. When I asked for the "best seat in the house" (we were celebrating a special occassion), the host said the best table was the one we would be seated at. HUH??? We ended up with a very small table near the window. I mean the area we were seated in was soooooo small I couldn't even move my chair back nor could my wife. 

The restaurant was about 20% at capacity and it took about 15 minutes for our waiter to find us in our little corner. He took our orders of Spaghetti Bolognese and Chicken Parmigiana which arrived after another 15 minutes. Both entrees were ok and we've had better at Macaroni Bar and Grill!!! At least the water was icy cold here just like their service. Go somewhere else when in North Beach.
author: Theratrick P.

description: Although the restaurant was not even half full, the service took forever.  I could tolerate that, but my spaghetti Bolognese was the worst Italian food I have ever eaten!
author: jeff m.

description:
Scenario: Going out to dinner with 8 friends on Veteran's Day.  My friend knows one of the waiters there and recommended it as our dinner spot.

Product: The antipasti was tasty, the wine quite delicious, the entrees to die for, and the dessert delectable.  We started getting full so everyone passed around their entrees to sample.  The pesto was pretty good but I would have to say the lasagna (meaty, rich, dense, rich & meaty) and the lobster ravioli (just a hint of lobster and wonderful cream sauce) were my favorites.  The baked ravioli and the pumpkin and spice ravioli were close behind.  The gnocchi was good in the sense that they were warm and chewy and gooey, a very exciting texture.  The price range for appetizer, entree, wine, and dessert was about $30 per person.  Well worth it!

Service: Very good service.  Our waiter was friendly, talkative, made good recommendations as to entree/wine/dessert choices, served our food moments after it was cooked (we were sitting right next to the service bar so I could see it being cooked just moments before the heavenly lobster ravioli met my taste buds), and generally was very attentive.

Atmosphere: This place is very cozy.  The neighborhood is Italian (duh!) through and through.  Inside there are murals on the ceiling, soft lighting, and nice chandeliers.  My only complaint is that the seating felt a little cramped, though there were 9 of us.  This would be a fantastic place to bring your sweetie, maybe even pop the question;)

Uniquity: The food was amazing, the service was friendly and the atmosphere makes this a definite stop with your significant other.
author: Robert R.

description: There should be a star or two for this restaurant.  The food is amazing and the hospitality is memorable.  You feel as though you were going to Maurizio's house for dinner.  Bring your appetite and it will not break the bank.  Everything is fresh and made daily.  A definite do not miss, you can even get your photo with his car that is parked out front.
author: Lovegood F.

description: Talk about feeling like royalty?  This place is over the top.  Every time we come here, Marco, the host, really "rolls out the red carpet."  These guys are sincerely interested in making customers feel like part of their extended family.  They do their best to offer a sampling of different Italian regional cuisines in a truly homey, welcoming atmosphere.  The wine selection is great too.  Mona Lisa is a genuine Italian experience.
author: Eric M.

description:
This place is delicious and the owner is genuinely warm and friendly.  They have a bitching fiat delivery car too (so I guess that means they deliver but don't quote me).

Probably my favorite place in North Beach for Italian.  Which is to say DAMN GOOD.
author: Nahum M.

description:
I've been here many times, but after a trip to Italy, I feel better informed to comment.

Location is on Columbus in the middle of North Beach, and the restaurant itself is full of gaudy Italian decorations and artwork ... it feels like the inside of the Santa Maria della Vittoria church in Italy, but you get to eat in it and there's no Ecstasy of St Theresa.  Service is always decent, and the place is ALWAYS busy.  The host runs his seating Italian style ... noting you by face (usually), as opposed to making you sign in, and making casual conversation or jokes, and lazying about.  You do have to wait outside, so if it's cold, bring a coat.  The place is too packed inside for them to let you stand around.

Large variety of different Italian dishes ... I've tried many different things, and have always found the food to be delicious and fresh.  The place just feels authentic ... and it's cozy, yet crowded, intimate yet loud ... very Italian.
author: Kristen H.

description:
Classic italian restaurant. Fancy table settings and eclectic decor lend Mona Lisa it's elegant yet unpretentious atmosphere. The extensive menu lets you choose between all kinds of pasta, sauces, meats and veggies, and all dishes are good. 

Friendly Italian service staff kept our water glasses full and plenty of bread on the table. Overall, one of the better Italian spots on Columbus.
author: Cody E.

description:
I would give this a 3.5 star rating.

I came here with a group of 14 for a friend's birthday and the waiters were extremely accomodating of a large group.  The restaurant is a lot larger than it looks from the outside.  The menu is huge and though the food wasn't completely stellar, I think everyone was happy with what they ordered.  It is a bit touristy, but would make a great place to bring out of town guests or to go to with a large group!
author: Shawna S.

description:
Probably the best restaraunt on Columbus Str..
Fancy-upscale type of place for a slow wining and dining.
Mouthwatering appetizers', superfresh mozarella and amazing pesto sause.
Loved their seafood pizza, very deliscious, thin dough.
2 thumbs up for the service: literally from the table to the door.
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description:
Wow this place was tasty...As are most of the places on Columbus Ave.
We had a lot of fun with Mauritizo.  He even let us climb in his car.
Good food, hugs from the italian waitstaff?  I love North Beach!!

Tasty tasty tasty...
author: Norma M.

description: Horrible decor, mediocre service and mediocre food, and the prices are ridiculous relative to the food quality.  Go to Franchino's next door instead.
author: Meanie A.

description: This place is expensive and not that yummy. I went here hungry...and for a hungry person anything should taste good..but this place was just okay.  It made me full, but without that satisfying feeling.  I have had a lot of Italian food in my life and I would still choose Maggiano's (a chain restaurant) over this place.  The portions are small and the food is mediocre.  Don't go out of your way to eat here...there are other places throughout little Italy that I recommend you try before this place.
author: Emily S.

description: This was a second place my husabnd and I went for a late lunch. The food was good, gnocci and a veggie pizza. However don't expect the server  not to give a rudely delivered opinion when you ask for something a certain way as it's their way or no way. Then the dining room was covered in two inches of dust and the "paintings" were on closer inspection, wall paper copies. Then they have walls of celeb photos, other than a couple, no one outside of the city would ever know. Maybe pictures they mix in to show a lot of people, probably walkers-by who sign their own picture for a free lunch... nuff said
author: Jason M.

description:
My old roommate and I go here for date nights.  The servers are so sweet and recognize us when we walk in the door. ("Bella regatza!")  We love the little two-person table in the corner looking out onto Columbus.  
My roommate always gets the chicken piccata, which is f-ing incredible.  I usually go with the ravioli alla zucca (pumpkin ravioli in butter sauce) or the four cheese gnocchi.  These are serious meals and sometimes I feel like I need to be rolled out of the place on a handtruck.  Their wine selection is nice--I like the chiantis the best.  Last time we were there, the glorious server brought us a huge plate of appetizers--we're talking bruschetta, olives, salame and margherita salad--on the house.  ON THE HOUSE.  The service is incredible (even if you aren't a pretty girl) and even though there are a lot of tourists, it's totally bearable.
author: Sarah H.

description:
I went to this place for dinner prior to a bachelorette celebration night-on-the-town. Perfect! The sister of the bride who planned the event had been here a number of times with her boyfriend and apparently she liked it enough to have a bunch of girls come and enjoy it as well. 

Let's just say I was wooed upon entering with Italian men saying "Ciao bellas" as we entered in their authentic italian accents.... *swoooon*

The calamari appetizer is the best I've ever had - not chewy at all and a great batter that I could still taste much later due to all the garlic. I have to say a bottle of their Pinot Noir makes the taste even better. My mouth is salivating as I write this.... must... get... back... soon.

I'm also a fan of mushroom risotto and theirs absolutely does NOT disappoint. 

The only cons is the place is kind of on the "tight" side... not much space between tables. But I didn't mind... kind of reminded me of how seating is in Italy anyway. Us Americans are sooo concerned with our 'personal space!' 

Some other reviewers mentioned slow service, but both times I was amazed at how fast it came out. One visit was on a Saturday night with the place packed, the other was on a Tuesday night with seats open. I say order the calamari and a bottle of wine and actually take your time with the meal!
author: Tonja R.

description:
Mona Lisa is one of the best Italian places in the city!

The place is so charming, with seating out on the street and a cozy interior.

The food is phenomenal.  I'm an Italian girl myself, so I know good Italian food.  And it doesn't get much better than this.

But what really makes this place special is the staff.  They are all so friendly and fun, and authentically Italian.  They remind me of my extended family at the holidays.  If you want to have the best possible dining experience in North Beach, you must come to Mona Lisa's.
author: Karen L.

description: Even the pickiest of girlfriends should have no problem finding something they will enjoy. There are (my estimate) at least 400 items on the menu. The bruschetta appetizer is insanely tasty and more than enough for two. The fried calamari could double as an entree. If you want Italian without pretentiousness, and the feeling of being fed a 'homecooked' meal, I recommend it.
author: Rocky S.

description: Decent food, average service, excellent atmosphere.
author: Sean A.

description:
Mona Lisa has a great flavor in their sauces.
Service is just okay - i think it depends on who you get.
Pricey just like all the other italian places around here. Portion is mediocre especially for a 20+buck dish. I will go back for the flavor and decor - romantic yet family like resturant. the people who worked there can get pretty loud but im okay with it here because it's great to see an italian family speaking italian and laughing with each other.
author: Janet W.

description: We were looking for a place to eat Italian in North Beach area and after looking at reviews we finally ended up here. From appetizer to desert, everything tasted great and my group were all very happy with the choice. The staff were friendly and I would return. Menu was huge but waiter was very helpful in suggesting something.
author: Paul T.

description: Zero stars! This place is a definite skip! As a native new yorker I know better than to rely on a Little Italy or in this case North Beach  tourist trap restaurant. But we were hungry and had a killer walk in experience at another place so we headed here. It was horrible! They tried to seat us at a 2 person mini table. I asked for a 4 top so we could sit side by side and they accommodated us. Two minutes later the server asked us to move. We didn't and that set the tone for the rest of the meal. I ordered beef carpaccio which was not on the menu. I thought that would get the waiter's attention but I still had to flag him down for black pepper. Then we dove in to the "carpaccio" which was none other than roast beef. At that point we decided to pay for what we ate and leave before getting worse into a bad meal. Suffice it to say do not go here!!!
author: cassidy s.

description: I have been here many times and always left happy.  it's not the greatest food, but it's good.  I have found two things that they do really really well and the rest seems to be above average.   The Fettuccine alla Pescatore and the Tiramisu are delicious and I highly recommend them both.  This place can get kind of busy, but always makes for a fun dinner out.
author: Aaron L.

description: I've dined here a few times or should I say, every time I visit SF and I make it a point to dine here before returning home from a visit. The service is perfect, the atmosphere is very close to home and comforting with a touch of elegance. For some reason I always get a little extra with my meal! This place LOVES to feed their customers! And who could say no to complimentary desserts or appetizers!? I Love, love, LOVE the lasagna!! Good thing I dine with my family and friends, I get to try out what they order and let me tell you.... There isn't a thing on this menu that isn't perfection! ** I recommend the Calamari to start and Canoli's to end your meal** Anything on that menu for your main course will satisfy your appetite =)
author: RS M.

description:
I know 2 stars seems harsh, but it was a "Meh. I've experienced better" sort of dining experience. 
Walked in about 7:30 on Thursday night and waited about 10 minutes to be seated. We ordered and didn't eat until almost an hour later. It was a busy time and there was a birthday party so it's understandable but... we were hungry! 
Food was yummy (fettucine pescatore and spaghetti allo scoglio) and my friend said she'd come back for it, but I wasn't too impressed. Regular day-old french bread basket. I kept having that crunchy feeling when I ate my fettucine with mussels and clams. 
Service was rushed and not too attentive, bunch of Italian waiters running back and forth. Restaurant is crowded and waiter knocked over my water glass, wetting the table as he scurried by. "Just testing your reflexes!" Um... ok. He left before I could ask for at least another napkin to wipe this water off. A plus: dirty plates were promptly removed from our small table. Waiter brought the check and barely asked if we needed anything else. 
I don't like eating places where I don't feel like a valued customer. I can take my business elsewhere =P.
author: Christine Y.

description: Food was good, price was high for what you get. I'm glad we had a gift certificate to cover some of the cost. Menu had so many items that it takes a long time to read them all.  Probably would try somewhere else next time.
author: Clay G.

description: My first time to San Francisco. Stopped by Mona Lisa, menu looked inviting.  The staff was wonderful, very attentive. Full menu. Our food was amazing. The lasagne was very flavorful. My husband had the veal. Very glad we came across this restaurant.
author: Sharlotte S.

description: After frequenting this fine establishment for the past 9 years, it remains my husband and my favorite restaurant.  The owner Mauricio and his staff treat you like family.  The food is fabulous.  The only down side is that this restaurant is soooo good that we are now scarred and any other Italian restaurant is...well, just that...any other Italian restaurant.  The 4 cheese ravioli is amazing.  Never have I tasted ravioli so fresh before.  And the 4 cheese sauce the prepare just absolutely explodes on your taste buds....we take family and friends here all the time.  YOU CANNOT GO WRONG WITH THIS RESTAURANT!  Do yourself a favor and skip the rest and stay with the best...Mona Lisa's.
author: antonia c.

description:
From the host to the desert,

I WOULD RECOMMEND RESERVATIONS BUT IF YOU ASK FOR THE OWNER HE WILL TRY TO TAKE CARE OF YOU ! I MENTIONED I READ THE GOOD REVIEWS ON YELP AND HE WENT THE EXTRA DISTANCE TO TAKE CARE OF US !

What a Great Night out !!! Feeling to feel. Italian. For one night the owner great host very good hearted  The service is great and the food is excellent  Was there on a week day and we had a great time waiting in line the place was completely full and the owner was able to please every one ether with wine or an antipasto on the house 

I recommend this place if you want to have a good Italian meal for a good value ! This restaurant is PERFECT for italian food lovers and or pasta seafood lovers! We had a group of 10 people that just loved the steak, veal, chicken,pasta, seafood and original specials. Affordable and fun dinning. My overall experience was great and fun, not to mention that they serve you big portions so expect to take home leftovers or share family style so you can try everything. It gets really packed but trust me it is definitely worth the wait =)  

(my girl friend thought the waiters were super hot and model like..so if you are in to italian men and great italian cuisine; MONA LISA is where they are at)

It's not easy to find an authentic italian restaurant in this country.  I know of one i would recommend: Mona Lisa !!  

I go to  Mona Lisa every time I'm in San Fran because it's really GOOD.  They have fantastic pizza and pasta not to mention some great veal, seafood and steak dishes (though, disappointingly, not all specials are always available the fresh specials are limited on a first come first serve basis and not always on the menu).

My girl friend and I recently celebrated our anniversary here and the staff went out of their way to make our evening pleasant.  The maitre'd helped me coordinate, via email, the exact table I wanted and delivery of flowers to be set up and waiting for us on arrival.  Our server was knowledgeable, helpful, and attentive without being intrusive.
 
Dessert was a revelation:  Layered sponge cake and whipped cream with a chocolate bamba and espresso!  

What could be better?

My girlfriend commented at one point during the meal, that it didn't seem very Italian to her - which I found to be complimentary since most Americans think of Italian food as loaded w/ garlic and heavy on tomato sauce and oil ... a distinctly Italian influence on American Italian cuisine and so much less than what the nuances of Italian cooking have to offer.

Some of the reviews herein say that mona lisa is average but they must work for the competition, I don't know - but my first time was in 2006 and i keep coming back ! MONA LISA IS MY FAVORITE NORTH BEACH EXPERIENCE.  Maybe I just know what to order by sticking to the authentic menu ... but also note that, per Michael Bauer's recent, glowing review in the SF Chronicle, and several professional athlete and celebrity reviews its a WINNER IN MY BOOK !

No better Italian cooking than the food of NORTH BEACH ... thank you MONA LISA!

CIAO!
author: carl h.

description:
Five of us had dinner at Mona Lisa on Friday night.  It was a great experience.  Good food and service.  The owner Mauricio helped us get a very safe ride back to Ghirardelli Square.  He is a gracious host.
We highly recommend Mona Lisa.
author: Michele A.

description:
Ahh this place has incredible food!!!

Came here for a first date, my birthday last year, brought some family friends once and every time I take someone new they remind me of how good it was and tell me they want to go back. The menu is seriously intimidating, long and endless. BUT... i bet that everything on that menu is spectacular regardless of what you order. Everyone raved about what they ordered in my birthday party of 20 so I know at least 20% of the menu is excellent. I've been there about 5 or 6 times and the food is very impressive. I DREAM about the fresh pumpkin raviolis!! My stubborn grandmother finally says she found a cioppino better than hers, and the service is excellent

Also, the atmosphere is great when its bustling at dinner with all the decorative walls and great italian speaking waiters. Great service, the freshest food, definitely worth trying.

Only negative is parking, but where in the city is parking actually easy anyway?
author: Ashley V.

description: Food wasn't the problem: service was. Instead of a neat, easy to read printed receipt, we got a small paper with prices scribbled in. I kept a running estimate in my head of what the total should have been: $160. The piece of paper showed $240... Apparently the waiters there are trained to stuff the bill when they see people wearing dolce & gabbana. Mona Lisa's great food can't make up for such lack of integrity.
author: Christian C.

description: A lot of great places in North Beach, this would not be top of my list but pretty good location and decent food.  Worth a try, just not part of my regular rotation.
author: Todd S.

description: Terrible service. We were actually asked to leave to make room for others.  Amazingly, we hadn't finished our wine!
author: Darrel P.

description: Very good pizzas, but most everything else is aggressively average, bordering on pretty good.  Prices keep me from coming back here more than twice; there is definitely better italian food in the city.
author: Nathan S.

description: i give it 5star it is excellent food great service and they treat you like family really the best pasta i have ever had i have tried a few things here and it is never a let down
author: Gypsy R.

description: This was a great itialian restaurant. The decorations were so interesting, very romantic for a date night. I would highly recommend the Fettucine Mona Lisa, but stay away from the table wine!
author: Jennifer M.

description: I have been to SF a few times and have tried many many Italian places in order to find, what in my opinion, is the best. I will withhold deeming Mona Lisa the best, but it is certainly the best I have found so far. Granted, I was a little inebriated when I came here, the pasta and meatballs were excellent. The service was top notch and the atmosphere was great. We came with a big group rather late into the night as the servers shifts ended they stayed and talked with us. It was truly a great experience. As authentic as I have had in SF.
author: Chris S.

description:
BEST SERVICE AND ITALIAN FOOD EVER!!!!

My mom used to come from Dallas to SF every 6 weeks to see me when I was living in the City.

Every time she came, we went to Mona Lisa.

She has been unable to travel for the last 10 years and I have moved back to Dallas, but I go back about once a year.

The owner always remembers me, but more importantly, my mother and asks me to call her on the phone so he can speak to her.

He calls her "My Queen."

Although the days of "all of my pastas is $8.88" is gone, the food is still terrific and the service couldn't be any better.

Rumor has it that his brother has opened up a restaurant called "Coluseo."

Can't wait to try it!
author: skip s.

description: I took out of town guests here for dinner. I've eaten here before on less busy evenings and had a pleasant experience. This time the food was again good, and the service was good too, until we got the check. We sat at the table for maybe another 10 minutes chatting, and then the waiter pretty abruptly asked us to give up the table for another party. That's not exactly the send-off I want to get from a place that is so aggressive in pulling you off the street. Maybe they thought we were all out of towners who wouldn't care?
author: Thomas S.

description:
I have eaten at Mona Lisa twice.  My friend and I went there at first because it was convenient and had no wait.  The Yelp reviews were kind of mixed, but we figured we'd give it a shot anyway.  I'm so glad that we did.  The food was really good.  I live in LA where good Italian food is nearly impossible to find.  So I was so happy once we received our fried calamari appetizer.  It's a really big portion, and the breading and seasoning complement it very nicely.  Our entrees were very tasty as well.

So this weekend when I was back in SF visiting my friend, we decided to try Mona Lisa again, hoping it would be as good as last time - and it sure was.  We again started with the fried calamari (delicious), and I had a simple penne with chicken in a tomato cream sauce.  It was a nice portion (not too big, not too small), and very flavorful.  

I will say, though, that the menu needs some help.  It is humongous and needs a little organization.  On the plus side, you can get pretty much anything you want.  You just have to do a lot of reading first.  Unlike other reviews, I didn't feel that the service was bad on either visit.  The waiters were attentive as needed.  

I will definitely go back to Mona Lisa next time I'm in SF!
author: Ryan B.

description:
My boyfriend and I wanted to go someplace special for my birthday so we picked this cozy little Italian restaurant and I must say that we left very happy.  Yes, the place is small, but the romantic candle light and decorations overpowered the feeling of being cramped.  The atmosphere was wonderful.  I also love it when you can see the chefs working on your food.  Their open kitchen brings about a pleasant feeling as it almost seems more personal.  The service was excellent as well.  The waiters were friendly though albeit, a little too busy to check up on you often, but they get the job done.
The highlight of the night was definitely the food.  For me, the salmon pasta that we ordered was unforgettable.  Tasting the sauce reminded me of what a cream sauce was supposed to be like...it's supposed to be creamy!  Their sauce wasn't overly thick and injected with butter like many so called 'Italian' places out there, but it actually tasted like rich milk that complimented the pasta instead of drowning it.  The salmon was perfectly cooked so that the flavor of the fish was still there, but was still tender and moist.  The salmon comes in small chunks, but for 1 of the cheapest items on the pasta menu, I thought it was totally worth it.
The next most memorable items were the appetizers.  There calamari was absolutely delicious.  The batter was not too heavy and allowed you to enjoy the delightful texture of fresh squid.  If the flavor's not bold enough for you, the marinara sauce will definitely make up for that.  They have the best marinara sauce that I've ever tasted hands down.  It's not too tangy or dominated by tomatoes by is a fine blend of tomato sauce and herbs.   The other appetizer plate that we got was a nice starter as well, containing various cold meats and cheeses to get you ready for the main course.  All of the ingredients were fresh and delectable.
The pizza that we ordered was also delicious with a harmonious combination of artichokes, olives and ham.  The crust was of a thin style.  It was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  It wasn't too hollow, nor too heavy.  My favorite part of the pizza was the generous chunks of artichoke baked into the flavorful cheese.
So all in all, it was a great place for a nice, authentic Italian dinner.  We definitely recommend it.
author: J K.

description:
I really like this place, I'm not giving it a 5 because the seating arrangement I don't love so much.  The food has always been really good, but at times I had to sit very close to the next table. So close I feel like they are part of my party.  I don't care much about what's happening around me, but that day was a bit intrusive. Then again it was Christmas time and the place was really full. I've gotten great service and have never had a problem with the food I ordered. 

I've been back several times and have enjoyed it.
author: Raquel R.

description:
A friend was up from LA, and we were wandering the streets looking for a good place to line our tummies before we hit the bars.  We saw a place that looked good, stood in line to get in, and promptly realized that we were in line for the wrong restaurant.  Thankfully, the wait took all of about 4 minutes, and the nice Italian man outside reminded me of a younger, sober-er version of my Nono, because we didn't have time to switch back to our original choice.

I still think about that pasta.  I defy anyone (without a shelfish allergy) to tell me how you can go wrong with crab and asparagus in a tomato cream sauce.  Henceforth, I shall drag every out of town friend here to get me my Mona Lisa pasta fix.
author: sarah w.

description: Menu is huge, food is tasty, and the environment is great.  No matter what we have ordered, it's been delicious. I'm fond of the ravioli bolognese, which I get with pink sauce.   The four cheese penne is also a favorite.    The hop-on, hop-off tourist bus stops right in front of the restaurant, and people are always out front, snapping photos of the the little Fiat with the Mona Lisa design on the hood.  They have a few tables right outside, if you're into sidewalk dining and people watching (which doesn't get any better than this!  It's North Beach!)    The staff and the owner are wonderful and always treat us like family (which is nice since we do go there quite regularly!).  Every time someone comes to visit me, we end up going here because it's a great meal in an exciting part of town.     The one time we got there on a Saturday night (right before Christmas) and they were busy, they walked us over across the street to Colosseo, which is apparently their new sister restaurant with the same menu and recipes. They were true to their word.  It was delicious, too!
author: Amy J.

description:
Last night was the 2nd time my husband and I came to Mona Lisa; we're glad we came.  Upon getting seated, we mentioned to our waiter, who was very attentive, we had a Restaurant.Com certificate.  Likewise, we told him we had very little time for dinner due to an event we had to be within 45 minutes.  He ensured we got served immediately and was very considerate.

For starters we had some wine and Calamari Fritti for appetizer -- very good and cooked perfectly and the marinara sauce was wonderful!
My husband had the Minnestrone and he said it was amazingly good.  
He also had the Ravioli Crema di noci and appeared to have enjoyed every bite, although he was beginning to get full at this point.  He did not finish his serving.
I had the Gnocchi al Pomodoro w/Shrimp; the sauce and the gnocchi were cooked perfectly.  Albeit, I would've enjoyed a couple more shrimps.  I didn't finish my plate, neither and requested to take our leftovers home.

We couldn't leave without trying their Tiramisu and we were not disappointed.  My husband had a latte and he said is absolutely made perfectly.

We had a positive experience at Mona Lisa and will definitely return for more.
author: Rico M.

description:
Um..ya...tourist heaven.

That's all I can say.

When people can't get into the Garlic Themed restaurant in the same neighborhood, they come here .
author: Me Y.

description: I am so sorry that people had a bad experience in Mona Lisa... I used to go here every Sunday morning with my ex a couple of years ago. Never had any problems with food or service. Besides, I really loved the Italiano decor. I do not know what (if anything) has changed, and what is the difference between morning and evening staff, but I would really recommend this place for brunch or lunch on the weekend
author: Olga P.

description: When I went to this restaurant with my fellow marines and navy corpsman in full uniform for San Francisco fleet week, we weren't expecting any special treatment, good or bad, but my waiter was the worst I've ever had... ever. He was rude, barely came by the table, and wouldn't even split my check up for the party I was with because he was "too busy". It seemed to me that we were being prejudiced for being military.
author: James H.

description: Prices are a little high, but the food is really good.  Service is nice.  Outdoor dining is romantic.  We had the salmon carpaccio and lasagna.  I think Mona Lisa is a good restaurant but there are better ones on Columbus Ave. in North Beach.
author: Steven G.

description: Sooooo delicious. I love gnocchi, and these are by far the best I've had (including it Italy). Just don't try to eat the whole bowl. They're delicious, but you will be sick all day if you eat them all. Doggie bag, anyone?
author: S A.

description: This place is awesome!  I've been here about 4 times the past couple of years. The food is always delicious and the atmosphere is amazing. The manager, the host, and all the waiters either are Italian or speak Italian. They speak Italian to each other. The desserts are to die for as well. The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because even if you have a reservation you still might have to wait a little bit to get seated. And also the service can be slow (depending on how busy it is). Other than that, everything else more than makes up for it.
author: Anastacio R.

description: Mona Lisa felt like an authentic Italian experience!! The food was delicious, my pasta was homemade, and my wine was terrific! The owner was very charming and stopped by our table to toast a drink with us.  Then to our surprise with our bill came out a complementary dessert which was fantastic! Overall, an absolutely wonderful experience!!
author: Melissa W.

description:
The food was good but super pricey.  The place is fancy giving you the feeling of Italy.  Upon arrival it was a busy Saturday night and the place was packed.  Surprisingly we were able to be seated within 5ish minutes.  Menu had a large selection with all kinds of appealing dishes.  My girl ordered some seafood which came out very very salty and I ordered the spaghetti  and meat balls which was wonderful.  My serving was small and the price was over the top; very expensive.  Overall, this is a good place to eat if you are looking to spend some money for average but good food.  

After looking at other reviews I see they love to use the salt!
author: Mike F.

description:
Yummy yummy yummy!
My friend suggested this place yesterday, and boy am I glad he did. The decor is interesting, and the atmosphere, it's so lively! It was pretty busy on a Monday night, and the place was filled with people and all the patrons seemed to be really enjoying themselves too.
I had the spaghetti with clams in a clear wine sauce, boy it's good! The portions are huge! But I finished it all! There was like 2 dozen clams. Mmmmmm can't wait to go back.
My friends seemed to really enjoy their food too. The waiters were real Italian, and they were all so nice and courteous. The place is filled with energy, it's so alive.
My friend ordered 2 pizzas but I was way to full to try it. I did have dessert. The profiteroles were not too bad, and I also had this vanilla & chocolate ice cream with a frozen cherry covered in chocolate ball thing, which was ok.
I would definitely recommend this place for a nice happy meal that will fill you up but won't kill you wallet =)
We had 2 appetizers, 2 pizzas, 3 entrees, 2 desserts and a coffee, all for about $150. Not too shabby =)
author: Jenny W.

description:
here's the deal...i ilve in SF so i was a little skeptical of doing the whole kitschy crazy columbus st italian restaurant scene...but my sister and her bf were in town and we had a wedding in North Beach so figured what the H not? 

I WAS SERIOUSLY IMPRESSED.  yes, the waiters were totally guido'd out and i was called "senorina" 9234234 times and ogled to the high heavens....but the food was great, the atmosphere was fun and the price was right.  of all the spots on columbus i would definitely recommend mona lisa for a fun north beach experience.

my fave dishes:  the cheesey ravioli with walnuts, prosciutto and melon, mushroom risotto and the bruschetta
author: Brooke M.

description: You would think that an italian restaurant in little italy, with that great a location, would know how to make pasta.  But no, they suck.  Come on.  I can make better spaghetti at home.
author: Richard E.

description:
We took our cousins here who were visiting from out of town. Mona Lisa has a large menu of dishes which can be a worry at some places, meaning that you may get more options than quality. No worries there for our experience. The dishes were exceptional. I had the Penne San Francisco (crab, penne, asparagus in tomato cream sauce) and it was quite tasty! The steak with porcini mushrooms was great. My wife loved her pasta dish. The deserts were amazing. We had cannoli which had dark chocolate, and some orange peel in it with the whip cream and the cheese filling. Sooo good. The peach sorbet was unbelievable and I don't even care for peach (my cuz said the same). The tiramisu was great, too. Our server was very friendly and accommodating. We had a very good experience overall and would go back. We had 1 salad, 1 appetizer, 4 entrees, 3 desserts, and 3 coffees. Bill was around $160 for all this for 4 people so...less than 200 for 4 people having a quality meal. Nice.

Update: Went back a second time and two of three dishes were craaaaazy salty. Maybe it was just bad night or a sign of hit and miss. Hopefully just a farce because the first visit was excellent.
author: McKay G.

description:
Negative:
I hoped that things will turn out awesome that night, as this is the first time that "my husband meets the in-law" kinda thing. We rushed to restaurant after picking up my mom from the international airport and brought her here, as we thought this is the best place to take a special guest. At first, my mom was amazed, because of the huge selection of food on their menu. Thirty minutes after, a roach ran across our table that freaked us all out. OMG. My husband tried to talk to the manager about it and warned them that this incident will ruin their reputation, so they should make sure cleanliness is their priority above all. As a compliment, they gave us one tiramisu cake for dessert. I took a bite and there was a curly hair in our tiramisu. OMG. What a nightmare. 

We thought that they will take care of everything, because of these terrible incidents. Guess what??? We had to pay for all those craps, and we were surprised to pay such an expensive amount for a pasta, risotto, and one appetizer.

Bathroom was clean, but when my mom tried to get a glimpse of their kitchen, she thought it was pretty dirty for a restaurant.

Comment on food: 
Their spaghetti was bland, but their risotto is pretty good.

Positive:
This restaurant looks so classic and elegant with its gorgeous interior design. It reminded me so much of my stay in Rome --the ambience, the waiters speaking in Italian, the seemingly authentic Italian menu. I also love that they have the probably most extensive menu in North Beach.
author: Brownlab S.

description:
SERVICE:  Decent,  my glass of water was empty and I had to keep asking for water refills.  My clams / mussels were sandy and I asked the watier why it was sandy, he said because it was fresh, that's complete BS

FOOD: Dessert was great but appetizer and entree was horrible.  I ordered some combination of seafood pasta with white wine sause.  Sause was bland and watery, clam and mussels was tiny and had alot of sand, shrimp was not fresh and overcooked.  I ordered smoked salmon / smoked meat on bread (forgot what it's called), it was overly salty and portions were very small for $13.

ATMOSPHERE: noisy but not too noisy, decor was tasteful and great for dates.

CONCLUSION:  I rather open up canned pasta and eat at home.  I was VERY disappointed about the quality,  go to Michaelangelos instead
author: Raymond L.

description:
hospitality..hospitality...hospitality....

and i can't say that enough times...me and my girls, we would come here religiously almost every weekend...so much that they started to take notice...and the owner would always send us over an appetizer on the house...bruchetta, my favorite...everybody's favorite, unless of course you dont like tomatoes...

the individual pizza is scrumptious, i ask for extra olives...cuz its the good marinated olives..not those nasty lil black things "pizza hut" likes to call olives... you could even share a pizza with some one...8 slices...cuz its real easy to fill up on the bread they send your way as soon as u sit down with olive oil n balsamic vinaigrette, and  i'll glass of wine to go with that, por favore amore!

only thing i would not recommend eating is the seafood...well thats obvious...cuz everybody should know, you dont eat seafood at a non seafood place...

the risotto is to die for...creamy and cheesy and muy italiano!! 

pasta is always good

cheese ravioli is yummy...just wish they could put more ravioli's on the plate....
author: SammyWammy S.

description: Visiting from Seattle, and following a wine tour, we really wanted great Italian food. We got okay food and bad service. I asked for parmesan cheese to be brought to the table and cracked black pepper. Without asking, the sad waiter shook tons of cheese on my seafood pasta. No apologies made. In addition, we kept having to ask for service. We did not finish before he came and swept our plates away. For 250.00 bill, everything should have been great.
author: Quinn D.

description:
My boyfriend and I tried the Mona Lisa for the first time this past weekend for lunch and it will be the last time I go there.  The service was terrible.
We must have had the same waiter that shauna m. had.  It took forever for him to take our order (and the restaurant was not busy by any means).
I ordered the saffron risotto with prawns and it was tasteless.  My boyfriend ordered a veggie pizza which was better than the risotto.
Once we were done eating we sat there for quite a long time waiting for the waiter to bring us our check.  I was very disappointed with this restaurant and will not go back.
author: Connie I.

description: We were looking for some good authentic North Beach Italian while in SF recently and stumbled upon this restaurant. Very kitschy painted wall murals and extensive menu, we all found something we liked. I had a great risotto dish and my son said he had the best pizza ever.  We were happy, but there are so many other restaurants in North Beach that I think we'd rather try something new next time, instead of returning here. Not a knock necessarily, but it didn't blow my socks off.
author: Carrie S.

description: Great Restaurant located in the heart of North Beach. Great Wine. Great Service. Food was good and well priced.
author: Ruby M.

description:
whack. why doesnt yelp have negative stars..just like ms. chatherine h..who im sure i ran into that night because EVERYONE was outside complaining about lost reservations..mona lisa lost our reservations as well.. the jerk off at the front was the biggest prick ever (well i would be too if i wasnt getting any love on valentines day!) way to f*** up valentines day dinner assclowns. 

MONA LISA RESTAURANT--YOU SUCK!
author: Clair B.

description:
Kudos to anyone else giving this place ONE STAR. absolutely the worst dining experience i have ever had. Five star reviews must be an inside job from this tacky decored(flashing christmas lights) TV-dinner tasting restaurant.

Lured in by an overly friendly italian man and seated at a cramped two-top. Very slow service, the place was practically empty but it took a long time to get service.  They said that they were offering a free bruschetta appetizer that night which we asked for and then they just gave us bread (which was not very good). 

Should have known by the overly extensive menu of very basic items that this place would suck.

Food came out quick, the vegetables tasted frozen or canned. Nothing tasted fresh about it.  Left in a hurry, considered not paying the ticket, but did....  don't eat here.
author: Brad Y.

description: Quintessential Italian comfort food restaurant: high on quantity and charm, but not so much on quality. Not like that is a knock against this place. The food was good and plenty, but nothing to write home about. The decor obnoxious, atmosphere lively and staff authentically Italian.
author: Yoeun P.

description: WOWSERS!! They have 137+ pastas on their menu!! I could go back every day for 6 months and still not have tried everything. They have a whole section of vegetarian pastas that is like a whole page long. We had a vegetable risotto, a truffle & cheese ravioli with tomato cream sauce (EXCELLENT), and a vegetarian pizza. Their dessert menu was fantastic (same stuff that Steps of Rome has) .. the profiteroles are the  best.
author: Antara B.

description:
I am not one to really ever give bad reviews, never a 1 star at least, but this place was just plain awful.  Trader Joe's pizza is better than this.  When my friend asked the waiter what the pizza was like, the waiter answered "it's italian pizza".  WRONG.  It was horrible, soggy crust, heavy toppings, and weird tasting sauce.  

Please do NOT go to this tourist trap.  We even let a couple know that was looking at the menu outside to go somewhere else.  I don't want to cause a restaurant to have fewer patrons, but I can't in all good judgment recommend this to anyone.
author: Jenn L.

description: I love this place!!  The Gorgonzola sauce is ridiculously amazing. There's a risqué pic of Mona on the wall.  You should eat here.
author: Liss J.

description:
"Yo Mona Lisa...could I get a date on Friday...and if you're busy...I wouldn't mind takin' Saturday ay ay..."

besides the words of wyclef...all i hafta say about this place is, "meh!"
author: Nancy T.

description: A mediocre place. A little bit too cramped for my taste. Had hardly any room for walking. The menu is very extensive, good or bad? you decide. Lets see....me and my boyfriend started off with the Fritti Misto (fried Calamari and prawns with marinara sauce) which was tasty. I had the Spaghetti allo Scoglio. I liked the mussels in it, but that was pretty much it. My boyfriend had the Lobster Ravioli that was pretty tasty. Dessert was the Chocolate Truffle. It was yummy but nothing that went "Damn, I gotta get more of that!" not even a "I gotta come back next time for it" . Total for our bill was about $63. The decorations was nice. Service wasn't bad. I probably wouldn't come back here again.
author: Audrey M.

description: The scenery was great. The calamari was excellent, but the lobster ravioli was ok. I will go back and try something else.
author: Mike O.

description: Mona Lisa has such an extensive menu! I had their pasta in white wine sauce with calamari, shrimp, and mussells. It was plentiful and good, but I wish it had more sauce. My friend had the veal parmigian and I thought the veal was too salty, but my friend thoroughly enjoyed it. Prices are reasonable (for North Beach, that is) and I would come back here again. The ambience was nice and the staff was friendly. They have outside seating which is great for people watching.
author: Mia F.

description:
There are many great selling points to Mona Lisa: decor, location, food, service...

I like Little Italy, so that is why I say location, but that is probably because I'm Italian.  I can't really think of any other reason I like it, since parking is a WHORE there.  But Mona Lisa is a cute little restaurant, the decor could be called kitchsy I suppose but it is charming in my opinion.

The staff is extremely friendly, and the food is great.  I usually get fettucine alfredo, which is amazing, but last time I had pesto ravioli and they were really really good too.  Everything I have tasted there is good, actually.  My boyfriend always gets risotto, and if you like that, theirs is mmmmm.   

It is also a cute place to go on a date...me and my man went on our second or third date there, and the food and atmosphere made up for the awkwardness of trying to make conversation with someone you don't know that well...HA HA sorry baby if you are reading this but its true.
author: Jessi C.

description: I will always remember this place... if not for the great atmosphere and food... but definitely because this was the night that my boyfriend proposed to me and is now my fiance (btw... I don't like that term much, lets go with future husband:).  Anyway... back to the food.  I had the spinach and ricotta ravioli which was divine!  Our server was very attentive and very helpful with picking out a wonderful wine to go with our meal.  Sure this place is smack dab in the middle of a major tourist spot, but I was a tourist so it works for me:).
author: Halley S.

description: If you like to see a restaurant owner make fun of mentally disabled homeless people, then I would highly recommend this place for lunch. My wife and I went there on a sunny Sunday San Francisco afternoon for al fresco dining and, after waiting 20 minutes for menus, waters, and a Sam Adams, watched as this disabled guy walked up to the 4 waiters and the manager (who were sititng outside bullshitting and not helping customes) - they began to yell at him making fun of the way he talked and then as the guy walked away, the staff and owner began to make fun of the way the guy walked. We waited another 30 minutes for our food - a waiter only came by one time during this time to see if we needed anything (there was only ONE other couple in the place). The food was mediocre - I had the lasagnae and my wife had shrimp fettucini alfredo - both were just OK, but not worth a 30 minute wait.
author: Brian H.

description: I really tried to be impressed, but it was just meh- both food and service. While the staff at the door were friendly, the waiter was not- rarely paid attention to us (never asked how the food was, we waited for 15 minutes after plates were cleared and had to flag down the waiter to get the check, etc). I don't mind dining in European style- with a long dinner and such, but it's another thing when you feel like as a patron you're being ignored. The risotto had a really great texture, but there was a lack of flavor and tasted more on the bland side. We tried one of the ravioli dishes, which was tasty...but nothing to really write home about. For the price it was okay, but the service/food was lacking enough that I'll try elsewhere next time.
author: Glaciala A.

description: North Beach. Mmmm... conjures up mouthwatering memories of a little place called Mona Lisa. What a great restaurant. Intimate, eclectic, fabulous wait staff with fabulous Italian accents to die for, wonderfully warm ambiance, and delicious food. Try the gnocchi, it's fantastic. But then again, so is everything else, including their salads. Whenever my husband and I go to San Francisco, we take our first meal at Mona Lisa.
author: angie w.

description: I went there with a large group and they were really great about accommodating us.  I thought the service was good too.  Now, maybe I am just one of those people that hates paying for pasta because it is soooo cheap to make yourself, but I really didn't think the food was worth the price.  It was good, but the portions were small (for an Italian restaurant) and I wasn't really "wowed."
author: Britany F.

description: Five stars for atmosphere, great staff and all around fun place !  Four to five stars for the food.  Good solid quality, freshness, taste and value.  Mauricio and his staff know how to treat guests and that is really important to us.  Best Tiramisu anywhere !  Anyplace that asks if you want dessert and you repsond "two" and they do not miss a beat and bring you the tiramisu without even double checking now that is cool !
author: BGinLove B.

description: Delicious food. Only outranked in North Beach - in my opinion - by Figaro and Franchino - though a close race! Absolutely authentic - my Italian friend says it tastes just like his grandmother's cooking.
author: Niki N.

description: We needed to find a place that was open late, since we got out of a show at around 10:30pm on a Saturday night - so we headed to North Beach. We happened upon Mona Lisa and I'm glad that I tried it out, no reservations, and we were seated right away - probably because of the late hour. Mona Lisa has really good, standard, Italian food - nothing special, but it's good stuff.  Large portions, so you can split if you want. The decor is pretty elaborate - and a little scary, but fun at the same time. I had the chicken parm and enjoyed it. I'd go back again-
author: meagan m.

description: I've experienced very bad services here at Mona Lisa and also got food poisoned from this place after eating here.  I will never go back.
author: Laura L.

description:
I went there last night around 9pm with my cousin and 2 of her friends.  We had a 5th person in our group but he was running late.  When we got to the restaurant the 4 of us put our name on the waitlist and were told it would be approx. 40 mins.  We asked the host if there was a bar we could wait at.  He said no.  We then asked if we could leave our number so we could wait in a nearby coffee shop and return when a table was ready.  He shrugged, which we took as another no.  He wasn't the most welcoming and friendly person we encountered, but we heard the food was fantastic so we decided to stick around.  Well just minutes later, my cousin, who's from England and is the cutest person I know, said god knows what to this guy and before we knew it, we had a table instantly!  Even though our 5th person wasn't with us, they still seated us and politely accepted our request to order without him and have him order separately when he arrived.

Our waiter, Lucciano, who I believe is from Italy (I mean grew up there, not Italian American), was AWESOME!  He recommended an Italian Champagne called Prosecco, and it was perfect.  Sweet, light and ideal for the summer.  

I ordered a Vegetable Lasagne for my entree.  Turned out they were out of it so I asked Lucciano if he could suggest a good alternative.  He told me the Manicotti was the closest to what I was looking for.  I went with that and was very, very pleased.  The spinach and ricotta cheese were perfectly blended together and the creamy marinara sauce melted in my mouth.  My cousin ordered the Four Cheese Gnochi and shared some with me, which was also lip smacking.

For dessert, I ordered a Tiramisu, which two of us were going to share.  Well, turned out they were out of that too.  As a 2nd choice, I asked for one Chocolate Truffle.  At this point, our 5th person finally showed up & ordered a dessert to catch up with us.  He chose the Profiteroll.  When Lucciano came back, he brought the Profiteroll, the Chocolate Truffle and a Chocolate Ganache Cheesecake for free since everything I ordered wasn't in.  It was really nice of him, especially since we didn't complain or even request a freebee, he brought it on his own accord.   This showed the care of the restaurant in providing excellent service and made our experience that much better.  We ate our dishes family style and everything was fantastic.  I especially loved the hard shell around the truffle and the soft icecream dissolving after a bite.  The caramel in the Profiteroll was heaven too.

I know this review is loooooong, but I just wanted to include everything we had because the quality was that goooood.  I will definately go back!
author: Swetha G.

description: My boyfriend and I were actually headed toward another Italian restaurant when we were intervened by the maitre' d' on the sidewalk. He informed us that the restaurant was celebrating an anniversary and would be offering a free appetizer. As we had our minds set on the other place, we probably would not had stayed had we not been offered the novelty Italian vehicle seating on the street that another couple had made reservations for but foolishly failed to show up for. What a blast! People on the street were taking pictures of us as we were probably a sight, having a fine, three course meal outside in a convertible. The waiter and maitre' d' both took excellent care of us even when we each ordered like, eight cups of coffee. The food was excellent, the service was amazing, and I can honestly say it was the most memorable dining experience I have ever had. I'm trying to figure out how to upload pictures on this site as I have a ton of pictures that passerbys sent to me . . .
author: K L.

description:
A big group of us, about 10, decided to hang out in the North beach area one night and were walking around looking for a place to have dinner. This guy, probably the owner, was standing in front of this place and actually approached us in order to convince us to eat there. Since he said we could be seated in the next five minutes we decided to give it a try. Being that we were such a big group with no reservations, we knew that it was probably going to be hard to find a place to accommodate us with out having to wait a long time. So we waited outside until we were called to be seated. About 15 minutes went by and we decided to ask what was going on. We were told that it would be another 5 minutes. Needless to say, this went on for about an hour before we were seated which was ridiculous. For the amount of time we waited, we could have gone anywhere else. This guy clearly lied to us on purpose to get our business. Anyway, we decided to eat there since we were all starving and didn't want to start the whole process all over again. When we sat down, we were given four appetizers on the house which made up for the wait a little bit. 

Now to the food, it was OK. Not good, not bad. I have had better. It was also a bit pricey. I haven't been back since and don't plan on ever going back.
author: Diane M.

description: the Long wait despite having reservations made me think that i was in for a big treat with the food, but I wasnt really impressed.  I WILL go back again, cause seriously, it seemed like everyone else there would wait a really long time to get in.  I had some sort of baked penne pasta, so dont get that, its blah.  Ill give it another chance and report back.  Try Figaro down the street, I was really impressed by their food.
author: Cathleya G.

description: Cheesy decor and cheesy pasta.  This one should be left for the tourists, along with the Stinking Rose.  I've had so much better elsewhere in this lovely neighborhood.
author: happy t.

description:
THIS RESTAURANT CATERS TO RIPPING OFF ANYONE AND ESPECIALLY TOURISTS!!!

So I got that off my chest.    I am not a tourist, I live in Telegraph Hill and frequently visit restaurants in North Beach.   I had a birthday dinner at Mona Lisa back in November and my close friend Phil H. wrote a scathing review.   I thought the restaurant was cheezy but the pasta is good.   Last night I went to Mona Lisa with a couple of friends and I had a horrible experience.    I ordered a $32 bottle of wine and the waiter came back and said he didn't have the wine but gave me two options, another bottle at $32 or one at $42.  I decided to splurge and get the $42 bottle and had a decent dinner and the wine was FANTASTIC.   When we got the bill, I saw on the bill the wine was $68 (I guess you get what you pay for since the wine was fantastic). . .     I mentioned this to the waiter since he mentioned this wine was only $10 more.   After mentioning this mistake on the bill, the waiter had the nerve to bring over the wine list prices and said it's $68.  I would have been fine if he said oh my mistake and just made the corrected price on the bill, but he argued with me saying it was $68.   Finally I got him to make the corrected price on the bill.   I will never go back to this restaurant again, I feel I would need to double check every price on the bill.
author: Dave B.

description: love their calamari and fetuccini alfredo w/ jumbo prawns =)
author: Kae B.

description: Good Atmosphere, love the decor and customer service, I am just super picky on my Italiano food.. great for a date, not for tons of people..Service is with a smile!!
author: Rachelle C.

description: Great atmosphere, and I loved the decor with Italian painting and statues which you can see from the pictures.  I had the Chicken Mona Lisa pasta with marsala sauce and a very good pinot wine.  Italian accent waiter to match the decor, although the waiter seemed a little distracted at times. Probably gonna spend upwards of $20/person but a great restaurant for that price range.
author: Mitchell M.

description: I would eat my own foot before stepping foot in this restaurant. No matter what the food is like, the service is SOOOO bad, they don't deserve your money. Reservations mean nothing to them no matter how far in advance you made them. We arrived early and were kept wiating for over an hour past our reservation time to be seated. The service is beyond slow and the food is just ok. I have had walk up single slices of pizza that were far more satisfying.
author: Donald W.

description:
i spent a week for my first time in san francisco and ended up eating here twice.  i know, not very creative, but i was with two different groups of people.  the first time i was brought here by a friend who used to live in north beach.  the food was good, but not extra memorable.  i ate the bruschetta and the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce.  the buschetta was average.  the gnocchi was actually great, but not quite the best i've had.  but the gnocchi dumplings themselves were definitely on the right side of fluffy and the gorgonzola sauce had a ton of flavor.  at this stage i would rate this place 4 stars.

i went back a few days later with my wife.  she got some sort of cheese tortellini with peas and ham.  it was freaking fantastic.  i was picking off of her plate the entire time.  the ham was retardedly salty, which made it a little difficult to eat a lot of at once.  but the flavor of the dish was amazing.  i got the chicken san marino.  it was chicken stuffed with mozzarella and covered in tomato cream sauce.  also totally fantastic.  one of the best italian chicken dishes i've had.

the second night was probably the best italian meal i've eaten since i was in italy 3 years ago.  and i've eaten at a lot of great italian restaurants in the last 3 years.  so i have to give this place 5 stars.
author: Scott S.

description:
when you're here, you're family!

mona lisa is in the heart of the north beach. we rarely go, but went because we had a friend in town and wanted to cover all the san francisco basics. 

while we were strolling by we noticed mona lisa. the owner was quite the charmer. he convinced us to dine at the restaurant, luring us in with free bruschetta and a promise that he would turn the heat lamps on if we wanted to dine outside. it also didn't hurt that the waiter called me bella.... 

the menu had a great variety of italian dishes and was surprisingly affordable, considering its location. i ordered the veal picatta and it was pretty good. my only complaint is that the spinach was super oily which made the rest of my plate greasy. the guys ordered lobster ravioli, which was OK and the pumpkin ravioli which was quite delicious. the sage on top was perfect. 

overall, it's a pretty good, reasonably priced classic italian restaurant with good service. i might go back if i was in the area, but would more likely be up for trying another restaurant.
author: Jessica S.

description: I'm surprised I haven't been here before. Perhaps it was the pushy staff outside, always trying to lure me in. I finally gave in one night and my friends and I were pleasantly surprised. The inside was nicely decorated and the food was good. Service was also good (minus pushy sales at the front door) but it also wasn't busy at that late hour. Might return, not sure yet, since there are sooo many other choices on Columbus. Good enough to try once, or to show out of towners. Again, really liked the inside.
author: Sabi M.

description: Hmmm...I only ate here because it was an out-of-town friend's birthday, and also a tradition of hers to eat here when she's in the city.  The place is crowded and the food is average.  They are very nice though...one of my friends was a victim of the 'unscrew the jar of dried chili pepper' trick.  About half of the bottle landed on her dish, and the entire table, along with several tables around us, did the collective "ohhhh".  The waiter saw what happened and gave her a fresh plate of pasta, no extra charge.
author: San D.

description: Mona Lisa is the place to be when I have a craving for Italian food. I have been coming here for a couple of years. The food is consistent and people friendly. This place does get packed on weekends so be prepared to wait. I try to come on off nights and the service is quick and the food as it should be. People that complain that its bad on the weekend and how busy... come on its busy for a reason and just because you have to wait ohhh no...
author: Dennis K.

description: I haven't been here in a really long time...but I'm craving their walnut raviolis right about now.
author: Roxanne B.

description: Mona Lisa Smiles.  You're sure to leave here with a smile on your face.  The food is great, typical awesome North Beach Italian food.  LOVED the 4-cheese pasta dish. My secret is to sit at the table near the window.  It's intimate, and you won't be bothered by overhearing other people's conversations.  Order some wine throughout dinner and dessert, you'll certainly leave Mona Lisa with a bigger smile :)
author: Wendy H.

description:
I went there for my bday last year with a party of 10. They placed us near the door, where the kitchen is, and we kept getting bumped in the chair by the waiters walking around. It was too crowded. 

The service was a bit below average. They kept rushing us to order - drinks to be exact. The food was okay, I think I had the chicken marsala and it was like eating salt. I would not go back.
author: Tracy P.

description:
this is the best restaurant in San Francisco's little Italy neighborhood. I am a local to the city and have eaten at every restaurant in North Beach. The menu is HUGE, tough to choose, but my favs are: the spagetti polpette (and it is theonly spagetti and meatballs worth eating in the area); chicken piccata - out of this world; the ravioli are all made each day - cannot be beat; the risotta is creamy and delicious. 

The wine list is great and as a tradional 'mom&pop' restaurant, it doesn't serve liqour which to some is a downside, but then, wine is traditional for Italy! 

Mauricio, the owner, makes sure you are happy. As a frequent guest to his restaurant, I get a compliementary appetizer or glass of wine each time I eat there or bring a guest with me. I have only had one bad meal in the seven years I have been going to this restaurant and the waiter warned me it wasn't that great and I ordered it anyway. The menu has grown and changed over the years and the prices have gone up, but in comparision to other restaurants in North Beach, you get the best meal for your money! I could eat there every night!
author: Laura G.

description:
We were here once before a few years ago and had a decent (but not great) lunch.  Decided to try it again with friends for dinner.  Big mistake.  Huge lines on a Saturday night -- after our experience, I'm not sure why.  Our reservations were basically ignored.  The decor is rather cheesy (topless Mona Lisa, anyone?), the service was so-so, and the food was poor.  The bread that arrived before the meal actually had dried, stale ends.  The appetizer of bruschetta and capresi salad was uninspired.  My husband ordered a risotto he had had here before and loved -- this time, it was dry and the shrimp was over-cooked.  My  porcinni mushroom risotto, which I ordered on the server's recommendation, was nothing but salt and garlic -- I only ate about half of it, and that was because I had skipped lunch.  One friend ordered a dish with salmon, which he doesn't like, because the server was rushing us through the ordering process.  Bleh.
There are many wonderful restaurants in San Francisco -- frequent them and skip Mona Lisa's!  Don't waste a night in the city on this place!
author: Sandi P.

description: I would give 4 stars, but there has been a major change.  I must admit, I have not been here for a while, but when I DID go, there was a jar of fresh chopped garlic on each table to mix with olive oil and balsamic vinegar to dunk your bread into.  Never had 3 ingredients tasted so good together.  Now the jar is gone!!  Nothing was memorable, and a better lasagne can be had in my kitchen.  Nice, homey decor, but I agree that the same sauce appears in some pastas.
author: Michael M.

description:
Good food, good service, not pricey, but then again i didn't pay.   (Note, food did take a bit to get to us, though it was crowded)

Outdoor seating didn't have heaters so we opted for indoors(SF is cold! after living in San Diego for a week)

Penne alla Silana was GOOD. eggplant and garlic, I added a side of Spinach and meat sauce and my taste buds sang with pleasure.

CUTE sighting. Little boy, maybe 3, with mom and dad fell asleep with his face on the table. Kodak moment.

Mona Lisa may be anti-semitic though, of the 30 flags on the wall the Israel flag was the only small one the rest was one size. things that make you go hmmmmmm
author: James H.

description: I can't believe I fell for this tourist trap of a restaurant.  Everything we ordered was awful, especially the homemade pasta which makes Safeway pasta seem classic Italian.
author: Debbie Y.

description: The food is pretty good, not the best in North Beach, bur a far cry from McDonalds.  It's classic italian, the kind of stuff you could make at home its become such standard fare.
author: Herbert S.

description:
I went here last night with my dad & boyfriend, looking for some great Italian food and a fun enough atmosphere to entertain my Denverite dad.  We were very thoroughly impressed.

I had the Fettuccine alla Pescatore-- clams, mussels, calamari, and jumbo shrimp in a tomato sauce.  Absolutely delicious.  My dad & boyfriend had 2 different kinds of lasagna-- wonderful.  All of our entrees were nicely presented and very tasty, and we all thought it couldn't get any better... and then we saw the dessert menu.

If you go here, definitely go for dessert.  They have all sorts of gelato concoctions that are simply unique, not to mention delicious.  I'd recommend the Coppa Caffe or Cappuccino Truffle if you like coffee desserts!  

Great service-- I think we only had to wait a few minutes for a table-- and nice wait staff.

I'd definitely take friends and family here again, and suggest this place to anyone who likes good Italian food with a campy Italian restaurant's charm.
author: Coral E.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in North Beach,  by far, and probably my favorite in San Francisco. If you can't find something you like on the menu, you're not looking. They offer 30 different types of Rissoto alone! The bread is excellent, though they don't make it themselves. I've frequently been able to get free bruschetta here, too, which is always nice. The atmosphere is wonderful and the wine list is pretty good. I've never been disappointed at here at Mona Lisa, and it not nearly the tourist trap the other reviewers lead you to believe it is. In fact, it is probably the least "touristy" of the restaurants I've been to on Columbus. If you want a tourist trap, go up the street to Calzones.
author: Lance J.

description: Searching for authentic Italian food before my poetry feature at Om Shan Tea in San Francisco, my husband and former Violent Femmes' drummer Guy Hoffman checked out several options before landing at Mona Lisa. What was it? The Italians speaking in Italian out front, welcoming us with fervor, the menu offering dishes I recognized from my travels in Italy. The entire staff was so friendly and helpful. The Pinot Grigio was superb. Guy did not indulge in his usual dry gin martini or exotic beer. I ordered the Melanzane alla Parmigiana. Delightful! Delicious! Reminded me of u manchare and my Sicilian relatives back home! Buon manchare, molto bene, grazie Mona Lisa! She makes you smile. I will go to see her every time.
author: Jeanne Marie S.

description:
Looking for something to remember (for your "worst ever" list).  Prepared to play code breaker and actuary when the bill comes and they try STEAL some extra money.  Then go here or live vicariously through this review.

Quickly seated on a busy night, but I think that was a sign of what was to come.  The ridiculous 800 item menu without some simple Italian dishes (no grilled calamari, no cavatelli pasta, etc) was an initial tipoff that this place has no idea what Italian is beyond saying "Graaatzieeee".

Obviously cheap frozen squid from a box in my dish.  A side of olive (maybe) oil with a bit of mushy tasteless spinach.  She had the gnocchi which wasn't very good and was covered in the same tasteless, except for some sourness/acidity from the tomatoes, red sauce.  I don't even know where they buy (they don't make anything) sauce this bad since it makes Prego/Ragu seem like something Charlie Trotter must have slaved for hours on.   And Prego/Ragu are CRAP.  

All this for $14-20 PASTA dish prices! In this alternate universe Olive Garden is a good deal at $200 a person.

So you would think all that was bad enough.  But no, read on to see the positive for this place and how that went bad.....

The server was nice (if a bit corny) and attentive.  He kept our wine glasses full, etc....  But, I never got a refill on my empty water.  Maybe the attention to the wine is more about getting you to order more than caring to your needs, who knows.  So his rating started strong and was dropping when I got the almost unreadable mess of a "bill".  I was trying to figure out why it didn't add up when she noticed some inconspicuous scribble for bruschetta we didn't order.  It didn't stop there, the tax was padded with another 5-7 dollars.  I complained and had the bill corrected, but come on how many times do they pull this per night.  So not only do they rob me indirectly with the crap food, but they also just flat out steal.
author: K B.

description: We used to eat here ALL the time, starting on one of our earliest dates. Normally we ignore the people standing outside trying to coax passersby into their restaurants, but we were hungry, it looked decent, and we didn't feel like hunting anymore for the restaurant we were originally planning on going to. We have yet to go to the original place we were headed for that night, but have made countless trips to the Mona Lisa. It was one of the few places we missed immensely when we moved to the east coast. We finally made it back a couple weeks ago, and the food and ambiance was as excellent as we remembered. I usually take forever to decide what I want only to revert back to their tortelloni, last time it was the tortelloni with pesto sauce. Even my 4yo declared the Mona Lisa her favorite restaurant, and she normally can't pick because she loves everywhere as long as it's a restaurant.
author: kandice u.

description: i thought the food was decent.  the menu is a little overwhelming.  i think they should simplify it a tad and focus a bit more on quality that quantity on their dishes.  the service was great though.  i'd go back - you get what you get for the prices.  oh and there are tons if strip clubs to hit up afterwards if you like that kinda thing.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: I used to love this place and would come semi-regularly for my fill of saltimbuca. This however is now, not then and things have changed. The quality of the food has slipped, but the dazzle of the interior has increased. This restaurant is becoming all glitz and no hutzpah in the kitchen. I kvetch about it here because of the fond memories i once had. Then again, the food could've been just as mediocre and my pallet just hadn't tried wonderful regional Italian dishes at fine eateries yet.
