Who knows, bottom line is, it's not bad, but far from great. Get the Sicilian candy, roast cloves of garlic with a little cheese and herb on top, very tasty, the rest of the menu is hit or miss.
author: Len S.

description: This is my favorite restaurant.  Period!  I know what good italian food is and the Mona Lisa has it!  My fav dish is the rigatoni with ricotta cheese and the best dessert (which, unfortunately is no longer on the menu) is the stracciatella gelato with hazelnut.  The owner is always around greeting people and the waiters are very tentative.  The ambiance really makes the place.  You get the feeling that you are in a Florence ristorante.  I highly recommend this place.  Yes, they are busy but that must mean it's good right?  Totally worth the wait and they always try to seat you a-sap.
author: Lindsay I.

description: Every time I visit SF, I always have to take the trip to Little Italy to eat here. It is hands down my favorite place there. Just give me some house bread, the Tomatoes Caprese, and the Spaghetti all'Amatriciana (tomato sauce, pancetta, onions, parmesan) or Fettuccine alla Pescatore (tomato sauce, prawns, calamari, mussels, clams, garlic) and I am a very happy man. The service is also very good/friendly.
author: Brian V.

description: Let me begin by saying i usually dont like italian resturants mainly because the dishes are not authentic. But before my wonderful job came along I had mona lisa to turn to. There chipino is so incredible. also dishes like either putanesca is to die for. just dont go on a major holiday or occasion because finding a table is nearly impossible. otherwise wonderful
author: joselyn b.

description: i only went to this place because I was craving for italian food and my friend said it was good when he came here back in the day. It looked very nice and fancy but it was not enough to earn them anything more than 2.5 stars. I dont know if it was the owner that was there that night but when my friend and I entered the door from the freezing outside winds, we were not seated until 30 minutes later even though there were tables open. I felt like I was being judged because I was Asian. This caucasian couple came in 20 minutes after us and were seated and served before we were. I dont know what the deal was but the food wasn't all that and the service was not as fast as I hoped it would be. Also, we were carded for alcohol while others around us were not.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: I've been to Italy (loved it)  Im actually from Spain so i know whats up, and when I think of Mona Lisa I think "Family Here" I think of this place and not that other place that smashes olives in a sterile environment! every piece of the wall(s) are covered with anything italiano! This is what a REAL italian restaurant should be like, walking through the place smelling the simmering Tomatoes and roasted garlic, and they have great portions and feeling relaxed and not leaving hungry. What's really "funny" is the fine picture of Mona Lisa with her bare Boobies hanging out! lol hahaha the price is Great! for North Beach, I love the mood..... I loved our waitress (Elizabeth) (Liz) whichever Totally nice woman with a GREAT SMILE! made us feel like family!  parking is a bitch but hey!! We are in the City And County Of San Francisco California! what do you Expect?
author: Isabella D.

description: My favorite restaurant in North Beach!  Granted I've only sampled three entrees, but they get an A+ for my measure of an Italian restaurant - the pescatore dish.  This place and Trastevere on 3rd Street Promenade in Santa Monica are the two best.  I've been to 5 or so Italian joints in North Beach and this place has the best showing.  It's pretty crowded and there's always a bit of a wait.  But it's definitely worth it!
author: Tommy K.

description: Mona Lisa is FANTASTIC!!! I took my parents here when they came into town for the day, and I made reservations for 6. When we got there we were the first ones, the chef presented us a complimentary platter overflowing of delicious prosciutto, salame, cheeses, tomatoes caprese! We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it was as fresh as it gets. good dipping sauce too. I ordered the penne san francisco (tomoato cream sauce with asparagus and crab) and my boyfriend ordered the risotto allo scoglio (white wine sauce with clams, calamari, prawns and  mussles). we were so full! my parents had spaghetti al salmone and the chicken san francisco. great wine selection, attentive service (not too pushy, but know when you need a refill or the dessert menu!). I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE! GREAT SERVICE, GREAT FOOD, GREAT AMBIANCE, and parking is less than a block away in the structure by the police department. I'll definitely be going again :)
author: toni b.

description: I think this place deserves somewhere in between 3 and 4 stars...maybe like a 3.8.  Yeah, that sounds about right.  I'm Italian and grew up eating authentic Italian grub (see My Last Meal), so my standards are high in this category.  Having said that, this place was good but not great.  Standard Italian fare on the menu.  It's the only place I've been in North Beach, so I don't really know how it compares food-wise, price-wise, and tourist-trap-wise to other places.  The management and waiters were Italian, so I guess that's a good sign.  All in all, it wasn't a bad meal, but I'd be willing to do a little more exploring to see if there's something better out there.
author: Steve S.

description: I took a prospective new client here and we really enjoyed the entire experience. The food was quite good, and the atmosphere was straight out of Lady and the Tramp. We especially liked the Sicilian Candy appetizer (roasted garlic), and the pasta was cooked to perfection.
author: Thomas M.

description: Had an absolutely fantastic dinner here at Mona Lisa this past Saturday evening. Cannot say enough good things about the owner Mauricio and our server Mario made the whole night wonderful. Such great charm and personality and you can see that everyone here, from Mauricio at the top, all the way to the busboys, really enjoy making the customers' experience special. Mario not only was great at suggesting what wines would be good choices with the food we ordered, but had a fun and enjoyable personality. We were there at the same time a very large wedding party was there and the restaurant was packed, but service and food was still perfect! The food is some of the best I have had. I am a huge fan of a particular Italian place in Little Italy in Mulberry St in NY and Mona Lisa is right there with them on how great the food is. The risotto was prepared perfectly and the Lobster Ravioli in tomato cream sauce was just absolutely delicious! Had the Italian Candy (roasted garlic) for an appetizer and would definitely suggest this to everyone. That along with the Tomato Caprese and Bruschetta make an excellent appetizer. Overall, such an outstanding experience. Thank you Mauricio and Mario! Cannot wait to come see you guys soon!
author: jason c.

description: My friend and I were going to other place then local SF guy suggested to come to this place. The decoration was amazing. We ordered Linguine calamari... I almost cried. It just tasted so good! They made with real squid ink sauce, the whole dish is black but tastes like heaven! Teramisu was also exceptional. It was light-creamy taste and has the melting wet taste mixing together so perfectly.
author: Sunisa A.

description: Talk about a disappointing introduction to SF Italian food! Terrible service, very slow and disinterested. The food was just as bad, at least what I ordered. I had a risotto and the rice was still...crunchy. Pretty sure risotto is not supposed to be crunchy, it never has been in the past. Also had a bad clam in it, sand and grit throughout the dish and the shrimp tasted a bit off. Did not bother to complain to the waiter as he was virtually invisible to us. My boyfriend had the veal marsala which he rated the sauce as the best part of the dish. Tough veal? He got it. Should have brought a flashlight to read the menu.
author: Joan C.

description: The decor in this place is the best thing about it - especially now that it's the holiday season!! After wandering up and down Columbus looking for a restaurant that looked inviting (I swear I am useless without my Yelp) we finally picked Mona Lisa Restaurant b/c of the the baby Italian car out front. I have no idea what it's called but the bf was so enamored by it that he insisted that we eat here...good thing!! I had the crab pasta and it was perfect! I'm usually very hesitant to order pasta b/c the sauces get so damn heavy but this one was the perfect balance between hearty pasta and delicious crab! The waiter gave me a crab cracker but I didn't even need to use it b/c my delicious king crab legs were already cut into manageable pieces!! My only concern was the combination of nudie paintings and the kids at the next table but it seemed like they were enjoying themselves. Good environment for a formal dinner or casual dinner - the wait staff is friendly regardless. Definitely on my list of top restaurants in North Beach!
author: Christina L.

description: This place is SUPERB!! I live in SD and I can't stop thinking about this place and wondering when I can return. I went in a group of four and 3/4 dishes were mouth watering. The gnocchi with pesto just melts in your mouth. The penne with eggplant was full of flavor and the pesto lasagna had a great balance of cheese and sauce! If you are a fan of Italian Sausage you must add that to your dish. We added it to the penne and gnocchi and it was amazing. Two Thumbs up!!
author: R B.

description:
A friend recommended this place to me and wow, let me tell you I was impressed!

The place looks a little tacky on the inside, but don't let that fool you.  Every waiter in the place is straight out of Italy I swear!  Our waiter had the cutest accent.  The menu is HUGE most extensive menu I have ever seen.  It is divided up by all the different types of pastas and after about 20minutes of deciding I choose the artichoke ravioli's, let me tell you they were like heaven on earth I loved them!  My sis had lobster ravioli's and they were just as good too!
Aside from the great main course the waiter also gave us complimentary bruchetta appetizer and 2 glasses of port wine for dessert that were also excellent (and free so you can't beat that!).

I will definitely be coming back here again real soon!  One of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to.  This would also be a neat place to go to at night because it gets pretty dark in here and they dim the lights and light candles all around the tables.
author: Ness S.

description: My favorite North Beach restaurant. Ravioli alla Zucca is pretty much AMAZING! Stick with pasta -- steak and chicken dishes have been good but not as wonderful as the pasta. Gorgonzola cream sauce- lovely! Gnocchi al pomodoro also a classic fave. Service is slow, wait sometimes long, but always worth it. I always check to see how clean my dishes are.
author: Angela H.

description: Granted, this is a complete touristy restaurant with different versions of the Mona Lisa. But the food was good and so was the wine. I had some amazing tortellini and an amazingly cute waiter...that alone deserves another trip!
author: Erin F.

description: Great place! I came here for a Valentine's Day dinner with my girlfriend, and we were very impressed. The food was very good - I ordered the calamari after seeing them bring it out to someone else, and I highly recommend it if you like calamari - warning: portion is gigantic. My girlfriend got the Pasta Carbonara, and she said it was the best she had tried since she had been in Italy. It was slightly noisy inside, but it added to the ambiance of the restaurant.
author: Daniel F.

description:
Four of us ended up eating here last August and we finally were able to order main entrees.  (Yes, I am late on writing many reviews, but what can you do with a 1-year-old running around dictating schedules?)

The salads were crisp.  Four of us were able to share two different kinds - one caesar (never fails when my husband orders) and one special.  Again, the caesar was not too garlicky and the special had yummy spinach and feta and plump cherry tomatoes.  

Between the four of us, someone had a fish dish, two had pasta dishes, and the fourth had veal parm.  We all tasted each others because there was definitely more than enough to go around and since each of us had a difficult time deciding what we wanted because of the array of options from not only the traditional menu but also the specials menu, we figured we would taste test.

The salmon was thoroughly cooked without being dry.  This was from the specials menu and the person who ordered it even had it more customized making sure it was not cooked with butter and substituted one of the sides for rice.  Even without the sauces, the dish was not plain because the fish was well seasoned and grilled.  The colorful veggies also helped please the eye.

***The server had kindly explained with a smile that anything can be done for the customer.

I ordered the clams and olive oil but I opted for linguini instead of spaghetti. It is really difficult to mess up this kind of order and of course, ML shined through.

The other pasta dish had sausage and peppers, but mild.  This was good because the person who ordered it does not do well with spicy dishes.  I am not sure if the sausage was homemade or not, but it tasted homemade.  It was not overpowered with fennel, which tends to happen often.  This is just a personal preference, so do not make a conclusion based on my personal taste over yours.  If you like fennel, then there might be too little in there for you.

The veal parm was juicy, tender, and included two slices of veal.  Typically you only see one slice.  Very filling, especially when served over pasta of your choice.
author: Kristina M.

description: This place is absolutely perfect!! It is the best italian in the city by far. The inside of the restaurant has the italian feel to it and a ton of celebrity  pictures on the walls. The food will completely trick you in to thinking you are in Italy. Our table had cheese ravioli, a pizza, meat lasagna and a chicken dish and we all loved it! Go here and you will not be disappointed!
author: Chris R.

description: Great location, truly delightful waiters, good service and the decor is fun. Too bad this is wasted on profoundly mediocre food -- watery, unseasoned brushcetta; tasteless sullied olive oil -- or was that canola oil in an olive oil bottle? Pasta, specifically ravioli,  that was under done and uninspired, accompanied by a flavorless cheese sprinkled from a bowl  that rivaled the bland ravioli --  And all this for  2 was almost $100  -- OK that includes a bottle of wine and the tip, but puleeaze. North Beach can do better than that!  For you tourists that have more distinguishing taste buds than your teenagers, there are so many many other restaurants in North Beach that are sooo much better.
author: Kay V.

description:
Visited this restaurant on a cold December morning at 11 am while visiting my brother in SF in 2007. Even though we were the first ones in the door, and they weren't even fully operational yet (still waiting on bread delivery) - we were greeted by a waiter (owner?) and warmly welcomed in. 

We settled in with glasses of wine, and when the bread delivery came, the waiter brought us complimentary bruschetta for our patience. Our food was very good - piping hot, comfort Italian food - we especially loved the eggplant dish (Parmesan I think - thin layers of eggplant with mozzarella and great sauce). 

Just when we thought we were wrapping up our meal, the same gentleman brought us a complimentary dessert and 2 glasses of port. 

He made a random restaurant selection on a cold morning one of the highlights of our trip.

Vegetarian Friendly: 5/5
author: Prachi D.

description: Good pasta.. probably more on the heavy/creamy side. I like the four-cheese ravioli. Interesting dessert menu.
author: Russel S.

description: Came here after a show. The wall painting is phenomenal, beautiful even it's a bit old. The dim lighting makes it more comfy, especially on a rainy evening. Food was so so and a bit too salty unfortunately... service overall was good as the server was quite attentive and friendly.
author: T L.

description:
this place gets extra points for getting us in quickly without our full party...

food-wise, it was good, tasty and filling.  their lasagna di casa was yummy if you enjoy extreme cheesiness!
author: Jill k.

description: Cute little restaurant with great Italian food, friendly staff, decent SF prices, and a prime location for people watching. I was entertained in every way for the hour and a half I was there.
author: Christine K.

description: The food and the service were nothing special and were definitely not worth the 30 minute wait. Even though there are so many other great Italian restaurants in the area, I guess this one gets lots of attention because of its location. Nice ambiance, but stay away from here on the weekends!
author: Natalie T.

description: It's campy. The street guys are straight off the boat. The food is hit or miss. All in all, it's FUN and the service has always been great! We have ALWAYS had a great time here! Again, the food is hit or miss; I've had the Lasagna, Gnocchi and Tortellini and they've been good!! GO with a fun group and enjoy yourself!!
author: Rob L.

description: The four-cheese tortellini was way too salty. Pasta at Olive Garden tasted better.
author: Amy D.

description: This, is a loose 4-star rating. I would say the food is jjjuuust above average. However, the location and ambience make this place worth visiting next time you come to North Beach and can't figure out where to eat. The selection of food is outstanding and although there are some real finds and real misses on it you won't be sorry if you stick to the simpler things.
author: Andrew W.

description:
oh memories... way back in those innocent college days, thinking that we'd share a romantic italian dinner in north beach, we found ourselves squished in a dimly-lit room cramped with other couples trying to do the same.  although there was a slight feeling of being herded into the dining room by the suave maitre d who hounded us to come in, that dinner was still memorable...  the candlelight, the rich carbonara, our non-alcoholic sodas... we were as PG13 and sweet as Disney's lady and the tramp.

now looking back, i guess mona lisa was a pretty sophisticated choice for us back then, considering that we thought ordering beyond the $0.99 menu was a splurge!  however, nowadays, i tend to avoid placed like these due to the graphic behind the scenes accounts of health code violations from my friends who used to work at NB restaurants!  hint:  ALWAYS be nice to your servers or be sure that a friend works there first!
author: becky f.

description:
a great tacky italian joint in north beach. theres a cheesy fresco on the ceiling that spans the length of the space. theres more different pastas here then there are guidos in italy.

took the gf here for her birthday about a month ago after trying and being denied at da flora without a reservation (c'mon.. it was a tuesday!) and had a nice meal with a bottle of chianti to commemorate the birthday i spent with her last year in florence.

this place is noisy with italian jibberish and the doorman has that certain italian bravado that makes you say: "mi scusi, pero your breaking my comfort bubble". and the best part is that he asked my gf if i spoke italian... im asian like a motherfucker!
author: N. B. K.

description: These guys were wonderful. The food was very good, but the service was top friggin' notch. On top of it all, free coffee and desert. I don't know why, but it was incredible.
author: Stephen D.

description: Great food coupled with great service, intimate setting, great decor and incredible location to see the happenings in North Beach while munching on some good Italian food. This is a great place, Thursday night was perfectly mellow, the staff are a cool group of people and the food, i.e. grilled chicken with pasta. The other dish was cheese artichokes which were great as well....great food coupled with great ambiance as they say!
author: Jonathan F.

description: Not terrible, but not the best.  I liked the service, our waiter was nice.  I think there was a "family meeting" happening as we were there, but they didn't seem to mind that we were enjoying our pasta and vino.
author: Maricris D.

description: good food, price is not that bad for the very fulfilling plates!
author: John E.

description: A beautiful highly decorated restaurant. Always packed and cramped with people.  The food is quite tasteful. Its a great place to take a date out.
author: Prescott T.

description: Ok...have seen some of the reviews...and either they were mistaking this place with another, are overly picky, or had a one-time bad experience. THIS....is my favorite restaurant in SF. We went to Sacramento, and were going to drive home the next day, but we decided to stay in SF one night...so that we could have dinner here. My wife and her family are ALL from Italy...and they think it's incredibly authentic. Their Fettuccini Pescadore Is my wife's fave and swears its very close to the one her uncle makes...in Italy...and he's a chef. Be patient with the service, because they get busy, but the atmosphere is great, the servers are friendly and the owner(if you know the language is right off-the-plane Italian, and will speak it. They have this amazing sampler tower appetizer...this...could alone, be a meal. If people are used to Olive Garden or some other "supposed" Italian place...do not go here. This place is VERY authentic, which might explain some of the complaints about how the food is tasting. I have taken many people here...and they now eat there every time they come to town. the prices are reasonable and it's just a great, fun place to go to...especially in these chilly fall evenings. Just for added fun, they have this little Italian convertible car outside, almost entirely made of wood parked in front of the restaurant...and you can eat in it...right on the street! Very cool. There are other great places in that area as well....but this, hands down...is our favorite. Buono natale'!
author: Giogio T.

description: They have a huge menu with prices you'd expect for good, not great, italian food. Ambiance is a little cheesy and a bit much, but it's North Beach I guess.
author: Riz N.

description:
Let me begin by saying that I feel this place actually deserves a little more than a 3, perhaps a 3.3 or 3.5, but deifnitely not a 4. I went here last night with my girlfriend wanting to take advantage of our entertainment book coupon. I am always suspect of eating at Italian restaurants since I'm lactose intolerant; it's a veritable recipe for disaster. But, we had a buy one, get one, so why not?

The bread was tough and kind of stale tasting, and there wasn't a proper oil dish for dipping, just these strange kidney shaped bowls. The server took his time getting to us, but I was in a mood to take my time anyway. We got a bottle of Sangiovese, which was pretty reasonably priced and quite tasty. The house salad was pretty weak; just some mixed greens with one pathetic slice of tomato. I got the veal osso bucco over polenta and my girlfriend got some kind of combo with manicottii, canneloni, and raviolis. The food was definitely tasty enough to meet my standards. The portions were more than adequate as well. I must complain that the server never came by to check on us, but the wine had done the trick to help me relax and keep my standards low. 

Overall, this place is alright. It was my first foray into the Italian restaurant scene in North Beach. Perhaps I would go back, but more than likely, I will just listen to some fellow yelpers recommendations and experiment with some other establishments.
author: Saikat P.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in North Beach. The food is so good, especially the artichoke sauce plump ravioli. Average wine. Really dark romantic setting inside. Service is very knowledgeable about what they are serving, and its always nice to hear original Italian accents. You can watch what's going on in the kitchen as there are limited barriers, so you can see the cooks prepare dishes. Wide selection of delicious Italian food. the only con: seating is a little tight inside the restaurant. Other people's intimate conversations can easily be heard, even if you don't want them to be heard.
author: Food L.

description: This is my favorite North Beach Italian restaurant. They lured me off the street on a vacation out here years ago and I haven't found more entertaining waiters (I swear it's the same guy every time!) or a more gaudy decor. The food is very good - not top shelf Italian but enjoyable for a $12-20 entree kind of place.
author: Mel H.

description: I had the funghi pasta, and it was delicious!  I think my boyfriend had an eggplant dish, which was ok, thus, the three stars.  There are probably better Italian places in the area though.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
I love North Beach....this place is amazing for Italian food, great ambiance. I can't remember what I ate here.....I think I had too much wine. 
good times : )
author: Tabitha B.

description: Went here for my sister's college graduation. The setting and mood are very nice: lots of famous italian works of art in the wallpaper and such, and the lights are dimmed. The food wasn't extraordinary, however. Probably good for a date though.
author: Irvin David U.

description: I love this restaurant.  I hadn't been here for years, but was in the City for the day a couple of weeks ago and my friends and I needed some Italian food.  The wait was long, but everything was worth it.  It was almost like being in Italy, from the Italian-only speaking guy manning the door to the ambiance and food.  Oh... and the food... I had the gnocchi and they were soooo good.  Don't tell my dad but they're better than the family recipe!  I think everyone at the table was happy because there wasn't much talking, and we're a chatty bunch.  Wine was great too, and the prices were good.  Definitely don't go starving, cause you'll have to wait for a table, but so worth it.
author: Carmen R.

description: This place isn't bad nor is is great. The things that weren't that great was the seating and the service was decent. Tables are really close to each other and felt really cramped (due to the place being small). I do recommend that you try the Sicilian Candy and the caprese salad. I had the lasagna which was a little burnt on the top.  I never thought eating garlic by itself would taste good but it did. So try the Sicilian Candy when you go.
author: David W.

description: I feel like this is the default place to go if you want good, reliable well-priced italian food. The salmon risotto is delicious, and so is the chicken piccata. It was so much food, I couldn't finish the entree. It seems like it should be a lot darker than it  is, it must be the natural light. My only problem is that sometimes the tables are slightly too close to other tables so it seems less intimate. But otherwise, everything is great!
author: Natalie J.

description: We accidentally ended up here. The restaurants are so close together that you think you are walking into the door of one, but it's actually another. I am so glad that we made the mistake. Unbelievable!!! This place was packed. The matre' d was busting his butt, and working off of faces not a list. I loved listening to the wait staff yell at each other in Italian. The motif was a little cheesy, very stereotypical, but the staff and the food were dynamite. I had the 4 cheese gnocchi with nutmeg. It has an Italian name, but I can't remember it. It was so good I wanted to cry! The calamari was fresh and fried to perfection. If you are in Little Italy PLEASE go here!!!!!!
author: Lisa S.

description: Excellent authentic food. Many pastas homemade and all in all delicious. Four of us ordered entrees and they were all great. We got upsold on a bottle of Pinot noir not on the menu but it was delicious.
author: Mickey Z.

description:
You know how Mona Lisa's smile is very half-assed? Well, that's the best portrayal I have for Mona Lisa Restaurant. We (boyfriend and I) decided to go here based off of yelp reviews to see why some people rated it poorly and some outstandingly. Unfortunately, I am going to side with those who give it 1 star or 0, if possible.

We  walked in on a Wednesday night, made reservations, as very few people were there at about 6:30pm. We weren't greeted by our server and felt a bit rushed as he stood there waiting for us to order, after requesting a few minutes. The extra time was necessary, considering their menu was so long. We ordered the Calamari Fritti, to start us off, which is basically calamari with marinara. It was okay, only the top parts of the squid cut in ring-like shapes, no tentacles. From the impression of our appetizer, we thought it would've been an okay dinner.

We finally ordered and got our food with not too long of a wait. He ordered Spaghetti alle Vongole (white wine sauce, clams and garlic) as I had the  Rigatoni Osilio (chicken basil in pesto sauce). The Spaghetti alle Vongole was a bland white wine sauce, lacked garlic and any sort of flavor with clams thrown in. As my Rigatoni Osilio, was an extremely small portion, where they used large rigatoni pasta that was dry, topped with clumps of pesto. People are usually put in a situation where they want less olive oil, but in this case, I wanted more. The bread provided tasted stale and we wondered, what more could go wrong from this place. As we already started eating our dishes, the server then comes back asking if we wanted parmesan cheese. We both agreed that it would probably add a little something to our dishes. He spooned a large amount and started to put it on my dish. When I told him that, that was enough, he plopped the entire spoonful in my plate, no longer being able to see my rigatoni noodles because there was that little of it. The boyfriend's clams ate all the cheese, as the server plopped it off to the side.

He was also very rude, was never attentive of what we wanted and was into chatting it up with his fellow servers. If you're a tourist and you want a true North Beach experience, don't come here to be disappointed and be given the wrong impression. Also, if you don't like searching for parking for a good amount of time, valet your car.

Will not be revisiting this place. Extremely disappointed.
author: Ada T.

description: I love this place, I took my girlfriend here for our 1st anniversary. She loved it. We had a great time together. The food was exceptional. The staff was great. It is a little pricey but totally worth it. When I have the cash I will take every date I want to impress there.
author: Kyle B.

description: We got to sit outside with my daughter for my 1st Fathers Day!  Very petite in physical structure buy this makes for a more intimate feel.  The food was surging with flavor and our baby loved looking at all of the cool relics around the place. I can't wait to try more off of the menu. Thanks Mona Lisa.
author: Inyata J.

description: Mona Lisa has some of the greatest risotto dishes. They have a whole page in their menu that is dedicated just to all their different risottos. Try the creamy Alfredo risotto with shrimp!! I'd go back to Mona Lisa just for that!
author: Jon M.

description: Huge menu! Period! This place was awesome. Best part was the selection.
author: Matt P.

description: Great place for quite food on a Sunday night.  All the tourists have left, and you can find one of the few Italian places in North Beach that is actually good.  I got the salmon and prawns, but instead of the creme sauce I opted for plain tomato sauce.  They also let me get extra veggies instead of the side of pasta (just wasn't in the mood).  The veggies - spinach- was doused in a little extra EVOO than I would have liked, but I still really enjoyed the dish.  I would agree with Russel S. in saying that the food is a little heavy.
author: Lindsay T.

description: If I could give this place zero stars, I would.  End of story: I didn't pay for the meal because it was that terrible.  I guess it deserves a star for some level of customer service.  I went to this place with my girlfriend after an amazing day in the city.  The food was incredibly bland and flavorless.  The "Sicilian candy," aka roasted garlic, tasted like over fried french fries.  The pasta tasted like a papertowl roll dipped in Trader Joes spaghetti sauce.  Nah.  Ragu.  With mushrooms.  Watered down.  Bottom line - I love Italian food.  But for a meal that would have cost me $80, I can't be anything but honest.  Thankfully I got the meal on the house.
author: Anya L.

description: I have to say that this restaurant is a great place to eat.  The thing is the menu is very overwhelming!  There is just sooooo much to choose from.  My favorite dish is the spinach and beef risotto.  I recommend this place highly!!!
author: Philip L.

description: A friend referred me to this restaurant so I thought I'd try this restaurant. Really liked the Pesto Tortellini.... portion size is large. I enjoyed the atmosphere except for the flashing flights above us... I didn't want to have a seizure. Great job. I will have to try the dessert next time.
author: Ella C.

description:
place is super busy, so service totally sucks

bread = dry and bland

red wine = ok

gnocchi = such a disappointment

bathrooms = disgusting
author: suz s.

description: I am a huge fan of this restaurant. I took my friend out for a casual date, and was stunned by the decor as well as the elegant, yet casual setting. Sure, there were candles on the table, but we didn't feel like it forced us to be romantic. The place was pretty loud, but we didn't have to strain to talk, either. The pasta menu is fairly extensive, though I felt like it often repeated the same sauce with a different pasta. Dessert menu was nothing extraordinary - it utilized a very similar one to Steps of Rome, but their black forest cake really was delicious; just the right amount of moisture. I would bring friends here again.
author: Edlyn Y.

description: Everyone wants to stroll down Columbus Avenue, and if your visitors aren't the Rose Pistola type, I would suggest a stop here.  It's kitschy and overdone, but I actually love the four cheese gnocchi.  Your arteries will never forgive you, but visitors always get a kick out of it.  Cheap!
author: Bridget T.

description: We loved this place. We liked the cheezy decor. We got Ciante in the straw basket even - $28 - good wine though. For an appetizer, we got the Italian Sampler  (14.95)- with Brushcetta, tomatoes caprese, roasted garlic. It was very good. For dinner we shared the Rigatoni con Salsiccia Carciofi (14.95) -in garlic olive oil with sausage and artichokes. It was really, really good. We loved the Italian wait staff, the decor of the restaurant was fun, and it was our first dinner in North Beach. I love that whole area. San Francisco is an awesome city!
author: tracy d.

description: The food was good here.  It's a nice romantic restaurant.  The service was good.  The neighborhood is Little Italy.  It was a good experience overall.  If you are looking for good authentic Italian food, this is a good place to go.  Good to go to with a group or with a date.
author: Ahmed B.

description: We really liked this place. The decor is pure Italian, but bring a flashlight to read the extensive menu.  The staff is Italian, so what do you expect? They were friendly and the service was very good. We got a free bruschetta for speaking Italian, very nice. We ordered four pasta dishes and three were very good. I did not care much for the Carbonara, way too salty. We split a couple of deserts, also most excellent. I would definitely return.
author: Bob R.

description: Food was decent. Way too touristy. Probably something a little better around the area.
author: Mike C.

description: It's true that this place has a large menu and wine selection.  However,  the food was very mediocre and overpriced.  The restaurant is very cramp for space.  Thus, the waiters had virtually no room to walk around the tables.  So if you are the poor souls who have their seats on the aisle,  they will keep bumping into your chairs as they walk by!  I ordered the Prosciutto ravioli  and it was absolutely the most salty and fatty prosciutto I have ever eaten, plus it was severely under cooked.  Save your money and avoid this restaurant.
author: Elsa L.

description: Best Italian food in North Beach. Great ambience with artwork and European feel. Great service and the menu is huge. It'll take me years to try everything. Calamari and veal was delicious. My wine glass was never low which I appreciated. Had a great time enjoying dinner with family and friends. The owner makes his way through the restaurant ensuring your dining experience is a classic Italiano one.
author: Erik W.

description:
Agree with below yelper.  Place is narrow and cramp.  The service was so and so since we went on a Saturday night and they were extremely busy.  We had reservation for 6:45 for 10 and were seated a in a few minutes.  Food took forever to get to our table.  Since we had a show we had to catch at 9:30, we asked for the check and boxes once our entree arrived.  

I ordered the Lasagne di Casa which was a good sized portion (compared to Il Fornio) and tasted pretty darn good.  Though it is really oily, especially when you reheat it for lunch the next day.  I tried a couple of girls other dishes and it was overall good.  I didn't hear any complaints.

When we left around 9 PM, there was quite a line outside waiting to get in.  If you have to wait, make sure to bring a coat because it gets chilly!
author: Kazoua T.

description: Great place for a night out with the girls. I loved it, host was very nice and our waiter took care of us. He even took time out to look for a champaign bottle we wanted that was not on the menu that night. The food was amaizing.  If you and your friends want a nice, dark romantic night. This is a great location. It is also family friendly. I was not sure if they take reservations. But over all the placed rocked. I hope to go again as our Host, Mr. Pino reminded us to stay warm and gave us a great hug and asked us to come back again. Magnifico!
author: Eli R.

description: The best bruschetta I have ever had! Love that the staff is actually Italian!  Very proud people, wonderful service, great dark ambiance, and the food is amazing! Highly recommend.
author: celena l.

description:
Wow this place has got it all! 
Its got real charm and ambiance with an amazing menu that goes on for days...

I went here with a good friend, our mission was to find the best all around italian place in North Beach a very difficult task but we decided to take it. 

My absolute favorite dish was the calamari and all the desserts! (my friend and I shared a few desserts) the wine was very good and everything was moderately priced. There is really nothing I can say bad about this place, we were seated by quickly by the friendly and attentive staff on the out door patio that is well heated on those cold san francisco nights. The location was also conveniently located near all the hot clubs in NorthBeach. 

Big applause to Maritcio the owner for combining good food, good prices and great staff to make Mona Lisa THE best italian restaurant in all of North Beach!
author: Gabriela J.

description: I would choose another restaurant. I came here with my sister and her daughter. The service was poor and and the food mediocre. The waiter added a 20% gratuity fee on our check!
author: Leslie E.

description: this place has the best cioppino (sp?) i have ever had.  it's an art form.  anytime i had visitors come in, i'd take them here.  the owner is italian through and through and dresses and looks the part... totally hip... like he's from milan or something.  now that i don't live here anymore.  i completely miss it!
author: paul l.

description: Mona Lisa reminds me of the small downtown, small city, central Italy, family restaurant moved directly to San Francisco. Good food and great recipes, just like they are from that Mediterranean home of good food and great recipes. Prices are reasonable and the place is noisy, but, what else can you expect on Columbus Avenue?
author: Jump Dancer B.

description: Mona Lisa has a lot of delicious food to choose from. My favorite is their scampi with marsala sauce. The staff are friendly and it makes you feel like your in Italy. I  will definetely come back there!!
author: stella n.

description:
Wow.... such a disappointment. While visiting SF with friends we found ourselves in North Beach. excited to get some good Italian food we arrived at Mona Lisa after a recommendation from a friend. 

First off, the decor is ... well interesting. Imagine red robin goes Italian. Walls were covered in paintings and such, mainly of Mona Lisa. Not the worst, but definite not the best idea for interior design. 

We got seated right away, which was nice on a Saturday night. We waiting about 10 minutes before our waiter took our drink order, then another 10 to get the actually drinks. Not to mention the lack of refills. (We realized this was because our waiter was too busy hanging out by the front door) 

Food was bland, boring and nothing to rave about. This is probably due to the enormous menu, usually a sign the food will be so so. I got the chicken parm and it was very soggy. My gf got some sort of shrimp pasta, to which she said was not appetizing at all. Over cooked shrimp killed the dish for her. Another friend got a gnocchi dish, he seemed to enjoy it but said it was nothing special. 

Our waiter seemed in another world. Not friendly at all and mumbled everything he said, so it was hard to understand him. I really think he would have rather not been working at the time. 

Wont be back...
author: Chris D.

description:
This place is very touristy and the service isn't so great.

The only reason I'll give it another star (would be 2) is for the cute waiter.

Yep...other than that, there are way too many great places to eat in North Beach. Don't spend your money on Mona Lisa.
author: Nicole R.

description:
We came to this place because somebody (the owner maybe) was outside being "simpatico" and talked us into coming in. That's when the simpatico ended. The service was atrocious, we didn't get water until we were dying of thirst, the waiter kept trying to push us to order outrageously expensive stuff, the pasta was undercooked, and we ordered some stuff to take with us that never came (but were charged for).

The decor is very elaborate but I never felt as much in a tourist trap as in this place.
author: lulu b.

description: Squid Ink Risotto w/ Calamari!!!  GOOD!!!!  better with their parmesan cheese...and it IS pitch black...not fishy at ALL...and it was quite large in portion...
author: Diana C.

description:
This review has 2 parts, the food and the service.

Food: 4 stars.  The selection of pasta alone is worthy of 3 stars.  Personally, I'm a huge fan of the Carbonara.

Service: 1 stars.  I have never been more rudely treated by a host, let alone an Italian host.  I frequented Mona Lisa for several months while working in SF.  I recently returned to the city for a conference and had to stop in to Mona Lisa to get my favorite Carbonara.  

I waited for nearly an hour before being told that I would not be seated simply because I was alone.  Understandably, a single person will not receive priority on a Saturday night; however, it is deplorable to mistreat a patron in this way.  During that hours, I watched 3 separate parties be seated.  Coincidentally, 2 of the parties were young attractive women.  Being far from a young attractive woman and lacking my beautiful wife on my arm - that's a plug in case she reads this :) - I was continually passed over.  I watched the same thing happen to decidedly bland and older couples.  I even heard several couples complain that they had reservations that were simply not honored.  

Moral of the story, unless you are a young attractive woman willing to flirt your way to a table, you may want to consider passing on this place.  I hate to say it since the food is quite good but on principal I must.
author: Tony S.

description: Did not care for this place as much.  Seemed very touristy and cheezy inside.  I thought the service was poor, had to raise my hand in the air 2-3 times to get the guy to come over. The restaurant wasn't that busy, but they seemed to take everyone and stuff them in the front corner by all the windows, which seemed to be so that peeps outside would think it was a hot spot.  The gnocchi was great, my pasta was mediocre. Menu was huge.  Would not go back.
author: Mark A.

description: This has got to be the most disgusting Italian restaurant I have ever eaten at. I would like to warn EVERYONE not to enter this place.  Oh, it looks cute on the outside and has a cute little mini convertible car.  I spoke to a "customer" (who must have been a shill working for the place) and she told me it was fantastic.  Well, the barker (the little guy outside trying to drum up business and bringing people in) offered us a free appetizer.  When I asked about the pizza, he told me it was so big that the three of us would get full from it.  Well, we were not given a choice of an appetizer (we were initially told we would) and after we ate the appetizer (which was a couple of slices of meat) and the server wanted to take our order he told us the pizza would serve only 1 person and in all of his years of working there, never would a pizza serve more than one.  We ordered two pizzas and a pasta with pesto sauce and the entire meal was HORRIBLE.  The server never even came over to see how our meal was.  I was so angry that I asked for the check, paid it and got out faster than you can say "Rip off restaurant".  We ended up at McDonalds on the wharf and enjoyed dinner.  I might has well of took a match to the $57.00 I spent there.
author: Yvonne B.

description: So my mom and I live about 2 hours away from SF, not to far, but we usually go just for the Italian food ready for something exquisite! When we got there, our usual spot was closed and we decided we'd try something new... Seeing the Mona Lisa had good reviews we decided to give it a try! While the ambiance was a little more modern italian as opposed to old tradition style Italian, the service was really good and our food came out quick. However, we ordered a Bruschetta and Carpaccio for appetizer and the Bruschetta topping looked and was so unappetizing, it was clearly OLD and had been in the fridge for days! It looked mushy and was TASTELESS! As for the carpaccio it was dry, not even a little drizzle of Olive oil. We then ordered a Salad and the dressing tasted like a quick squeeze of lemon as opposed to a lemon vinaigrette. We did order two types of pasta and they were very good, but honestly the bad outweighed the good and we just wouldn't be back!
author: Jessica L.

description: Stopped in with a friend while walking the area looking for an Italian restaurant.  The service was great, the environment was typical tacky Italian (sorry) (except for the handsome Italians), and the food was excellent.  My friend and I split the fried calamari appetizer which was amazing.  We also split the crab ravioli.  The ravioli were delicious and the sauce was a perfect amount and compliment to the crab inside.
author: Jason S.

description: Food was no where near good Italian. Try SODINI'S in NORTH BEACH.
author: Jen P.

description:
I love this place! I've been going to Mona Lisa since 1999. The food is great and the portions are generous. 
The staff has always been great....
The third time I ate here was on a New Years Eve and the place was packed. The hostess promptly found a place for the two of us to sit. I have  no idea how she did it.
I have since introduced my family to this gem of a place. They've also fallen in love with The Mona Lisa. There really is something for everyone!
Whenever my sister comes up from so cal, the first question is, "Which night are we going to Mona Lisa?".
author: Rustin H.

description: This place is so gross! The food tastes like it's from Pasta Pomodorro and everything is just all wrong about it! I had the salmon with pasta and it was just...disgusting. The service is so-so, actually, no I take that back. They're like scowling Russians: rude
author: Nicole W.

description: The worse waiter ever!! Service was horrible. My husband and I will never come back.
author: Hanh J.

description: Stopped there for a lunch. I ordered a pasta dish and my companion ordered risotto. Both were drenched in oil, it was unpleasant to look at or eat. The overall flavor was not so bad though. Why is it so hard nowadays  to have reasonable pasta in 'italian' restaurants?
author: Mikhail K.

description: I am a repeating customer who had to return to this wonderful place for my birthday. The last few times I tried to venture out to some of the other restaurants....just to see if Mona Lisa is still holding their own. One place, which used to be a very good restaurant years ago, was so bad my wife and I walked out. Food was so horrible, that the owner even offered to get us something else and we said sorry. If you can't make two common dishes, then what's the chances of getting us something that we are going to like? Went back to Mona Lisa where we were treated as friends...even though the owner wasn't there that day. This past weekend was absolutely fabulous as our dinner party of 7 all had different entrees which were wonderful. I just can't seem to get away from this place. When you travel 2.5 hours to go to dinner, it's hard to go to another place that just isn't up to par. I would hate to ruin a trip to San Francisco by going somewhere else wishing we would have just gone to the Mona Lisa. It's that good!
author: Robert Y.

description: There aren't many places you can go to at 10:30pm on a Saturday night and get this level of food without a reservation.  The atmosphere was very nice, lots of Renaissance era paintings scattered on the walls and ceiling, but it wasn't overly cliche.  The menu had more options than I had ever seen in any Italian restaurant, and when you are hungry that late at night, everything sounds great.  I had the meat lasagna, and my date had some sort of ravioli filled with feta cheese.  Both were honestly the best Italian I had ever eaten.  No complaints about the service either.  For the quality of food, the prices were more than reasonable.  The bruschette was the only thing I'd suggest staying away from.  They piled it high with fresh tomatoes and onions, tasted more like Mexican salsa.  The bread was hardly toasted, if at all and we didn't taste any garlic.
author: Eric H.

description: I ordered the pesto spaghetti. bland and cold. I could make myself a better dinner. Shouldn't have let my out of towner friend choose the restaurant. Bad bad choice.
author: Sam P.

description: I've only eaten here twice in my entire life...but last night completely sealed the deal for me!  We were starving...and the first time I've eaten here, it was still very good.  I was in the mood more for Pan ta Rei down the street, but my bf wanted Mona Lisa...I was stoked to do it.  We ordered artichoke ravioli, napoleonita pizza, and I had a glass of chianti.  I can't believe how much I stuffed my face.  I finished it all off.  It was super good.  The staff was a little on the slow side, we had to ask the waiter a couple of times for some bread, but otherwise, I really enjoyed and I will definitely be back!
author: Olivia S.

description: I agree with some, what is up with this place. Came here once with a friend for lunch, we get sat right next to the kitchen wall and against another cramped lil table, and the bathroom in sight. I asked to be moved to another table, but said they were reserved for other guests. Unless they were gonna have a party of 50 walking in at that moment, I see no reason why they could not honor a simple request. I mean it was the middle day. I counted like maybe 5 other people eating at the moment and no one waiting. I should have walked out at that point. But I was told that they had good food, another mistake. The spaghetti and bologenese (sp) were bland, bread stale, and the recommended wine (upsell if I ever heard one) was just cheap at best tasting. Had better at trader joe's. Service was bad too. I work in the industry and one of the few times where I remember leaving no tip. Just awful. Much better places up and down the street.
author: Danny Q.

description: While I was vacation to the bay area, I with some family members to this because we heard this is a really good restaurant. Hint, hint it is a good idea to place a reservation like most restaurants. I was greeted and was guided to our table. Let tell ya, their sour dough bread and olive oil is out of this world and add a little bit of that dark vinegar that I forgot what it was. On the menu, there are thousands of choices so take your time. Also we were handed a small platters that had garlic bread, cold cuts, and (I think the most delicious) soft sour dough bread with some soft cheese probably like or is mozzarella, slice of tomato, and a sweet basil leaf on top. I ordered lasagna and was good, but I think it would've been better like basil leaves or something yet it is very delicious. This place had a candle on the table so don't bring babies. But regular kids who know fire safety it is good. The place looks small for Italian restaurants I have been in. It looks dark but it is more warm.
author: Llecram P.

description: I must admit that this is probably only of my favorite Italian restaurants in North Beach. It beats all the outdoor restaurants on Columbus. From the moment you step in it seems as if you have stepped into a restaurant in Italy (or maybe a scene from "Goodfellas") where the host will greeted with a "buona sera bella" as you walk in and a "ciao bella, avere una buona notte" as you walk out after a delicious dinner. From the Mona Lisa painting to the Sistine Chapel murals and the Michelangelo's, the art inside is a little cheesy but it gives it character! The pizza Don Mario is delicious and the ravioli is to die for! If you want a glass of wine, the servers there always have great recommendations. Mona Lisa has a great selection of wines and well as a variety of pastas. Though, I have never had dessert here because I always leave really full and practically leaving with a food coma, there is no doubt that their Lemon Ripieno or Limoncello gelato is probably fantastic.
author: Valerie F.

description:
the host at the door, needs help !

who does he think he is, tony montana ?

i was promised a table after 20 mins, 

20 mins after, people who came after me were being seated (all couples btw, everyone waiting for a table for 2)

the dude cant speak english, & when i go to check with him about my table, he simply refuses, saying that, he cant help me, if i dont have a reservation !

hold on, what about the 1300 couples who just went by him ? he doesnt care to explain, & he has the guts to ask me to take it easy...

the owner or whoevers picture is on the website came out & took us in, friendly chap, & spoke english for a change..

the food was average...lasagne al pesto was nice...

no bread served...& waiter was least attentive...even though he seemed energetic & busy...

i would prefer the small but excellent pasta paradiso on spear street.
author: vvek s.

description: ok so i called this place on Tuesday to make reservations for friday. being my paranoid self, i asked my friend to call back to confirm our reservations. well, it looks as though they didn't take my reservations and my friend had to book it again.  so our reservations were for 7:30 and our table was not ready until 45 mins. later. i can't blame them because the other table was taking their time after they paid their bill. they tried their best.  we got seated and they immediately gave us bread and the water. and at this point we were already starving. the food was ok. we had the Lasagna,Gnocchi al Pesto, the penne with eggplant and garlic.  and other dishes i don't remember. the Gnocchi was ok. to be honest the pasta place in the Westfield food court had better Gnocchi, i think it was the pesto sauce that killed it for me.  the prices were not bad. for 7 people, including the bday girl the billed ended being around 22.00 per person. but parking was so hard around this place.. i guess you have to expected that being that it was a friday night in north beach.
author: Belinda C.

description: Oh Mona Lisa! I have eaten in Mona Lisa three times in the past month and every time it has been delicious! I had the Pizza Quattro Stagioni - the pizza is very authentic Italian with thin crust and topped with fresh artichokes, mushrooms and delicious prosciutto cotto. I also had the spaghetti with seafood and tomato sauce. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente and the sauce was so good I felt the urge to lick my plate clean. They also make fresh arugula and fennel salads. The portions are generous unlike other spots in North Beach. To top it all off they have an interesting wine list. The servers are very wine knowledgeable and recommended me a delicious Calabrian wine called Librandi Ciro rosso and another time I had a crisp glass of Caposaldo pinot grigio. I will definitely be back!
author: Ottavia M.

description: OMG!! SO Good.  Hubby and I was just driving through San Francisco going to Sonoma.  We parked right in front Maurice took care of our care.  This is the BEST Italian food I have ever had.  I have ate a lot of Italian restaurant.  There spicy red sauce is to die for.  I had the fettucini mona lisa, my husband had spaghetti w/sausage.  I know now every time I stop in SF I will also  stop there.
author: Denise C.

description: Mona Lisa is located on Columbus st and Broadway. One of the most busy st in the city. Right near China Town. Parking sucks! you gotta so super lucky to ever find any. I normally catch a cab or muni when i down toward that way. The restaurant is not that big but it's long. It had many tables but all the tables are a little compress together. I ate there previous with a friend and the table next to us had scooped their chair back w/o any consideration! It push my friend upward where her chair literally lifted off the ground and her chest on flap onto our dinning table. The painting on the wall are rated R. Definitely not a family restaurant for children. Their service was OK. they only come when you call them. They don't check up on you as often as I would like them to. They need to smile a little more often. The restaurant setting is dim lighted. Ideally for romantic couples and group of friends gathering. Now the food taste amazing. The brucheta and the shrimp with clams steam in garlic wine sauce. and the fried calamari. it's friend to golden perfection,dip with marinara sauce. crispy but when you buy in to it. it's a little watery. It taste like they use new oil to friend it every time. The linguine Vogone taste great. Bottom line is everything on the menu taste amazing! u have to come and try it out.
author: tahni c.

description: I ate here with some friends before a Giants game.  Located right on Columbus Ave I thought this restaurant had a lot of charm, with some interesting decor, like the st. patty's day hat on a statue...go figure.  It has a few tables outside and a nice dining space indoors.  We sat on the inside but right by the open windows so we got a nice breeze.  We had the Prosciutto e Melone, recommended by one of our party and I really enjoyed it, quite good melon for the city.  The menu was HUGE with so many different choices.  I ended up with the Penne al Forno alla Calabrese.  A baked penne dish with ham. It was tasty and the portion was quite large, a good value for the price.  I also tried the crab ravioli which were good but I was happier with my dish.  A little slow on the service but they make everything fresh when you order it and hey, you're suppose to enjoy the experience.  Definitely a restaurant to keep in the back pocket in case I'm not sure where else to eat in North Beach on another visit.
author: Laura T.

description: a great spot. even my arrogant east coast italian friends approve. the employees are wonderful and the food is even better. the place usually has the longest lines of any of the spots on columbus, but if you go on a tuesday night you wont be dissapointed. the raviolis are wonderful
author: Andrew D.

description: service a def 2... rarely saw my server, poured my own drinks and never recd bread like other tables...and not busy tue night. food ok but not great...salad was a loser, rav was just ok. wanted to check this out and glad i did solo...wont be back.
author: D N.

description: Came here on a date and left very satisfied. We ordered the calamari fritti, a salmon pasta in cream sauce, and a pizza. all the ingredients were very fresh, especially the seafood, and the pizza was a very refreshing change to the traditional pizzas found in the US. definitely worth a visit.
author: Brian M.

description: Ugh what a nightmare experience.  It was my friend's 20th birthday so all 8 of us decided we wanted a nice sit down Italian lunch.  Atmosphere was nice, but it was HOT in there, and they served us water...but warm water...and no ice.  Dumb.  We ordered an appetizer and each ordered at least a $12 plate of food.  Tons of food, which was nice, but not that good.  I got the Alfredo, I could feel it slowing my heart beat and it wasn't worth it.  So the reason for the one star: not one of us finished our meals, we all had ALMOST FULL plates of food.  The douchy (yes he was kind of ridiculous/rude...very "northbeach tool" kind of guy) waiter had been skirting around out table the entire time, which was not okay especially because the restaurant was EMPTY.  So we asked for boxes so we could get out of there.  He takes all of our plates, and returns with one plate of food bagged.  He dumped ALL of our food in the trash except for my one friend's salad.  We sat there not even wanting to tip him but because of the party size he had tacked on about 20% anyway.  So he dumped out over $100 dollars of food and all he could say was, "have a great afternoon".  I have never mugged someone so hard walking out of a restaurant.
author: Rachelle P.

description: Went here for my birthday. Lets say I had a hard time finishing my dish.  Got some seafood stew that was really good. The only thing I kinda hoped for was pasta to go along with it because the sauce was sooo good.  But afterwards, when I was almost done with my dish, the waiter piles a mountain of pasta on my food.  I would say it was 10x better with pasta in it.  The place did get busy and the waiter didn't come around that often.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Absolutely loved this restaurant.  The decor was awesome from the tapestries to the china dolls swinging from the lanterns.  The alternating italian music and traveling violinist was a great backdrop to my glasses of white wine.  I was lucky enough to get a seat by the window where I could people watch.  The violinst made his way outside and a lady decided to "flamenco" dance in the street.  All I can say is that she tried...  The whole scene outside might have been staged, but I guess all that matters is that I and others were entertained.    The food was excellent.  I started off with the meatballs in a tomato sauce $5.  Yummy!  Rich sauce..wonderful use of garlic.  I ordered the Chicken Mancino $13(rolled chicken breast, with ham and mozarella) in a creamy tomato sauce.  Absolutely great!  The spinach and side of pasta that came with it wasn't all that great, but hey, you can't win them all. I passed on dessert but noticed that the menu was extensive and looked great. All in all I had a wonderful dining experience and ate some great food.  Did I mention I was dining alone on a Saturday night???
author: LaSha G.

description: i've been coming to Mona Lisa since 2005 , everytime  i have the chance to visit San Francisco i look forward to go there,i understand the busy the could get and that turns to have to wait a little bit too long sometimes,but everytime i go i have a great experience as service and food,most of the time my waiter has been Luciano great guy and recently on the 14 of feb i visit and i was taken care by Gian Luca who did a great job spite the high amount of people at the restaurant also the host Pina helped us out to,always a pleausure i hope people see that and not the bad things that every business are susceptible to have,also looking forward to check Luciano's new restaurant opening on march
author: Mo F.

description: the wait for our table was long.  my pasta carbonara came to be an unbearingly salty dish.  after some discussion with waiter/chefs and 10 additional minutes, my dish was replaced with one of the best pasta carbonaras i have ever had.  the calamari appetizer and dishes ordered by guests were well enjoyed and definately a place we would venture to again.
author: lucie l.

description: We came here for my Aunt's 50th Birthday. FUN! Now I am picky about my Italian food & this place passed the test!  It's a good choice for nothing over the top, but good, down home grub with the whole North Beach ambiance. The staff is very fun & friendly & the menu goes on forever. A nice break from those pretentious, wannabe Italian restaurants that aren't even owned by Italians. I recommend the pesto gnocchi, the veal Mona Lisa & the veal scallopini! One thing I will say, the chicken cacciatore needs improvement...as soon as I saw the bell peppers I knew it was a bad choice.  As far as everyone complaining that the restaurant is small & crampy....come one people! It's part of the experience & I am not afraid to say, I liked it!!! It's a fun pick, especially if you have out of town guests looking to just sit back & enjoy themselves! What's wrong with a little off the wall decor anyway???
author: Genie M.

description: i liked the decor.  my baked ravioli was really really delicious.  but my friend's pasta arrabiata was questionable.  but it's about on par with what you expect from north beach italian.
author: jessie h.

description: i'm not smiling.  high noise volume and average food.  need i say more?
author: Dorothy L.

description: My boyfriend and I used to eat here at least once every two weeks. There are countless places in North Beach but we always had such great service and food that we kept coming back. Until now! There were actually two instances but the first bad one really wasn't that big of a deal except their garlic bread was horrible. I love love garlic but whoever decided to make it this time must have not been paying attention when he lathered on the garlic spread. You could barely eat it!!!! The second bad experience is why I will not be eating here again. As I said before there are plenty of places to eat. When we got there it was clear that the waiter was too busy for his own good. We waited about 10 minutes before he came to the table. When he finally did it was "are you ready to order" ? Not would you like something to drink and appetizer nothing. We order. First our salads came with our garlic bread (i decided to try it again) the thing is, I ordered and appetizer. When I ask where that is he says oh you wanted to order and appetizer? Like I forgot. I said " no i ordered it". He leaves comes back 10 minutes later and says "were out" !! Then our entrees come. Mine is sooooo salty that I don't even eat it all but he never even comes back to ask how our entrees were. Instead we sit there for 25 minutes with dirty plates. I finally get up and find him with my credit card in hand and he's on his phone in the corner TEXTING!!!!! Do you think we got any apologies??? Nope just our bill dirty plates still on the table. Needless to say this is the last time Mona Lisa will be seeing Lisa !!!!!
author: lisa v.

description: My BF and I went to the Mona Lisa for a late lunch on President's day and was pleasantly surprised. The food was pretty good. We ordered the Sautee di Cozze e Vongole (clams and mussels in garlic and tomato sauce), which was really good. I ordered the Gnocchi Ruggero (Gorgonzola sauce with spinach and walnuts) w/ sausage and loved it. My BF ordered the Ravioli Bolognese (cheese ravioli w/ tomato meat sauce), which was also very tasty. The waiter was really friendly and helpful. Overall a very good experience.  I would go back.
author: Nicole W.

description: This place is just one big let down from start to finish. Much to my chagrin I've been here twice, both for friends' birthdays, and both times were horrible. We had reservations both times, but that didn't seem to matter since we were made to wait over an hour the first time and 45 minutes the second. After 45 minutes of waiting they sensed our annoyance and comped us two bottles of wine as a peace offering. Unfortunately, one of the bottles had turned to vinegar and the other one was just awful. When we finally got to the table and received our food I was shocked that we'd waited so long for what turned out to be truly forgettable fare. The food was uninspired, greasy and average at best. Olive Garden has better quality Italian food. The service was no better. We had to flag down our waiter to get any service. With so many other great options in North Beach, I don't know why anyone would go through the trouble of trying to dine at this overrated, under-qualified place.
author: Peter B.

description: went here for the first time after hearing great things about the restaurant. tried a few dishes and i feel this place to be over rated. my bolognese penne was bland. the service was pretty good except for my water running dry, but other than that. everyone was pretty nice. the calamari was salty. the environment and setting were good.
author: Katherine F.

description: i somehow ended up here by chance. was just walking around north beach with friends and picked this restaruant and it was GREAT! it was a nize cozy atmosphere with over-the-top decor.  the food was authentic and flavorfull.
author: Jason M.

description: I give four stars strictly for the gnocchi quattro fromaggi.  I have been for lunch and dinner and yes expect to sit practically on the table next you.  I like the food but not my favorite.  I strictly go here for the gnocchi
author: Teresa G.

description: Truelly amazing food. We had the vegetarian Pizza, four cheese Ravioli and the vegetarian Lasagna. Excellent. The service was a bit on the slow side. We had to look for our waiter a few times and I noticed he was coming back in from outside, so I guess he liked the fresh air a bit too much!!!! But overall as I said before the food was fantastic.
author: Sam K.

description: My husband and I had a delicious lunch, we ordered different entrees and they were all good. The inside is very unique, the service was good and friendly.  We will definitely go back, that's how much we enjoyed ourselves.
author: diane s.

description: This is nothing more than a tourist trap. The only reason we went there was the over zealous host standing outside trying to get folks to sit down. Once inside, however, we were sorely disappointed by everything we ordered. If you are looking for a reasonable place to eat in north beach, I'd send you to Ideale.
author: Avid E.

description: Nice romantic restaurant.  The food was good, the service was good.  The neighborhood is Little Italy.  It was a good experience overall.  If you are looking for good authentic Italian food, this is a good place to go.  Good to go to with a group or with a date.
author: Edward F.

description: We sat outside. The tanned Italian host got down to his knees when a pretty brunette asked for a table. Huge line of tourists waited outside the narrow sidewalk to get a table. Good people watch on a strangely warm night. Corkage fee is $15 dollars. Not bad these days. Very good Spaghetti Carbonara. We will come back for the Carbonara. Smoky chunky pieces of bacon ham. The prosciutto and melon dish was average. I had the Chicken Marsala and it was just average.  Service was good. Three stars for the service and the Carbonara.
author: Seymour S.

description: This place is awesome!! The chicken picatta is awesome and the chicken SF is great as well!!! I'm only giving it 4 stars because the service isn't the best. The waiter was a little slow both times. And what a better way to end the night than to have great tiramisu!!!
author: Angela H.

description:
I have seriously never had such bad service in my whole entire life. Wow, my friends and I stopped in for lunch and he host was very nice, but upon sitting down and ordering in this nearly empty restaurant our server rushed us through everything. When asking if we could possibly have some vinegrette reduction for our bread he began to lecture us and told us that they only served italian food and basically ridiculed us by saying that since we're american we don't know what italian food is. Dude, all of us may be american, but then again, all of us at the table had worked in italian restaurants and know that VINEGRETTE REDUCTION IS ITALIAN. What a douche...we ordered three entrees, one of which was the gnocci ruggero, that my friend usually swears by, but we were in a meaty mood and asked him KINDLY to add a little pancetta into, his response was to argue with us and after at least a 3min conversation of him lecturing us and us trying to explain what we wanted he quickly walked away. The order of course wasn't what we asked for and in the end we just gave up, only ate half of our third entree which they ruined by bringing us the gnocci al quattro formaggi with pancetta and over doused with walnuts. Seriously disgusting. Towards the end another server had come, obviously having calmed down our first server and tried to smooth things over.

It was hands down, THE WORST SERVICE I have ever had in my whole life. I have never been lectured by my server and felt like I was a child for simply asking for one little adjustment.
author: Elsa H.

description:
went last Saturday night, got a great table in the back, cozy and lots of ambiance

start with bread - good, then house salad - OK, then I had veal w/prosciutto , it was tough and cold,   with sides of salty spinach and cold pasta,  

the pasta  alle Vongole was not too tasteful.

I probably ordered  the wrong things,  there are a lot of better italian restaurants in North Beach.

waiters had some great mone lisa ties.
author: daniel s.

description: Just recently returned from san francisco and while there ate at the Mona Lisa. After arriving it was crowded and we had to wait about 20-25 minutes but that was to be expected considering it was memorial weekend Our whole party enjoyed their meals. The homemade gnocchi was the biggest hit though. we got the one with the spinach and walnuts. The tortellini was very tasty as well. we would all definetely visit this restaurant again if ever in the san fran area again.
author: Susan P.

description: I've tried two pastas here - the carbonara and one with red sauce (can't remember the name!)  Both weren't very good and the service was reallllllllllly slow (dinner without appetizers took three hours!)  Wouldn't go back.
author: Holly S.

description: Having gone to several Italian places in that neighborhood, this one was by far my best experience - if also the cheesiest.  The menu has tons of options and the service is lickety-split.  The atmosphere is pretty cozy, though the wall art is more entertaining than I think it's intended to be.  In all, a solid place for a comforting plate of pasta.
author: GK S.

description:
supped at Mona Lisa this past Sunday.  No wait, got right in.  Was dining alone, so was seated at a small table shoved up against the counter.  A little crowded, but no big deal.  Have dined at Mona Lisa usually once each time I'm in San Francisco (about once a year).

Ordered the tortellini in 4-cheese cream sauce, which was VERY,  VERY rich and, as another reviewer put it, "quite pungent".  I couldn't finish it.  Luckily, I had ordered a side of meatballs, which helped cut the richness somewhat.  The "side" of meatballs was actually from the Spaghetti Polpette (without the spaghetti)- so I was charged for a half order of spaghetti polpette... not a huge deal.  The meatballs had good flavor, and  the marinara they came with was nondescript, but good nonetheless.   All in all, an enjoyable meal.  The bread was forgettable, but that seems to be a common theme for all places along Columbus Street.   Service was good as well.  No complaints.  Good Italian, but didn't send me over the moon.  Decently priced.  Quaint, tho slightly kitchy decor.  I decided to forgo dessert, as I've had far too much BAD tiramsu at several places along Columbus St. to go down that road again.  Good, consistant Italian food.  Will return again.
author: R S.

description: My gf and I went there with reservations.  When we got there they made us wait even though there were seats opening up for two.  They were letting people whom they seem to know just walk right in without any reservations and take those open seats while we and others were waiting outside in the cold.  At that moment I saw no point in reservations when they were selectively letting people in like they do at the clubs.  after standing outside in the cold for over an hour even with reservations they allowed us to stand inside to wait some more.  When we finally got a seat we were not in a good mood from still having to wait so long even with reservations for only two!  We were sitting to a large group having dinner and all of a sudden one of the ladies jumped up screaming.  I looked over and I saw two cockroaches running around the table and floor.  Not the little cockroaches but the ones that are about 3 inches long!  That right there topped off our experience at Mona Lisa.  The group immediately left there table and who can blame them.  We should of follow their lead but we stuck around unfortunately to be treated like 2nd rate customers.  I will not go back here nor do I recommend them to anyone.  When I think Mona Lisa I think of bad service and cockroaches!
author: Tony X.

description: i think many of the bad reviewers must be smoking crack because this place is amazing.  come here for the food, not for the service.  it's not that the service is bad but it's a bit on the slow side - that doesn't bother me but it does bother some.  there are these two wonderful waiters here - i think they're brothers - and i usually try to sit in their section, they're very friendly and knowledgeable about the extensive pasta menu.  all of the pasta dishes are amazing.  they have especially good pesto sauce and on the gnocchi it is to die for.  i have never been disappointed with my meal here and i've been many, many times.  my husband's family is italian and we brought them here to eat and it passed their test with flying colors.
author: Shelley N.

description: pasta was good, but not the italian sampler.
author: Evan P.

description: i am not a big fan of italian, yet it was my THIRD north beach/italian restaurant in the space of 4 days. it was j's bday and the place we were going to go was closed, so we tried mona lisa. we only waited maybe 15 minutes, on a sunday night. the owner was super nice and he offered free wine, which s took him up on. After eating at pinnochios on thurs, this place seemed more authentic, less touristy. I did like the atmosphere better, and at a birthday, I guess that's very important. The menu was large, but most of the pasta had no meat. I had something with ham and chicken, which was pretty good, not memorable. Everyone liked their food, but the portions were a bit small. The exception to that was n's pasta dish, which wasn't huge, but normal sized. They came with a side of penne, which wasn't good. the sauce was boring, and the pasta puffy. Everyone else liked it, but I didn't eat it. The sauce on the chicken was a cream tomato sauce, and that was good. for dessert there was some tropical sherbert with white chocolate drizzled on it, which everyone thought was meh, and black forest cake which I did not try but others said was ok. Overall, the service was friendly, the atmosphere nice, but the food was only ok and smallish. If I have to get dragged to north beach again, I'd rather check out someplace else. However, it's not a bad restaurant, just not great.
author: Merredith L.

description: good wine, filling food. good place to go for a relaxed meal. the decor is a bit cheesy and over the top, but the food is yummy. service is good.
author: marcie d.
